jobTitle: BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW! Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50584039.txt	§BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW!§§Advertiser: §Recruitment Expert§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§I KNOW YOU WANT TO - SO GO ON...APPLY!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW! §    §      §        §          §Outstanding opportunity for people looking for §flexibility & great earnings but want to work hard§          §Profit share potential & Uncapped Commissions§          §Flexibility - §Work from home§ and be your own boss (min 4-5 days p/w) working from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. If you ever wanted to feel like you're §running your own business§ - this is the opportunity for you (without risking your house or savings and making money from the get go while working from home) while being supported by an experienced mentor. §        §  §We are a growing Recruitment Agency with §big dreams, a solid vision and a track record of success§ - and we would love to have interesting, loyal and hard working people come along on the journey to success. At the moment we recruit in the most exciting niche ever - ACCOUNTANTS (they're not that bad...really!) on a national scale and are growing quite rapidly and will be expanding to other service lines – MEDICAL (Doctors, Physios, Radiologists), FINANCIAL PLANNING, LEGAL (so if you have experience in these sectors either from there or B2B then reach out) etc...§  §We operate a no nonsense approach by doing the right thing by our clients and candidates, hard work and sincerity.§  §Ideally, you want to be able to work from home full time with flexibility, have full management support but also have a lot of autonomy and you thrive on success - we're building a culture of success and want to be surrounded by people that are driven, fun and intelligent and those that understand that §success breeds success.§  §We are looking for individuals that are:§  §1.     Prepared to §enjoy life§ while §making great money§ and §looking after their families§2.     Very §success driven and goal oriented§ - we want a culture of success and we are only prepared to hire winners§3.     You know how to build rapport and §consult in an honest and engaging way §that adds value§4.     Have high levels of §Attention to Detail§5.     Must have a track record of success in your life and ability to execute and get $##t done no matter what. §6.     Genuinely want to be involved in building the business and make it better every year - §proactive individuals§ that strive for personal improvement§7.     §Loyal§ & §Intelligent§ - we want people that will be the fabric of this organisation for many years to come and if you want to be involved in the management of the company then even better. Recruitment is not something you give a go, unless you’re prepared to put in the hard yards and make it a career for at least 4-5 years – don’t bother applying – it’s too hard of a job to just “give it a go”§8.     Open minded, tough, very intelligent, resilient, curious and lots of fun§9.     People with high commercial acumen that know how to consult not just hard sell.§10. §Ideally (bonus but not necessary):§- You have a §Recruitment Agency/Sales/Accounting/Medical/Legal/Management background§, where you have used your outstanding communication skills to build strong relationships and achieve sales targets§ - If you have an §Accounting/Medical/Legal/FinPlan/Corporate§ background in Australia - even better. §- §Ability to create quick and strong rapport with clients over the phone §and a willingness to contribute as part of a collaborative and dynamic team.§- You have some §extra skills to bring to the team§ - such as digital marketing, copywriting, website development etc...§               § ***100% Fluency in English is a must***§Once you prove yourself as a capable Recruiter that can bill and train other recruiters and earn their respect as a Manager and then you’ll be promoted to Director to grow and lead the company further into different markets (niche and geographic) – if you wish, if not, I’m more than happy for you to remain an excellent recruiter. §  §What you're going to get:§  §• A lot of §training§ but also a lot of being thrown in the deep end§• Ability to §work from home§ (part time or full time) but still be part of a team (for those in Capital Cities can arrange an office)§• Have a §lot of fun doing an amazing job§• §Earning great money§ - way above industry average - at the same time not interested in people that expect high base salaries - this is sales - this will be a low base or §COMMISSION ONLY role§ to begin with (depending on your experience) and if you perform well then a base determined by the billings of your previous two quarters, which you'll earn after you qualify for it - the rest you actually have to earn (like close a sale - you know the fun part!).§• Involved in the decision making of the business and if you're up for it - the management & potential ownership of the company down the road§• Lots of bonuses and incentives§  §Ideal for people tired of the corporate environment §wanting to be financially independent or spoil the family with some extra holidays and toys...but also be there for your kids at school events, sports events and watch them get a medal in their 100m race at the athletics carnival (even if there are only 3 kids in the race!). If your kids are at school and you have time to work hard during school hours and watch your kids grow up and be there for them when they come home from school then this is for you. But this is not a 9-5pm job - in recruitment you always have to be available for your clients and candidates by phone or email. §This role §WILL NOT WORK§ for you if: §        §          §You DON’T have solid corporate experience (i.e.: you’ve never worked in an office environment unless you were a doctor).§          §You DON’T have a stable job history (i.e.: your CV looks worse than a that of a job-hopping kangaroo)§          §You're AFRAID of working hard - the role requires discipline and hard work to begin with, afterwards gets much easier, you will be doing long hours, your candidates are sometimes only available after hours – so you need to be available when they are.§          §You're AFRAID of picking up the phone and speaking to strangers on a daily basis and using your skills and intelligence to influence them§          §You're NOT WILLING TO COMMIT 3-5 years to this because this role takes time to master and pay growing dividends the longer you're in it§          §You are NOT COACHABLE & INTELLIGENT - there is a lot of training provided so you need to want to learn and more important implement§          §You're NOT A TEAM PLAYER - this is a team effort and will require everyone to contribute to the success of the business§          §You are NOT COMMITTED TO YOUR SUCCESS, LACK DRIVE IN LIFE and HAVE OTHER BUSINESSES OR PRIORITIES on the side that will distract you. §          §You are NOT AN HONEST & TRUSTWORTHY INDIVIDUAL - you will get full transparency, honesty, and integrity from me with a lot of support and training - but I expect honesty and integrity from you as well. §        § That's it!§ (Can’t believe you’ve read this far) §The rest is up to you. But we want winners on board. If you're interested (and you should be - I mean §WHO wouldn't want to recruit accountants from home and have fun doing that while making the big bucks!!!§)§  §Make sure you research and understand the challenges & realities of working in recruitment in an agency environment and you are §comfortable with a potentially commission only role§ to begin with (so we don't waste each other's time – otherwise I’m paying you to watch Netflix at home). This is not for everyone but is very rewarding for those that are prepared to work hard and make a career out of it. Most consultants make §six figure incomes§ (not bad when you're working from home). Also - this role only works if you can dedicate ideally 5 days (to begin with anyway) where you can be on the phone during working hours (i.e. in the range of 9-5 when your clients will be able to talk to you) but you can still organise your time as you wish but you will need an environment where you are not distracted by anything else and are available to work when your clients and candidates need you (because there are after-hours interviews when candidates are available only at that time). §Apply§ §ONLY§ §BY§ sending §Michael§ an §EMAIL§ with your CV to §michael@recruitmentexpert.com.au§, §with a cover letter§ explaining whatever you want to explain in relation to the above (why recruitment, and that you understand what's involved, how low base+commission structure will work for you financially, why you think you’ll make this work for you and you’ve done your research to understand what’s involved etc...) and you §have to use the word§ giraffe in your story.§  §Talk to you soon!§(We get 100’s of applications so only successful candidates will be contacted)§      §      §Michael Edelstein §    §    §The Experts you Trust§    §  §§§ §Outstanding opportunity for people looking for §flexibility & great earnings but want to work hard§ §Profit share potential & Uncapped Commissions§ §Flexibility - §Work from home§ and be your own boss (min 4-5 days p/w) working from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. even better. §- §Ability to create quick and strong rapport with clients over the phone §and a willingness to contribute as part of a collaborative and dynamic team.§- You have some §extra skills to bring to the team§ - such as digital marketing, copywriting, website development etc...§               § ***100% Fluency in English is a must***§Once you prove yourself as a capable Recruiter that can bill and train other recruiters and earn their respect as a Manager and then you’ll be promoted to Director to grow and lead the company further into different markets (niche and geographic) – if you wish, if not, I’m more than happy for you to remain an excellent recruiter. §  §What you're going to get:§  §• A lot of §training§ but also a lot of being thrown in the deep end§• Ability to §work from home§ (part time or full time) but still be part of a team (for those in Capital Cities can arrange an office)§• Have a §lot of fun doing an amazing job§• §Earning great money§ - way above industry average - at the same time not interested in people that expect high base salaries - this is sales - this will be a low base or §COMMISSION ONLY role§ to begin with (depending on your experience) and if you perform well then a base determined by the billings of your previous two quarters, which you'll earn after you qualify for it - the rest you actually have to earn (like close a sale - you know the fun part!).§• Involved in the decision making of the business and if you're up for it - the management & potential ownership of the company down the road§• Lots of bonuses and incentives§  §Ideal for people tired of the corporate environment §wanting to be financially independent or spoil the family with some extra holidays and toys...but also be there for your kids at school events, sports events and watch them get a medal in their 100m race at the athletics carnival (even if there are only 3 kids in the race!). If your kids are at school and you have time to work hard during school hours and watch your kids grow up and be there for them when they come home from school then this is for you. But this is not a 9-5pm job - in recruitment you always have to be available for your clients and candidates by phone or email. §This role §WILL NOT WORK§ for you if: § § §You DON’T have solid corporate experience (i.e.: you’ve never worked in an office environment unless you were a doctor).§ §You DON’T have a stable job history (i.e.: your CV looks worse than a that of a job-hopping kangaroo)§ §You're AFRAID of working hard - the role requires discipline and hard work to begin with, afterwards gets much easier, you will be doing long hours, your candidates are sometimes only available after hours – so you need to be available when they are.§ §You're AFRAID of picking up the phone and speaking to strangers on a daily basis and using your skills and intelligence to influence them§ §You're NOT WILLING TO COMMIT 3-5 years to this because this role takes time to master and pay growing dividends the longer you're in it§ §You are NOT COACHABLE & INTELLIGENT - there is a lot of training provided so you need to want to learn and more important implement§ §You're NOT A TEAM PLAYER - this is a team effort and will require everyone to contribute to the success of the business§ §You are NOT COMMITTED TO YOUR SUCCESS, LACK DRIVE IN LIFE and HAVE OTHER BUSINESSES OR PRIORITIES on the side that will distract you. § §You are NOT AN HONEST & TRUSTWORTHY INDIVIDUAL - you will get full transparency, honesty, and integrity from me with a lot of support and training - but I expect honesty and integrity from you as well. § § That's it!§ (Can’t believe you’ve read this far) §The rest is up to you. But we want winners on board. If you're interested (and you should be - I mean §WHO wouldn't want to recruit accountants from home and have fun doing that while making the big bucks!!!§)§  §Make sure you research and understand the challenges & realities of working in recruitment in an agency environment and you are §comfortable with a potentially commission only role§ to begin with (so we don't waste each other's time – otherwise I’m paying you to watch Netflix at home). This is not for everyone but is very rewarding for those that are prepared to work hard and make a career out of it. Most consultants make §six figure incomes§ (not bad when you're working from home). Also - this role only works if you can dedicate ideally 5 days (to begin with anyway) where you can be on the phone during working hours (i.e. in the range of 9-5 when your clients will be able to talk to you) but you can still organise your time as you wish but you will need an environment where you are not distracted by anything else and are available to work when your clients and candidates need you (because there are after-hours interviews when candidates are available only at that time). §Apply§ §ONLY§ §BY§ sending §Michael§ an §EMAIL§ with your CV to §michael@recruitmentexpert.com.au§, §with a cover letter§ explaining whatever you want to explain in relation to the above (why recruitment, and that you understand what's involved, how low base+commission structure will work for you financially, why you think you’ll make this work for you and you’ve done your research to understand what’s involved etc...) and you §have to use the word§ giraffe in your story.§  §Talk to you soon!§(We get 100’s of applications so only successful candidates will be contacted)§§§§

jobText: TXT/50589664.txt	§HSEQ Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HSEQ Specialist§§Advertiser: §MDL Civil§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About the Company:§  §Established in 2019, MDL Civil and Engineering Ltd is a privately-owned land development and civil engineering company with an innovative ‘can do’ culture. We are in a period of growth, including the delivery of large infrastructure projects across the nation. Join a successful company with modern technology and equipment, smart industry thinking and strong values of integrity.§  §Working together with the HSEQ Manager and HR & HSEQ Business Support you will have key input into developing and implementing a continuous improvement process in the civil construction industry – a high risk industry with plenty of learning to be had. We are a newly established and fast-growing business with a unique opportunity to get things right the first time. We want to ensure we build working environments that make HSEQ easy with a strong base culture and support process for learning.§  §We are focused on a collaborative and engaging approach rather than one based on minimum compliance. We aim to adopt HSE & Q best practice into every-day behaviours. Our HSEQ Specialist will champion best practice in the civil construction industry to continuously improve HSEQ culture, communication and accountability within our business and construction sites.§  §Based in Auckland, you will be responsible for Health, Safety and Environmental aspects across a range of development contracts in Auckland and Northland. There will be a boots on the ground component to the role.§  §Duties include:§ § §Ensuring best practice and leading research is promoted and incorporated into planning.§ §Actively drive the employee participation programme.§ §Being a hands-on champion in hazard identification, risk management and continuous improvement.§ §Ensuring accidents/events are reported as soon as possible, with investigations and reporting completed and learning recommendations considered and actioned in a timely manner.§ §Developing and delivering HSEQ training and induction programmes, Site Specific Safety Plans (SSSP’s), and user-friendly fit for purposes resources for users.§ §Trend analysis and reporting.§ §Sound leadership and advice in HSEQ matters.§ §Assisting with ACC/Workers compensation claims and return to work processes.§ §Engaging with key stakeholders and teams, including presenting and engaging with groups. § §Project Management.§ §About you§ § §You’re approachable, relatable and caring with an ability to resolve conflict easily. § §You have a genuine passion for HSEQ and training, a strong interest in systems processes and improvement.§ §You have drive and perseverance to follow through.§ §You are an adaptable person who can communicate at different levels.§ §You have excellent oral and written communication skills.§ §You’re not afraid to innovate and question the status quo, with an ability to back yourself with reason(s). § §You have excellent time management with ability to self-start.§ §This is the perfect position for a passionate HSE professional who really wants to make a difference in not only returning the team home to their families at the end of the day but influencing a step-change in the construction industry.§  §Key skills§  §A tertiary qualification in ergonomics, occupational health, construction management or degree relevant to quality, environment, safety and health is preferred but not essential. Between 2-5 years of practical experience is preferred.§  §It would help to already have 2-5 years experience in the HSEQ field outside of the construction sector that we can apply to the construction sector. However, construction experience will not be overlooked.§  §What can we offer you?§ § §Competitive package§ §Company Vehicle§ §Work for a company who take care of their staff§ §Permanent role§ §Only applicants that meet the above criteria will be considered for the role.§  §On offer is a unique opportunity to work for a progressive contractor with a bright future. Travel within the Auckland and Northland regions will be required.§  §A pre-employment drug and alcohol test will be required.§  §You must be a permanent New Zealand resident or a candidate holding a relevant visa to apply.§  §To discuss this role in more detail please contact Natalie on 027 3917045§  §Alternatively please email CV's to §careers@mdlcivil.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50589769.txt	§People & Organisation Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Organisation Business Partner§§Advertiser: §BBC Technologies§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§BBC Technologies is seeking a People and Organisation Business Partner to join our wonderful, globally focused team, based in Hamilton, New Zealand.§ § § §About Us§ § §BBC Technologies is the global leader in complete turnkey solutions for sorting, optimizing, and packing small fruit. BBC Technologies designs, develops, manufactures and installs all their own end-to-end turnkey lines, which include traceability and analytics software. We are a NZ based international company that has made the most of our Kiwi ingenuity to develop innovative products specifically designed for small, delicate fruit including blueberries, cherries and cherry tomatoes.§ §BBC Technologies is a member of the TOMRA Group that was founded on innovation in 1972 that began with design, manufacture, and sale of reverse vending machines for automated collection of used beverage containers. Today TOMRA provides technology-led solutions that enable the circular economy with advanced collection and sorting systems that optimize resource recovery and minimize waste in the food, recycling and mining industries.   § §Our People & Organisation team service the global BBC Technologies workforce as well as work closely with the global TOMRA Group. On our path to maturity and further growth we have some fantastic global and local projects on the horizon.§ § § §The Role§ § §We’re looking for a passionate and driven People & Organisation Business Partner to join our lively and collaborative team. Change is exciting and the pace is fast!  § §The role provides true partnership and trusted support to our leaders across the full range of human resource disciplines. Day to day you’ll be working with leaders on cyclical People & Organisation activities, leading projects in areas such as talent planning, employee experience and diversity, equity & inclusion, as well as working with a global team on various initiatives. § §This is an exciting new role where you’ll have an opportunity to implement exciting initiatives that will make a difference to our culture and employee experience as well as help us on our journey of growth!  § § § §Person Specifications § §Along with a proactive and progressive approach to the People function we’re looking for candidates with: § § §A tertiary qualification in Human Resources (or similar) OR equivalent experience.§ §Experience in an HR Business Partnering role.§ §Excellent relationship building skills to get to know the business and also influence best outcomes.§ §Experience successfully delivering People projects.§ §Experience writing policies, guidelines and other internal communications.§ §Experience effectively presenting information and responding to questions from across the business.§ §Recruitment experience.§ § § §Why work for us?§  § §This is a fantastic opportunity to join a well-known New Zealand company, with an established global presence.§ §If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Click to apply now with an up to date CV and cover letter outlining why you would be great for this role. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50589913.txt	§HR & Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR & Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Sunfed§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§THE OPPORTUNITY§Sunfed® is an award winning innovative and rapidly expanding food tech company that is leading the pack globally and shaping the future of food. Using our clean and breakthrough technology built with kiwi ingenuity, we are re-imagining the high protein food system to make meat without the animal. Our world-first category-breaking range of Sunfed Meats® taste, feel and cook like animal meat but are healthier both for us, and the planet. It includes established favourite Chicken Free Chicken®, the very popular Boar Free Bacon® and the highly anticipated Bull Free Beef® debuted at Meatstock 2020!§We are looking for an exceptional §HR & Office Manager §who is a natural at all things HR and administration, and can operate with high autonomy. You will be a champion for enhancing Health, Safety and Wellbeing of all Sunfedites. The successful person will play a pivotal role in the ongoing growth and success of Sunfed and be part of a highly innovative team.§RESPONSIBILITIES§You will act as the first point of contact for HR-related queries from employees and external partners. Your main HR administrative duties include responding to compliance issues and maintaining personnel records, managing HR documents (e.g. employment records and onboarding guides), and coordinating the smooth running of the office. Our ideal candidate has proven experience with HR procedures and employment law, and can juggle various administrative tasks effortlessly. Responsibilities include:§§Enforce company policies and procedures§Manage compliance issues such as non-conformance with H&S, Hygiene and Confidentiality protocols and facilitate internal investigations as needed§Coordinate performance management and disciplinary actions§Organize and maintain up-to-date personnel records§Organize office operations and procedures§Prepare HR documents and office policies, like employment contracts and onboarding playbooks§Perform employee on-boarding, including setting up employee digital devices, accounts and access controls§Liaise with external HR partners, like agencies§Answer employees queries about HR-related issues§Assist payroll department by providing relevant employee information (e.g. leaves of absence, sick days and work schedules)§Arrange travel accommodations and process expenses§Provide general administrative support to employees such as scheduling meetings§Plan in-house or off-site activities, like parties, celebrations and conferences§Receive and monitor visitors§Liaise with office vendors, including cleaning, catering and security services§§Requirements§Does this sound like you?§You have a relevant tertiary qualification in Human Resources or a related field.§You have proven experience as an HR Manager or a very similar role.§You have thorough knowledge of employment laws and keep yourself up-to-date.§You have experience working with software systems and are digitally-savvy.§You have exceptional attention to detail, nothing gets past you!§You have an eagle eye for detail and are a stickler for accuracy.§You are a strong Project Manager, your organisational skills are second to none.§You have the ability to prioritise tasks and manage time, all while operating at speed!§You are an exceptional communicator, both written and verbal, and are comfortable talking with staff at all levels.§You have proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, nothing phases you.§You thrive under pressure in a fast-paced agile dynamic environment, enjoy R&D and constant change.§You LOVE people and want to see them thrive to their fullest potential!§§Benefits§Want to leave the world better than you found it? Then Sunfed is the place for you.§Born global, Sunfed is a fast paced, constantly changing dynamic calling that focuses on your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team of high performing misfits, we are bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to fulfill our purpose whilst delighting our customers. We are uncompromisingly committed to success.§We look for people who love to learn, can hit the ground running, devour new challenges, generate innovative ideas and execute with intelligence, passion and enthusiasm.§The pace and demands of Sunfed has made it a gathering place for driven and talented people. In this environment, Sunfedites draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to be at peak performance, realise their potential and thrive.§If you're hungry to make a difference and strive to always be your best self, then let's talk.§Learn more @ www.sunfedfoods.com§Facebook - @sunfedmeats : https://www.facebook.com/sunfedmeats §Instagram - @sunfedmeats : https://www.instagram.com/sunfedmeats/ §Twitter - @sunfedmeats : https://www.twitter.com/sunfedmeats/ §Please note that due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your interest.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§Which of the following Work Health & Safety qualifications have you obtained?§How many years' experience do you have in an administration role?§How many years' experience do you have in the following legal disciplines?§What is your expected annual salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50597138.txt	§National Health & Safety Manager - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Health & Safety Manager - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Ideal Electrical Suppliers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Ideal Electrical Suppliers is part of the global Rexel SA Group, the world's largest distributor of electrical, lighting and datacom products. With premium Ideal outlets across New Zealand and a reputation for customer service that goes the extra mile, we provide total electrical, datacom and lighting solutions to customers in the industrial, commercial and residential sectors.§      §National Health & Safety Manager - Auckland §      §        §          §Brand New National Role§          §Be our H&S Guru§          §Build an outstanding safety culture§        §        §A fantastic §new§ opportunity has arisen in Auckland for a §National Health & Safety Manager§ to join our Team. The key emphasis of the role is to lead, drive and manage Ideal Electricals efforts through the provision of technical expertise in the areas of occupational health, safety, and environment, consistent with Ideal Electricals/Rexel policies and values.§        §Reporting to the Managing Director you will work closely with our Operations Managers and the HR team to champion health and safety engagement across the business, which includes 48 Branches and 5 regional support centres and a Distribution Centre; you will be responsible for setting and delivering the safety strategy as the business matures on its safety journey, coaching, enabling and assisting people leaders to deliver improved health and safety outcomes.§        §Whilst we have some H&S systems and processes in place, a key issue is to obtain the full engagement of the team; your challenge will be to promote a strong culture of safe working practices across the organisation, aiming for zero harm whilst gaining buy-in across the business. Currently, we rely heavily on a paper-based manual system and we have the opportunity to leverage technology and the support from the Rexel business in Australia – another challenge will be to manage the change and adoption of these new systems in NZ.§        §To be successful in your application, you will have demonstrated experience in managing OH&S behavioural change in a medium to large organisation and come from a good OH&S pedigree with a Diploma or above in a related safety/HR or ER discipline.  As the expert, you will have a detailed H&S legislative knowledge and how to manage this on a national basis, in addition to a sound working knowledge and understanding of WorkSafe and other governmental bodies such as ACC. §        §Strong communication, presentation, and relationship development skills are an absolute must, as well as a thorough understanding of the commercial pressures facing line management and why the “risk” is sometimes unfortunately taken.  The ability to communicate (verbal and written) at all levels from senior management down to the “branch floor” will be key to getting the team to understand the “why” and then engage in our safety journey. A good understanding of key HR practices in NZ would be a bonus.§        §What we can offer in return, in addition to our excellent benefit package (salary, medical cover, subsidised holiday homes, etc.) is an excellent career opportunity.  §        §If you are a confident and flexible safety practitioner looking for a great challenge to build an outstanding safety culture and forge a brand-new role, apply now!§      §      §      §    §    §www.ideal.co.nz§  §§§ §Brand New National Role§ §Be our H&S Guru§ §Build an outstanding safety culture§ §A fantastic §new§ opportunity has arisen in Auckland for a §National Health & Safety Manager§ to join our Team. The key emphasis of the role is to lead, drive and manage Ideal Electricals efforts through the provision of technical expertise in the areas of occupational health, safety, and environment, consistent with Ideal Electricals/Rexel policies and values.§ §Reporting to the Managing Director you will work closely with our Operations Managers and the HR team to champion health and safety engagement across the business, which includes 48 Branches and 5 regional support centres and a Distribution Centre; you will be responsible for setting and delivering the safety strategy as the business matures on its safety journey, coaching, enabling and assisting people leaders to deliver improved health and safety outcomes.§ §Whilst we have some H&S systems and processes in place, a key issue is to obtain the full engagement of the team; your challenge will be to promote a strong culture of safe working practices across the organisation, aiming for zero harm whilst gaining buy-in across the business. Currently, we rely heavily on a paper-based manual system and we have the opportunity to leverage technology and the support from the Rexel business in Australia – another challenge will be to manage the change and adoption of these new systems in NZ.§ §To be successful in your application, you will have demonstrated experience in managing OH&S behavioural change in a medium to large organisation and come from a good OH&S pedigree with a Diploma or above in a related safety/HR or ER discipline.  As the expert, you will have a detailed H&S legislative knowledge and how to manage this on a national basis, in addition to a sound working knowledge and understanding of WorkSafe and other governmental bodies such as ACC. § §Strong communication, presentation, and relationship development skills are an absolute must, as well as a thorough understanding of the commercial pressures facing line management and why the “risk” is sometimes unfortunately taken.  The ability to communicate (verbal and written) at all levels from senior management down to the “branch floor” will be key to getting the team to understand the “why” and then engage in our safety journey. A good understanding of key HR practices in NZ would be a bonus.§ §What we can offer in return, in addition to our excellent benefit package (salary, medical cover, subsidised holiday homes, etc.) is an excellent career opportunity.  § §If you are a confident and flexible safety practitioner looking for a great challenge to build an outstanding safety culture and forge a brand-new role, apply now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50598089.txt	§National HR Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National HR Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Ruby Recruit Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§ §National HR Business Partner§ § §Crown Lift Trucks is a well-known global manufacturer of Material Handling Equipment with a reputation for award-winning product design, advanced engineering technology, and a commitment to sustainability, this North American privately owned business is truly an industry leader in New Zealand with continued focus to growth.  §This company is “customer service centric” with fully integrated sales and service teams providing its customers with both excellent products, exceptional field service support to enhance the customer experience.   §Reporting to the New Zealand Managing Director, this newly created role will full responsibility for all aspects of Human Resources for New Zealand’s 300 FTE’s across 14 branches and headquartered in Auckland.   §As a member of the New Zealand Senior Management Team, this role will provide business-focused, strategic and operational HR/ER advice and support across the business. You will provide a professional, and credible human resource support across New Zealand especially regarding employee/industrial relations, recruitment, talent management, remuneration and benefits, and Generalist HR leadership.   §You will also play key role in identifying and promoting new ways of working and empowering approaches to people management in support of delivering the strategic goals of the business. This is a true generalist human resources role, where coaching, having authentic conversations, and people development will play a significant factor in the success of the role.   §To be considered you will have at least 8 years demonstrable HR experience where you have delivered both operationally and strategically. Strong EQ, the ability to challenge views in a professional manner, and be a confident leader are all critical requirements for this role. The business will see you quickly as the go to for all things Human Resources, and you influencing skills, practicality, and tenacity will make you a genuine and trusted leader. §To apply, please submit your CV and covering letter using the link.  §For further information regarding this role please contact Kelly George @ Ruby Recruit  Mobile - §0277779177§ Email - Kelly@rubyrecruit.co.nz §Please note our clients are unable to provide sponsorship for this role therefore candidates need to be eligible to work in New Zealand. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobText: TXT/50600355.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §Craigmore§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Rest of Hawkes Bay§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About the role:§This position reports to the Business Manager with oversite of orchards across Hawkes Bay, Gisborne, Northland and Bay of Plenty.  The responsibilities includes implementing the H&S strategy across the Horticulture division, building on the culture of health and safety and continuous improvement throughout the Orchards.  Essentially, you will be the conduit between what’s on paper and what happens out in the field. Your role is to bring the strategy to life and to bring the people on the journey, so the business meets its legal and ethical obligations.§You should be passionate about health and safety and have the energy and drive to support this busy environment. You will have best practice methodology firmly at the heart of your work ethic and take pride in your ability to drive a health and safety culture and create business value. §As the Ongaonga orchard is currently being developed and with further development planned, it would be preferred if you have an understanding of the health and safety requirements associated with construction and project management. Although the role is based in Hawkes Bay, travel may be required from time to time.§You will also bring:§Experience and understanding of the challenges within a horticulture environment (viticulture is a bonus) §Qualifications within H&S e.g. NEBOSH certified or similar §Previous experience (3-4 years minimum) in a similar role providing health and safety advice, guidance including meeting compliance requirements of international certification e.g. Global Gap§Management of Hazard ID, reporting and investigation; emergency preparedness and response; and incident and investigation protocols§Proven experience in developing and implementing robust health and safety programmes§Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to establish and build effective working relationships especially with seasonal workers e.g. RSE workers§Previous experience in developing and upskilling employees to influence safety behaviours§Ability to manage time, prioritise and complete reporting requirements associated with the role.§About us:§Craigmore manages dairy, horticulture and forest investments throughout New Zealand. Our aim is to be a long-term producer of high-quality food and forest products whilst managing land sustainably, developing our people and maintaining a balance of growing and diversifying existing investment strategies. §If this sounds like you and you’re ready to take on a new challenge, then click ‘apply now’ and forward an up to date cv. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How many years' experience do you have in a training & development role?§Which of the following Work Health & Safety qualifications have you obtained?§§§

We deliver recruitment and career services to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§ § The Adecco Group is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland and listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (ADEN) and powered by nine global lead brands: Adecco, Adia, Badenoch & Clark, General Assembly, LHH, Modis, Pontoon, Spring Professional and Vettery.§ § §About the opportunity:§ § This is an amazing opportunity for a motivated and energetic people-oriented sales or recruitment professional to join our Adecco Palmerston North team. No two days are ever the same - so if you’re looking for a challenge, keep on reading!§ § As a Recruitment Consultant, you will enjoy the challenge of running a 360-degree desk in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for servicing clients and candidates and ensuring all parts of the recruitment equation are considered at every turn. Driving your desk for success will be vital, and whilst taking on an established client base from day one, it’s critical that the successful candidate is someone who enjoys and gets a kick out of hunting for new business, whilst have the skill to be able to convert new clients into longstanding established partners of Adecco.§ § While recruitment is not a 9 to 5 role, it is certainly a way of life. Your passion for meeting people of all walks will be high on your priority list, and being driven to learn about industry will be front and centre for you. You may be a seasoned recruiter or an industry specialist in the civil and industrial fields. Either way, a fascination in seeing how NZ’s economy ticks over will stand you in great stead for success in this fast-paced role.§ § Being passionate to help others and focused on driving long term mutually beneficial relationships will help you in the role too. jobText: TXT/50602174.txt	§HR & Office Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR & Office Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §P4S Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§This is a truly varied and exciting full time role that will suit someone looking for their second career move.  For two days a week you will be the on-site HR resource for one of our most important clients, and for the other three days a week you will be working in our office carrying out recruitment, office administration and backup payroll duties. § §Alongside this you’ll co-ordinate some of the other key activities across the business, such as keeping us connected with our training course alumni, making sure our newsletters are current and ‘on-point’ and keeping our name at the forefront of our clients’ minds.§ §Ideally you have some understanding of NZ employment legislation, possibly through a role in recruitment, human resources or payroll. You’ll also be a self-starter who ‘gets stuck in’ and has loads of common sense.  You’ll be accurate, pay high attention to detail and you’ll also have strong IT skills.  § §Our business has been around for over 20 years, we have a great track record with our clients and our focus on their success ensures our own.  We’re a small close-knit team who enjoy delivering top quality service to our clients and having fun while we do it. So, if you are interested in joining our team, please log onto our website and apply §at www.people4success.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

some of the areas we will utilise your expertise will be:§          §            §Developing an ER strategy for MPI that links with other strategies such as people capability, remuneration, and workforce planning§            §Engaging with the business, wider public sector, and SSC to develop bargaining strategies for union negotiations§            §Leading and representing MPI in union negotiations, mediations and employment law disputes§            §Leading ER-related audit process including reviews of documentation, agreement and policies§            §Ensuring leaders operate within and comply with employment law and legislation§            §Maintaining oversight of business unit-specific engagement, to ensure it is connected appropriately to MPI-wide approaches§          §          § §          §Mōu - Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Auckland MPI Centre (close to Auckland Airport) or Wellington Locations Available!§People may be surprised where MPI's work takes our people - jobText: TXT/50605220.txt	§People & Culture Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Advisor§§Advertiser: §PwC NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Line of Service§Internal Firm Services§Industry/Sector§Not Applicable§Specialism§IFS - Human Capital (HC)§Management Level§Senior Associate§Job Description & Summary§§Kia Ora§§Who are we?§We’re a team of trusted business advisors who work alongside our clients and build long lasting relationships that create value. Our people are what make us the leading professional services firm in New Zealand - full of energy, challenge, and opportunities. Our values are at the centre of who we are; it decides the way we think, who we employ and how we work.§§What would you be doing? §We have an exciting permanent opportunity in Wellington for an experienced and motivated HR generalist to join our People and Culture team.  In this role you’ll be a trusted business advisor driving key strategic and operational priorities within your portfolio as well as providing day to day HR advice and support. This is a busy role where you’ll be the key point of contact for an operating unit and responsible for delivering the full life cycle of HR activity. Some key responsibilities include: §Working alongside the P&C Business Partner to successfully deliver all operational HR activity §Assist in planning and managing remuneration reviews including understanding and applying benchmark data and remuneration guidelines§Taking an active role in our Graduate Recruitment programme and supporting stakeholders across the full spectrum of HR issues, policies and procedures§Contribute to, manage and implement People & Culture framework and policies.§Manage and coach on performance management and organisational development frameworks and activities §​§What you’ll need to bring to the role§You’ll be a commercially focused HR Generalist with a minimum of three year’s HR advisory experience. §You will be confident in owning HR projects and have experience managing Employee Relations§A tertiary qualification in HR or an HR related discipline a prerequisite.§To be successful you’ll be a self-starter with a natural talent for establishing effective working relationships in an open and approachable manner. §Previous experience working in a professional services organisation advantageous.§You will have a proven track record in building relationships based on trust, credibility and the delivery of quality work. You’ll have sound judgment to deal with demanding situations, and experience in problem solving - particularly the ability to source and offer a variety of solutions. §Your strong attention to detail will be relied on, coupled with your client-service mind set and organised approach to your work. You are a team player with a high level of energy and passion for what you do.§Open to travel between various PwC office locations.§​§Why is PwC a great place to work?§Today’s constantly changing commercial world requires us to be proactive with our professional and personal development. At PwC, you will have an unrivalled level of access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms, where you’ll be enabled by cutting-edge technology and a culture of self-disruption. We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and with an increasingly agile workforce drive flexible working to get the best out of our people. At PwC, we aim to inspire, motivate and reward our people to succeed in all areas of their lives.§ §What next?§If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. To submit your details click ‘apply now’.§Ngā mihi mahana§§§Education §(if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)§Degrees/Field of Study required: Bachelor Degree - Human Resources Management§Degrees/Field of Study preferred:§Certifications §(if blank, certifications not specified)§§Desired Languages §(If blank, desired languages not specified)§English§Travel Requirements§Up to 20%§Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?§No§Government Clearance Required?§No§Job Posting End Date§October 22, 2020§§§§§

Join the People and Culture team at Wintec.§We enjoy a good laugh, a lot of character, and promote being our authentic selves at work. That said we work exceptionally hard between the chuckles - but continuously gain positivity and energy from each other to get through even the most gruelling of days. This is your opportunity to join a team that will bring out the best in you, in an organisation that aspires to lead the change in tertiary education and model modern working practices.§About the role§In this role you will support the Safety and Wellbeing Manager and partner with managers and staff across all areas of Wintec. You will use your influence and coaching abilities to achieve the organisational goals through managers and staff to affect safety and wellbeing change. You will work alongside a high performing collaborative team, who works closely together providing supportive guidance and experience to continuously grow each other. You will hit the ground running as you must be able to churn through the day to day operational needs and provide sound leadership advice on Safety and Wellbeing management. You will identify risks and manage investigations, promote safety and wellbeing practices across Wintec while coaching and mentoring others. It's essential that you have experience in building strong relationships and have superior communication skills working with a diverse group of people. §If safety and wellbeing is a passion for you and you have a generalist understanding of Health and Safety and its impact on an organisation both legislatively and practically then this could be the job for you. Your ability to influence leaders to create a proactive safety and wellbeing culture to get the best out of their teams, through coaching and development, to achieve our strategic goals will be your true measure of success. You will be motivated in bringing out the best in people and have the tenacity to work through the challenges that come with taking people on this journey. Your ability to stay calm in a crisis is critical whilst using your highly developed communication skills to build and maintain strong relationships and commitment to safety and wellbeing, this could be your next exciting move. §Working at Wintec§In return for your expertise and energy, we offer a flexible working environment where people respect each other and work together, take responsibility, and focus on quality in everything they do.§Wintec continues to be one of the leading tertiary institutes by fostering an innovative and forward thinking organisation. Our team works to stay abreast of the fast-changing world of technology and industry practice. For an energetic self-starter looking for a fast-paced working environment, Wintec is the place to be.§Closing Date: There will be no closing date for this position and the advert may be removed without notice - applications will be reviewed as received and you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as possible. Applications close when position is filled.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50605683.txt	§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Human Resources and Payroll Administrator §      §        §          §Agricultural not-for-profit§          §New and exciting HR team§          §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§        §        § §        §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§        § §        §As OSPRI moves through the implementation phase of a new and improved operating model, driven by a newly appointed Chief Executive and Board, nothing is more important now than the continued development and success of their people. Following the successful recruitment of the HR Business Partner and a Senior Human Resources Advisor, OSPRI are now searching for a Human Resources and Payroll Administrator to deliver operational payroll processing and broad HR coordination and support to the wider team.§        § §        §As the new HR and Payroll Administrator, you will have primary responsibility for the successful management and running of OSPRI’s fortnightly payroll process. You will produce informative dashboard reports and provide meaningful analytics for the business, utilising tools such as PowerBI, relating to all matters HR and payroll. Using this information, you will work with the team to identify and introduce process and efficiency improvement across the function. You will also play a critical role in the preparation and implementation of a new payroll system, as part of the broader HRIS implementation early next year. Beyond Payroll, you will become the ‘engine room’ of the HR team, providing coordination and administrative support towards recruitment, remuneration, performance management, policy development and L&D.§        § §        §OSPRI are looking for a customer focused HR and Payroll administrator to join a growing, fun and enthusiastic HR team. You will bring at least 1-2 years of hands on experience managing payroll processes, allowing you to hit the ground running when you start. You will have clear competency working with Microsoft suite, ideally with experience in PowerBI and/or strong Microsoft Excel skills. As part of a small team you will work with and support all areas of the business, so you will need strong communication and relationship management skills. OSPRI are outcome focussed, however believe in having fun at the same time; as the key support person in the team, you will be someone that can navigate the enjoyable, people facing elements of the role, along with the busy administration components.  §        § §        §As the Human Resources team at OSPRI grows in line with the broader expansion of the organisation, there is now a need for either an up and coming HR professional with experience in payroll management, or an established HR and payroll administrator looking for a new challenge.§ §        §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§        §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Monday 12th October at 5pm.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Agricultural not-for-profit§ §New and exciting HR team§ §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§ § § §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. We are a market leader in the home garden and horticulture industry, supplying retail products to independent garden centres and big box DIY retailers.§  §We currently have a great opportunity for a proactive and experienced generalist HR Manager to join our busy Mt Maunganui based team. §  §The role§  §This role provides true business partnership and support across the full range of HR services to our leaders and our staff.  As part of the Senior Leadership Team, reporting to the MD, this sole charge role ensures that all aspects of HR practices and processes are delivered efficiently and effectively to drive employee engagement and business performance. You will have proven experience in developing HR Strategy, but still like to keep your hands busy doing-the-doing.  In charge of your own day you will have autonomy and accountability.§  §The key responsibilities of the role are:§ § §timely and accurate HR advice and support to the business;§ §development of an HR Strategy to support and drive business goals;§ §ensuring compliance with Employment legislation & keeping up to date with Employment law;§ §management of the Performance Evaluation Process;§ §management of Talent & Succession Planning§ §development & review of Policy & Procedure;§ §the management of the end to end recruitment and onboarding process;§ §the management of all HR administration;§ §supporting Health & Safety across the business;§ §The ideal person will:§ § §have 5+ years proven HR generalist experience;§ §an in-depth working knowledge and understanding of NZ employment legislation;§ communication skills;§ §strong relationship building skills;§ §be a positive and proactive team player; § §be self-motivated and results orientated.§ §This role is a permanent part-time position working 25+ hours per week – there is some flexibility around the hours and when they are worked for the successful person.§  §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test. Tui is a safety sensitive site operating random drug testing.§  §Applications close Wednesday 7th October 2020.§Applicants for this position should have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in jobText: TXT/50608554.txt	§Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Brannigans Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator §      §        §Our Client§        §RX Plastics (RXP) are part of Aliaxis, a global organization employing over 16,000 people worldwide. Aliaxis are proud manufacturers of brands such as Marley, RXP, Dux and Dynex. The RXP main factory is in Tinwald, Ashburton and comprises two areas making plastic pipe and tanks, and running three shifts. They dispatch their orders through dedicated Warehouse teams (one based in Tinwald and the other in Hornby).  For further information please go to §www.rxplastics.co.nz§        §The Role§        §Reporting to the GM RX Plastics with functional reporting through to the NZ HSE Facilitator your key responsibilities will be to bring sound, practical HSE knowledge to the business and implement programs to develop and support the safety leadership capability of line managers and supervisors. The role will influence and engage the team to ensure everyone is safe at work, the HSE system is sound, a positive safety culture is in place and people hold themselves and others to account for HSE. Ensuring the JSEA’s and risk assessments are working well and utilising the application of ISO14001 within the manufacturing environment are key accountabilities. In addition, you will be responsible for ensuring the maintenance of the Global Aliaxis NZ policies regarding health, safety and environment.§        §Skills and Experience§        §To be successful in this role, you will have at least 5 years’ experience in a senior HSE role along with a formal qualification in an occupational health and safety related field and preferably be ICAM trained.  Practical experience of permit to work systems, JSEAs and risk assessments are a must along with the knowledge of how to apply ISO14001 in a busy manufacturing environment. Your outstanding interpersonal skills and the confidence to influence and engage with others will set you apart. You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account.§        §To Apply§        §Opportunities like this don’t often arise.  If you feel you possess the above qualities please click the ‘Apply’ button and upload your cover letter and CV. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Carole Peterson on §03 345 8751§ or Amanda Hance on §03 345 8754§.§        §Applications for this role close 5pm Tuesday 13 October 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Our Client§ §RX Plastics (RXP) are part of Aliaxis, a global organization employing over 16,000 people worldwide. Aliaxis are proud manufacturers of brands such as Marley, RXP, Dux and Dynex. The RXP main factory is in Tinwald, Ashburton and comprises two areas making plastic pipe and tanks, and running three shifts. They dispatch their orders through dedicated Warehouse teams (one based in Tinwald and the other in Hornby).  For further information please go to §www.rxplastics.co.nz§ §The Role§ §Reporting to the GM RX Plastics with functional reporting through to the NZ HSE Facilitator your key responsibilities will be to bring sound, practical HSE knowledge to the business and implement programs to develop and support the safety leadership capability of line managers and supervisors. The role will influence and engage the team to ensure everyone is safe at work, the HSE system is sound, a positive safety culture is in place and people hold themselves and others to account for HSE. Ensuring the JSEA’s and risk assessments are working well and utilising the application of ISO14001 within the manufacturing environment are key accountabilities. In addition, you will be responsible for ensuring the maintenance of the Global Aliaxis NZ policies regarding health, safety and environment.§ §Skills and Experience§ §To be successful in this role, you will have at least 5 years’ experience in a senior HSE role along with a formal qualification in an occupational health and safety related field and preferably be ICAM trained.  Practical experience of permit to work systems, JSEAs and risk assessments are a must along with the knowledge of how to apply ISO14001 in a busy manufacturing environment. Your outstanding interpersonal skills and the confidence to influence and engage with others will set you apart. You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account.§ §To Apply§ §Opportunities like this don’t often arise.  If you feel you possess the above qualities please click the ‘Apply’ button and upload your cover letter and CV. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Carole Peterson on §03 345 8751§ or Amanda Hance on §03 345 8754§.§ §Applications for this role close 5pm Tuesday 13 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50609429.txt	§Recruitment Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Advisor§§Advertiser: §Southern District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§Dunedin Hospital§§Permanent in-house recruitment opportunity§Fun, friendly team environment§Become a trusted advisor managing end to end recruitment§This isn't just another recruitment job, this is a chance to use your skills to find top talent AND make a difference to the health of your community and our wider region!§About us§Here at the Southern DHB, we put our patients, families and whanau at the centre of everything we do. That includes bringing in the right talent to make sure that their needs are met; and that's where you come in.§You will be joining a friendly, hard-working team, dedicated to providing excellent service to managers and candidates alike throughout the recruitment process. Whilst each advisor manages their own portfolio, we work well as a team offering support when needed.§About the opportunity§We are looking for a skilled, motivated and positive team member to bring their passion for recruiting and building relationships into this busy and rewarding role. As a trusted Recruitment Advisor, you will be responsible for managing the end to end recruitment process for the Senior Medical Officer (SMO) portfolio across the Southern DHB.§Whilst this role is largely autonomous, you'll work closely alongside a specialist recruitment coordinator who will help you with the relocation of many of your overseas candidates. Together you will work quickly and efficiently, ironing out issues and making things happen across a number of vacancies and candidates at any one time.§This role has a New Zealand wide network of recruiters across the DHBs where you can at times contribute to projects at a national level. Your role will also involve creating sourcing strategies to achieve the short and long-term hiring goals often within hard to fill areas.§You'll have the ability to offer expert advice across campaign planning, the hiring process and ultimately finding the right person for the job. Being able to organise and prioritise your time effectively; and build strong relationships to work confidently alongside senior candidates and DHB management will be strengths of yours.§About you§If you're experienced in the world of recruitment, and looking to use your skills in a busy and rewarding in-house recruitment role, this could be the role for you!§Our ideal candidate will have the following:§Proven recruitment experience preferably in either an in-house or agency environment - or both!§Experience in pro-actively sourcing candidates to meet business needs§Knowledge and experience of campaign planning and successful advertising initiatives§Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organisation§A passion for providing exceptional candidate care throughout the recruitment process§The ability to prioritise effectively and self-manage your time§Adaptable style and a positive attitude§Your commitment to customer service will ensure the candidate experience is positive, memorable and consistent.We would prefer you to have significant recruitment expertise, and an interest in health care would be a bonus.§You'll receive full training in our systems and processes and a full handover, so when you start working independently you'll be able to hit the ground running. As this is a district-wide role, you will provide support to managers in Dunedin, Invercargill and Queenstown; travel between these locations will be required at times.§This is a great opportunity to join a friendly, dedicated team. If you think you fit the bill, and would enjoy recruiting in a complex and varied health care environment, we'd love to hear from you!§Why Southern?§Now is a great time to relocate to Southern if you were considering a move! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out §https://southernhealthcareers.nz/§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.§Closing date: Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess, Recruitment Advisor - Corporate Directorate on §(03) 470 9021§.§Pre-employment occupational health assessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§To apply§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: §www.southernhealth.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50609431.txt	§Regional Sales & Relationship Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Sales & Relationship Manager§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Agency§§§§§§This is a truly unique role, sitting across two of New Zealand’s best known recruitment businesses, Madison and AbsoluteIT, who operate as part of the AWF Madison Group. This role will develop key client relationships and drive strategic sales initiatives across the Auckland region. §With an extensive client network and NZ’s largest recruitment business behind you, this is the opportunity for an experienced recruiter or sales leader to take the next step. As a group, we’re committed to transforming the ideals of traditional recruitment and this role will be an integral part of changing the perception of what services we offer.§Key responsibilities include:§§Develop and execute an effective sales plan with a focus on Madison and Absolute IT§Build relationships with relevant organisations to obtain tenders and influence proposals§Coach internal staff on effective client relationships, business development, and account management§Identify growth sectors, and develop a sales strategy to target those sectors§Uncover new opportunities and market gaps outside of traditional recruitment§Engage existing team in overall sales strategy and process§About you:§You will live and breathe the recruitment industry and be driven by fostering long-lasting partnerships. Your strong commercial acumen and ability to hold strategic conversations at all levels paired with your understanding of the recruitment market will excite you about driving innovative changes across multiple businesses. You must be able to work well autonomously and as part of a team, whilst demonstrating leadership capability while contributing to company culture.§While we’re open to previous work history, your background will ideally include:§A proven track record of agency recruitment and sales/business development experience§Responding to RFPs and RFIs§Training and development of staff§Developing sales strategies§Why you should apply:§§Work for a Kiwi-owned NZX listed business§Report directly to the General Manager§Work autonomously as part of the leadership team§Ownership of sales and client relationships across Auckland§If you’re up for a challenging, yet exciting and rewarding opportunity, email your CV and cover letter to §april.lynch@madison.co.nz§ quoting reference #89346§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: HR Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50611329.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §Rata Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The Company§ §A family owned organisation who can be proud of their innovation and transformation over the years.  There are always exciting times within this business as they evolve and progress with the changing landscape.  Longevity is prominent throughout; this speaks volumes for a company who know their people are key to the ongoing success. Reporting through to a knowledgeable, successful and supportive GM who will ensure you have the tools needed to deliver great HR work.  A professional but relaxed culture, there are so many positives for the successful candidate to get excited about.§ § §The Opportunity§ §This sole charge generalist, operational and hands on HR Manager role offers variety plus.  Ultimately your role will be to ensure all aspects of human resources for NZ are delivered to a high standard.   Ensuring the HR strategic plan is prepared, implemented and reviewed, your role will be to ensure it is having the effect needed against business objectives. § §Your position will focus on positive deliverables around:§  § §Management of employment processes§ §Sound knowledge of NZ employment relations § §Advising Managers on operational HR issues§ §Policy & procedure development and review§ §Internal corporate communications§ §Management of performance appraisals§ §Supplier management§ §Adhoc projects§ §   §The Individual§ §Your generalist HR knowledge and experience will be appreciated, and you will also learn and develop your commercial knowledge along the way. § §In charge of your own day, you will have autonomy and responsibility, but always with the guidance if needed of a superb leadership team.  You must possess the drive and motivation to achieve the HR objectives set, be commercially astute but most importantly know how to partner with a business and their Managers to ensure its success – this is absolute key.§ §Your presence makes a huge difference to this business, ensuring you feel valued and appreciated throughout.  §Rata Recruitment§Specialise in providing expert, talented personnel on a contract and permanent basis, to clients throughout New Zealand’s technical industries.§Rata Recruitment will process and manage your personal data confidentially and securely. Our policies and processes ensure we act in accordance with 'The Privacy Act 1993' and in-line with definitions outlined by 'The Office of the Privacy Commissioner'.'§If you would like to find out more about this role, or how we can assist in your next career opportunity, please make contact or visit our website on www.ratarecruitment.co.nz§§§§
