jobText: TXT/50611868.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §DHP Consultancy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§About the client§ §The College are passionate about helping New Zealanders within healthcare.  They are proud of their achievements but want to improve their HR practices for their people. § § § §What you’ll be doing§Ensuring HR disciplines are delivered whilst working collaboratively, stretching boundaries and harnessing the potential of the team as we build for tomorrow – while delivering today.  As the lead for the People and Culture functions you will play a pivotal role in helping the college achieve their goal of being the ‘great place to work."  Ensuring  their people are well supported.  You will be the steward and shepherd of their culture – reaching across their business to help them cultivate an environment where their people thrive.§ §Collaborating with leaders across the business, you will build a deep understanding of what they do, helping the business leaders identify opportunities and bring solutions that work for their people and their business.  You will be motivated and energised by a challenge and enjoy the space to create solutions that help them maintain the talent and capability so vital for their success§ §You will be motivated so that the respect and value they place on their people extends further to a holistic approach to wellness and wellbeing which enriches people lives at work and at home.§ § § §What you’ll bring§ §We recognise that there’s much more to you than your CV.  We don’t mind what industries you’ve worked with or what titles you have had, but you will be instantly credible as a people and HR leader; be polished in your ability to work as part of a senior team, and have enough business acumen to enable you to navigate the organisation and identify how to create more value through people.  § §You will not be shy of rolling your sleeves up; will be as comfortable in the conceptual as the actual and motivated by finding creative and pragmatic solutions.§ § § §Why us?§ §The College believe great things happen in the every day, every task an opportunity to make a difference. They are a humble bunch that get satisfaction from helping others succeed.§ §The College  believe their strategy has huge opportunity for all involved in their business – whether it’s growth or the opportunity to make an even greater impact for all New Zealanders, or the ability to learn from their experience and celebrate their success.§ §They are a people business – it is their people who make the greatest difference to the people of NZ.  They value their time, talent and insight and are as committed to ensuring the College has as positive an impact on their lives.§ §Ki te hunga e āta whakaaro ana ki te tuku i te pukapuka tono mō te tūranga nei. He Kāreti tēnei e kaingākau ana ki te reo me ngā tikanga Māori. Mehemea e manawanui ana koe ki te āwhina i te Kāreti ki te whakatutuki i te mana hauora taurite, tēnā koa tukua mai to tono.§ §Next steps§ §To express your interest in this opportunity, please click the 'Apply Now' button below and attach your CV and a cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources manager?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§Have you completed a qualification in human resources (HR)?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of employment & workplace relations?§§§

jobTitle: People and Culture Consultant Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50612717.txt	§People and Culture Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Culture Consultant§§Advertiser: §The People Project§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The People Project was founded out of an aspiration to do something bigger than ourselves by genuinely helping Kiwi businesses with their people matters. We are a specialist Human Resources Consulting business and partner with organisations across New Zealand to provide them with the support and guidance that is suitable to their unique culture. We pride ourselves on our modern, simple and commercial approach with a long-term commitment to our relationships with our clients.§ §We are stoked that our business is growing because it means our network of contractors we love to partner with is also growing! We are looking for another like minded HR Specialist to join us for 10 hours a week initially as we continue to build an incredible business that we are proud of.§ § § §What we are looking for:§ §This is a 100% flexible position, we are looking for someone that is after minimum 10 hours a week with the potential to increase over time.  § §Due to the nature of our work and our client’s needs we want to see true generalist’s with a minimum of 5 years’ experience working in either a corporate or SME environment dealing with stakeholders at all levels ideally in an HR business Partner level or above.§ §This role will be doing a mix of Employment Relations, Change Management, Leadership Coaching Recruitment, Policy work. We are a full service HR offering and we do everything for our clients from more administrative tasks to strategic work so you need to be comfortable doing it all, that’s why our clients love us and why we are so embedded in their businesses.§ §This is a role that requires someone to be able to manage a lot of moving parts, with shifting deadlines while managing multiple stakeholders. Being organised and backing yourself is critical to be successful in this role.§ §What is most important to us is that you have strong relationship building skills and high levels of Emotional Intelligence, credibility and commercial acumen. We don’t do transactional consulting we pride ourselves on our long-term relationships, high standards and service.§ §Our consultants work across clients in manufacturing, FMCG, Tech, Financial Services, Not for Profit, Public Sector and Services so you will gain exposure to a broad range of stakeholders and people matters.§ §In return you will be offered an opportunity to grow your career, stretch your learning and work in a trusting, fun and open environment where you can be yourself.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobTitle: Payroll Project Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50613170.txt	§Payroll Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll Project Manager§§Advertiser: §Infinitas Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Payroll Project Manager to lead the implementation of a new payroll system for this large and established New Zealand business in the healthcare sector.§  § We are looking for someone that has experience of implementing payroll systems for multi-site operations as well as someone who has experience of transformation and stakeholder management.  You will be managing the software provider and project managing the whole transition from the old payroll system to the new system. It is vital that you have a strong understanding of New Zealand payroll legislation and can define the project scope, goals and deliverables and well as lead the implementation.§  § Specific responsibilities of the role include:§ § §Lead the planning and management assigned project§ §Define project scope, goals and deliverables§ §Define project tasks and resource requirements§ §Plan and schedule project timelines§ §Provide direction and support to project team§ §Monitor and report on progress of the project to stakeholders§ §Implement and manage project changes and interventions to achieve project outputs§ §Project evaluation and assessment of the results§ § The company has a large and varied workforce with a mix of salaried and waged staff. This role could suit experienced HR Project Managers or project managers with payroll implementation experience.§  § The company is at the beginning stage of a positive transformation project that allows for significant improvements to be made across the business and this role is seen as critical to the continued success of the organisation.§  § Although a contract position, we are looking for someone to make improvements and work with the highly talented and capable business unit leaders across the company to continue driving a high performing culture.§  § This is a fast-paced business that will need someone to be forward thinking and be able to handle high workloads during this crucial period for the business. It is an exciting opportunity that will be challenging but highly rewarding and will see you work closely with a high performing senior leadership team and working across the business.  §  § You will be reporting into the commercial and programme manager who wants to give you the autonomy to deliver on projects and lead the business on the journey to make them more efficient.  §  § This role is initially a six-month contract but could be extended.§  § Please apply to the role online, or if you have any questions please call Jason on §09 218 6127§§§§

jobText: TXT/50613858.txt	§Senior Advisor, Health, Safety & Wellbeing§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor, Health, Safety & Wellbeing§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Make history with us§  §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§  §The People and Capability Group is responsible for leading and delivering programmes of work that support strategic objectives and underpin the organisations capability, capacity and culture.§  §We are looking for an experienced, Health, Safety and Wellbeing Senior Advisor to ensure we have the programmes, policies, governance and leadership in place to ensure our people are safe at work.§  §The opportunity§  §We are looking for someone for 3-4 months to provide expert advice on Health, Safety and Wellbeing (HS&W) to all levels of the business and explore future HS&W opportunities. The role works alongside senior leaders and the EPA Board to set the direction for Health, Safety and Wellbeing to deliver a comprehensive suite of initiatives, hazard and risk management, governance reporting and audits.§  §Under the currently COVID-19 situation, this role is pivotal in providing advice to Senior Management and leading the response to keep staff safe and well during the pandemic.§  §The role also manages our Business Continuity and Emergency Management Programme along with the physical security requirements for the EPA, ensuring we have robust systems, processes and protocols in place, in case we need them.§  §This role also looks after our people in the field ensuing their safety while working in a regulatory setting with Hazardous Substances and New Organisms, and public engagement activities.§  §About you§  §We’re after someone who has a flexible and agile working style, fantastic organisational skills, and is excellent at managing relationships.§  §Other skills include:§ § §Senior level experience in the Health, Safety and Wellbeing field§ §Business Continuity and Emergency Management experience, specifically in; identifying and managing business continuity risk effectively§ §Experience in Physical Security and with the Governments Protective Security Requirements§ §Experience implementing and using online H&S systems for monitoring and reporting§ §Demonstrated competence in developing health and safety strategies, plans and policies§ §Demonstrated competence in health and safety risk identification and management§ §Demonstrated ability to identify and implement training requirements across an organisation§ §Good problem solving skills including the ability to think laterally§ §Highly developed communication skills§ §A proven ability to effectively handle competing priorities and tight timeframes§ §Sound judgement, professionalism and integrity§ §How to apply§  §Please contact §julia.holman@epa.govt.nz§ for a copy of the job description§  §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§  §Applications close 5pm 7 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50614921.txt	§Senior Learning & Development Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Learning & Development Advisor§§Advertiser: §Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu –The Correspondence School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Senior Learning & Development Advisor §      §        §        §        §        §      §    §    §      §        §Senior Learning & Development Advisor§        §Permanent§        §Full Time (1.0 FTE) (40 hours)§        §Based in Wellington §        §Tackle a role with variety and challenge.§        §          §Join a passionate, fun team of HR professionals§          §A chance to bring your creativity, passion, ideas & juggling skills and experience§          §An opportunity to grow and develop, this role is suited to a "self-starter"§        §        §Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu (Te Kura) is New Zealand's largest school. With over 12,000 students (from early childhood to young adults) at any point in time and over 23,000 over a school year, most of whom live in New Zealand. As a Big Picture school we provide personalised and authentic learning programmes through distance education from early childhood level to NCEA Level 3, including to young adult and adult learners.§        §Our vision is to enable our students to achieve their educational and personal goals, empowering them to become engaged and contributing members of their communities.§        §With nearly 600 kaimahi (staff) located throughout New Zealand, most are Kaiako (teachers) and approximately 130 are specialist and support kaimahi including managers and an additional 120 learning support kaimahi. §        §The HR team supports our kaimahi and leaders by walking alongside them, providing advice and support. Working on a range of issues and challenges, your advice will span all aspects of Learning and Development. While there are some opportunities to develop your  instructional design (Captivate) skills, the main focus of the role is to collaborate with our leaders and subject matter specialists to identify, then source and implement learning products and programmes, while always looking at learning investment. You will ensure the Learning and Development is user friendly, clear, concise, logical and be a superb influencer. §        §We promise you variety, growth opportunities, great team members who have your back and above all, be in a team that loves cake!§        § §Who are you?§        §          §You value people and kindness, and are passionate about learning and delivering excellent results§          §You believe in the value of strong, positive, trusting teams who work together as one§          §You have proven experience in people development with a track record of designing and delivering learning and education solutions for adult learners§          §You are organised, plan ahead, set priorities, meet deadlines and attend to the details§          §You have an open and fresh approach, inclusive and collaborative style and the desire to provide innovative learning solutions and are willing to give new tools and technology a try§          §You practice "win win" and have superb influence and negotiation skills§          §You build strong relationships and networks with people at all levels to ensure the best outcomes§          §As a resilient person you will keep going, even when there may be bumps along the way and will show composure under pressure§          §Comfortable with developing and delivering training in virtual or face to face sessions, either yourself or by collaborating with internal or external providers§          §Demonstratable ability in using development tools e.g. Adobe Captivate, Desire2Learn (LMS), Salesforce Knowledgebase§          §You have a love of learning and seek out opportunities to learn new skills, new technologies and keep up-to-date with the latest Learning Developments§          §You have a qualification and/or experience in teaching adult learners§          §Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori§        §        §If this sounds like you, and you are looking to join a forward thinking, innovative organisation, apply now!§        §Listen to Mike Hollings [link removed] our Chief Executive, talk about the school and check out our 360 Virtual Tours [link removed].§        §To apply, click the Apply button. If applying from an external site you will be taken through to our Careers Website, where you can view a detailed position description, as well as complete an online application form and attach your CV and cover letter. With over 12,000 students (from early childhood to young adults) at any point in time and over 23,000 over a school year, most of whom live in New Zealand. As a Big Picture school we provide personalised and authentic learning programmes through distance education from early childhood level to NCEA Level 3, including to young adult and adult learners.§Our vision is to enable our students to achieve their educational and personal goals, empowering them to become engaged and contributing members of their communities.§With nearly 600 kaimahi (staff) located throughout New Zealand, most are Kaiako (teachers) and approximately 130 are specialist and support kaimahi including managers and an additional 120 learning support kaimahi. §The HR team supports our kaimahi and leaders by walking alongside them, providing advice and support. Working on a range of issues and challenges, your advice will span all aspects of Learning and Development. While there are some opportunities to develop your  instructional design (Captivate) skills, the main focus of the role is to collaborate with our leaders and subject matter specialists to identify, then source and implement learning products and programmes, while always looking at learning investment. You will ensure the Learning and Development is user friendly, clear, concise, logical and be a superb influencer. §We promise you variety, growth opportunities, great team members who have your back and above all, be in a team that loves cake!§ §Who are you?§§You value people and kindness, and are passionate about learning and delivering excellent results§You believe in the value of strong, positive, trusting teams who work together as one§You have proven experience in people development with a track record of designing and delivering learning and education solutions for adult learners§You are organised, plan ahead, set priorities, meet deadlines and attend to the details§You have an open and fresh approach, inclusive and collaborative style and the desire to provide innovative learning solutions and are willing to give new tools and technology a try§You practice "win win" and have superb influence and negotiation skills§You build strong relationships and networks with people at all levels to ensure the best outcomes§As a resilient person you will keep going, even when there may be bumps along the way and will show composure under pressure§Comfortable with developing and delivering training in virtual or face to face sessions, either yourself or by collaborating with internal or external providers§Demonstratable ability in using development tools e.g. Adobe Captivate, Desire2Learn (LMS), Salesforce Knowledgebase§You have a love of learning and seek out opportunities to learn new skills, new technologies and keep up-to-date with the latest Learning Developments§You have a qualification and/or experience in teaching adult learners§Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori§§If this sounds like you, and you are looking to join a forward thinking, innovative organisation, apply now!§Listen to Mike Hollings [link removed] our Chief Executive, talk about the school and check out our 360 Virtual Tours [link removed].§To jobTitle: Systems & Technology Trainer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50614966.txt	§Systems & Technology Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Systems & Technology Trainer§§Advertiser: §EnviroWaste Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Our employees tell us that they enjoy our 'family-like' team environment and value the company's commitment to growing our teams, technology infrastructure and customer base which all combined make us one of NZ’s leading waste service providers. §As the Company grows, and we’re quickly reaching 1000 employees & our teams progress, we have a need for a §Systems and Technology§ §Trainer§ to join our Corporate Technology team. §This is a true support role, working with all stakeholders where you will be an expert in our systems, processes and technology used nationwide. Success will be§Taking full ownership of the training right from writing & creation of training resources, roll out and delivering it.§Understanding different needs, catering for different learning styles and able to implement training via various platforms i.e. webinar, classroom training, manuals or one-on-one’s §Following up after training and assessing further needs§Ensuring training material is easily accessible and able to be interpreted by all employees§In a multifaceted organisation, some of the systems we use are Microsoft 365 suite, D365 F&S and CRM, Power BI, and a custom created Weighbridge software. §Your experience will show you are§A skilled trainer who can easily break down complex systems and deliver training in a way that users can easily understand §Confident and able to deliver training via various platforms, and capture feedback and cater to differing personalities (whether it is a Manager, Driver or Customer Service Representative) §Competent with learning new systems, but already have working knowledge of Windows 10, Office 365 Suite, SharePoint and some knowledge of D365 is preferred but not essential§Able to create new training material, or develop on existing for best outcomes §Able to utilise Power BI dashboards to report on training carried out, and further needs of the business§If you wish to apply for this position, please click apply now and complete the online application form and submit an updated copy of your CV.  We look forward to receiving your application!§Safety and well-being are paramount to us, so our recruitment process involves a Ministry of Justice criminal background check, and a pre-employment medical including drug test. You must also be eligible to work in NZ (either as a New Zealand Citizen or Resident or have a valid working visa) to apply for this role.§§§§

jobTitle: Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50621030.txt	§Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Reporting to the Chief People and Culture Officer, you will lead proactive safety and security strategies through visible leadership and partnership across the Council, including working closely with our Executive Leadership Team and Elected Members. Alongside your team of dedicated Safety, Security and Wellbeing Team, you will be accountable for the development and delivery of strategies and initiatives that build and maintain a strong and capable Safety, Security and Wellbeing culture across Council. You will be responsible for driving the organisational maturity to support the Council's safety journey through coaching, enabling and assisting people leaders champion health and safety throughout the organisation. Collaborating with the People and Culture Group, you will operationalise the wellbeing strategy which your team and you will co-design with the Culture and Capability Team.§This role requires a forward thinking, delivery-focussed person who is comfortable working in a very complex and high-risk organisation. You will be focussed on uplifting the capability and ownership of our operational leadership teams in ensuring good practice of health, safety, security and wellbeing so that the Council meets and where practicable exceeds its obligations under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 and other related Regulations.§As a senior leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities". Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for?§A relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent skills and experience§Proof of understanding of health and safety and related employment legislation§Demonstrated experience in the management and provision of safety security and wellbeing services and systems to a diverse and complex organisation§A proven track record of achievement in collaboration and integration in a political, or similar environment§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Knowledge and experience with the ACC Partnership Programme§Proven ability to conduct investigations, using ICAM methodology.§Development of performance reporting, measurement and research programmes.§Exceptional written, visual and oral communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present well- crafted detailed analysis and arguments.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including:§He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do§Whakapai ake - We're always improving§Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate§Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§Please see attached job description for more information. All applications must be submitted online.§If you have any questions please contact Aleena Antony, Talent Acquisition Partner at §aleena.antony@wcc.govt.nz§. Applications close §11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50621586.txt	§Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Remuneration & Benefits§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover §      §        §When it comes to retail, competition, technology and shifting economies have changed the way Kiwis shop.§        §For TWG to thrive in this ever-changing environment, we’re going Agile to ensure our customers always come first.  One of the first steps to becoming an agile organisation is rethinking our structure. We’re saying goodbye to silos and traditional business structures to allow room for faster decision-making, improved communication and empowered, cross-functional teams to thrive. By doing this we unlock collaboration, productivity and speed to market so we can adapt quickly to ever-changing customer needs.§        §The Role§        §HR is not an area you might typically associate with advanced analytics, but here at The Warehouse Group we're out to break that mould. Our vision is to build world class advanced analytics around People that will drive actionable insights for our business leaders around recruitment, health & safety, performance management and workforce planning.§        §Your key responsibilities will be:§        §          §To provide expert remuneration consultation & service to the business§          §Managing the remuneration analysis and reporting §          §Helping the HR team with our annual performance and remuneration reviews and incentive scheme management §          §Complete any remuneration projects as required for the business§        §        §About You§        §You are passionate about data. You're the type person who gets excited about different and unique data sets and all the ways that they could be used to provide business insight that is relevant and digestible.§        §You're a story teller, the data is your subject, and you can adjust your story to suit any audience from advanced data geeks like yourself right through to the most analytically challenged. §        §Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lense and approach you bring to work everyday. You are someone responsive, adaptable and has a continuous improvement approach towards what you do. You will have a test and learn mindset and hold an openness to new ideas and a desire to develop them together with others.§        §You're also great at the following:§        §          §A sound understanding of HR legislation in regards to remuneration.§          §Strong SQL & Excel skills§          §Your ability at operating effectively within a large, fast-paced organisation – having a background in retail is beneficial but not essential.§          §Clear, effective written and verbal communication skills.§          §Resilience, and strong stakeholder management skills.§          §A real drive and passion for people and doing the right thing.§          §Have sound judgement and strong values§        §        §What's in it for you? §        §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§When it comes to retail, competition, technology and shifting economies have changed the way Kiwis shop.§  §For TWG to thrive in this ever-changing environment, we’re going Agile to ensure our customers always come first.  One of the first steps to becoming an agile organisation is rethinking our structure. We’re saying goodbye to silos and traditional business structures to allow room for faster decision-making, improved communication and empowered, cross-functional teams to thrive. By doing this we unlock collaboration, productivity and speed to market so we can adapt quickly to ever-changing customer needs.§  §The Role§  §HR is not an area you might typically associate with advanced analytics, but here at The Warehouse Group we're out to break that mould. Our vision is to build world class advanced analytics around People that will drive actionable insights for our business leaders around recruitment, health & safety, performance management and workforce planning.§  §Your key responsibilities will be:§ § §To provide expert remuneration consultation & service to the business§ §Managing the remuneration analysis and reporting § §Helping the HR team with our annual performance and remuneration reviews and incentive scheme management § §Complete any remuneration projects as required for the business§ §About You§  §You are passionate about data. You're the type person who gets excited about different and unique data sets and all the ways that they could be used to provide business insight that is relevant and digestible.§  §You're a story teller, the data is your subject, and you can adjust your story to suit any audience from advanced data geeks like yourself right through to the most analytically challenged. §  §Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lense and approach you bring to work everyday. You are someone responsive, adaptable and has a continuous improvement approach towards what you do. You will have a test and learn mindset and hold an openness to new ideas and a desire to develop them together with others.§  §You're also great at the following:§ § §A sound understanding of HR legislation in regards to remuneration.§ §Strong SQL & Excel skills§ §Your ability at operating effectively within a large, fast-paced organisation – having a background in retail is beneficial but not essential.§ §Clear, effective written and verbal communication skills.§ §Resilience, and strong stakeholder management skills.§ §A real drive and passion for people and doing the right thing.§ §Have sound judgement and strong values§ §What's in it for you? §  §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. As the focus for infrastructure development changes, portability of skills becomes more important and the challenge is to match our capability with the needs of our customers.§        §Talent attraction using bespoke, fit-for-purpose sourcing strategies and talent pipelining including proactively approaching candidates will be the main focus in this newly created role. You will be able to design and implement a comprehensive candidate engagement strategy which enhances the end-to-end lifecycle of talent mobility, and create a vision that engages our internal stakeholders. The role will also provide an end-to-end recruitment service to the business. You will enjoy the fast paced nature of a busy and successful internal recruitment function.§        §We are looking for a high performer who shows initiative and drive.   You might be currently working in an agency looking for a change, or already in house looking for a new challenge.    You will bring not only proven experience, preferably across the infrastructure/construction industries, but also a passion for making a difference, and you will couple this with:§        §          §Demonstrated experience in creating, implementing and executing proactive sourcing and continued development of job specific talent pools, campaigns and strategic workforce planning§          §Attention to detail, ability to multi-task and follow through§          §Proven experience in proactive recruitment cost management via strategic sourcing§          §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a strong focus on customer and candidate experience§          §Experience with social recruitment§          §Experience of partnering within a business to deliver a best in class strategic sourcing solution§          §Positive supportive team player§          §Ability to think about outside the recruitment box§        §        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   § §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573725 to apply. §    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Recruiter to join our team! §Our Infrastructure Projects division is a project led business, which operates across a number of sectors including road and rail, water, power, education, and defence infrastructure. As the focus for infrastructure development changes, portability of skills becomes more important and the challenge is to match our capability with the needs of our customers.§Talent attraction using bespoke, fit-for-purpose sourcing strategies and talent pipelining including proactively approaching candidates will be the main focus in this newly created role. You will be able to design and implement a comprehensive candidate engagement strategy which enhances the end-to-end lifecycle of talent mobility, and create a vision that engages our internal stakeholders. The role will also provide an end-to-end recruitment service to the business. You will enjoy the fast paced nature of a busy and successful internal recruitment function.§We are looking for a high performer who shows initiative and drive.   You might be currently working in an agency looking for a change, or already in house looking for a new challenge.    You will bring not only proven experience, preferably across the infrastructure/construction industries, but also a passion for making a difference, and you will couple this with:§§Demonstrated experience in creating, implementing and executing proactive sourcing and continued development of job specific talent pools, campaigns and strategic workforce planning§Attention to detail, ability to multi-task and follow through§Proven experience in proactive recruitment cost management via strategic sourcing§Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a strong focus on customer and candidate experience§Experience with social recruitment§Experience of partnering within a business to deliver a best in class strategic sourcing solution§Positive supportive team player§Ability to think about outside the recruitment box§§This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   § §§If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573725 to apply. §    §§Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50622767.txt	§Senior & Principal Recruiters§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior & Principal Recruiters§§Advertiser: §Talent Army§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §Senior & Principal Recruiters §    §      §At Talent Army we work with §tech start-ups, agencies and growing companies§ that are §scaling§ and help them find awesome people to help them scale.§We've just turned FIVE and since Talent Army was founded the team has been growing VERY fast. We have offices in Wellington and Auckland and work in Australia and the United States.§Crazily, we are yet to make a single sales call at all and every day we get approached by amazing new clients that keep referring new companies to us. §This means we need Senior & Principal recruiters based in §Wellington§ to help 'US' scale too. §A bit about us. §We tend not to take ourselves too seriously and threw out all our suits and business attire and now 'wear whatever we want!' We are proactive in the way we source people (§LinkedIn, Github, Meetups, Chrome extensions,§ and any tool that helps us reach good tech candidates!) If you don't know how to use these we can teach you. §We're §informal§, §honest,§ and §collaborative§ with clients, candidates, and between our team.  §What we care about the most is to provide excellent 'no bullsh*t service to our clients and help lift the profile of the recruitment industry. §We also operate a 4-day work week and you get paid the 5 days. §On top of all the above; we pay well, pay commission, have a conference budget, and do a lot of cool things as a team. For example: At the end of every month we have §#TalentArmyAFK§ (Talent Army Away from Keyboard) where we get out of the office for the day and do something fun. The last two months we §did axe throwing §and how to make a §barista coffee§ from our machine. §We also have a private island holiday in Fiji booked when Covid allows us. §Our clients §trust§ us as their recruitment team and work §exclusively§ with us. This makes a huge difference and we have clients that give us keys to their office, let us use their email domain and truly treat us as an employee or a partner.  §We like §sharing what we know§, as we like §learning§ new stuff. Be it a new recruitment tool or the last trends in the tech world. We quite like attending §tech and recruitment conferences§ too and can usually be found at most of them. §Last but not least...have a look at §Talent Army website§ to see if you share our vision of how recruitment should be like!§Don't come here if you want a boring easy throw an ad up online and send the 3 best candidates that apply. We tend to operate faster and deal directly with founders and managers. §Do come here if you have the below:§What you will do:§        §          §Build really good§ relationships§ with your clients - you'll be talking directly to start ups founders, and giving them advice as well as candidates! Sometimes we even work onsite to really understand the work they are doing. §          §Source §good developers, digital designers, testers, project managers, development managers, product managers, tech leads and all-round great tech people, both in NZ and worldwide.§          §Keep on learning§ about the IT & Recruitment trends (Meetups and conferences are always welcome).§          §Work §collaboratively§ and §dynamically§ within the team. §          §Be yourself§. No need to dress up (unless you want to!). If you don't know something, just ask. If you know a better way to do things, share it with us. If you don't like beer/wine, just ask for your sugar-free almond milk (but if you do like beer/wine, you'll always find some in the fridge!).§          §Share your knowledge §- we're all about sharing our strengths, and growing as a team. §        § What skills & experience are we looking for? §          §Someone who loves §getting to know their clients§, and is really able to §understand their needs. §          §Sound experience across§ Account Management and sourcing§, be as an agency or internal recruiter. What matters here is that you know how things work so you will be able to manage your time strategically.§          §Experience within the tech industry§. IT has its own rules and requires us to do our homework to be successful. We're often reading blogs and attending tech conferences. §          §Team player§, §proactive§, §passionate§.§        § §I love a good cover letter and so tell me what you can achieve here in 4 days and what you will want to do on your paid day off.§      §      §      §    §    §    §  §§§At Talent Army we work with §tech start-ups, agencies and growing companies§ that are §scaling§ and help them find awesome people to help them scale.§We've just turned FIVE and since Talent Army was founded the team has been growing VERY fast. jobText: TXT/50623514.txt	§People & Capability Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Capability Manager§§Advertiser: §Stepping Stone Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §People & Capability Manager §      §      §    §    §    §      §        §          §Stepping Stone Trust (SST) is a well-established and proven mental health service provider in Canterbury; caring for over 500 tangata whaiora/consumers each week.§          §            §Provide specialist HR advice, support & expertise§            §Develop & implement a people capability strategy§            §Contribute to organisational wellbeing§            §Assist staff to maximise their strengths in delivering quality care§          §          §Are you searching for the next step in your HR career, where you can influence organisational people strategies and empower others to manage their staff successfully?§          §The People & Capability Manager (PCM) reports to the CEO and is a member of the Senior Management Team - this is an active and important role in management level collaborative decision making, driving new and better ways of operating SST's core people processes and contributing to the overall wellbeing and progress of the organisation.§          §The PCM provides specialist HR advice, support, expertise and overall leadership accountability for excellence through people; the PCM will develop and implement the people capability strategy for the organisation. They will oversee the learning and development framework, supporting and enabling our people to excel in quality service delivery. They will create, nurture and engage a high performing workforce, coach managers to be empowered in proactively managing their people effectively and confidently, while ensuring SST's people related policies and procedures are best practice and executed consistently.§          §It is expected the PCM will maintain a high level of professionalism and integrity and display a positive outlook and a team focus. They will oversee the learning and development framework, supporting and enabling our people to excel in quality service delivery. They will create, nurture and engage a high performing workforce, coach managers to be empowered in proactively managing their people effectively and confidently, while ensuring SST's people related policies and procedures are best practice and executed consistently.§ §It is expected the PCM will maintain a high level of professionalism and integrity and display a positive outlook and a team focus. They will possess an enquiring attitude and be articulate with the ability to lead and deliver ongoing business improvements.§ §This role is a fulltime 1.0 FTE position.§ §SST is a faith based organisation - you will need to be comfortable working within the vision, mission and core values of Stepping Stone Trust, these are outlined on our website - www.stepstone.org.nz§ §For more information about this role, contact the CEO, Tim Butcher, on 03-3386390§ §To apply for this job go to: steppingstonetrust.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5221757.§ §Applications close 12 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50624151.txt	§People and Culture Consultant (HR Professional)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Culture Consultant (HR Professional)§§Advertiser: §Strategy Collective§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§People and Culture Consultant (HR Professional)§Do you want to make a difference, and truly empower businesses to create high performing workforces? If so, we have an exciting opportunity to join our People and Culture Team at Strategy Collective! We are a pretty cool bunch of consultants, with great ideas and lots of energy. Our team works hard for our clients by developing effective and meaningful people and culture strategies which actually work.§We are on the hunt for an energetic, experienced and proactive §People and Culture Professional.§ We are looking for someone to fit into our dynamic, and vibrant workplace here at Strategy Collective.§Located in the historic White Hart building in New Plymouth, Strategy Collective is an environment where exceptional people with common aspirations and a commitment to excellence can thrive. Our business takes a collaborative approach to help engage, empower and excite our clients. With capabilities across People and Culture (HR), Brand and Marketing, and Accounting, we integrate client strategies and vision across all business functions.§  §THE ROLE:§  §The People and Culture Consultant will be accountable for providing clients with high-level Human Resource and Organisational Development consultancy services. The role will be responsible for maintaining existing relationships and developing new business contacts which align with the strategic objectives of Strategy Collective.§ § §Provide clients with advice, coaching, and support on all general People and Culture matters.§ §Identify and implement initiatives aimed at improving People and Culture services within our client groups.§ §Collaborate with other People and Culture Consultants to implement projects and initiatives.§ §Develop and provide relevant workshops on topical People and Culture practices to a market of clients.§ §Identify opportunities for business transformation/improvement and creating high-performance business value for the client, and then implement initiatives for organisational change.§ §THE PERSON:§ § §Minimum tertiary qualification in the relevant field of Human Resources, Psychology, Business Management, or Industrial / Organisational Psychology.§ §A minimum of 7 years’ experience in providing generalist advisory on a wide range of complex People and Culture services.§ §Accreditation in leadership development or team diagnostic tools would be beneficial.§ §You will be highly analytical and strategic in your approach.§ §Demonstrated ability to build and develop outstanding relationships with clients, stakeholders, and colleagues.§ §Advanced knowledge of NZ Employment legislation.§ §A proactive approach to People and Culture.§ §Accredited in psychometric assessment (desirable)§ §Strong attention to detail and a confident communicator.§ §Collaborative in style and bursting with enthusiasm.§ §Experience in a consulting environment (preferred, not essential).§ §WORK PERK§When you join our team, you get some pretty cool work perks.§ § §Involvement in exciting projects.§ §Amazing clients to work with.§ §A team that works smart and plays hard.§ §A fun, friendly and positive work environment where you’ll make a bunch of new mates.§ §Your birthday off.§ §If this sounds like a business you want to contribute to and grow your career, then please apply online via our HRIS through the following link (rather than applying through Seek directly):§https://hart.montageonline.co.nz/public/process/new/application/26576§For more information about the role or for a confidential discussion please contact Charlotte McIsaac at Strategy Collective via 021 048 0243 or email charlotte@strategycollective.co.nz§Applications close:§ 22 October 2020. We may begin reviewing applications before this date.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Remuneration and Benefits Lead Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624281.txt	§Remuneration and Benefits Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remuneration and Benefits Lead§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Remuneration & Benefits§§§§§§At Hamilton City Council we are re-shaping the way we work.  Our great river city is buzzing: we are growing fast with our biggest ever capital spend planned, and embracing new initiatives that make a difference to our community. §  §The People, Safety and Wellness team plays an important role in this journey and as a result, we are seeking an experienced Remuneration and Benefits Lead to join our team on fixed-term 12-month contract covering maternity leave.§  §The Role:§  §Reporting to the People, Safety and Wellness Manager and leading a team of three, this role is responsible for the design and implementation of our remuneration, rewards and reporting programs to support key organisational strategies aligned to the Council’s high- performance framework. Other key accountabilities include:§ § §Develop and deliver the remuneration strategy and employee benefits programme.§ §Be a key member on the project team to design and implement a new HRIS system.§ §Lead the reward and recognition programme.§ §Lead and rollout the annual performance review cycle through the HR Business Partners.§ §Oversee position management ensuring data is correct and of high quality, and the integrity of the establishment schedule is maintained.§ §Monitor remuneration trends and review market data to benchmark the Council’s practices and programmes.§ §Manage the job evaluation processes ensuring the integrity of the system.§ §Reporting and metrics which are meaningful to managers, creating dashboards, data integrity and audit reports while providing analysis and commentary§ §Lead the payroll function, reviewing processes and aligning to best-practice methodologies.§ §About you:§  §We are looking for an individual with a high level of professional knowledge and experience in contemporary remuneration and benefit practices, payroll systems, legislation and market practice and be equipped with the skills to re-define the way we work in this space. In addition, proven leadership skills, excellent analytical and data analysis skills along with a positive mindset to drive transformation are key attributes we are looking for.§  §To be successful in this role, you will have five to 10 years’ experience in a similar role in medium to large organisations.§  §About us:§  §Hamilton City Council is committed to being an organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. This is your chance to be part of the team that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§  §The recruiting range for this role starts at $100,000 per annum and can be negotiated for the right candidate in accordance with skills, knowledge and experience.§  §For a copy of the position description, please click § HERE§.§  §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§  §Applications close 11 October 2020.§  §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process (including testing), reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§  §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. §Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50625797.txt	§IT Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§IT Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Comspek International Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §IT Recruitment Consultant §      §        §Comspek International is a Kiwi-owned and operated specialist Telco and IT recruitment consultancy with offices in Auckland and Wellington. Due to our continued success, we are looking to welcome a couple new Recruitment Consultants to our Wellington team. You might have one or two years of experience in specialist ICT recruitment, or have been in B2B Sales or Consulting and are looking to kick off your career in a new industry. Whichever you are, you will be hard working, personable, and resilient and interested in not just building long-term relationships, but also in utilising your excellent influencing, advising, and sales skills.§        § §        §What you will do day to day:§        §You will be working on sourcing for roles from our wide range of clients and finding the best candidates to fill them. Utilising a number of different strategies, you will be calling applicants who mail in, using social media such as LinkedIn and other search techniques to find and engage with top-notch candidates, scouring our very large internal database and cold-calling referrals, and utilising your growing professional network to find appropriate candidates. You will then be expected to meet, submit and coach any successful candidates through the interview and placement process, in a genuine consultative manner. §        § §        §As a Recruiter with Comspek, you will be expected to meet and ideally exceed monthly targets by building relationships from scratch and delivering for our clients to enable mutually beneficial outcomes. §        § §        §What makes us different:§        §Our flexibility§        §Many recruitment agencies bind their resourcers under tight guidelines on which client or job type they can work on, limit them to either contract or permanent roles only, and stop them from working on positions outside of their geographical jurisdiction.§        §Working as a Recruiter for Comspek you will have access to recruit on all jobs, under all Account Managers and clients, both contract and permanent and across any location. This enables you to maximise your network and your potential earnings.§        § §        §Culture of Teamwork§        §We have a stable management team that are still hands-on recruiters and mentors who love to see the team deliver for our amazing clients. We are looking for individuals with Passion, Drive, Discipline, Resilience, Positivity, and Enthusiasm to succeed in a fun and supportive environment. Our culture is one of open communication and full team effort. This opportunity is what you make it, and we give back what you put in.§        § §        §Our commission structure§        §We make it very attractive to work for Comspek. When you fill a position with Comspek you will enjoy a percentage of the billable for a permanent role or an ongoing percentage of the margin for a contract role, on every placement.§        § §        §If you are looking for your next recruitment opportunity or you're a sales professional with a genuine interest in People and Technology, please get in touch!§      §      §      §      §    §  §§§Comspek International is a Kiwi-owned and operated specialist Telco and IT recruitment consultancy with offices in Auckland and Wellington. Due to our continued success, we are looking to welcome a couple new Recruitment Consultants to our Wellington team. You might have one or two years of experience in specialist ICT recruitment, or have been in B2B Sales or Consulting and are looking to kick off your career in a new industry. Whichever you are, you will be hard working, personable, and resilient and interested in not just building long-term relationships, but also in utilising your excellent influencing, advising, and sales skills.§  § §  §What you will do day to day:§  §You will be working on sourcing for roles from our wide range of clients and finding the best candidates to fill them. Utilising a number of different strategies, you will be calling applicants who mail in, using social media such as LinkedIn and other search techniques to find and engage with top-notch candidates, scouring our very large internal database and cold-calling referrals, and utilising your growing professional network to find appropriate candidates. You will then be expected to meet, submit and coach any successful candidates through the interview and placement process, in a genuine consultative manner. §  § §  §As a Recruiter with Comspek, you will be expected to meet and ideally exceed monthly targets by building relationships from scratch and delivering for our clients to enable mutually beneficial outcomes. §  § §  §What makes us different:§  §Our flexibility§  §Many recruitment agencies bind their resourcers under tight guidelines on which client or job type they can work on, limit them to either contract or permanent roles only, and stop them from working on positions outside of their geographical jurisdiction.§  §Working as a Recruiter for Comspek you will have access to recruit on all jobs, under all Account Managers and clients, both contract and permanent and across any location. This enables you to maximise your network and your potential earnings.§  § §  §Culture of Teamwork§  §We have a stable management team that are still hands-on recruiters and mentors who love to see the team deliver for our amazing clients. We are looking for individuals with Passion, Drive, Discipline, Resilience, Positivity, and Enthusiasm to succeed in a fun and supportive environment. Our culture is one of open communication and full team effort. This opportunity is what you make it, and we give back what you put in.§  § §  §Our commission structure§  §We make it very attractive to work for Comspek. jobText: TXT/50628156.txt	§Senior HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §Need Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§Publicly listed company; care at the forefront of what they do! §Varied role with heavy reliance on ER skill set and experience within unionised environments   §Convenient CBD/fringe location; some off street parking; easy access to public transport   §§ §§This vacancy has now been placed.  Should you need any support with a resume review/LinkedIn profile tips, please do make contact.  Thank you for your interest in this opportunity.   §§ §This is a fabulous contract opportunity to showcase your generalist HR skill set.  As the interim senior in the HR team your experience and know-how will be called upon.  Strengths working within a high volume environment, the intricacies of ER/HR regulations and exposure working within a unionised environment will be essential.  My client is in need of an intelligent and assertive professional.  A self-managing self-starter with the ability to work independently will be important as will be your ability to nurture a small team.  We do need a warm consultative style; a passionate HR professional with patience and care.  Highly organised, excellent time management skills with meticulous attention to detail – this is a great role and one you will take a great deal of satisfaction from.  We do need high efficiency, ability to juggle and superior communication skills to all stakeholder relationships.      §  §An organisation whose primary focus and commitment is to support our community in the healthcare sector, your compassion and support will see you become one of the team in no time.  We need your expertise! § §You may be looking to add value and shine on a new platform over short term contract.  You may well be between roles with this contract “playing” to your strengths.  Do not delay and apply today (almost an immediate start).  §   §Call Tara Fisher on 021 940 298 for a confidential chat or click “apply”. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50628744.txt	§Human Resource Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resource Advisor§§Advertiser: §The University of Waikato§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced HR professional to provide trusted advice and operational excellence on people and workforce issues.§You will be a true HR generalist responsible for supporting, coaching and advising people leaders to enable them to make strategic people decisions and manage operational matters. You will provide advice on best-practice solutions related to all HR related matters including recruitment, performance management and employment relations.§To be successful in this role you will have at least five years' experience as a HR generalist, ideally in a medium to large complex organisation. You will have in depth knowledge and experience in employment relations, performance management and change management. You will have acute business acumen and understanding of organisational issues and challenges with an ability to build strong relationships, develop trust and credibility with people leaders and staff. A confident, clear and concise communication style along with experience working alongside Unions is essential.§The University is committed to our Māori and Pacific communities and an understanding of the culture is essential.§This is a challenging opportunity that will enable you to develop your skills and be part of a supportive team committed to providing excellent client service.§If you would like to discuss this opportunity please contact Hanlie du Plessis, Associate Director, Human Resource Management, email: §hanlie.duplessis@waikato.ac.nz§The position will remain open until filled. Vacancy number: 400208§For more information and to apply, visit www.jobs.waikato.ac.nz§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Further more you will have to understand the organisations that are hiring for these skills, identify and engage with key stakeholders to present them with the best talent available to drive revenue.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ In order to succeed you will have an interest in technology and be able to become familiar with concepts quickly through formal and informal learning. You will be savvy on social media and be able to convert relationships from online to face to face. You will have a flexible mind-set and will be able to come up with creative solutions to challenges that the market presents.§ § We are looking for individuals who may have worked in agency recruitment or internal recruitment who have a passion for service delivery and matching the right person to the right job.§ § §What you'll get in return§ In return you will not just have a job but a career. jobText: TXT/50629273.txt	§Regional Human Resource Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Human Resource Manager§§Advertiser: §OCS Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$75,000 - $84,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§OCS Wellington is currently recruiting for a Human Resource Manager to join our team! Located in Ngauranga and over 300 staff in Wellington – OCS is a leading company in the service industry, that prides itself on providing quality services and account management within the Commercial Cleaning Sector.§ §Our services include commercial cleaning, special services, confidential document disposal, facilities services management § §The Opportunity§ §Reporting to the General Manager – Central Region, we are looking to appoint an experienced HR Manager to provide the first line of general Human Resources support for the region. You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining best practice in OCS HR and Health & Safety Policies and Objectives while maintaining a flexible approach to problem-solving, to meet the needs of your internal client base. HR experience particularly in an Operations environment would be advantageous. § §Key Responsibilities§ § §Recruitment and Retention§ §Administration & Documentation§ §Employment Relations§ §Transfer of Undertaking§ §Induction & Training§ §Labour Management§ §Health & Safety§ §Injury Management§ §Participate in special projects required to improve HR/Recruitment Information and strategy from time to time.§ §To carry out any other reasonable and related duties required by the department to ensure the recruitment and customer objectives are met.§ §To undertake any other tasks as may be reasonably required to assist the company in achieving its business objectives§ §About you - Skills and Experience§ § §3 years of HR experience particularly in an operations environment§ §A strong recruitment background with at least 3 years' minimum experience in a similar role§ §Good interpersonal skills & ability to communicate with people of all levels§ §You will have exceptional attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills and be able to build strong relationships at all levels of the business.§ §A team player and the ability to be adaptable and resilient in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment is a necessity. This is a great opportunity for you to play a significant role in providing excellent recruitment solutions and HR support § §You’ll have energy and enthusiasm and be ready to use your initiative and step up.§ §To be considered for the position, candidates will be required to undergo a Ministry of Justice & Police clearance check to verify a clear criminal record, must prove their eligibility to work in New Zealand.§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §Apply Now§ §If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you!§ §Apply by emailing your CV to  Regional HR Manager §Natalia.Whangapirita@ocs.co.nz§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§
