jobTitle: Chief Advisor: Culture and Development Job in Gisborne - SEEK
email: If you are interested in this position please submit your application via the Seek website, or if you would like further information or a full job description please contact Gillian Gibson at gillian@gilliangibson.co.nz
jobText: TXT/50630434.txt	§Chief Advisor: Culture and Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Advisor: Culture and Development§§Advertiser: §Gillian Gibson Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Chief Advisor Culture and Development§ § §Exciting new senior organisational leadership role§ §Values –based organisation ‘People are at the heart of everything we do'§ §Make a positive impact supporting the people of the Tairāwhiti region thrive§ §Mō te tūnga | About the role§  §This is an exciting time for us and to support our strategic plans and the huge programme of work we have to deliver, we are lifting our organisation development capability and creating a new role to lead and implement initiatives that will make a difference to our culture and employee experience.         §  §You will drive thought leadership and build leadership and organisational capability, aligned with our organisational vision and values of Piritahi Tairāwhiti.§  §Your key focus will be to design, develop, and embed cultural initiatives and engagement strategies that shape Council’s culture to ensure we can deliver on business strategy and our cultural aspirations.    You will coach and support others and design and facilitate learning and development activities to strengthen our culture and capability.   §  §Your leadership will help us as a region on our journey of growing and promoting the wellbeing of our community and people. §  §Mōu | About you § § §You will understand culture and behaviour and know how best to develop people and organisational culture to deliver strategic outcomes for the organisation by: transforming the organisation to become more customer focused and efficient; and building a high performance organisation which supports the achievement of organisational strategies.§ §You will be:  § §Highly skilled at relationship building, influencing and coaching people and able to assist an organisation to bring vision to life through practical implementation§ §A pragmatic advisor that our Leaders can trust§ §A strong, direct, open, and honest communicator, someone who builds effective working relationships and credibility with a wide range of people and cultures§ §Innovative, learning oriented, demonstrating passion and energy to take on the challenges of the role and be results and outcome focused.§ § § §You will bring knowledge and experience working with Iwi and/or the ability to converse in Te Reo Maori would be desirable in this role. As a minimum, applicants must have a basic knowledge of working with tangata whenua and have a willingness to learn. § §Mō mātou | About us§  §Gisborne District Council are the proud winners of the 2019 LGNZ Excellence Awards, recognising our work in growing and promoting the well-being of our community and people. §  §As an organisation, our vision is Piritahi Tairāwhiti (making our people proud).  And, as a region, Tairāwhiti has plenty to be proud of with beaches, bush, surf, and lakes on our doorstep, creating the perfect setting for lifestyle, wellbeing, and outdoor adventure. With a variety of cafés, sports clubs, vineyards, entertainment, shops and well-equipped parks, there’s something here for everyone.  What’s more, with all you need at your fingertips, long daily commutes are a thing of the past and the drive to work will barely leave you time to drink your morning coffee.   In addition to a great place to live and work, we offer a flexible approach to work, a supportive and diverse work culture, and relocation support. §  §If you are interested in this position please submit your application via the Seek website, or if you would like further information or a full job description please contact Gillian Gibson at gillian@gilliangibson.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Health & Fitness for Work Partner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630474.txt	§Health & Fitness for Work Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Fitness for Work Partner§§Advertiser: §C3 Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health & Fitness for Work Partner §      §        §C3 Limited is a market leader in New Zealand’s port related product handling, adding value to its clients’ business by providing solutions to their logistics needs.  C3 Limited employ over 1200 staff in 13 locations across New Zealand and is part of the Linx Cargo Care Group.§        §Reporting to the GM Health, Safety, Environment and Risk, this position will work on a daily basis with our operational and HSER teams to improve the workforce’s resilience and overall wellbeing. The role will manage, support, develop and transform C3's health and injury management with proactive return to work practices, including the delivery of accurate and efficient claims management. Ideally this position would be based in one of our larger branches in Tauranga, Auckland or Wellington, however flexibility may apply for the right candidate. The successful applicant will be required to develop and maintain health management processes, systems and strategies to improve individual outcomes for workers injured at work and away from work.§        §This role will contribute to the development and implementation of Health and Wellbeing initiatives across the business and manage Fitness for Work requirements including drug & alcohol management, fatigue management and occupational health exposures. There will also be the opportunity for involvement in broader HSER activities and initiatives, expanding the scope of the role as capacity allows.§        §To succeed in this position you will have sound computer skills and administrative abilities for case management, reporting and data analysis as well as being highly organised and able to work autonomously.§        §To be considered for this position you will require:§        §          §Experience in injury management and/or ACC - ideally working with industry to achieve sustainable return to work outcomes for workers §          §Sound knowledge of and commitment to medical evidence and leading practice in injury management§          §A relevant tertiary qualification preferably in Allied Health is desirable §          §Experience in managing fitness for work components such as drug & alcohol management   §          §Experience and/or skills in implementing scalable systems and processes for a geographically diverse workforce is desirable. §          §Strong written and verbal communication skills§          §Experience and/or skills in interacting with medical and allied health professionals is desirable§          §A collaborative approach to building relationships with our operations and support services§          §Knowledge of relevant legal requirements for case management of ACC/ medically managed injuries§          §Experience/exposure to the ports/logistics/forestry industry would be preferable§        §        §If you want to build your career with a progressive company that offers opportunities to develop and grow then we would like to hear from you. Please submit a recent CV that clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position.§        §Applications close 08 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §Apply online at §www.c3.co.nz/careers§ §  §§§C3 Limited is a market leader in New Zealand’s port related product handling, adding value to its clients’ business by providing solutions to their logistics needs.  C3 Limited employ over 1200 staff in 13 locations across New Zealand and is part of the Linx Cargo Care Group.§Reporting to the GM Health, Safety, Environment and Risk, this position will work on a daily basis with our operational and HSER teams to improve the workforce’s resilience and overall wellbeing. The role will manage, support, develop and transform C3's health and injury management with proactive return to work practices, including the delivery of accurate and efficient claims management. Ideally this position would be based in one of our larger branches in Tauranga, Auckland or Wellington, however flexibility may apply for the right candidate. The successful applicant will be required to develop and maintain health management processes, systems and strategies to improve individual outcomes for workers injured at work and away from work.§This role will contribute to the development and implementation of Health and Wellbeing initiatives across the business and manage Fitness for Work requirements including drug & alcohol management, fatigue management and occupational health exposures. There will also be the opportunity for involvement in broader HSER activities and initiatives, expanding the scope of the role as capacity allows.§To succeed in this position you will have sound computer skills and administrative abilities for case management, reporting and data analysis as well as being highly organised and able to work autonomously.§To be considered for this position you will require:§Experience in injury management and/or ACC - ideally working with industry to achieve sustainable return to work outcomes for workers §Sound knowledge of and commitment to medical evidence and leading practice in injury management§A relevant tertiary qualification preferably in Allied Health is desirable §Experience in managing fitness for work components such as drug & alcohol management   §Experience and/or skills in implementing scalable systems and processes for a geographically diverse workforce is desirable. §Strong written and verbal communication skills§Experience and/or skills in interacting with medical and allied health professionals is desirable§A collaborative approach to building relationships with our operations and support services§Knowledge of relevant legal requirements for case management of ACC/ medically managed injuries§Experience/exposure to the ports/logistics/forestry industry would be preferable§If you want to build your career with a progressive company that offers opportunities to develop and grow then we would like to hear from you. Please submit a recent CV that clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position.§Applications close 08 October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630693.txt	§Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter§§Advertiser: §Northland District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §Northland District Health Board staff have big hearts and a strong commitment to provide high quality health care to our diverse community. Through our work we get to make a real difference, enhance our skills and further our professional development. Working in a friendly, supportive environment and living in the sub-tropical north is an added bonus.§    §      §Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter §      §        §Northland DHB is committed to a system that is Tiriti (Treaty) based and one that actively and purposefully invests in equitable outcomes for its Māori population. §        §Northland DHB recognises Māori as tāngata Whenua (first peoples) of New Zealand and have prioritised Māori health. We understand our Te Tiriti o Waitangi obligations in relation to: §        §          §Stewardship §          §Iwi/Māori health development §          §Equity §          §Mātauranga Māori (Māori knowledge and expertise) §        §        §This role offers the opportunity for someone with a wide range of proven administrative skills to work and support all aspects of our in-house Locum recruitment function within a challenging and stimulating Health Board environment. §Volume recruitment demands two things from a recruitment process: efficiency and consistency. This is a fast paced role requiring exceptional multi-tasking and the ability to meet strict deadlines. The role works closely with Service Managers and Recruitment agencies to successfully secure Locum coverage to meet District Health Board demands. Working within recruitment, you will follow well established systems and methods to generate a smooth recruitment process for both the organisation and candidates. §Applicants need to be extremely process driven, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to apply themselves consistently and methodically to their work. Previous experience in recruitment would be advantageous. §As the successful applicant you will have the following attributes: §        §          §Excellent computer literacy skills. §          §Strong organisational skills, ability to work autonomously as well as a team player.§          §Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written enabling good working relationships. §        §        §If you have the above attributes, this role could be for you. We require an expert in senior level recruitment, who will provide guidance to our diverse range of clients.  §We partner with our clients across the recruitment process from start to finish including:§  §Creating professional job descriptions that include key competencies and skills required§  §Conducting remuneration reviews §  §Advising on relevant advertising platforms§  §Managing all candidate response§  §Providing regular professional reports on recruitment campaign success§  §Headhunting services §  §Creating competency based behavioural interview guides §  §Conducting formal interviews and providing insight to Managers and / or Boards§  §Conducting expert reference and psychometric testing and providing feedback to clients and candidates §  §Advising and creating employment offers and agreements§In addition to providing expert recruitment services the successful applicant will be interested in developing or expanding their generalist HR knowledge and able to advise clients on a range of topics, which may include; employment law, leadership development, performance development and HR policy and procedure. §About you §This role would suit an individual with external consultancy experience who wants to develop their technical HR knowledge. It may also suit an internal HR specialist who would like to move into a business advisory role. §The successful applicant must be proficient and confident at business development and relationship building, however our whole team approach and focus on growing existing client relationships will be a refreshing change of pace for those familiar with competitive sales environments.  §The successful applicant will possess:§  §A proven track record in recruitment – particularly with senior leadership roles.§  §Specialist and/or generalist knowledge in any other HR fields. §  §Previous experience in external consultancy services and/or a desire to drive new business opportunities. §  §A focus on personal professional development, with a willingness to develop your HR expertise. §  §A team-player attitude§What’s in it for you? §At Findex we are committed to our employees. We offer development programs and exciting career progression opportunities, in addition to a thriving social culture that includes monthly activities and events.§We also offer a flexible working model, with state of the art office facilities and meeting rooms, or work from home options for those that prefer flexibility. §The Findex HR and H&S Consultancy team is small and close-knit, with a focus on using our diverse skillsets to complete projects together. We have the added benefit of operating under Findex, a stable and well-resourced global operator. §Applications §Please apply online by uploading your resume and cover letter, alternatively for more information please contact Zachary Pentecost on 027 564 7144.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §HRaHS---Senior-HR-Consultant-PD-Invercargill---August-20.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Under the Executive Director of People, Culture and Technology's care, guidance and sponsorship, the General Manager HR is working towards an integrated, fully functioning Human Resources team including increasing capacity and capability in Organisational Development. Our team purpose: §Enabling our People - to foster a valued, healthy and high performing workforce empowering our people to succeed§, clearly articulates our commitment to developing our organisation.§About the opportunity§You will be an integral part of achieving this, so we are looking for applicants who can demonstrate experience shaping, driving and implementing impactful people-centric organisational development initiatives within complex working environments§As a key contributor you have a wonderful opportunity to make a difference to our approach to Employee Engagement and Experience. You will be working side by side with our newly promoted Organisational Development Manager, our GM HR and wider team using your knowledge and experience across the full spectrum of organisational development practices and processes. This role will play an important part in helping us plan and implement a focussed OD strategy for Southern DHB and there will be many opportunities to explore this growing and rewarding field of HR. Above all, we live by and role model our organisational values of §Kind, Open, Positive§ and §Community§. This role has a district wide focus so the ability to travel is important.§If you think you might complement our team and want to make an impact, apply now!§Why Southern?§Now is a great time to relocate to Southern if you were considering a move! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out §https://southernhealthcareers.nz/§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.§Closing date: Sunday, 11 October 2020.§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess, Recruitment Advisor - Corporate Directorate on §(03) 470 9021§Pre-Employment Occupational Health Assessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§To apply§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: §www.southernhealth.nz§Click here to view the role description§§§§

jobText: TXT/50633796.txt	§Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Partner§§Advertiser: §ACC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§Opportunity to join a team passionate about supporting the business to drive organisational performance, while continuing to improve the employee experience§Diverse portfolio with the ability to work in the business and across the Talent Group§Flexible work environment, including the ability to WFH where it meets team and customer needs§ACC has been improving the lives of New Zealanders since 1974. With ACC, you'll be supporting people in Aotearoa to stay safe by minimising the incidence and impact of injury, as well as helping them recover from injury if an accident does happen. Join us - an organisation that grew out of bold thinking and has an enduring commitment to care for others at work, home and play.§As a Business Partner, you will partner with Enterprise Leaders to embed ACC's Talent strategy, enable organisational performance and drive strategic priorities. You will work directly with the business and across the Talent Group to drive initiatives that will improve the employee experience, increase leadership capability, improve our cultural competence and enable strong organisational performance.§To support one of our key organisational strategies, Whāia Te Tika, we are in the early stages of developing a programme of work for our people to build our Māori Cultural Competence. In the role of Business Partner, one of the areas you will work alongside the business on is implementing and embedding this programme of work, enabling the business to deliver Whāia Te Tika through our people. This is a great opportunity to apply your passion for Te Ao Māori in a role where you can support ACC to improve outcomes for Maōri through our people.§What we are looking for from you to be successful in this role is:§experience providing strategic HR advice at enterprise level within a large and complex organisation§a proven ability to communicate, influence and effectively engage with senior leaders to achieve business outcomes§experience driving change to enable the business to achieve strategic objectives.§As we look to improve our cultural competence as a function, we're looking for people who have a good knowledge of Te Reo and tikanga (or are passionate and keen to learn) to join our team, so we can support ACC to improve outcomes for Māori.§Working at ACC§To support an inclusive workplace, we have:§Employee networks: Pride@AC; Ability@ACC; Women's Network; Cross-Cultural Network; MIND Network§ACC's Māori Strategy, Whāia te Tika§Development opportunities in Te Reo Māori me ngā tikanga§Support Māori by partnering with iwi and other Māori entities.§Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and Approach§Advocates within the disability sector§Applications will run through to Friday, 9 October but please note that if an ideal candidate is found during this time we will move forward with screening and interviewing sooner.§Applications can only be accepted when submitted through our ACC Career Website or through Seek. With over 27,000 small business clients, we are changing the way businesses look at their workplace relations and seek advice. §  §Now, more than ever, New Zealand business owners are in need of support to manage their obligations in a complex and ever-changing environment. Our Advice team is as the core of our service, guiding our clients through this challenging time by providing timely and expert advice.§Your role will be to respond to inbound advice queries via email and telephone, providing accurate and expert advice on disciplinary and performance management matters, dismissals, wage rates, discrimination in the workplace, bullying and harassment, work health and safety queries and many more workplace matters. Your ability to manage clients' expectations through difficult times will be paramount and your organisation and prioritisation skills are a must in the successful delivery of the world-class service that we offer.§  §What are we looking for?§As an Employment Relations Adviser, you’ll be capable of:§ § §Providing workplace relations advice by phone and email§ §Guiding our SME clients to manage their ER matters from strategy to execution§ §Communicating complex information or concepts to clients without using technical jargon§ §Providing timely and practical advice to clients from all industry types§ §Delivering industry-defining service by partnering with clients as a trusted Adviser§ § §The right person will have:§ § §Detailed and up to date knowledge of the national employment relations framework, together with relevant practical experience in providing professional quality advice across all workplace relations matters§ §Experience managing employee matters such as disciplinary action, redundancies and performance management from inception to completion§ §Proven capability in providing timely commercial advice to clients, together with excellent verbal and written communication skills being essential§ §Experience working in an advisory role in an employer association or trade union will be highly regarded§ §Qualifications in law, industrial relations or human resources are preferred§ § §We do we offer in return?§ § §Gain valuable ER knowledge and experience across a multitude of industries§ §Clearly defined career paths. Your career path starts with the Adviser role where you refine the fundamentals of ER, and the ability to provide timely advice to busy business owners.§ §Professional development opportunities to cross skill or specialise in WHS, Wages or our Product team or to work more closely with clients on highly complex and challenging ER issues.§ §Flexible working arrangements, including part-time, working from home, afternoon and evening shifts and even the flexibility to work around personal errands in full-time roles§ §Build your career within a supportive culture with leaders focused on supporting your ongoing professional development and success§ §Exciting, fast paced work environment with a motivated and driven workforce§ §Attractive remuneration to highly experienced ER professionals, immediately available and interested in joining us on a short term contract§ § §Why join Employsure?§  §Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity. We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander origin, and people with disabilities.§The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.§With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.§Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in employee relations?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639048.txt	§Recruitment Administrator | Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Administrator | Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.§Our team§The Talent Acquisition team work together to fill and pipeline Talent across Datacom offices across New Zealand and Australia. Working as a remote team, we have team members across the board with specialisations across different technologies and skill sets. There's never a dull moment in the TA team as we're dedicated to proactively sourcing and seeking out the best talent to deliver our services. §About the Role§With a constant high number of vacancies to fill, we are looking for an enthusiastic administrator to support us on a fixed term basis, initially. You'll be tasked with everything from managing contracts for new employee's - as well as extending current ones, through to being the SME for our various recruitment systems and tools (Workable, X-Ref, Flare, Docu-Sign, HireVue). A document ninja, you'll use your initiative to hunt down the info you need, and make the lives of the TA team as easy as possible. We've embraced the hybrid working future, so this role will give you the option of working from home several days a week and we will even consider someone who would like to work part-time (afternoon's ideally). §This will be a 4 month, fixed-term contract initially.§What you'll do§Take responsibility for ensuring accuracy of all onboarding paperwork.§Manage new contracts and contract extensions§Implement processes to ensure nothing is missed and all relevant parties receive the right info at the right time§Run reports to show status and track Recruitment progress across the board.§Work with our systems/tool providers to manage issues, upgrades and new ways of doing things§Liaise with the wider business and other teams, such as payroll, when necessary. §What you'll bring§We are looking for an upbeat, positive individual who is keen to get stuck into any task. You'll be an excellent communicator, a sharp problem solver and the type of person who takes pride in your work and enjoys going above and beyond to find that perfect solution. §You're detail focused and you enjoy working with people - you've probably got the patience of a saint as you explain processes and train on systems. We use a number of different tools and technologies so it goes without saying you'll be tech savvy with a "learn on the go" attitude.§You don't necessarily need a recruitment background - perhaps you come from the HR side, or even a busy office administrator type of role. Whatever it may be, so long as you're a quick learner and have an interest in how recruitment for a large organisation can be done efficiently, we want to hear from you. §The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50640518.txt	§Recruitment Consultant §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant §§Advertiser: §Alpha Recruitment - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §      § §      §        §Recruitment Consultant §        §          §Alpha Recruitment is New Zealand owned and operated and has been established for more than 30 years. We now have 8 recruitment brands under the Alpha Group umbrella across Auckland and Wellington, and have exciting plans to expand further. Despite our growth Alpha still maintains a family business feel and the team is tight knit. We are proud winners of multiple Seek awards and last year were awarded Employer of the Year and the Supreme Winner Award at the prestigious Newmarket Business Awards. §          §Due to the growth at our Source HR & Recruitment site based in Onehunga we are  looking for our next superstar to join the team! This is a varied role and you will be recruiting for Scientific and Laboratory roles along with White and Blue Collar temps.§          §You will need to have previous Recruitment and Business Development experience ; what’s more important to us is a positive, can do attitude and open to learning, the ability to problem solve and act with urgency, previous experience in a sales environment is beneficial, a team player mentality and the ability to build solid relationships.§          §As a Recruitment Consultant at Source HR your typical day to day duties will include:§          §            §End to end recruitment activities – from gathering the client brief, advertising, shortlisting and presenting candidates, through to negotiating placements and follow up §            §Account management (nurturing your existing client relationships) and new business development (growing your client base)§            §Working collaboratively in a team environment, and always striving to do the ‘right thing’§          §          §If you are looking for your next role in recruitment this could be the ideal opportunity for you to join a supportive environment with a friendly and inclusive culture. Your team mates will help you through your bad days and celebrate your successes. KPIs are realistic and earning potential is high. Or, perhaps you have previous recruitment experience and you’re looking to avoid the treadmill of the big corporate model whilst still having access to the opportunities that come with a growing business. Either way, if the you have the attributes listed above and this sounds like it could be a fit for you we would love to talk to you. Apply today!§        §        §PO Box 99256 Newmarket, Auckland NZ§ Ph: §09 524 2336§ • Fax: §09 524 2794§ Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below. §      §      §    §  §§§Alpha Recruitment is New Zealand owned and operated and has been established for more than 30 years. We now have 8 recruitment brands under the Alpha Group umbrella across Auckland and Wellington, and have exciting plans to expand further. Despite our growth Alpha still maintains a family business feel and the team is tight knit. We are proud winners of multiple Seek awards and last year were awarded Employer of the Year and the Supreme Winner Award at the prestigious Newmarket Business Awards. §Due to the growth at our Source HR & Recruitment site based in Onehunga we are  looking for our next superstar to join the team! This is a varied role and you will be recruiting for Scientific and Laboratory roles along with White and Blue Collar temps.§You will need to have previous Recruitment and Business Development experience ; what’s more important to us is a positive, can do attitude and open to learning, the ability to problem solve and act with urgency, previous experience in a sales environment is beneficial, a team player mentality and the ability to build solid relationships.§As a Recruitment Consultant at Source HR your typical day to day duties will include:§End to end recruitment activities – from gathering the client brief, advertising, shortlisting and presenting candidates, through to negotiating placements and follow up §Account management (nurturing your existing client relationships) and new business development (growing your client base)§Working collaboratively in a team environment, and always striving to do the ‘right thing’§If you are looking for your next role in recruitment this could be the ideal opportunity for you to join a supportive environment with a friendly and inclusive culture. Your team mates will help you through your bad days and celebrate your successes. KPIs are realistic and earning potential is high. Or, perhaps you have previous recruitment experience and you’re looking to avoid the treadmill of the big corporate model whilst still having access to the opportunities that come with a growing business. Either way, if the you have the attributes listed above and this sounds like it could be a fit for you we would love to talk to you. Apply today!§§§§

Safety§§§§§§It is hard to show and say what is great about a business in a job advert but here goes ...§  §Concretec is a leader in the precast industry.  We take on challenging projects that others may not and pride ourselves on the high quality of our work.  Because of this we see many clients return and partner with us time and time again.§  §We also have great people, strong teams and promote mental and physical health & well-being.§  §We are now on the hunt for a§ Health & Safety Advisor§ to join our team here in Pokeno, Waikato.§  §This role will be working primarily ‘on the ground’ in the H&S space, however the successful applicant must be interested in learning about HR & Recruitment as the two roles work closely together.§  §To be considered for this role you will;§ § §Be a committed H&S professional, who will thrive on spending time ‘on the ground’ with our people§ §Have strong knowledge of the HSWA and other applicable legislation and best practice documents and methods§ §Preferably have experience within the construction manufacturing industry§ §Be able to confidently assess various site areas and tasks completed, identifying risks, and working with staff to prevent injuries§ §Actively work with and manage contractor compliance and H&S on-site§ §Manage staff, contractor, and visitor inductions, keeping up to date records and ensuring documentation is up-to-date and compliant with current legislation§ §Have the ability to engage and influence all levels of the business, from our working Directors, to our production staff§ §Complete a whole range of other adhoc duties as required§ §You will be sitting in an open plan office, with a ‘pod’ of people who are able to knuckle down and focus, whilst enjoying a laugh and a bit of banter.§  §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please send through a current CV by clicking the ‘Apply’ button below.  Please note that successful applicants must have the current right to work in NZ, and due to Immigration NZ’s hold on allowing people on temporary visas back in to the country, you must also currently reside in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of jobText: TXT/50641018.txt	§Health and Safety Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Fegan & Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Claymark Group (under new ownership as of 1 October 2020) is New Zealand’s largest manufacturer and exporter of premium pine products. Operating across five sawmilling and remanufacturing sites in the Bay of Plenty region, the Claymark Brand is recognised at the highest levels on the domestic and global markets for it quality and precision focus.§  §With new ownership comes a desire to continue to grow and develop the Claymark brand and reputation with this to be supported through an enhancement of quality people management processes.§  §Primary to this focus is a total dedication to the health, safety and wellbeing of all 450+ employees within the Group. To support this focus Claymark are therefore seeking to strengthen their internal Health and Safety capabilities through the establishment of a new Health and Safety Coordinator role.§  §Reporting directly to the Group Health and Safety Manager, we are seeking expressions of interest for suitably qualified and experienced individuals for the full-time role of §Health and Safety Coordinator – Katikati §  §This role will work closely with the respective Site Managers to ensure full compliance with all legislative and regulatory provisions through planning and managing training, conducting audits, monitoring processes, reviewing and reporting on data, undertaking investigations and actively facilitating site Health and Safety meetings.§  §To be successful in being appointed to this role, the successful candidate will need to demonstrate extensive knowledge and experience in a production / manufacturing industry, a sound knowledge of New Zealand Health and Safety Legislation and Regulations, a dedication to detail oriented solutions and the ability to work effectively within a multicultural work environment. As this role is site based, the appointee will need to be highly organised, self-managing and be able to display high levels of initiative and decision making.§  §Formal qualifications and training in health and safety are desirable.§  §As we are seeking to have the appointee in place as soon as possible, applicants must have a current entitlement to work in New Zealand.§  §If you believe that you have the required skills, experience and abilities to be successful this role please forward a comprehensive CV to: §jobs@fegan.co.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50641103.txt	§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Are you looking for a new opportunity that offers much more than the average Payroll Manager role?§Wellington City Council (WCC) have an opportunity for an experienced Payroll, Remuneration and HRIS Manager to join the team reporting to the Manager HR Services. As a leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities".§The Payroll and HRIS team contribute to this vision by providing accurate and timely payroll services for WCC, Wellington Water and some Council Controlled Organisations including the Zoo, Zealandia and part time staff for Wellington Venues. In addition the team deliver HRIS system development to improve our customer's experience, implement a fit for purpose remuneration and benefits strategy and framework that supports our employee value proposition and develop robust and HR analytics and reporting systems that enable our leaders to make informed people related decisions.§This role requires a customer centric, delivery focussed person who is comfortable working and providing services in a complex and diverse organisation. You will be innovative in your thinking, champion continuous improvement and be flexible in your approach to meet customer needs.§Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for§?§A broad range of experience with HRIS systems, preferably with TechnologyOne§Experience managing and improving HRIS systems and tools to meet both customer needs and legislative requirements.§Experience developing and implementing remuneration and reward strategies, systems and process across multiple employment contract types.§The ability to build robust HR metrics, trend data and analysis for the business to support better decision making.§A high level of Payroll expertise (technical, functional and operational) and experience in managing and improving Payroll processes.§A good working knowledge of the relevant employment legislation that relates to the payroll particularly the Holidays Act.§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment.§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including: He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do Whakapai ake - We're always improving Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§For further information please checkout the position description or contact §Sarah.Kirkland@wcc.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50641638.txt	§Human Resources Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Administrator§§Advertiser: §Higher Ground Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Permanent Part Time Position:§ 3 days a week (24 flexible hours)§  §Location:§ Te Atatu Peninsula, Auckland§  §Reports to:§ Operations Manager§  § §  §Higher Ground§  §Higher Ground Drug Rehabilitation Trust is a not-for-profit organisation that provides quality abstinence-based treatment within a therapeutic community for clients who are severely dependent on alcohol and other drugs.  Our primary focus is an 18-week residential programme that is based on the 12 Step recovery principles.  We aim to support recovery for individuals and whānau and reduce the harm that alcohol and other drug addiction causes in communities and society as a whole. §  § §  §About the role§  §Are you looking for change and wanting to extend your HR knowledge and experience? Are you wanting to apply your proven HR practice, work with a small but supportive team, and have autonomy over your own work? Then look no further.§  §We are seeking an exceptional HR Administrator experienced in all things HR who can assist with the day-to-day operations of the organisation.  This is a varied role that supports all departments of the Trust therefore strong communication and relationship management skills are a must.  Your main duties and responsibilities include: recruitment, induction, employment contracts, variations and offer letters, remuneration calculation, management of all HR related documentation, database management, maintenance and development of policies and procedures, payroll administration, management of performance appraisals and staff training, health and safety administration, and assisting senior management with any staffing issues when they arise.§  § §  §Benefits jobText: TXT/50643218.txt	§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in§The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§About the Role§Reporting to the People & Culture Business Partner, the People & Culture Advisor (PA) will work with the business to provide support and consultation primarily to the broader market / Executive Group team. The PA is also responsible for overseeing/assisting in the day-to-day delivery of People projects, programs, and strategies (communication, on-boarding, integration, talent management etc.).§This is a 12m Fixed-Term role.§What you'll bring§2+ years general HR experience§Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment§Exposure to ER would be highly beneficial§Experience or a good understanding of change management principles§Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment§Flexible with fantastic communication skills and huge amounts of drive§The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"§Solutions focus and comfortable working in an environment which demands strong deliverables§Ability to identify problems and drive appropriate solutions§Strong internal and external customer service focus§Responsibilities§As a People & Culture Advisor you will build trusted advisor relationships across your assigned client groups. You work closely with client business units to apply HR management principles and knowledge to establish rapport, trust, confidence and credibility with management and employees. You will ideally have some experience in change management principles.  The successful candidate will also have a "hands on," "roll up your sleeves" mentality and a strong internal and external customer service focus. There will always be a bias for action, strong work ethic, and a desire to achieve excellent results. You will need the ability to connect and positively interface at all organisational levels, a passion for inventing solutions and process improvement. §Why you want to join us§At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We've maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise' and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Diversity is the foundation on which we have built our world-class organization, unparalleled in delivering distinctive value through the work we do.§ § § §We embrace an inclusive culture where our people trust each other, respect diversity and share ideas freely.§§§§§

We own a host of iconic brands that generations of Kiwis have grown up with and put in their supermarket trolleys every week.  We are a team that believes that anything is possible.  A team that understands our business and focuses on the right things that make the biggest difference and one that considers our end to end value chain when making decisions to optimize our business. We drive change as an opportunity for us to innovate and transform our business and to achieve beyond what we think is possible.§        §About the opportunity:§        §We are seeking an experienced Senior HR Business Partner to support the Sales Leadership Team, based at our Head Office in Auckland.§        §This role partners closely within some of our growing channels to understand challenges and opportunities, and create a road map that delivers end to end solutions that will drive a high performance culture. business, we have an exciting growth strategy which you will be a significant contributor to.§        §Role responsibilities:§        §          §Help drive & lead HR transformation and strategic Acquisition Team to ensure recruitment is aligned to business strategy, capability required, budget, and headcount§          §Complete investigations as required for senior / high risk grievances (complex ER)§        §        §To be successful in this role you will need:§        §          §A growth mindset§          §Optimism, curiosity, energy and resilience§          §Strong internal and experience in working with a Sales leadership team§        §        § What can we offer you?§        §In return for your passion and commitment, we will reward you with a competitive remuneration opportunity to fashion their own home grown career across functions, locations and brands.  Our aim is to be a destination employer in the food industry where we don't just offer jobs - we offer careers.§        §To learn more about this career opportunity or to apply online, please click Apply Online and you will be taken to our careers page.§        §Interested in other opportunities?  To complete analysis, insights, and prioritisation of capability gaps, opportunities, recommendation of interventions, and work with leaders on the execution of this plan as appropriate§Drive a culture of performance and accountability by partnering with the leadership teams on the Performance and Development planning cycle§Work with lead teams to identify talent and assist in creating targeted development plans§Ensure HR initiatives are pragmatic, commercial, and linked to business performance§Work with the Talent Acquisition Team to ensure recruitment is aligned to business strategy, capability required, budget, and headcount§Complete investigations as required for senior / high risk grievances (complex ER)§§To be successful in this role you will need:§§A growth mindset§Optimism, curiosity, energy and resilience§Strong internal and external stakeholder management (essential)§Experience in delivering organisational development and projects to build capability§Track record in influencing and driving a high performance culture§Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical, and organisational skills§Able to display excellent judgement, drive, and initiative§Bachelor's degree in Human resources, Business, or related field (preferred)§5+ years in an HRBP role or similar§Experience in FMCG or related industry (advantageous)§Ideally experience in working with a Sales leadership team§§ What can we offer you?§In return for your passion and commitment, we will reward you with a competitive remuneration package and help you to achieve personal and professional growth and development during your time with us. §With sites spanning across the Australasian region our employees have the opportunity to fashion their own home grown career across functions, locations and brands.  Our aim is to be a destination employer in the food industry where we don't just offer jobs - jobTitle: Health and Safety Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646065.txt	§Health and Safety Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Manager§§Advertiser: §Watties§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Job Description:§  §This senior role reports directly to the Site Manager and is responsible for leading implementation and management of Operational Risk Management (ORM) work streams including Environmental, Health & Safety, Business Continuity, Asset Conservation, Facility Security and Sustainability. As a key member of the site leadership team the incumbent will ensure compliance with corporate and regulatory requirements and drive continuous improvement in all ORM work streams.§  §About the role:§ § §Lead the development and implementation of annual Improvement plans in relation to Environmental Health and Safety, Asset Conservation, Facility Security and Sustainability.§ §Develop site risk management processes and strategic plans.§ §Lead delivery of continuous improvement in risk management performance and manage associated site steering meetings.§ §Lead processes that improve management competence and raise commitment to cultivate a proactive safety culture that encourages ownership, continuous improvement and manufacturing excellence.§ §Proactively ensure that site employees are competent to manage all safety critical activities.§ §Lead dealings with regulatory authorities and insurance companies in all matters relating to EHS.§ §Direct the activities of the site security team and deliver compliance to company standards for facility security.§ §Develop and maintain systems that facilitate the reporting of all EHS KPI’s and relevant score cards.§ §Benchmark the sites performance against other Kraft Heinz sites, identifying areas for improvement and sharing best practices.§ §Attainment and thereafter annual maintenance of certification to ISO 14001 Environmental Standard.§ §Ensure the site is always fully compliant with all regulatory requirements.§ §Support the prevention and management of sickness and injury related absence.§ § §  §About you:§ § §A proven track record of results and continuous improvement in EHS or related roles.§ §Experience in leading significant changes and delivery of strategic objectives within a complex manufacturing environment.§ §Strong people influencing skills including communication, relationship building, motivational and staff development.§ §Think and act like an owner with a “can do” approach accompanied by positive and urgent behaviour.§ §Deliver on what you say you’ll do, always maintaining a high level of integrity.§ §An understanding of New Zealand legal systems, regulatory processes and relevant legislation.§ §Understanding and experience with Safety Management Systems such as ACC Partnership Program.§ §Sound technical knowledge, excellent understanding of EHS metrics and high level of computer literacy.§ §Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.§ §Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role, preferably in a manufacturing environment.§ §If you are passionate about Health and Safety, then this role is an ideal opportunity to demonstrate your abilities within a large manufacturing organization. You will gain fantastic exposure within a business that has a strong global footprint and roadmap for success.§  §Benefits program§  §We empower our people to own their work, and it’s true our employees are our competitive advantage – so we take care of our employees with our ‘Live Well’ benefits program:§ § §Gatherings - End of Year Celebration§ §Wellbeing – annual health checks & flu shots, wellbeing sessions & webinars§ §Parental Leave - 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers§ §We are an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces, promotes and values diversity and inclusion.§  §Bring your appetite for more!§  §As part of the Wattie’s brand, you’ll be working for one of New Zealand’s most loved food and beverage companies, boasting 35 brands and working across 37 categories.  Our offering is unique because Wattie’s is proudly part of the Kraft Heinz Company, so you get to enjoy the perks of a global organisation while working on a local iconic brand.§  §Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand or who are certain they can gain eligibility through immigration processes should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§

       §Applications close: Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§        §Please note: If you currently work for MSD please apply through your MyHR careers portal at work.§        §For any further information You represent clients by marketing their skills to employers with focus on sustainability. You’ll work alongside employers to identify solutions to their current and future labour needs. You’ll work alongside service centre staff to provide quality labour market information and promote employment and training opportunities.§  §About you§  §This role will appeal to a sales-oriented person as you will become the voice of your clients by selling their skills to employers. You enjoy business development and engaging with diverse groups of people and communities. Your natural flair for seeking out labour market trends and insights ensures you proactively anticipate impacts and opportunities. jobText: TXT/50647069.txt	§Human Resource Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resource Advisor§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Taranakipine are leaders in the design and manufacture of value-added wood products. They pride themselves in understanding customers’ needs, manufacturing to industry best practice and servicing customers with quality products. Established over 60 years ago, Taranakipine holds a significant position in both NZ and overseas timber products markets and is committed to growth and development in new opportunities such as their new venture Woodspan PLT Panels. Their culture is open, approachable and supportive with a focus on team, continuous improvement and excellent customer service.§The Opportunity§A re-alignment of roles has created an exciting opportunity for an experienced HR Advisor to support Taranakipine managers to deliver HR and people practices and processes. Reporting through to the Senior Operations Manager, you will spend half your time onsite, working with the teams and actively contributing to a positive and productive culture. Your skills across all key HR operational areas will be critical to this role, as well as your ability to build strong business partnership relationships, have a high level of emotional intelligence and feel comfortable wearing steel cap boots and a high-vis jacket.§This is a permanent full-time position, but there is some flexibility with hours depending on the skills and experience of the successful candidate. §You will be responsible for;§Providing advice on best-practice solutions related to all HR areas including employment relations, performance management and recruitment§Leading, developing and delivering the HR strategy across the business§Working alongside managers to deliver HR programmes and initiatives§Implementing best practice principles for recruitment, on-boarding and induction§Helping identify development opportunities and training across the business§Facilitating the annual performance and remuneration review processes§Responding to employee enquiries on a broad range of HR related matters§Maintaining accurate record keeping, document management and providing reporting of all HR related data§Our Ideal Candidate§You will be proactive, have a positive attitude and won’t hesitate to get things done. You will be personable, supportive and a team player. You must also bring to the role the following;§Relevant tertiary qualification and 5+ years in a similar role, ideally within a manufacturing environment§In-depth knowledge and experience in employment relations, performance management and change management§Demonstrated commercial acumen, a history of strong internal business relationships and a supportive and collaborative style§Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and deliver quality§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§Proven analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail§A high level of resilience and initiative§If you are someone that is passionate about developing and supporting managers to enhance the culture, team capabilities and staff engagement in a future focused business, then this role is for you.§To obtain a copy of the position description, please email the recruitment team at Baker Tilly Staples Rodway on §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. To discuss this role in confidence, contact Recruitment Specialist, Melissa Henwood on §06 757 3155§.§Applications close Friday 16th October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: LMS Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647304.txt	§LMS Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LMS Specialist§§Advertiser: §Blue Sky Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §LMS Specialist §      §This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation. §      §      §    §    §www.blueskyrecruitment.nz §  §§§This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation.§§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647863.txt	§Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §AWF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§About the company:§ AWF is part of AWF Madison Group - New Zealand’s only staffing provider listed on the NZX. Today, we are NZ’s largest staffing provider with a geographic spread almost double our nearest competitor. From Kaitaia to Invercargill, there are up to 3,500 people working through AWF every day. From providing chippies to the country's largest constructors, roller drivers to civil contractors; devanning services, picking and packing for many iconic brands; driving trucks in some of the largest fleets; to processing many of the food items we all eat every day, AWF supply them all.§ § §The Role:§ As a Recruitment Consultant you must be able to understand our clients and candidates needs and requirements in Waihi, surrounding areas including Coromandel, Whangamata, Whitianga and as far North as Maramarua. Your clients’ base will consist of the mining sector and well known national large construction companies. Multi-tasking and switching priorities are a key element of the role along with maintaining and managing our commitment to the H&S of our staff. This is an end to end recruitment role on a desk with established clients that have the potential to offer more to someone that goes the extra mile for them. To cover the large geographical area, extensive travel is an essential component in this role therefore a full NZ drivers licence is pivotal.§ § Day to day you will be:§Build exceptional relationships with both clients and workforce§Provide regular communication with customers and temp employees§Manage daily dispatch procedures and ensure effective service delivery§Ensure temporary employees skills and experience match job requirements§Day to day management of H&S including on site auditing§Ensure daily compliance within proven operating systems§Required to be successful in the role:§At least 2-3 years of proven experience in the customer service industry§Background in the recruitment industry preferred§Account management experience§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Proven administration skills in a fast paced environment§Experience working with the Microsoft suite§The benefits:§ The people in our business are passionate about what they do every day, helping people get into to work and thrive. For your passion and hard work you are rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and bonus along with all the perks of work for a large NZ organisation.§ § §If you are up for the challenge please apply now!§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50648224.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §Oji Fibre Solutions Pulp and Paper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§Exciting opportunity to put your sound HR Generalist experience to work§Showcase your ER/IR skills in a complex manufacturing environment§Kinleith Mill, part of the Tokoroa community for more than 60 years§Oji Fibre Solutions (NZ) Limited is New Zealand's largest pulp & paper manufacturer. Backed by the strength of the Oji Holdings Group, we are a company with heritage, and are committed to delivering quality, innovative products that enhance the competitiveness of our customers. We have an extensive team of people, who work together to produce quality kraft pulp, paper and fibre packaging products from renewable, sustainably harvested forestry and recycled wood fibre. We are proud of our circular economy 'solutions by nature', creating value from natural, renewable and recyclable resources, is key to our ongoing operations, customers, communities and sustainability success.§We have an exciting opportunity for an accomplished §HR Manager §to join the Pulp and Paper HR team. The role is based at our Kinleith Mill, located 8kms South of Tokoroa. If you're looking for a varied role where you will partner and work alongside key Business Units to provide sound, pragmatic and timely HR advice on a wide range of topics, from IR/ER matters to performance and change leadership, work force planning, recruitment and talent management, remuneration and rewards and employee wellbeing, just to name a few - then this is the role for you!§This unique opportunity is your chance to shine by demonstrating and putting into practise your extensive and well-developed HR generalist skill set. To hit the ground running and own this role, you will preferably have a tertiary qualification in Human Resources or similar, supported with demonstrated success in delivering HR leadership in a large complex manufacturing or heavy industry environment, and must be familiar with operating within a unionised environment. You will also have real flexibility about how you deliver HR services.§To be successful, you must demonstrate the following personal attributes:§Highly customer focused with the ability to connect at all levels of the business§Team player who can work both independently and collaboratively§Proven problem solving, influencing, leadership, coaching, training and team building skills§Be held in high regard by your internal and external customers as a trusted advisor§Highly organised, able to manage multiple conflicting demands;§Accomplished written and presentation skills§Driven to deliver results§Strong attention to detail with robust analytical skills§In return for your commitment, the Company offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package, including enhanced superannuation, subsidised medial, life, disability and income protection insurance.§In accordance with company policy, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical examination, drug test and police check. Oji Fibre Solutions will meet these expenses.§Apply online today with your current CV and a cover letter.§https://ojifs.careercentre.net.nz/Job/HR-Manager/Waikato/3989§Applications close on Thursday, 29 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

medium to large size organisation§Strong data sense, eye for details and good multi-tasking ability§Good problem solver with great communication and critical thinking skills§Ability to work independently and/or collaborate well with various stakeholders§Thorough understanding of current HR best practice and legislation§Experience working with HRIS, CHRIS, KRONOS, or similar related full-time, Monday to Friday role§Competitive salary§Enhanced superannuation§Subsidised health insurance, life, disability and income protection insurance§Opportunity for further development and growth in the business§Be part of a dedicated and close-knit team§Employee purchasing benefits programme§In accordance with company policy, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical examination, drug test, criminal history and credit history check. Oji Fibre Solutions will meet these expenses.§So, if this sounds like your next move, apply now with your covering letter and CV. Please follow the link attached to apply on line now:§https://ojifs.careercentre.net.nz/Job/Human-Resources-Analyst/Bay-of-Plenty/3953§Applications close Thursday, 29 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
