We’re also about the future – exploring alternative energy sources that are sustainable, environmentally friendly and deliver New Zealand’s energy needs in a changing world.  We’re exploring all sorts of exciting possibilities that will support NZ’s low carbon energy future.§ §Is health and safety your passion?  Looking for a part-time gig?§ §We're looking for a part-time (20 hours/week) H&S Advisor to join our HSEQ team, based in Bell Block, New Plymouth.  In this newly created role, you'll be part of a team delivering H&S best practice to Firstgas Group's operations and activities.§ §You’ll be joining an experienced team of talented people who work within an atmosphere where autonomy, teamwork and flexibility complements the challenging and interesting work environment. § §You'll be responsible for:§ § §Provide H&S technical advice and support to First Gas Group personnel, franchisees, contractors and other stakeholders§ §Assist with delivery of the First Gas HSEQ Plan, working with the broader HSEQ team. § §Promote the use and continuous development of safety management systems, standards and tools throughout the business. § §Together with the assurance and improvement team, develop and update procedures, policies and guidelines.  § §Develop and embed internal H&S training refreshers. § §Lead Incident Investigations (Taproot or ICAM) and learning teams and provide support on other investigations and associated actions. § §Hazard and Risk Management. § §H&S data monitoring and analysis and reporting. § §Support the development, implementation and management of wellness programmes. § §Arrange and facilitate H&S meetings and associated actions as required. § §Advice and support for Hazardous Substances Management.§ §Do you have?§ § §2+ years' experience with high risk activities § §Comprehension of H&S legislation and associated relevant regulations. § §High level of IT competency§ §Superior communication skills§ §Ability to juggle and prioritise a large workload§ §A focus on results§ §Influencing and leadership skills§ §What we offer:§ §Firstgas Group offers a culture that embraces productivity and integrity, encourages proactive thinking and rewards achievement. On offer is an exciting role within a dynamic company. Grow your career in an environment that places high emphasis on staff development and well being. There is simply so much potential here - for our business and for your career.  So, make great things happen now by applying here today!§§§§

jobTitle: HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649286.txt	§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§Advertiser: §Kono NZ LP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term §    §      §        §Based in Nelson, Wakatū Incorporation is a Māori-family owned organisation with approximately 4,000 shareholders who descend from the traditional Māori land owners of the Nelson, Tasman and Golden Bay regions.§        §A business of land and sea, Wakatū has four parts: Manaaki, people and culture; Whenua, land and water space; Kono, an award-winning food and drinks producer and exporter, and Auora a consumer-focused, health-solutions business.§        §Guided by Te Pae Tawhiti, our long-term intergenerational vision, and deeply held values of rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, whanaungatanga, kaitiakitanga, hihiritanga and pono, Wakatū manages its assets in a way that will build on its legacy for the generations to come. Development, innovation, identity and integrity underpin everything we do. We are passionate about employing our whānau and encourage our Owners to consider if this role could be a good fit for them.§        §We are looking for an HR Advisor to join our team. This is a part time (0.5) role on a 12-month fixed term as maternity cover. This role is responsible for providing high quality advice and assistance to managers and staff in the areas of recruitment, remuneration, performance development and management, training and development, employment relations and industrial relations.§        §It's a varied role, and responsibilities include:§        §          §Workforce planning and recruitment: partnering with key stakeholders to plan and effect recruitment activities for the current and future needs of the business including owner employment initiatives and end to end best practice recruitment and selection including advertising, psychometric and personality testing, reference checking, remuneration advice and related administration.§          §Performance development: responsible for annual performance and development activities across the group, otherwise known as Kōrero Tupu including training of new staff and ensuring all staff have individual development plans.§          §Training and development: providing analysis of skill gaps in the provision of any Group wide initiatives and programmes. This includes identifying issues and making recommendations for programmes such as management and leadership development, health and safety, formal HR processes, recruitment and communication skills§          §Employment Relations: contribute to the development and implementation of employment relations strategy and advise and assists leaders through formal HR processes including, performance improvement, dispute resolution and change management policies and procedures§          §RSE Programme: Provide back up support to the RSE program including; Coordinate Employer recognition and registration with MBIE for RSE status, overseeing Agreement to Recruit (ATR) application, screen workers and conduct selection process and manage visa progressions and applications.§        §        §Our ideal candidate will enjoy interacting with a wide range of people, have fantastic communication skills and be a great team player, along with a commitment to providing excellent customer experience, including proven experience in a generalist or similar relevant human resource role. You will need to be well organised, with sound knowledge of employment legislation. A degree in HR is desirable, but not essential.§        §This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic team. If you are a people person with a passion for HR, then this is the ideal role for you.§        §All successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§        §To apply for this job go to: kononz.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies and enter ref code: 5228342.§        §Applications close: 11 October 2020§      §    §    §    §    §    §  §§§Based in Nelson, Wakatū Incorporation is a Māori-family owned organisation with approximately 4,000 shareholders who descend from the traditional Māori land owners of the Nelson, Tasman and Golden Bay regions.§ §A business of land and sea, Wakatū has four parts: Manaaki, people and culture; Whenua, land and water space; Kono, an award-winning food and drinks producer and exporter, and Auora a consumer-focused, health-solutions business.§ §Guided by Te Pae Tawhiti, our long-term intergenerational vision, and deeply held values of rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, whanaungatanga, kaitiakitanga, hihiritanga and pono, Wakatū manages its assets in a way that will build on its legacy for the generations to come. Development, innovation, identity and integrity underpin everything we do. We are passionate about employing our whānau and encourage our Owners to consider if this role could be a good fit for them.§ §We are looking for an HR Advisor to join our team. This is a part time (0.5) role on a 12-month fixed term as maternity cover. This role is responsible for providing high quality advice and assistance to managers and staff in the areas of recruitment, remuneration, performance development and management, training and development, employment relations and industrial relations.§ §It's a varied role, and responsibilities include:§ § §Workforce planning and recruitment: partnering with key stakeholders to plan and effect recruitment activities for the current and future needs of the business including owner employment initiatives and end to end best practice recruitment and selection including advertising, psychometric and personality testing, reference checking, remuneration advice and related administration.§ §Performance development: responsible for annual performance and development activities across the group, otherwise known as Kōrero Tupu including training of new staff and ensuring all staff have individual development plans.§ §Training and development: providing analysis of skill gaps in the provision of any Group wide initiatives and programmes. This includes identifying issues and making recommendations for programmes such as management and leadership development, health and safety, formal HR processes, recruitment and communication skills§ §Employment Relations: contribute to the development and implementation of employment relations strategy and advise and assists leaders through formal HR processes including, performance improvement, dispute resolution and change management policies and procedures§ §RSE Programme: Provide back up support to the RSE program including; Coordinate Employer recognition and registration with MBIE for RSE status, overseeing Agreement to Recruit (ATR) application, screen workers and conduct selection process and manage visa progressions and applications.§ §Our ideal candidate will enjoy interacting with a wide range of people, have fantastic communication skills and be a great team player, along with a commitment to providing excellent customer experience, including proven experience in a generalist or similar relevant human resource role. You will need to be well organised, with sound knowledge of employment legislation. A degree in HR is desirable, but not essential.§ §This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic team. jobText: TXT/50649844.txt	§HR Change Management Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Change Management Adviser§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Change Management Adviser §      §The Organisation§Since its inception in 2003, Tonga's Public Service Commission has implemented a number of reform initiatives in Human Resources, Policy, and other priority needs across the country. The Office of the Public Service Commission (OPSC) has also held responsibility for all HR management functions and is now in a position delegate this to each Government Ministry.  The Human Resources Delegation Framework is the means by which OPSC will carry out its delegation programme. §The Opportunity§ In this assignment you will work alongside the CEO and Deputy Secretary for Human Resources, as well as Ministry HR managers to ensure a successful transition.  You will assist with the final development of the Delegation Framework, and also provide advice on delegation piloting as well as a review of the pilot programme.§ On a day-to-day basis you will be mentoring and supporting staff with new processes within the Framework, leading training sessions and providing assistance to ministries engaged in the pilot programme. §Why You'll Love it§This is an impelling opportunity to utilise your senior HR skills to transform the entire Tongan public service. In addition to strengthening your existing professional credentials, you will enjoy everything Tonga has to offer- lush, natural landscapes, thriving marine life, and friendly, welcoming locals. § §We are looking for a volunteer with:§        §          §Strong HR Advisory change management experience§          §Experience reviewing, developing and implementing HR frameworks, processes and procedures§          §Experience in staff development including mentoring and delivering training sessions§          §Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation processes§        § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/TON-41254-HR-Change-Management-Adviser.pdf §  § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§ §§ Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. This work will help us determine which skills and experience our volunteers will need once we begin to redeploy people in the Pacific.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Organisation§Since its inception in 2003, Tonga's Public Service Commission has implemented a number of reform initiatives in Human Resources, Policy, and other priority needs across the country. Our people enjoy career development programmes, cross-business advancement opportunities and a range of staff benefits which makes Fletcher an employer of choice §          §          §The opportunities§          §We have two fixed term (12 and 15 month) opportunities available for People and Performance superstars to join our Team.  As a People and Performance professional you will understand the importance of partnering with the business, you will understand business challenges and support your business unit by providing long lasting solutions.§          §          §Our varied workforce means that one day you might be out on site with our Teams getting dirt on your boots, while another will be spent alongside our Senior Leadership team advising and guiding on best practice P&P solutions, with that in mind you will understand how important the delivery of concise and pragmatic advice to all levels within our organisation is critical.  You can expect to be at the forefront of taking ownership of new initiatives and as a culturally a diverse organisation you will enjoy working in this space. §          §          §As a strong P&P generalist, you won’t be afraid of ambiguity, you will be resilient and comfortable with change and it’s a given that you will come in and hit the ground running. jobText: TXT/50653557.txt	§HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi§§Advertiser: §Capital and Coast District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora§        §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§        §Contract: Permanent Full Time§        §About the role§        §Are you looking for an HR role with a difference? Have you thought about working in the Health Sector? If so read further....§        §CCDHB is looking for an HR Advisor to join the People, Culture and Capability Team. It is a demanding, busy, bouncing ball, but a fun & supportive environment.§        §You will be involved with:§        §          §Preparing for MECA / SECA negotiations, and subsequently being the subject matter expert on the implementation of the collective agreements.  This will involve working closely with our payroll team and the unions§          §Interesting IR issues including giving advice on the interpretation of MECA’s / SECA’s / employment legislation§          §HR policy work§          §Working with the Capability Development Team to identify opportunities and ways to share information / experience across the HR teams§          §Some generalist HR work§          §Regular formal and informal meetings with the various health sector unions.  CCDHB values the relationship with our union partners, and these meetings are a key part of that§          §Some aspects of this role may require working with the HR Team at Hutt Valley DHB §          §We have some flexibility to vary the scope of the role depending on the skills which the appointee brings to the job.§        §        §This is very much a role which somebody can make their own, and make their mark on the organisation. You will be well supported by the Managers, as well as having a great HR team around you to help you settle in and get up to speed. §        §This would be a good opportunity for someone who is ready to stretch into an organisation with unique complexities. We are the largest employer in the Wellington region with approximately 6,000 full time, part time, fixed term and casual so for the right person, this role will provide an opportunity for significant growth and experience in a really interesting sector. §        §About our organisation§        §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§        §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§        §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§        §How to apply§        §Applications close 14th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§        §Please note that applications will be considered as they are received. This means that the role may be filled before the closing date, so don’t delay if you wish to apply.§        §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§        §By joining together we will succeed§      §      §      §    §    §capitalhealth.careercentre.net.nz§  §§§Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora§ §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§ §Contract: Permanent Full Time§ §About the role§ §Are you looking for an HR role with a difference? Have you thought about working in the Health Sector? If so read further....§ §CCDHB is looking for an HR Advisor to join the People, Culture and Capability Team. You will be well supported by the Managers, as well as having a great HR team around you to help you settle in and get up to speed. § §This would be a good opportunity for someone who is ready to stretch into an organisation with unique complexities. We are the largest employer in the Wellington region with approximately 6,000 full time, part time, fixed term and casual so for the right person, this role will provide an opportunity for significant growth and experience in a really interesting sector. § §About our organisation§ §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. § §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. § §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§ §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§ §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§ §How to apply§ §Applications close 14th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. As the HR Manager you will provide expert advice and guidance in all HR areas, while working closely with the Managing Director to drive high performance and encourage employee engagement.§  § §The Person§ To be successful, you will need to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§        §          §Proven experience as a Senior HR Advisor or Manager§          §Sound experience managing employment processes§          §Strong knowledge and experience of NZ employment legislation. In return you will receive a competitive remuneration package including specialist health insurance and you will work in a lovely rural environment on the edge of Hamilton city.§  § Applications close 13 October 2020.§  § For confidential enquiries please contact Senga Allen on 027 210 4212.§      §      §      §    §    §everestpeople.co.nz§  §§§At Everest, we are all about people. As the HR Manager you will provide expert advice and guidance in all HR areas, while working closely with the Managing Director to drive high performance and encourage employee engagement.§  § §The Person§ To be successful, you will need to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§ § §Proven experience as a Senior HR Advisor or Manager§ §Sound experience managing employment processes§ §Strong knowledge and experience of NZ employment legislation. As a professional, you will keep up to date with relevant employment law precedent decisions to ensure that the company uses best practice in procedures and processes in dealing with employees.§ §Ability to resolve conflict and work efficiently under pressure and effective problem solving and analytical and project management skills.§ §High attention to detail, with strong communication skills, both written and verbal.§ §A high level of professionalism, with a down to earth approach and sense of humour.§ §Ability to build positive relationships and be flexible in your work style and ready to “muck in” if needed.§ §Commercial acumen and ability to think strategically.§ §A pro-active and independent attitude that will allow you to take responsibility.§ §A willingness to travel to our national locations and support management on HR issues.§ §  § By joining Caroline Eve, you will be instrumental in making a positive contribution to the company's success. In return you will receive a competitive remuneration package including specialist health insurance and you will work in a lovely rural environment on the edge of Hamilton city.§  § Applications close 13 October 2020.§  § For confidential enquiries please contact Senga Allen on 027 210 4212.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources manager?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653788.txt	§Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager  §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager  §§Advertiser: §AWF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Agency§§§§§§We have a great opportunity for an experienced hands on client relationship developer to lead and grow our Palmerston North and Wanganui branches.§ § Our regional branches represent a key part of AWF’s strategy to maintain its position as NZ’s leading provider of labour hire and permanent placement services to key provincial centres throughout the country§ § This Palmerston North based position revolves around growing business in a competitive environment through development and execution of a sound sales plan, delivering first class service to clients and candidates alike, leading and driving a team and operating within the risk management parameters of the company as a whole.§ § Ideally we’d like you to have a good understanding of the local economy, the people and the down to earth patriotic nature we have in this part of the world. And some sound exposure to multiple business sectors including manufacturing, logistics, roading/infrastructure and engineering.§ § The focus is on sales and people - both our clients and candidates and your team§ § You will:§ §  Lead by example, supporting and motivating your small team§ §  Seek out, win and maximise sales within existing customers, but also through growth of our client base§ §  Exceed financial targets§ §  Promote company driven key initiatives with a local flavour§ §  Ensure Health & Safety compliance is maintained - to both company and client standards§ § In this role you will be a critical part of driving the success of the Palmerston North and Wanganui branches. We require a self-motivator with focus and drive, who can juggle conflicting priorities, work smart to meet the demand, keep cool under pressure and provide solutions. We are people finding people for people, and everything that can go wrong sometimes does. You’ll therefore need to be someone with resilience and a ‘never say die’ approach, providing exceptional service to both clients and candidates whilst also working within financial guidelines.§ § Experience running a successful small B2B business or a branch of a national entity will be highly regarded.§ § Interested in learning more? Please click on the apply now button. Or if you’re really serious, pick up the phone and give Fleur Board, General Manager, a call on §0275 773068§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50656724.txt	§COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract)§§Advertiser: §Homecare Medical§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract) §      §      §      §        §Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme and join an agile working environment to provide L&D specialist capability!§        §          §Dynamic environment helping NZers fight COVID§          §Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme in our Grafton Office§          §Join an agile working environment§          §Fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021§        §        §About the role§        §As a COVID-19 L&D Consultant, you will support the COVID-19 programme by designing and delivering company training and development activities in accordance with the COVID-19 Programme, MOH specifications and HCM practices and standards.§        §Duties include the following:§        §          §Providing L&D specialist capability working in one of three cross-disciplinary squads that make up the programme: Systems and Change; COVID Management Systems; Onboarding§          §Bring your design and build skills in customer experience, graphic and multimedia, and learning, to help our people provide crucial support to NZers across the country§        §        §This is a fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021.§        §Qualifications and experience:§        §          §Tertiary qualification in adult learning - desirable§          §Strong customer service and/or patient care focus§          §Experience in the use of Information Technology systems§          §Experience in agile working environments and agile ways of working§          §Graphic design and experience design highly regarded§        §        §Skills and competence:§        §          §L&D consulting to a senior level i.e. comfortable engaging with a broad range of people including senior leaders§          §Design and build of learning solutions across a range of channels: video, live, virtual, digital§          §Note: We do not use eLearning software for our solutions. Exciting stuff!§Reporting directly to the CEO, the role is designed to provide a high-quality HR and H&S resource for Hydraulink New Zealand. You get to drive and deliver everything from recruitment, onboarding and retention, HS&E, performance management, learning and development, ER & IR, organisational change and more. Working closely with your Australian equivalent, you will also have the opportunity to develop and implement cohesive ANZ HR and H&S policies, processes and systems that support the achievement of Group-wide strategic goals.§A 0.5FTE Technical Trainer reports directly to this role plus you have shared access for support from our Executive Assistant.§About the person§You might be an HR Advisor or Business Partner on an upward trajectory in your HR career looking for that next step into a full generalist HR Manager’s function. Alternatively, you could be an experienced HR professional looking for a fresh challenge or someone returning to work following a break.§Your industry background is less important than your ability to balance commercial imperatives with a genuine “We Care” approach to the people within the business and have fun doing it.§This is a busy role supporting a 24/7 breakdown business so you will need to be able to manage a fluctuating workload, with regularly changing priorities, yet still be able to deliver effective operational HR and H&S services to the business.§You will need to have at least three years frontline operational experience, ideally as a HR generalist, and preferably in an industrial or related sector. Key competencies are:§Strategic thinking skills§Influencing and negotiating skills§Strong interpersonal skills go with the territory§Proven leadership and communication skills§Ability to drive projects to completion§The ability to interact across a very wide range of stakeholders.§Experience with the rollout and imbedding of HRIS products such Cornerstone or similar would be a huge advantage.§Last but by no means least, Hydraulink operate in a safety sensitive sector and utilise an external consultancy to support it at a strategic level. You don’t have to be a certified H&S specialist, although it wouldn’t hurt, but you do need to know your way around this business-critical area at an operational level. If not, you will need to be a quick study.§About the company§At Hydraulink we like to keep things moving, it's in our DNA. After all we are a leading multinational hose and fittings brand with a huge network in Australia, New Zealand and Asia Pacific.§And unlike some of our competitors, Hydraulink has also come through the COVID-19 crisis in pretty good shape.§A company which has successfully survived tough economic times before, we are one of the biggest players in our sector. jobText: TXT/50657456.txt	§Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying§§Advertiser: §Rice Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$60,000 - $80,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying §      §      §        §Having come out of the worst of the downturn this well known specialist construction agency is looking to add to their team. Impressively, they managed to keep everyone on board and are now looking to add to their lively and collaborative office with a greenfields opportunity for the right consultant. Planning and Surveying is a busy market and one that is not over saturated by consultants in that space. For consultants who have heard their clients say "they are the 6th recruiter to call today!" this would be a welcome change. With a plethora of work but only two agencies really working in the space it's a highlighted area for growth. The role requires a relationship focused and highly self motivated recruiter to knock on doors and pick up phones in order to get in front of the client base and establish themselves as the number 1 recruiter in the space. Having picked up a number of roles through their own client base the need and demand is immediate but the successful consultant will be expected to then source their own business going forward. §        §        §The benefits are certainly there for the right consultant with a comm structure that will see the successful applicant taking almost HALF of the fee. Most comm structures this lucrative will require a buy in from the consult for marketing or a minor investment, this option provides all the infrastructure, culture and security of a well run agency. Consultants often bounce ideas of one another and splitting deals has become the norm in this collaborative and enjoyable work place. At under 10 consultants and 1 office dog the team have fun at work but have priorities outside of work, they celebrate success away from the usual p*ss up. The ideal candidate will be experienced in agency recruitment, have experience in establishing and growing professional relationships, have a history of proven billings and comfortable with business development. As mentioned, only a few consultants have specific industry experience recruiting in this sector, the client will look at recruitment consultants from within the construction vertical, engineering (civil or structural) or even more outside the box provided they posses the aforementioned attributes. Recruitment agency experience is crucial. Threshold is calculated on base salary so a consultant who has an appreciation for the bigger picture will seize on this opportunity and carve themselves a path in a market that is unhindered by other consultants. §      §      §Scott Burnett§+64 21 293 4913§scott@rice.co.nz§ §    §    §  §§§Having come out of the worst of the downturn this well known specialist construction agency is looking to add to their team. For consultants who have heard their clients say "they are the 6th recruiter to call today!" this would be a welcome change. With a plethora of work but only two agencies really working in the space it's a highlighted area for growth. The role requires a relationship focused and highly self motivated recruiter to knock on doors and pick up phones in order to get in front of the client base and establish themselves as the number 1 recruiter in the space. Having picked up a number of roles through their own client base the need and demand is immediate but the successful consultant will be expected to then source their own business going forward. §§The benefits are certainly there for the right consultant with a comm structure that will see the successful applicant taking almost HALF of the fee. Most comm structures this lucrative will require a buy in from the consult for marketing or a minor investment, this option provides all the infrastructure, culture and security of a well run agency. Consultants often bounce ideas of one another and splitting deals has become the norm in this collaborative and enjoyable work place. At under 10 consultants and 1 office dog the team have fun at work but have priorities outside of work, they celebrate success away from the usual p*ss up. The ideal candidate will be experienced in agency recruitment, have experience in establishing and growing professional relationships, have a history of proven billings and comfortable with business development. jobText: TXT/50659625.txt	§Recruitment Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Manager§§Advertiser: §Ruby Recruit Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Warren and Mahoney is an iconic New Zealand architectural and design practice, renowned for its striking contemporary buildings created by a team focused on design excellence and innovation.  The organisation has evolved into an insight led, multidisciplinary practice which has grown rapidly in recent years and now operates across Asia Pacific with studios in seven Australasian cities, employing around 280 people. §Warren and Mahoney is looking to recruit an experienced, high performing Recruitment Manager to lead its recruitment activities across Australia and NZ, ensuring it continues to hire the most talented people, with diverse skills and experience to achieve its ambitious vision and goals. §Key responsibilities include the development and implementation of an overall sourcing strategy through gaining a sound understanding of the current and future recruitment needs, and industry trends. You will oversee the day to day recruitment activities, be focused on delivering high quality candidate care, develop talent pools for key roles, and manage agency relationships. §To be a success in this role, you will bring demonstrable experience and understanding of best practice recruitment, be a strategic thinker and influencer, have worked on employment branding activities and, most importantly, demonstrate excellent communication skills.  Ideally you will have a minimum of 10 years of relevant recruitment experience, including working in an in-house recruitment function. If you are seeking a vibrant, collaborative and inclusive culture, and a role that truly partners with its stakeholders then this could be the challenge you are looking for.§To apply, please submit your CV and covering letter using the link. (please use link rather than direct applications so we are able to respond accurately and efficiently - thank you!). §Please note our clients are unable to provide sponsorship for this role therefore candidates need to be eligible to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661091.txt	§Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist§§Advertiser: §ezyVet Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Base salary + bonus potential!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§We help vets be vets with our game changing Practice Management software. With customers in over twenty countries and 140+ staff in Auckland, London and Dallas. Our cloud-based software transforms the way our customers run their veterinary business. Join us on a mission to improve our customers lives, careers and businesses through technology.§We've got ambitious plans and we're growing at a fast pace where no two days are the same. If you’re a self-starter, team player and want to be at the heart of building something great then now is your chance to join the team as our Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist. We're moving into our new HQ later this year so we have a brand new space to grow into and we are the team challenged with driving that growth!§Your primary goal is to build and nurture quality candidate talent pools that consistently feed our open and anticipated global vacancies.  As a senior member of the team you'll ensure we consistently acquire high quality talent, offer a compelling employee value proposition and deliver excellent candidate experiences at high velocity. §§The nuts and bolts?§§       Champion ezyVet’s culture and values alongside key stakeholders involved in recruiting talent§       Understand key business drivers and people requirements to acquire top quality talent on a global basis, enabling our teams to scale successfully§       Design, implement and manage a framework of tailored and effective talent sourcing/recruitment tools and processes to support the needs of the business, including:§§Talent Planning & Acquisition/Recruitment§§       Development, promotion and management of the ezyVet employment brand globally§       Talent sourcing and advertising, shortlisting, testing, interviewing and offer management§Drive proactive sourcing strategies using a range of online and offline channels§       Manage digital and other advertising e.g. job sites§       Craft bespoke assessment tools that will effectively evaluate and identify desired candidate competency levels§       Coordinate brand awareness campaigns promoting a compelling employee value proposition§§Retention initiatives/Culture management and development§§       Identify and build on cultural & team building initiatives§       Conduct market surveys, analyse data, and identify areas for improvement in recruitment process, performance and overall EVP§§Analytics and ATS §§       Management and maintenance of applicant tracking system (BreezyHR [link removed]) recommending strategy and continuous improvement§       Provide recruitment metrics and reporting that contribute to tracking recruitment performance and driving data led decisions throughout the business.§In short, we're looking for a talented individual with a proven track record of delivering great hires with a candidate experience to match.§If you are up for the challenge, you will join an amazing kiwi success story, help build a culture that is the envy of the industry and revel in the delight of knowing you are a key part of building something great! §§§§

jobText: TXT/50661850.txt	§Recruitment Facilitator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Facilitator §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Facilitator §      §        §          §Passionate about making a real difference to people's lives?§          §Proven experience in recruitment?§          §Advocate of the trades as a sustainable career choice§          §Full time position - Auckland Central City based   §          §Salary range $91K - $113K depending on experience§        §        § §        §As the Recruitment Facilitator§        §TXT and Skills Hubs have been included as one of a package of initiatives in a government wide initiative called the Construction Skills Action Plan. §        §Construction is a key industry for the delivery of the Government's priorities and currently the construction industry does not have the skilled domestic workforce needed to build at pace and scale.  §        §TXT and Skills Hubs are one response to addressing labour and skills shortages.  By siting themselves close to large scale construction projects or clusters of projects, Hubs seek to    unlock the potential of tapping into a long term stream of employment and career opportunity for communities close to projects, thereby improving inter-generational economic and social wellbeing in those communities.§        §As the Recruitment Facilitator this role plays a key part of the wider TXT and Skills Hub and operates under the Hubs vision and values alongside a variety of key stakeholders.  This role will be a key pillar for a 'one stop shop' service approach for industry in relation to on-site training, promoting the investment in industry training and being a voice for trainee and employer needs. With a focus on individuals who are at various stages of seeking employment, this role is to oversee, facilitate and co-ordinate recruitment activities to ensure workforce development needs are met. There is a clear focus on remaining learner and employer centric in delivery and support including alignment to pastoral care of learners.§        §This also is a fantastic opportunity to truly collaborate with numerous organisations that contribute to a TXT and Skills Hub, all sharing the passion to tap into employment and careers offered by Auckland's major construction developments   and connect and support local jobseekers into those jobs and careers. §        §This role is part of the Sector Workforce Engagement Programme (SWEP) which supports businesses to invest and grow through better ways of accessing reliable, appropriately skilled staff at the right time and place.  The intention of SWEP is for government and industry partners to work together to identify and develop solutions that achieve both business and government objectives.§        § §        §Skills and experience required:§        §We are keen to hear from you if you have:§        §          §Proven recruitment experience§          §A passion for recruitment and getting  people connected to jobs and careers they can thrive in §          §Detailed knowledge and experience in working with a range  of recruitment applications and services§          §Strong relationship management skills; builds and sustains relationships  with job seekers and employers through respect for individuals, open communication and displaying sensitivity towards people§          §Sound writing and verbal communication skills, including well-developed presentation skills§          §Experience working with a wide range of job seeking candidates to support them in to employment k including young people entering the workforce and people looking to change careers paths or  re enter the work force§          §Demonstrates initiative and ownership, taking action before being asked and proactively makes suggestions on how to improve things at work§          §High level of attention to detail with the ability to maintain focus on priorities and work well under pressure§          §Able to embrace change and deal with ambiguity and uncertainty§          §Clean driver's license§          §Good level of IT  literacy and skills§          §Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§        §        § §        §Why work for us?§        §Developing our staff is a key focus for MBIE.  We aim to create a culture where staff are empowered to bring fresh perspectives to issues and to think outside the box.  Being the largest policy shop in NZ, MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments, rotations to other branches and study opportunities.§        § §        §About MBIE:§        §The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§        §Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §        §          §Mahi Tahi - Better Together§          §Maia - Bold and brave§          §Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§          §Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §Email Jo Smith at §joanne.smith@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1470556 if you have any further questions.§        §Applications close at 5pm on Sunday 11th October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Passionate about making a real difference to people's lives?§§Proven experience in recruitment?§§Advocate of the trades as a sustainable career choice§§Full time position - Auckland Central City based   §§Salary range $91K - $113K depending on experience§§ §As the Recruitment Facilitator§TXT and Skills Hubs have been included as one of a package of initiatives in a government wide initiative called the Construction Skills Action Plan. §Construction is a key industry for the delivery of the Government's priorities and currently the construction industry does not have the skilled domestic workforce needed to build at pace and scale.  §TXT and Skills Hubs are one response to addressing labour and skills shortages.  By siting themselves close to large scale construction projects or clusters of projects, Hubs seek to    unlock the potential of tapping into a long term stream of employment and career opportunity for communities close to projects, thereby improving inter-generational economic and social wellbeing in those communities.§As the Recruitment Facilitator this role plays a key part of the wider TXT and Skills Hub and operates under the Hubs vision and values alongside a variety of key stakeholders.  This role will be a key pillar for a 'one stop shop' service approach for industry in relation to on-site training, promoting the investment in industry training and being a voice for trainee and employer needs. With a focus on individuals who are at various stages of seeking employment, this role is to oversee, facilitate and co-ordinate recruitment activities to ensure workforce development needs are met. There is a clear focus on remaining learner and employer centric in delivery and support including alignment to pastoral care of learners.§This also is a fantastic opportunity to truly collaborate with numerous organisations that contribute to a TXT and Skills Hub, all sharing the passion to tap into employment and careers offered by Auckland's major construction developments   and connect and support local jobseekers into those jobs and careers. §This role is part of the Sector Workforce Engagement Programme (SWEP) which supports businesses to invest and grow through better ways of accessing reliable, appropriately skilled staff at the right time and place.  The intention of SWEP is for government and industry partners to work together to identify and develop solutions that achieve both business and government objectives.§ §Skills and experience required:§We are keen to hear from you if you have:§§Proven recruitment experience§A passion for recruitment and getting  people connected to jobs and careers they can thrive in §Detailed knowledge and experience in working with a range  of recruitment applications and services§Strong relationship management skills; builds and sustains relationships  with job seekers and employers through respect for individuals, open communication and displaying sensitivity towards people§Sound writing and verbal communication skills, including well-developed presentation skills§Experience working with a wide range of job seeking candidates to support them in to employment k including young people entering the workforce and people looking to change careers paths or  re enter the work force§Demonstrates initiative and ownership, taking action before being asked and proactively makes suggestions on how to improve things at work§High level of attention to detail with the ability to maintain focus on priorities and work well under pressure§Able to embrace change and deal with ambiguity and uncertainty§Clean driver's license§Good level of IT  literacy and skills§Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§§ §Why work for us?§Developing our staff is a key focus for MBIE.  We aim to create a culture where staff are empowered to bring fresh perspectives to issues and to think outside the box.  Being the largest policy shop in NZ, MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments, rotations to other branches and study opportunities.§ §About MBIE:§The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §§Mahi Tahi - Better Together§Maia - Bold and brave§Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§§ §How to apply:§Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§Email Jo Smith at §joanne.smith@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1470556 if you have any further questions.§Applications close at 5pm on Sunday 11th October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662413.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §Marlborough District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Health and Safety Advisor §      §        §Marlborough District Council is committed to improving the standard of health and safety for our staff, contractors, and clients through effective management systems and processes.§        §We are looking for an experienced Health and Safety Advisor to champion the health and safety of our organisation by providing support, facilitation, and expertise to our people. This role will strive to ensure that Council meets it's statutory obligations and operational requirements in accordance with the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.§        §About the role:§        §This role encompasses advising staff and contractors on all aspects relating to health and safety within an organisation that has multiple, and often complex, areas of operation. It also includes ensuring that our health and safety policies are available, relevant and regularly reviewed.§        §This role is also responsible for promoting well-being to all staff and encouraging/driving initiatives to support this.§        §About you:§        §You will have excellent knowledge of health and safety doctrine and principles, and will be able to demonstrate your expertise in the application of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015. You will be someone that has a keen eye for detail and has the ability to identify potential health and safety risks before they occur.§        §You will have great interpersonal and communications skills, be methodical, and have a passion for the well-being of people. We require someone that has the ability to manage confrontation, or stop dangerous practices, in a firm yet respectful manner.§        §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then please apply.§        §Applications close at 5.00 pm on 14 October 2020.§        §Applications should be made online via § the careers section of Marlborough District Council’s website§ where you will find full information on the vacancy and how to apply.§        §For further information you are welcome to contact Earle Williams (Senior Advisor HR and H&S) on §earle.williams@marlborough.govt.nz§      §      §        § Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§      §    §    §  §§§Marlborough District Council is committed to improving the standard of health and safety for our staff, contractors, and clients through effective management systems and processes.§  §We are looking for an experienced Health and Safety Advisor to champion the health and safety of our organisation by providing support, facilitation, and expertise to our people. This role will strive to ensure that Council meets it's statutory obligations and operational requirements in accordance with the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.§  §About the role:§  §This role encompasses advising staff and contractors on all aspects relating to health and safety within an organisation that has multiple, and often complex, areas of operation. It also includes ensuring that our health and safety policies are available, relevant and regularly reviewed.§  §This role is also responsible for promoting well-being to all staff and encouraging/driving initiatives to support this.§  §About you:§  §You will have excellent knowledge of health and safety doctrine and principles, and will be able to demonstrate your expertise in the application of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015. You will be someone that has a keen eye for detail and has the ability to identify potential health and safety risks before they occur.§  §You will have great interpersonal and communications skills, be methodical, and have a passion for the well-being of people. We require someone that has the ability to manage confrontation, or stop dangerous practices, in a firm yet respectful manner.§  §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then please apply.§  §Applications close at 5.00 pm on 14 October 2020.§  §Applications should be made online via § the careers section of Marlborough District Council’s website§ where you will find full information on the vacancy and how to apply.§  §For further information you are welcome to contact Earle Williams (Senior Advisor HR and H&S) on §earle.williams@marlborough.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50663601.txt	§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§Advertiser: §KiwiRail§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Workforce Planning and Development Lead §        §          §Your role:§          §KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§          §Your skills:§          §To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Your role:§KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§Your skills:§To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

communication skills.§          §Be tenacious, professional and driven to overcome road blocks.§          §Enjoy building relationships and making new connections.§          §Have a full clean and valid New Zealand driver’s licence.§        §        §We offer you§        §          §Coaching.§          §Supportive work environment.§          §Salary range $47,622 to $65,480 per annum (in line with skills and performance expectations).§        §        §How to apply§        §Apply online with your CV and cover letter that outlines your experience and motivation for the role.  Also, you need jobTitle: Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663984.txt	§Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Immigration Concepts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§New Zealand Immigration Concepts was established in Nelson in 1994. Today we are one of New Zealand’s leading immigration consultancies with our head office in Nelson and a branch in Wellington. § §Our team of Licensed Immigration Advisers and Job Search Professionals provide a superior and unique level of immigration assistance to highly skilled migrants from all over the world, assisting them with obtaining the necessary visas and finding employment. § §We are now looking for an additional§ §Job Search Professional/Employment Coach/Candidate Manager§ §who can be a star at helping our clients understand and navigate the New Zealand job market – ultimately leading to their success in finding a role in New Zealand.§ §This is a very pro-active and hands-on role to provide support for our clients throughout their entire job search journey. § §The ideal candidate for this role will need to have: § § §Strong coaching skills, with the ability to build effective working relationships with clients, and to help them develop a strategy that suits their employment needs§ §a solid understanding of the New Zealand job/labour market and the job application process§ §sound CV and cover letter writing and proofing skills, plus knowledge of platforms, such as LinkedIn § §the ability to contribute content for and take part in webinars – teaching an array of job search skills to those currently overseas § §the ability to build rapport quickly and work comfortably with people from varied cultural backgrounds § §a genuine interest in providing an outstanding level of support and encouragement, with the capacity for patience and perseverance§ §highly-organised, with the ability to be a self-starter who can work independently, and as part of a wider team§ §high ethical standards and integrity.§ §The journey of migrating to New Zealand is challenging and can be daunting for our clients at times, as many hurdles have to be taken along the way, particularly in a Covid-19 world. To help our clients navigate these difficult times, you will need to be patient and persistent. § §Our new team member will work closely with our Licensed Immigration Advisers in our Nelson office. § §Please email us your CV and cover letter today and let us know why you think you are our ideal candidate and when you would be able to start working with us. § §We are excited to hear from you!§ §Martina Koennecke, Director§New Zealand Immigration Concepts ltd. §MK@new-zealand-immigration.com§§§§

jobTitle: Work Broker (Taumarunui) Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665476.txt	§Work Broker (Taumarunui)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Work Broker (Taumarunui)§§Advertiser: §Ruapehu Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Salary§§No§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Job Description – Work Broker§  § §About Ruapehu Recruitment§ Ruapehu Recruitment was established in February 2015 as part of the Ruapehu Whānau Transformation plan. Our creation was a response to the need for proactive connection between local workers and local employment opportunities, and the need for targeted training to lift the skill-base of the local population. We initially serviced the Raetihi, Ohakune and Waiouru communities, and now services the entire Ruapehu district. §  § §Our Strategy§ The first four years of our development focused heavily on employment outcomes. To keep serving the needs of our people in innovative and responsive ways, we are now focusing on directly developing the skill base of the district’s talent pool. Additionally, we know that there is an opportunity to grow an outdoor based environmental workforce. This future aim aligns with the iwi aspirations of having our own uri looking after, working within, and protecting, our local taiao/environment. Te Ara ki Te Moungaroa 2020 -2025 provides the overarching strategic guidance to the entire Ngāti Rangi Group.§  § §Staff§ This role requires a proactive individual who has strong networks amongst the Taumarunui businesses and community to support local people into local employment predominantly in the Taumarunui area. This role, from time to time, will be required to work within the southern area of the district, to support the overall operations of the entity. The applicant will be given rein to make the role their own, while growing, maintaining and protecting the credibility and high-trust in the brand and business. They will report to the Business & Recruitment Administrator. The business is also run in close association with the sole shareholder - Ngā Waihua o Paerangi Trust, as a part of the new Ngāti Rangi Group.§  § §Key Aspects of the Role§  § §Purpose§      ·       Provide all in-house administration requirements for the Taumarunui location§ ·       Support recruitment functions, predominantly in Taumarunui area§ ·       Support on-hire client contracts and candidates§ ·       Maintain and use strong communication tools of the business§ ·       Maintain strong relationships within the Taumarunui area§      § §Location §      The role is based at 153 Hakiaha Street, Taumarunui 3920§      § §Responsible to§      Business & Recruitment Administrator§      § §Responsible for§      Nil§      § §Term§      Fixed term- 2022§      § §Relationships Internal§      All Ngāti Rangi Group governors and staff. Strong communication with Ruapehu Recruitment staff.§  §      § §Relationships external §      -          Ngā Waihua o Paerangi Trust, as a part of the new Ngāti Rangi Group.§ -          Ngati Haua Iwi Trust§ -          Iwi§ -          Clients§ -          Local community§ -          Employers§ -          Training Providers§ -          Funders§ -          Other Partners§      § §Qualifications §      Business, Administration, Human Resource or other related area/s§  §      § §Personal Attributes – Essential §      -          §A passion for the development of people:§ An understanding of, and the ability to, effectively operate in a community focused and iwi owned organization, with a natural interest in helping others.§ -          §Efficient Wizard:§ Significant, demonstrated business administration experience with proven ability to develop and maintain admin systems. High attention to detail. Excellent time-management skills and ability to multitask with focus. Outgoing and self-motivated with a strong desire to excel.§ -          §Relationship Builder:§ A strong listener, skilled at building and continuously growing strong and trusted relationships externally and internally.§ -          §Agile:§ Ability to be proactive and reactive, managing multiple priorities and able to eliminate roadblocks and not be deterred by the unexpected or ‘never been attempted before’.§ -          §Tech and Communications star: §Extraordinary and modern communication skills and awareness; both written and verbal communications a strength. Proven ability to utilize technology and IT systems, and a natural ability to easily learn new systems. Exceptionally proficient in Microsoft office suite.  §      § §Personal attributes – desirable §      -          §Ruapehu Pride:§ An affinity for the Ruapehu area and an understanding of the opportunities provided within our socio-economic climate.§ -          §Te Reo: §confidence, ability or strong interest in Te Reo Māori.§ -          §Tikanga:§ Candidate inspired by history and legacies of the diverse populations of the Ruapehu area. An understanding of local tikanga.§      § §  § §Role Specification(s)§      § §  § §Key Accountabilities of Role: §  § §Administration Management               25%§      §Means§      § §  Lead all administration of the Taumarunui office to support delivery of the business strategy and operational targets§ §  Support/complete internal business reporting functions as required§ §  Compile all financial information and documentation to support accurate timely pay runs§ §  Manage all administrative requirements at location to meet contractual obligations, business planning targets§ §  Support co-ordination of training and development courses/opportunities.§      §  Internal reporting produced at agreed frequency§ §  Financial obligations of the business continue to be met§ §  Effective management and co-ordination of location§ §  Positive stakeholder feedback§      § §On-hire contract management         15% §      §Means§      § §  On-hire client requests are scoped and appropriate paperwork generated§ §  Candidate scheduling for on-hire works is completed and well managed§ §  Contractor service/supply agreements current and well managed§ §  Ensures all paperwork is completed and all new hires pre-screening testing and preparation is complete; background checks as required§ §  Support team to ensure accurate completion of external contractual obligations in relation to on-hire management eg. employment placement and confirmation report; monthly summary report’ service withdrawal report§ §  Maintain robust time tracking systems of any on-hire staff§      §  Templates maintained§ §  Candidate reports completed§ §  On-hire contracts monitored and maintained§ §  Collect data§ §  Administration requirements of on-hire thoroughly complete; required screening protocols complete incl. drug tests / background checks§      § §Recruitment and Work Placement          40%§      §Means§      § §  Ensure (temporary and permanent) employees recommended completely satisfy client requirements (ie. Seek candidates, interview, assess, reference check)§ §  Support the building and maintaining of a pool of qualified/talented candidates§ §  Maintain all database records, ensuring integrity.§ §  Conduct follow-up meetings with clients evaluating recruitment plans and implementation§ §  Conduct regular follow-up with candidates including the provision or facilitation of pastoral care as required§ §  Ensure all hiring paperwork is filled out thoroughly and all required screening protocols are completed for all new hires as well as, drug tests and background checks when required by the client§ §  Communicate with clients for job orders, and all candidate matters§      §  Placement of 50 clients per year§ §  Engage in the evaluation system in place to inform improved delivery of recruitment service, including a focus on pastoral care§ §  Collect data and information§ §  Positive stakeholder feedback§      § §Relationship Management         10%§      §Means§      § §  Cultivate relationships with local/central government, iwi, industry and businesses, and any other stakeholders§ §  Work with Te Pae Tata or other entities to establish a pathway of learning and development for locals entering the workforce or pursuing career change/s§ §  Support the development of the growth and training pathways of the business§ §  Build and maintain working relationships with clients and candidate base.§      §  Stakeholder/Client contacts database§ §  JobAdder up to date; local candidate base always available§ §  Collect data§      § §Health & Safety             10%§      §Means§      § Comply with the organisations Health and Safety Management system, including statutory obligations, within the workplace, including but not limited to:§ §  Identification and management of hazards and the associated risk.§ §  Ensure use of appropriate tools, equipment and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to do the job(s) required.§ §  Ensure team members are competent and in a fit state to do the work they are asked to do.§ §  Initiate actions to prevent the occurrence of non-conformities in processes or systems.§ §  Verify and confirm the effective implementation of said solutions.§ §  Promote a positive health and safety culture in the workplace.§ §  Ensure audits are completed§ §   §      §  Compliant with Health & Safety management system audit requirements§      § §Additional Duties§      § Carry out any other duties reasonably requested from time to time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§
