jobText: TXT/50665580.txt	§Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Salary§§$73642 - $90969 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §Safety Advisor §    §      §        §What you will do§This position acts as the main point of contact for the Waiouru Military Camp (WMC) and Training Area relating to Health & Safety matters. You will provide advice and guidance to Commanders, Camp personnel, Unit Safety and Health Coordinators (USHC’s), lodger units, contractors and visitors. The capability is provided to all WMC units and facilities.§What we need§ §We are seeking a person who is passionate about health and safety; someone who is happy to get out into the business and continue to actively promote a health and safety culture. This is a key position where you will be delivering safety measures which requires exceptional communication and the ability to relate confidently to a wide range of people.§ §In terms of prior experience, you will already have a strong foundation in occupational health and safety and you are perhaps now looking to expand on that knowledge and start to broaden your ability, in what is quite a unique environment.§ §Ideally you will bring exposure to a wide range of industrial workplaces which has included:§        §          §Using risk management principles; §          §Auditing, conducting accident/incident investigations and delivering relevant training and presentations; and§          §This experience has also provided you with a thorough knowledge of all relevant occupational health and safety legislation including hazardous chemicals (HSNO). §        §        §You are self-managing and happy to work independently while also valuing the opportunity to be part of a passionate team of professionals.§ §A tertiary post graduate Diploma in Occupational Health and Safety, or equivalent academic qualification is required.  Military related qualifications or experience, understanding of HSNO legislation or Test Certifier, professional certification and/or membership of a recognised professional safety organisation is desirable.§ §Who we are§ §The Waiouru Regional Support Centre (WRSC), on behalf of Regional Support (Army) and HQ Training and Doctrine Command (NZ), is responsible for the command, control and administration of WMC.§WRSC is also charged with maintaining all stakeholder and local district relationships in order to achieve directed outputs.§ §Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing NZ;§          §5 weeks annual leave each year;§          §Variety, challenge and a chance to influence.§        §        § How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to apply online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. jobText: TXT/50665984.txt	§Administrator People & Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator People & Culture§§Advertiser: §NOVA ENERGY LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Todd Corporation – Downstream Division§   § The family owned Todd Corporation is one of New Zealand’s largest and most successful companies. With a family and business history dating back to 1884, the Company has interests in hydrocarbon exploration and production, electricity generation, energy retailing, property development, minerals, healthcare and technology. The Downstream Division of Todd Corporation consists of four entities; Nova Energy, megaTel, Synergise and Todd Generation. We have office locations in Auckland, Wellington, Tauranga, Whakatane, New Plymouth and Christchurch.§ § § § §People & Culture Administrator§ § § § Changes within the People & Culture team have opened up a vacancy for an Administrator. Reporting to the Business Partner, People & Culture, this is a great opportunity for a new graduate to be developed into a generalist. We have some flexibility as to whether this is a full time or part time position depending on your level of previous experience.   § § § § §About the Role§ § §The People & Culture Administrator will work closely with the two Business Partners and Advisor to support the People strategy. Day to day, the role will provide administrative support to the team including managing our on and offboarding, employment letters, pulling reports and supporting the advisor with recruitment.§ § §About You§ § §Ideally you will have a Human Resources Management Degree or related Qualification§ §Excellent computer skills with a high standard of proficiency in Microsoft Office§ §Well-developed verbal and written communication skills§ §Ability to work accurately, with attention to detail§ §Flexibility and willingness to learn§ §Adept at developing and maintaining effective working relationships with personnel and stakeholders§ §Ability to prioritise and manage time effectively and demonstrate a well-organised and systematic approach§ § If you are a team player with a great attitude and passion for people, please apply to be a part of our close-knit high-performance team. Apply directly via the applicable link. For more information you can visit our website at www.novaenergy.co.nz  and follow this link to review the position description https://www.novaenergy.co.nz/position-description  § § Applications close §11 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665996.txt	§Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§EXCELLENT COMMISSION STRUCTURE§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Recruitment Consultant §    §    §      §REAP Recruitment provides a Recruitment Service to the Real Estate and Property Industry. We are currently looking for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to help expand our service offering.  Ideally we are looking for candidates that have the following attributes§        §          §Proven recruitment experience, preferably in a Property Related field§          §Previous Real Estate or Property Management experience §          §Good network or client based §          §Self-motivated & dedicated to the task §        § This role is suitable for an existing and high achieving Consultant ready to take the "next step" in their career or one who requires more flexibility.  The role on offer includes§        §          §Work from home - you choose the place, the days & hours you wish to work §          §Commission Only§          §Dedicated Portfolio - with no restrictions on what you can recruit§          §Full support - we have great systems and process in place§          §Proven Success - we'll show you how to be successful§          §No desk or ongoing costs are payable§        § If you're currently working in Recruitment, then give me a call to compare your current billings and commission against our offering.  We pay a tiered commission structure based on your success and designed to put more money in your pocket.  Based on industry standard salaries and commission structures, if you're a high performing Recruitment Consultant you should easily double your current income.§ § Alternatively, if you don't "tick all the boxes" but believe you have "what it takes" then feel free to make contact to discuss more. § § If you're interested in finding out more then please apply on-line or give Matt Hunter a call on 021 321115.  I look forward to hearing from you soon§      §      §Matt Hunter§021 321115 §    §    §  §§§REAP Recruitment provides a Recruitment Service to the Real Estate and Property Industry. We are currently looking for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to help expand our service offering.  Ideally we are looking for candidates that have the following attributes§ § §Proven recruitment experience, preferably in a Property Related field§ §Previous Real Estate or Property Management experience § §Good network or client based § §Self-motivated & dedicated to the task § § This role is suitable for an existing and high achieving Consultant ready to take the "next step" in their career or one who requires more flexibility.  The role on offer includes§ § §Work from home - you choose the place, the days & hours you wish to work § §Commission Only§ §Dedicated Portfolio - with no restrictions on what you can recruit§ §Full support - we have great systems and process in place§ §Proven Success - we'll show you how to be successful§ §No desk or ongoing costs are payable§ § If you're currently working in Recruitment, then give me a call to compare your current billings and commission against our offering.  We pay a tiered commission structure based on your success and designed to put more money in your pocket.  Based on industry standard salaries and commission structures, if you're a high performing Recruitment Consultant you should easily double your current income.§ § Alternatively, if you don't "tick all the boxes" but believe you have "what it takes" then feel free to make contact to discuss more. § § If you're interested in finding out more then please apply on-line or give Matt Hunter a call on 021 321115.  I look forward to hearing from you soon§§§§

jobTitle: Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50666608.txt	§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki  §12 month maternity leave cover Auckland/Wellington based§This is an exciting opportunity to work across the Recruitment and Professional Development teams and various front line managers to assist, create and implement an attraction and talent strategy to ensure there is a consistent approach to attracting and recruiting graduates and student placements across Oranga Tamariki. If you have experience managing graduate and/or intern recruitment programmes we want to hear from you! This is a unique opportunity for you to contribute to the attraction, selection, retention, and development of talent in the early stages of their career.  §What we need you to do?§Partner with business managers, the Organisational Development team and Professional Development team to embed the Early in Career Talent strategy§Working closely with the Recruitment Manager to, design, implement and manage the recruitment process for graduates and student placements for early in career recruitment§Build strong relationships with tertiary institutions§Support the Recruitment Manager to drive continuous improvement§Improve understanding of recruitment practices and lift the capability of others in the team§Help build the recruitment capability of our hiring managers§What you will bring to the role?§An understanding of end-to-end recruitment and experience managing graduate recruitment programmes in government or the private sector§Ability to work under pressure and a good multitasker§High level of communication skills and a strong customer service ethic§Familiarity with social networks, professional sites and resume databases§Ability to coach and mentor people leaders§Energy and excitement knowing you will be a key member of the team that will evolve the way Oranga Tamariki recruits talent§About us§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children we're on a journey to ensure that all tamariki are in loving whānau and communities. Our vision is that New Zealand values the wellbeing of tamariki above all else. We believe that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can and should flourish.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you want to have a chat to someone first, you are welcome to reach out to §kate.scott@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday, 18 October 2020.§Position description: §https://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/early-in-career-partner-position-description-june-2019.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50666643.txt	§Talent acquisition Graduate Internshi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent acquisition Graduate Internshi§§Advertiser: §Spring Professional Sales and Marketing§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Talent acquisition Graduate Internshi §    §    §    §      §        § §        §Spring Professional is the executive search company inside the Adecco Group. We specialise in mid to senior-level recruitment across Engineering& Manufacturing, Supply Chain & Procurement, Technical Sales & IT. Our purpose is to bring great people to great organisations across New Zealand.§        § §        §Born through the fifty-year experience of The Adecco Group, Spring Professional supports businesses in the search and selection of professionals. ​The recent years has led our team of over 1500 consultants in 22 countries, to work closely to guide, manage and successfully bring professionals and organizations together.§        § §        §The experts at Spring Professional are close to the market and fully empathise with the needs of our clients. We proactively face changes in the labour market head-on and maintain our network of qualified professionals. This also keeps us close to our candidates. Finding the perfect talent requires close consultation.§        § §        §What you will learn to do with us : §        § §        §          §In this busy and fast-paced position, you will establish yourself as an essential asset within the Spring team. You will be responsible for the sourcing and management of candidate relationships, continually growing your networks to find the best talents possible for our clients.§          §You will focus on high-level recruitment, searching and assessing senior candidates for manager and director roles.§          §The tools you will learn to use to source candidates are our candidate database, Seek, LinkedIn, and other social media campaigns technologies.§          §Once you receive the job brief from the consultant you team-up with, you will write the advert, publish it according to the go-to-market strategy, proactively headhunt candidates, screening CVs, and process with the phone interviews. The consultant will then support you for the face to face interviews, and all the process with the client, until the hiring.§        §        § §        §The successful applicant will display:§        § §        §          §Willingness to build the foundation of his/her career in the HR / Recruitment industry, with the world's leading provider of temporary staffing, permanent placement, career transition and talent development§          §Consideration, as much as we do, quality, service excellence and long-term relationships with candidates and clients.§          §Self-confidence to target and convince talents, and then create an exclusive and rewarding partnership.§          §Enthusiasm to participate actively in the new team organisation and to the development of a champion's mindset.§        §        § §        §At Spring Professional, we strive to create an outstanding working environment and career experience for our team.§        § §        §What do we offer?§        §          §Second to none L&D opportunities§          §Flexibility of working hours§          §'Great Place to Work' certified environment§          §A global company with ongoing benefits§          §Opportunity to transform that non-paid voluntary contract to a permanent role inside the Adecco Group, in NZ§        §        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §springprofessional.co.nz§  §§§ §Spring Professional is the executive search company inside the Adecco Group. We specialise in mid to senior-level recruitment across Engineering& Manufacturing, Supply Chain & Procurement, Technical Sales & IT. Our purpose is to bring great people to great organisations across New Zealand.§ §Born through the fifty-year experience of The Adecco Group, Spring Professional supports businesses in the search and selection of professionals. ​The recent years has led our team of over 1500 consultants in 22 countries, to work closely to guide, manage and successfully bring professionals and organizations together.§ §The experts at Spring Professional are close to the market and fully empathise with the needs of our clients. We proactively face changes in the labour market head-on and maintain our network of qualified professionals. This also keeps us close to our candidates. Finding the perfect talent requires close consultation.§ §What you will learn to do with us : § §In this busy and fast-paced position, you will establish yourself as an essential asset within the Spring team. You will be responsible for the sourcing and management of candidate relationships, continually growing your networks to find the best talents possible for our clients.§You will focus on high-level recruitment, searching and assessing senior candidates for manager and director roles.§The tools you will learn to use to source candidates are our candidate database, Seek, LinkedIn, and other social media campaigns technologies.§Once you receive the job brief from the consultant you team-up with, you will write the advert, publish it according to the go-to-market strategy, proactively headhunt candidates, screening CVs, and process with the phone interviews. The consultant will then support you for the face to face interviews, and all the process with the client, until the hiring.§ §The successful applicant will display:§ §Willingness to build the foundation of his/her career in the HR / Recruitment industry, with the world's leading provider of temporary staffing, permanent placement, career transition and talent development§Consideration, as much as we do, quality, service excellence and long-term relationships with candidates and clients.§Self-confidence to target and convince talents, and then create an exclusive and rewarding partnership.§Enthusiasm to participate actively in the new team organisation and to the development of a champion's mindset.§ §At Spring Professional, we strive to create an outstanding working environment and career experience for our team.§ §What do we offer?§Second to none L&D opportunities§Flexibility of working hours§'Great Place to Work' certified environment§A global company with ongoing benefits§Opportunity to transform that non-paid voluntary contract to a permanent role inside the Adecco Group, in NZ§ § § §§§§

jobTitle: Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666896.txt	§Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term§§Advertiser: §NZ Nurses Organisation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term §      §        §New Zealand Nurses Organisation (NZNO) is the lead professional nursing organisation and union for nurses. NZNO represents more than 50,000 nurses, midwives, students, kaimahi hauora and health workers of which 3,600 are Māori members in Aotearoa/New Zealand. We represent the interests of nurses on professional and employment related matters. NZNO is a progressive organisation which works to improve the health status of all people of Aotearoa/New Zealand through participation in health and social policy development.§        §NZNO now seeks applications for the role of Organiser (0.8 FTE - 32 hours per week), fixed term to cover the work of a person who has been seconded to do other work until 31 March 2021. Based in our Hamilton office, this role is responsible for providing employment advocacy and industrial support to NZNO members.§        §The successful candidate will:§        §          §have a sound understanding of industrial and employment matters, good negotiation and interpersonal skills and a commitment to and affinity with the trade union movement or community activism.§          §be informed on the significance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi for NZNO and the health of New Zealanders.§          §have well developed communication skills (written and verbal) and have the ability to build rapport and problem solve.§          §understand the importance of building membership, organising NZNO members and developing delegates.§          §ideally have first-hand knowledge of the health sector and/or previous trade union organising experience.§          §have flexibility around the hours of work as some travel will be required.§          §have good IT skills.§          §work well as part of a team.§          §hold a full, clean drivers licence.§        §        §This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic and politically aware person to join a dynamic, high performing team.§        §Applications addressed in confidence to Glenda Alexander, Manager Industrial Services close at 12 midday on Wednesday 14 October 2020 and must include §both§ a cover letter and a current curriculum vitae. Please submit your application by email to the address below. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place the week 19 - 22 October 2020.§        §You will find a position description at https://tinyurl.com/y9q95y4z.§        § §        §Please send your application to §nina.pennycuick@nzno.org.nz§ (noting that receipt will not be acknowledged until 13th October).§      §      §      §    §    §www.nzno.org.nz§  §§§New Zealand Nurses Organisation (NZNO) is the lead professional nursing organisation and union for nurses. NZNO represents more than 50,000 nurses, midwives, students, kaimahi hauora and health workers of which 3,600 are Māori members in Aotearoa/New Zealand. We represent the interests of nurses on professional and employment related matters. NZNO is a progressive organisation which works to improve the health status of all people of Aotearoa/New Zealand through participation in health and social policy development.§ §NZNO now seeks applications for the role of Organiser (0.8 FTE - 32 hours per week), fixed term to cover the work of a person who has been seconded to do other work until 31 March 2021. Based in our Hamilton office, this role is responsible for providing employment advocacy and industrial support to NZNO members.§ §The successful candidate will:§ § §have a sound understanding of industrial and employment matters, good negotiation and interpersonal skills and a commitment to and affinity with the trade union movement or community activism.§ §be informed on the significance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi for NZNO and the health of New Zealanders.§ §have well developed communication skills (written and verbal) and have the ability to build rapport and problem solve.§ §understand the importance of building membership, organising NZNO members and developing delegates.§ §ideally have first-hand knowledge of the health sector and/or previous trade union organising experience.§ §have flexibility around the hours of work as some travel will be required.§ §have good IT skills.§ §work well as part of a team.§ §hold a full, clean drivers licence.§ §This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic and politically aware person to join a dynamic, high performing team.§ §Applications addressed in confidence to Glenda Alexander, Manager Industrial Services close at 12 midday on Wednesday 14 October 2020 and must include §both§ a cover letter and a current curriculum vitae. Please submit your application by email to the address below. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place the week 19 - 22 October 2020.§ §You will find a position description at https://tinyurl.com/y9q95y4z.§ § § §Please send your application to §nina.pennycuick@nzno.org.nz§ (noting that receipt will not be acknowledged until 13th October).§§§§

You will also be adept at managing recruitment systems and reporting. §The culture is highly collaborative, fast-paced and rapidly evolving. jobText: TXT/50668636.txt	§HR and Training Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR and Training Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Beaurepaires§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The opportunity § §Looking for a career choice and not just a job? Beaurepaires is a tyre retailer with 55 stores Nationwide and a Head Office located in Hamilton. We have a rare opportunity for someone to join our human resources department in a fun and supportive environment.§ §The role§ §This is a mid-level role that works closely with the Human Resource Manager to fundamentally support the business to optimise their people capability and overall performance.§ §You’ll be involved in a diverse range of human resource administration and coordination duties, while also supporting the generation of training material and maintaining LMS systems.§ §Day to day activities include:§ § §End to end recruitment for Head Office and supporting recruitment of 55 nationwide stores;§ §Preparation of variations and employment agreements;§ §Coordination of onboarding and induction processes;§ §Supporting the VISA application process;§ §Creating training material, maintaining the LMS system, and track progress completion by generating reports;§ §Review policies and procedures in line with current legislation and work with the HR Manager to update;§ §Assist with employment relations meetings when required;§ §Organise regular Store Manager training sessions and assist with the organisation of the annual conference;§ §Organise staff functions and monthly incentives;§ §Managing employee data and general HR administration;§ §Assisting with ad-hoc queries from employees and managers.§ §What we’re looking for§ §To be successful in this position, you will be able to demonstrate high attention to detail and accuracy. This is a deadline driven environment, so time management and ability to multitask is essential. As standard within the Human Resources industry, you must be able to uphold confidentiality and manage sensitive information.§ §The ideal candidate will have a tertiary degree in Human Resources, and a minimum of 1 years’ experience within an HR environment.§ §If working with people is a passion of yours – we’d love to hear from you – apply today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50670091.txt	§People & CultureOps Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & CultureOps Lead§§Advertiser: §Roam§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People & CultureOps Lead §      §About Roam§Roam builds exceptional digital businesses and products for clients around the globe. Started in 2013 we now have studios in Auckland and Sydney with more on the way. We craft experiences for companies like Google, EBay, Giant, ASB, Spark, Westpac, The Warehouse Group, Mercury and many more, including startups in Silicon Valley and the UK. § The core mission of our People & CultureOps Lead is to build the support functions needed to enable Roam to scale successfully. From recruiting and onboarding, to ongoing training, culture-building, and human resources. This role will partner closely with the VP of Operations and Roam leadership team to develop and implement our Culture Ops strategy initiatives. §   §   § §Your core responsibilities will include:§        §          §            §Establish a trusted People & CultureOps function that serves as an advisor and partner to leaders throughout the organisation, and build a team that can support our rapid growth with the expertise and empathy needed throughout hyper-growth. §            §Make our vision around what it means to work at Roam happen across all our employee touch-points and rally the team around that vision.§            §Build and implement programs across recruiting, onboarding, ongoing training, feedback and culture-building to reinforce our values and vision at Roam.§            §Collect business and people data through user research, design thinking and customer experience methods to inform initiatives and decisions. §            §Manage human resources needs across the organisation, including payroll and benefits, in partnership with Finance and Operations team.§            §Managing the People & Culture Ops team§          §        §   § §Skills and experience§        §          §            §8+ years of experience in People or Customer Experience Leadership roles §            §Consulting, design thinking, software development and/or CX experience is a plus§            §Experience working in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment, with the ability to lead and adapt in a changing business environment§            §Experience recruiting and managing people, including diverse teams (different locations, employees/contractors/agencies/ levels of experience, etc.)§            §Exceptional communication & collaboration skills, particularly with people who have different skill sets and are from different areas of the business§          §        §   § §Who you are§        §          §            §You live and breathe the qualities of an Exceptional Roamer - you’re curious, passionate, honest, humble, empathetic and pursue excellence everyday§            §You’re pragmatic, logical, measured and can solve any problem that gets thrown at you in a way that gets others excited to help§            §You are a strong, positive, optimistic leader with a resilient attitude, and have experience making things happen in fast growing companies§            §Continuous optimiser - This role will partner closely with the VP of Operations and Roam leadership team to develop and implement our Culture Ops strategy initiatives. §   §   § §Your core responsibilities will include:§ § § §Establish a trusted People & CultureOps function that serves as an advisor and partner to leaders throughout the organisation, and build a team that can support our rapid growth with the expertise and empathy needed throughout hyper-growth. § §Make our vision around what it means to work at Roam happen across all our employee touch-points and rally the team around that vision.§ §Build and implement programs across recruiting, onboarding, ongoing training, feedback and culture-building to reinforce our values and vision at Roam.§ §Collect business and people data through user research, design thinking and customer experience methods to inform initiatives and decisions. § §Manage human resources needs across the organisation, including payroll and benefits, in partnership with Finance and Operations team.§ §Managing the People & Culture Ops team§ § §   § §Skills and experience§ § § §8+ years of experience in People or Customer Experience Leadership roles § §Consulting, design thinking, software development and/or CX experience is a plus§ §Experience working in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment, with the ability to lead and adapt in a changing business environment§ §Experience recruiting and managing people, including diverse teams (different locations, employees/contractors/agencies/ levels of experience, etc.)§ §Exceptional communication & collaboration skills, particularly with people who have different skill sets and are from different areas of the business§ § §   § §Who you are§ § § §You live and breathe the qualities of an Exceptional Roamer - jobTitle: Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670587.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Hands-on H&S partnership and advisory role supporting our people §Fixed term opportunity to 25th June 2021 covering our Central Region§Flexibility to be based in Hamilton, Rotorua or any other Central regional office§Salary starting from $77,346 up to $109,194 based on skills/experience§§'Kotahi anō te kaupapa, ko te oranga o te iwi'  -  ‘There is only one purpose to our work:  the wellness and wellbeing of our people.§§Led from our Chief Executive, we're embedding a culture of continuous improvement and capability across our unique operating environment at Ara Poutama Aotearoa.  Nowhere else is quite the same - we have over 10,000 people at 100's of sites across Aotearoa with over 80% who work directly with the people in our care.  We also deliver instructional and rehabilitation programmes in high-risk industries, such as construction, engineering, construction, and agriculture - it's a diverse, interesting and complex portfolio to manage safety across.§Mō te tūnga | About the role§We have a fixed term opportunity for a Health and Safety professional to join our recently expanded Safety & Wellbeing Function and provide proactive health and safety advice and support to sites, leaders and teams across our Central Region.  Your key focus in this role is to support these teams to improve their health and safety performance and ensure that health and safety become core considerations throughout their business-as-usual ways of working.  This involves supporting sites, teams and projects to effectively apply a range of health and safety policies, procedures and protocols, supporting and guiding the completion of H&S Learning Reviews/investigations, undertaking critical risk and system assurance checks across teams and projects, and providing technically accurate and constructive advice to improve the H&S performance of business areas.§There is an expectation that the role holder can commit to regular regional travel, therefore a full driver's licence is essential.§Ngā pūkenga e kimi ana mātou | Skills we look for§To be successful, we are looking for evidence of the following key skills and experience within your written application:§§Experience in a similar role providing health and safety advice and guidance, ideally across large and complex organisations;§Demonstrated understanding of health and safety legislation;§Proven knowledge and understanding of incident investigation techniques;§Experience in delivering activities that improve awareness, knowledge and application of health and safety policies, procedures and protocols;§Excellent collaboration skills with an ability to develop strong relationships to drive culture change with key stakeholders;§Good technical experience, ideally with a background in a high-risk industry;§Knowledge of applied best practice in health and safety business partnering, including health and safety assurance and Learning Review/investigation activities; and§A full (clean) drivers licence§§Tono ināianei | Apply now§To apply online, submit your §CV and a tailored cover letter§ §(PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join our whanau at Ara Poutama Aotearoa and outline your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §Applications will close 9pm on Thursday 15 October.  Shortlisted candidates may be invited to take part in a pre-interview online competency assessment and video screening.§The salary range for this role is $77,346 up to $109,194 based demonstrable skills, experience and expertise relevant to the role.§§§§

Join a fast growing team!§§Advertiser: §MedRecruit§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Salary§§$90,000 - $119,999 OTE (Uncapped commission)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§The medical industry is one of the world’s busiest industries right now and we’re looking for a superstar! We need you to provide world class solutions to our medical industry by placing General Practitioners into hospitals, clinics and health services.§ §Who we are:§ §MedRecruit is the largest medical recruiter in Australia and New Zealand. We exist to support our medical industry by placing doctors into hospitals and clinics. The demands on the medical industry have never been higher, and we anticipate them to get even busier so we need you now.§ §For over 14 years we’ve been at the forefront of doctor placement in hospitals and clinics. We pride ourselves on our superior service to both our doctors and hospitals and we’re committed to excellence.§ §About the role:§ §To begin you’ll have a full induction with your highly experienced Country Manager. You’ll learn everything there is to know about the medical recruitment industry and our world class solutions focused approach.§ §You will be given a portfolio of doctors and hospitals and before you know it you will be up and running.§ §You will be provided with the tools of the job, a fantastic office environment, and a brilliant culture.§ §Your feedback and ideas will be taken on board and we’re always committed to improving, so we’re looking for someone who thinks the same…That the status quo is something to be challenged.§ §This role is based in our beautiful Queenstown office and your package will include a base salary and an uncapped commission structure.§ §Who we’re looking for:§ §To make the most of this opportunity you need, as a minimum, sales experience in a services environment. Ideally you will have worked with Doctors in the past, in a Business Development, Sales or Recruitment scenario.§ §On top of this we want to know that you are a self-starter; who knows that your success is in your own hands. Every day you strive for better. You are solutions focused and know that there is always a way.§ §Do you have recruitment experience? Are you driven by business development? Perhaps you’ve been a recruiter for a couple of years, or have experience in selling services? Are you ready to step into one of the world’s busiest industries? § §What to do next:§ §To apply, please follow the two steps below:§ § §Copy the below link into your web browser and then submit your CV and Cover Letter.§ §https://medworld.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=39§ § §In addition, please also follow these instructions: §We have a short questionnaire that we would like you to complete as part of your application. Please copy the below link into your web browser to complete the questionnaire.§ §https://survey.harrisonassessments.com/bdzs-uvy7-u2nf§ §Please note that we will only accept applications that are received via the above channel (and not via Seek) and that we will not consider applicants who do not complete the questionnaire. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a recruitment consultant?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50675800.txt	§HR Advisor - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor - Auckland§§Advertiser: §rhipe§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The role:§Reporting to the Group Executive, HR in Melbourne, the HR Advisor will have a passion for people and workplace culture and will work closely with the NZ business to provide generalist HR support and lead post-acquisition people integration.§The autonomous role has a broad remit encompassing policy, employment legislation and compliance, recruitment and onboarding, employee relations and management development, training delivery as well as the roll out of cross-Company programs.§The team:§The Global HR Team looks after people matters from recruitment and on-boarding to performance management and learning and development.  They are responsible for ensuring we have relevant HR infrastructure and frameworks in place, along with people strategies, policies and initiatives to enable a safe, happy and productive workforce.§Key responsibilities include:§Provide general HR support to the NZ office including employment legislation, employee relations and performance management advice§Lead post-acquisition integration from a people perspective including employment documentation, Group policies, processes and systems and cultural synergies§End to end recruitment involving advertising, screening for cultural fit and ideal team players, interview support, reference checking, offer and employment contracts§Deliver best practice on-boarding and inductions (F2F and Virtual Teams) for new staff to ensure an excellent employee experience§Support payroll additions, exits and accuracy each month and any Kiwis-Saver administration§Help drive Development plans and Performance Management and support employees in HRM system§Drive cross-company cultural programs including teamwork development, rhipe Values§Contribute to HR team to build in-house soft skills training and deliver training §Keep accurate records of training delivered, training plans, attendance and feedback§Ensure adherence to workplace relations requirements, labour law and OH&S§Experience, education and skills§:§To be successful in this role the incumbent will have the following attributes and experience:§Self-starter, able to work autonomously with strong mindset for continuous improvement§The ability to listen and interpret our clients' needs, engage with people, create, develop and maintain long-term partnerships§A track record in dealing with a variety of situations and the ability to be organised and solutions focused.  §High levels of clarity, accuracy and confidence in communication§Excellent organisational and time management skills§Experience in a similar HR generalist role§Managing HR systems and payroll, HRMS and/or LMS§Well-practised in on-boarding and presentation techniques and delivery§Good understanding of NZ employment legislation and ER capability§Highly desirable - experience in acquisitions and people integrations, payroll§To be eligible for this opportunity, candidates must hold valid working rights.§Why rhipe§?§Rhipe is a market leader for cloud and service provider software licensing in the APAC region.  We help businesses build, transform and accelerate their journey to the Cloud and our employees are at the heart of what we do.§We support equal opportunity and aim to provide a dynamic, inclusive and friendly work environment. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. With our flexible and diverse culture, we encourage candidates who may be seeking a flexible working arrangement or require reasonable work adjustments, to apply.§Our benefits§We offer an attractive remuneration package along with ongoing career opportunities, technological and professional development and support. We have a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork, flexibility and work-life balance.  §Some of our perks include an Employee Assistance Program, paid parental leave, employee 'Me day', Cultural Leave Day swap, CSR initiatives, regular social events.....plus, the added advantage of working with top-notch technology and colleagues that are passionate about what they do.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What is your expected annual salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50679899.txt	§Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based§§Advertiser: §The Recruitment Alternative§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based §        §          §            §              §                §                  §Enjoy a career with genuine family, work & life balance§                  §Part-time opportunity working from home§                  §Professional training & career progression opportunities§                  §Fabulous commission structure for the driven recruiter!§                § §About The Recruitment Alternative§The Recruitment Alternative is one of Australia and New Zealand's leading, permanent recruitment agencies. Established for over 11 years, we are proud of the exceptionally high standard recruitment service that we provide our clients, at very competitive rates. We are an award-winning agency and our staff enjoy the rewards of a truly, modern and innovative business structure. §We are currently expanding our business and looking for sharp, passionate, Recruitment Consultants to join our successful team. As a growing business, we are looking for consultants who can work independently from a home-based office, who are seeking work life balance but at the same time want to earn a high income via the application of steady hard work.  We provide thorough training, ongoing support and provide our consultants with all the tools necessary for success.§About the role§This is a unique, part time opportunity for an experienced and professional §Recruitment Consultant§. Working on permanent recruitment, across a warm desk of clients, you’ll be based entirely from home. This opportunity requires entrepreneurial recruiters, who thrive on working autonomously, and who are happy to self-manage their own workload. You will have a genuine passion for sourcing the best talent, and a demonstrated ability to achieve stand-out results. With a solid background in agency or internal recruitment, you will enjoy working on a broad range of placements. §  §Our flexible business model provides our consultants with genuine alternatives in how they work. We would prefer someone who could work 4 hours a day. Start time is slightly flexible, anytime before 10:00am would suit (Our office opens at 8:00am).§  §Perks of the job:§ § §Great hard working team with a sense of humour§ §Modern newly renovated central offices§ §Mac computer and iPhone§ §Constant improvements of systems and processes§ §An awesome work culture with everyone working towards the same goals§ §Reporting to the HR Advisor and working closely with operations, you will be responsible for delivering effective staff recruitment practices which you will develop together with the HR Advisor. jobText: TXT/50680943.txt	§Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational...§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational...§§Advertiser: §Counties Manukau District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational... §    §      §Full Time§Fixed Term until April 2021§        §People matter at Counties Manukau Health and we need someone who wants to be part of an Organisation Development team helping to drive better patient outcomes through better people practices, and better management and leadership. We currently have a full-time, fixed term role from now until around April 2021.§        §About us:§Counties Manukau Health is the largest employer in South Auckland employing over 8,000 staff spread across 23 different sites, working within a complex environment providing the best care for the community we serve.  Our vision is to work in partnership with our communities to improve the health status of all, with particular emphasis on Maaori and Pacific peoples and other communities with health disparities.  §        §About you:§This OD role presents an opportunity to partner with OD and HR colleagues to influence management and leadership capability, and to contribute to a positive, people centred culture. As an OD practitioner, you will bring expertise in OD disciplines, including organisational assessment, facilitation, training delivery, and content improvement.  You will need to act as the lead person on OD related projects.§        §We have recently initiated a range of bite-sized sessions (1-2 hours long) relating to team effectiveness and to management skills. All our OD team members therefore need to be comfortable “on our feet” facilitating team effectiveness workshops and delivering some management skills training.  §        §You are a confident communicator who can engage effectively with senior leaders, staff, unions, and colleagues. You will have the confidence to have bold conversations and build strong relationships especially with HR Business Partner colleagues. You will thrive on making things better, understanding the root cause of an issue and solving immediate problems. It’s important to us that you understand and relate to our values.§        §What we can offer you:§        §          §A fast paced environment where ‘doing it’ is more important than talking about it§          §An OD team where the focus has changed in recent months, and where we are trying new things§          §5 weeks annual leave (pro rata)§        §This role is based at Middlemore Hospital and the train stops outside our front door!§If this role sounds like you, apply at §www.countieshealthjobs.com§ or §click here§ for the job description.§        §For more information please contact Amy Lin in the Recruitment Centre §09 276 0044§ ext 58680 or email §amy.lin@middlemore.co.nz§        §Position Number: CMH§20203537§Closing Date: 12 October 2020§§ At Counties Manukau Health people and their lives matter to us. We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to delivering the best health outcomes for our community. To help us achieve this we need a workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applications from all backgrounds who share our values and have a passion to work in our community and would greatly value seeing applicants from our Maaori and Pacific communities. We are also committed to our Disability Strategy, which focuses on people with disabilities; they are our patients, whaanau, community and our staff - all carefully considered in our action plan. Together we will improve the accessibility needs for everyone who has a disability. Our values are Valuing Everyone- Whakawhanaungatanga , Kind –Manaakitanga, Together –Kotahitanga, Excellent- Rangatiratanga. If these are your values too, then join us today.§ §        § § § §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Full Time§Fixed Term until April 2021§People matter at Counties Manukau Health and we need someone who wants to be part of an Organisation Development team helping to drive better patient outcomes through better people practices, and better management and leadership. jobText: TXT/50681781.txt	§Business Partner  People & Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Partner  People & Culture§§Advertiser: §Regional Facilities Auckland (RFA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Partner People & Culture §      §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§With the exciting merger between RFA and ATEED, our passionate and creative teams are coming together! We are striving to create rewarding visitor experiences and positive outcomes for all Aucklanders. §To help us with our transformation and journey, we have an exciting opportunity for an exceptional Business Partner, People & Culture to join our team. §In this critical role, you will partner with senior leaders across the business to provide a generalist HR. You will be responsible for identifying and developing HR strategies with leaders, ensuring the needs of the BU and wider teams are considered throughout. You will cover end to end HR requirements and oversee the effectiveness of the HR operation whilst working closely with functions across the Council family.§        §He kōrero mōu: About you § §        §You will have significant HR experience working in a complex organisation with an ability to get things done.  You will bring proven experience with leadership teams on all levels as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert. § §        §Tertiary qualified, you will have demonstrated experience in a number of different areas in HR such as engagement strategy and execution; talent management, change, ER, and performance management; and experience negotiating with unions. Naturally, you will have political and business acumen and a collaborative working style.§You will bring exceptional relationship management skills, and familiarity working with and influencing a diverse range of stakeholders.  You will help lead and shape our culture by developing and delivering strategic people initiatives and programmes, and role-modeling the RFA values. You will motivate and inspire optimism in others in a way that inspires people. § §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §        §Our diverse, creative team of people work together to create unique experiences for people living in and visiting our city. §You will be part of a team making a valuable contribution to our city and to every occasion. Our passion for what we do breathes life into our vision to enrich and enhance life in Auckland.If you feel you can contribute to this outcome through your experience, excitement, and ingenuity please take up our invitation to apply. Come join us and have the satisfaction of knowing you’re contributing to Auckland’s economic growth.§ §        §For a confidential discussion or detailed PD, please contact Jess Rohr, Talent Acquisition Consultant §jess.rohr@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§.  §        § §        §Applications close 11th October 2020§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Acknowledgement to all.”§        § §        §At Vodafone, we’re committed to providing you with a friendly workplace environment where you can manage home and work balance through our leading flexible working practises. We value the diversity of thought, perspective and backgrounds our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027.§        § §        §Reporting to the Talent Manager, the Talent Acquisition Business Partner will be responsible for end-to-end proactive recruitment across the Vodafone NZ business.  This is a fast paced industry, where we are looking for experienced in-house recruitment consultants who are interested in bringing their innovative and continuous improvement approach, excellent relationship building and exemplary customer experience focus to a new industry.§        § §        §We are a small, tight team that will be looking to continue to build Vodafone’s talent capability and service offering since our new ownership jobTitle: Safety & Sustainability Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50682054.txt	§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§§Advertiser: §GSF Fresh New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator – GSF New Zealand                § §The Company§ §Established for over 70 years, Golden State Foods (GSF) is a global player in the food processing and distribution industries with customers in more than 40 countries on five continents. GSF Fresh New Zealand has become a leader in manufacturing and distribution of fresh-cut produce and salads to the retail and foodservice industry in New Zealand.  Groenz a wholly owned subsidiary of GSF, provides high quality sauces and condiments to QSR’s, hotels, restaurants and cafes across Oceania. As a leading global supplier, these GSF businesses are necessarily quality focussed whilst striving for a culture of Safety where everyone takes responsibility for their own safety as well as those around them. To capitalise on significantly improved Safety results in 2020, the business is looking to further enhance its goal of an incident free and safe home everyday culture. Our Sustainability goals require utilisation of our ISO 14001 certified EMS to further reduce our environmental footprint and anticipate benefits through reduction in energy, water and waste whilst improving our community reputation and recycling initiatives. To this end we are further investing in Safety and Sustainability resources in all our Asia Pacific markets.§ §The Role§ §New Role. Start January 2021!§ §We need a hands-on §Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§ who will passionately lead and develop the next phase of our Safety and Sustainability journey. Reporting to the Technical Director Asia Pacific, your role will be to provide leadership and expertise in areas of environmental, occupational health and safety (EHS), risk management, and workers compensation/loss control management to our NZ business units. § §More specifically you will:§ § §Develop ownership of Safety and Sustainability tasks into site management and supervisory teams’ duties through annual and monthly tasks planning and allocations.§ §Lead development of guidelines, assist in implementation and monitor comprehensive safety processes and management practices to meet all applicable company policies. § §Implement initiatives to reduce and prevent accidents, occupational illnesses, and exposure to long-term health.§ §Work with facilities in Auckland and Wellington to assure training of all associates in general safety and environmental awareness and specific programs (e.g. Social workplace accountability (SWA), Incident management, manual handling, risk management, LOTO, confined space, personal protective equipment (PPE), powered industrial vehicles, EMS, tradewaste, chemical management, stormwater, spill response).§ §Identify and interpret regulatory standards that impact operational exposures and business activities and guide needed plans to ensure compliance.§ §Collaborate with GSF corporate and APAC peers in identifying sustainability priorities, strategy and action planning and development of sustainability goals and metrics for GSF Fresh and Groenz.  § §Coach sites on ongoing collection of information and managing KPI’s for sustainability and working towards sustainability improvement plans.§ §Lead development of guidelines, assist in implementation and monitor comprehensive environmental processes and management practices to meet all applicable environmental policy requirements and ISO 14001.§ §Lead investigations and improvements in recyclables, water, energy, wastewater discharge, solid waste disposal, hazardous waste, air emissions, spill prevention control, stormwater pollutant discharge elimination system, ozone depleting substances, fuel, and community donations.§ §Conduct periodic EHS inspections and behavoiral observations and coach, direct site teams to do the same.§ §Administer EHS system in Intelex. Develop users and super users to improve and sustain effective use of intelex.§ §Collaborate with procurement teams to design and implement supplier engagement programs to encourage reduction in supply chain emissions, waste, and water use.§ §Manage weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual safety and sustainability reporting with site teams.§ §About you§ §To be considered for this position you must possess the following:§ § §Bachelor’s degree in Science/Technology/Engineering, Life Science, Safety, Environmental, or Risk Management.§ §3 to 5 years of relevant work experience within the food manufacturing, warehousing, and distribution environment.§ §Internal / External audit qualifications.§ §High level of attention to detail and strong communication skills.§ §Self-motivated, enthusiastic and a care factor to drive improvements.§ §Highly organised and strong administrative skills.§ §Intelex or other similar Software platform experience for EHSQ management systems.§ §Willing to travel between Auckland and Wellington on a regular basis.§ §Be able to spend at least 5 - 10 days per month in Wellington.§ §Our Values§ § §Treat others like you want to be treated§ §Make the best product§ §Give the customer a fair deal§ §Maintain the highest standards.§ §If you believe you have the experience and skills, and our values align with your personal values, please apply on-line now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Human Capital Senior Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682058.txt	§Human Capital Senior Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Capital Senior Consultant§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§ §Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach§ §Build your career with unlimited learning opportunities working alongside high-performing people§ §Give back to your community by helping kiwi businesses deliver transformational change for their people§  § §The Opportunity§ §Deloitte’s Human Capital Consulting practice works closely with business leaders to deliver people projects focused on transformational change, leadership development, culture, and organisation and operating model design. § §As a Senior Consultant in our Organisational Transformation team, you will be a key contributor to high quality project deliverables on a variety of client engagements, with support of your peers, Managers, Directors and Partners who will support your development with guidance and direction.§ §The broad nature of our client base means that you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a range of industries and to continue to learn every day, developing your core capabilities, which might include:§ § §Your role will focus on utilising your skills and experience from an HR and talent development background to help create people strategies, research, analytics, and industry insights to help design and implement programmes that aims to maximise capability and performance for people.§ §Compile and analyse data through workshops, interviews, questionnaires and other methods to find insights and pain points that addresses client needs.§ §Play an active part in creating of talent development and people strategies, and taking it through to the design and implementation people and talent programmes.§ §Collaborate with the broader Human Capital and Consulting Practice to deliver change management, learning and development, organisation design and other Human Capital capabilities to ensure transformation initiatives are fit for purpose and exceed client expectations.§ §Manage users and stakeholder expectations, own change management issues and escalate as required to appropriate channels to ensure full user adoption and delivery commitments are met.  § §Connect with team members to share knowledge and develop new capabilities and competencies with respect to the latest industry trends and insights.§  § §About you§ § §2 – 5 years’ experience in an HR/People/Talent Development role. Experience in a Consulting/Professional Services environment is highly advantageous.§ §Subject Matter Expertise in best practice Human Resources Business Processes and practices. This includes experience designing and delivering organisation operating models, change management, learning and development strategies and succession planning.§ §Strong quantitative and analysis skills, able to uncover the heart of problems, identify root causes and offer clear solutions in a constructive and logical sequence.§ §Sound interpersonal skills, able to gain the trust and confidence of those you collaborate with.§ §Fluent (close to native level) of English language skills is essential, both written and spoken, as is the ability to engage a range of users at all organisation levels.§  § §About the team§ §We are an award winning Consulting practice, where we are comprised of over 300 professionals nationwide, amongst a wider 1400 within the Deloitte New Zealand network. We continue to grow as a most respected professional services firm and now our Human Capital Practice are looking for talented person like you to working alongside a diverse team of specialist in our Wellington office..§ §At Deloitte, the success of our business is our people. We want people who share our values and relish the opportunity to embrace change, making a difference on every engagement. Our team have all come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, but all share a common purpose of making an impact that matters to our community.§ §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all.§ § §Interested?§ §If you have a passion for learning from talented people and would like to benefit from the support of a global organisation and network, apply now or contact Gracie Wang, Senior Talent Acquisition Advisor, on §+64 (9) 303 0775§ for any questions regarding this role.§ §Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process. §§§§

We have recently recruited a Safety & Wellbeing Manager who has strength in the wellbeing arena and now we are looking for a Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner to round out the team. You’ll be strong in your safety knowledge and keen to learn more about wellbeing from our very experienced Manager. . You’ll support the new Safety & Wellbeing Manager operationally in coaching and advice to portfolio managers to develop the safety and wellbeing cultures in their teams. We’ve just implemented a new reporting tool and you’ll work with teams to embed it into practice. Each day will be different with the variety of industries and associated risks keeping you on your toes. You’ll be continually learning and growing as you add value to our leaders and their teams.§          §Ara Institute of Canterbury Ltd is a vibrant and progressive tertiary institute providing world-class, tertiary-level education throughout the Canterbury and Waitaki region. Our talented colleagues, innovative business collaborators and supportive community partners are passionate about the role they play in our students' success. Every day we are privileged to be able to see our purpose realised – “Transforming Lives Through Education”. This is a unique opportunity to join us as we ready ourselves to support NZ to invest in training and skills to respond to the post Covid-19 environment.§          §The People and Culture Division, where this role sits, comprises P&C services (e.g. administration, HRIS), business partners and specialist functions including Employment Relations, Safety and Wellbeing, Employee Experience and Capability Development. The mission of the division is to partner with leaders to continually lift our employees’ experience and capability at work and build on our engaging culture so that individuals and the organisation can deliver outcomes beyond their expectations. A number of our areas of work are part of Ara’s Transformation Programme and this very much includes the changes we have been making in Safety and Wellbeing. We are committed to continuing that transformation as it is one of Ara’s Strategic Focus Areas and Priorities.§          §The Role§          §The Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner provides operational support and advice to managers and teams to continually improve the Safety and Wellbeing of people (colleagues and students) in our Ara community. This role partners with managers, teams and the student body to continually build an enduring safe and well culture. This role will integrate the health, safety and wellbeing frameworks and systems (critical risk management, data capture, policies, procedures, measurement) into the organisation and assists their portfolio areas to learn how they are keeping people safe and well and explore what else could be done.§          §The role also provides operational support to the Safety and Wellbeing Manager, ensuring Ara is legislatively current and is reporting and learning from its health, safety and wellbeing performance as well as implementing and improving practices in relation to colleague rehabilitation, psychological safety wellbeing (e.g. bullying and harassment), annual risk reviews, internal audits and the Ara wellbeing programme.§          §Skills/Experience§          §            §Demonstrated awareness of equity, cultural and bicultural issues and a commitment to biculturalism and the ability to translate these into action§            §A tertiary qualification in Health, Safety and Wellbeing or equivalent (or actively working towards one)§            §Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a similar role, with a working knowledge of building culture around health, safety and wellbeing in teams§            §Evidence of keeping up to date with health, safety and wellbeing technical requirements, legislation and practices§            §Proven track record of transferring knowledge into action§            §Experience of developing and maintaining effective relationships internally, across the organisation and externally§            §Current Drivers licence (travel required to our different campuses)§            §Excellent problem solving, analytical, ‘root cause’ exploration skills§            §Team player: collaborative ability with a sense of humour and a proactive approach§            §Preference will be given to candidates with a working knowledge of large and complex organisations and how that might be applied in a public sector organisation.§ description§          §To Apply§          §We accept applications via our online application system.
