jobText: TXT/50710823.txt	§Sales & Success Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales & Success Coach§§Advertiser: §VeriFone§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Why Verifone§ §For more than 30 years Verifone has established a remarkable record of leadership in the electronic payment technology industry. Verifone has one of the leading electronic payment solutions brands and is one of the largest providers of electronic payment systems worldwide.§ §Verifone has a diverse, dynamic and fast paced work environment in which employees are focused on results and have opportunities to excel. We take pride in the fact that we work with leading retailers, merchants, banks, and third party partners to invent and deliver innovative payments solution around the world. We strive for excellence in our products and services, and are obsessed with customer happiness. Across the globe, Verifone employees are leading the payments industry through experience, innovation, and an ambitious spirit. Whether it’s developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to the success of our customers, partners and investors. It is this passion for innovation that drives each one of our employees for personal and professional success. § § § §About the role§ §The right candidate will have hands-on experience coaching a sales team and looking for a new challenge in their career. We are looking for an Experienced Trainer/ Sales Coach to join the team. You will be working closely with the Sales Manager to implement processes and drive results from our Sales and Success teams.§ § § §What you'll do§ § §Educate, lead and coach to build required people and capability that delivers sustainable performance § §Monitor the performance of all Sales & Success staff and identify areas of improvement§ §Work with the marketing team to keep product content up to date § §Design training courses, coaching sessions, and other role-playing activities.§ §Shoot and film training videos across the company with our in-house video team. § §Develop educational material, including presentations, sales scripts and case studies§ §Design training courses using gamification, role-playing activities and job simulation§ §Set annual learning and development objectives for the sales team§ §Develop a relationship with the sales team that makes it easy to communicate their ideas and issues they are facing.§ §Onboard and train new hires with the Subject Matter Expert.§ §Set learning and financial objectives for the team§ §Prepare and present reports to the Sales Manager§ § § §What qualifications will you need to be successful? § § §Minimum 3 years of recent, relevant experience in training, coaching and facilitation§ §Understanding of Sales processes -  knowledge in HubSpot is preferred§ §Experience in developing training programs and materials§ §Strong interpersonal skills - ability to adapt to different learning styles and to identify key issues and present viable solutions§ §Strong leadership qualities, excellent organizational skills, and ability to speak comfortably in front of large groups§ §Strong analytical and problem solving skills§ §Effective time and project management skills§ § § §Verifone is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Verifone is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

You will oversee the effective recruitment, employee experience, engagement, performance management, remuneration structures and learning and development programmes. A key objective for the role will be in building culture across the group that meets the companies and the changing social expectations. Additionally, you will lead the industrial relations strategy, support negotiations and have strategic oversight of safety and wellbeing. Measuring and reporting on key human resource drivers will also be important to quantify the value within the Group.§ § § §Skills and Experience§ §This role requires an experienced, down to earth and innovative human resource and safety leader who can authentically connect and build great relationships with the team and wider business. You will be a strategic and trusted advisor who supports the senior leadership team and their managers to foster an outstanding diverse and inclusive culture, and further build the capability within their teams. We are looking for someone who is future focused and has a track record of leading Future of Work change with solid experience supporting people through this change. A relevant qualification and experience in a similar role are essential.§ § § §To Apply§ §Please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate “Apply” button. Initial phone enquiries can be made to Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8764§ or Sally Wynn-Williams on §03 345 8759§.§ §Applications for this role close 5pm Monday 26 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Learning & Development Consultant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711668.txt	§Learning & Development Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning & Development Consultant§§Advertiser: §Frucor Suntory§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Learning & Development Consultant §      §        §Who are we?§        §Thirsty work happens every day at Frucor Suntory – we are the distributor of some of New Zealand and Australia's most popular beverage brands after all. §        §We make, market and distribute a range of fruit juices, fruit drinks, energy drinks, waters and soft drinks, many of which are household names throughout New Zealand and Australia. Our brands include the iconic ‘V’ energy drink, Fresh Up, Just Juice, Amplify, h2go, Mizone, NZNatural and Suntory Boss Coffee. §        §Since our beginnings in the early 1960s, Frucor Suntory has evolved from a small New Zealand juice business to a leading Australasian drinks company and the market leader in energy drinks in Australia and New Zealand. We've been part of the leading Japanese beverage and food company Suntory Group since 2009 and in 2017, we became Frucor Suntory. §        §Frucor Suntory offers people an energetic, achievement-focused workplace with plenty of action and a fantastic values based culture. We're passionate and innovative, and we are always on the lookout for ways to do things better – how we make our drinks, look after our people and reduce our environmental footprint. §        §We are “Hungry to make drinks better” and looking to expand our team…§        §Based in Manukau, the L&D Consultant role reports to the Capability Manager and the primary purpose will be to lead, develop and deploy learning initiatives which help bring our people strategy to life. You will also provide facilitation for learning programmes and lead key learning initiatives as identified by Capability Manager. §        §This role is a regionally focussed position where you will operate across Frucor Suntory.§        §Your primary duties include leading the learning solutions to upskill our People Leaders in ‘operational people skills’, leading the design and development of our Manager’s basics suite of learning programmes, supporting the OD Consultant with the activation of the engagement survey approach and helping support and build leadership & capability development across the organisation. While focused on learning, this is also a varied role where at any one time you may be working on projects across our strategic choices – Growing our People, Culture, Better People Experiences, providing awesome experiences and moments that matter for our people. § §        §Where do you fit in?§        §Here at Frucor Suntory, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and like to have fun but we don’t shy away from a challenge, and neither should you. A lot of what we look for is how you would align with our values ‘Together’, ‘Go For It‘ and ‘Make a Difference’. §        §To enable you to hit the ground running, we’re looking for someone who:§        §          §Has proven experience in L&D, facilitation and instructional design§          §Online and digital learning experience is a bonus§          §Has strong relationship building and stakeholder management experience§          §Is proactive and a self-starter§          §Has the ability to work with ambiguity and translate training needs into practical learning outcomes§          §Has a tertiary qualification in organisational development, psychology, HR or business would be desirable§          §Brings experienced in facilitation and feedback provision to the table would be a nice to have§          §Has a generalist HR and/or consulting background would be useful§          §Has HDBI accreditation would be a great bonus§        §        §What’s it in for you?§        §We offer a competitive base salary, a day off on your birthday, flexible working hours, study leave and the opportunity to earn an incentive. Working at Frucor Suntory isn't a job, it's a career. We support our people to be their best, and our learning and development opportunities are hard to beat. We share ideas, knowledge and expertise wherever we can to ensure our employees can flourish. §        §This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a great team and use their skills to influence our staff and customers. You will receive a high level of support to learn new skills and enhance your personal development. §        §How do I apply?§        §If you’re passionate about your career and seek a high growth environment, a strong team culture, career advancement and the opportunity to make a real difference to the company’s on-going success, then this is the role for you! §        §Keen to join our team? Click apply to submit your CV & cover letter before §end of day Sunday 25 October§. §        §Attention Recruitment Agencies: Frucor Suntory has a Direct Sourcing model and at this point in time we will not require any recruitment agency support for this role.§      §      §Please note that final applicants will need to undergo a Ministry of Justice security check & a pre-employment drug test. Some roles may also need to undergo a credit check. §    §    §    §    §  §§§Who are we?§Thirsty work happens every day at Frucor Suntory – we are the distributor of some of New Zealand and Australia's most popular beverage brands after all. §We make, market and distribute a range of fruit juices, fruit drinks, energy drinks, waters and soft drinks, many of which are household names throughout New Zealand and Australia. Our brands include the iconic ‘V’ energy drink, Fresh Up, Just Juice, Amplify, h2go, Mizone, NZNatural and Suntory Boss Coffee. §Since our beginnings in the early 1960s, Frucor Suntory has evolved from a small New Zealand juice business to a leading Australasian drinks company and the market leader in energy drinks in Australia and New Zealand. We've been part of the leading Japanese beverage and food company Suntory Group since 2009 and in 2017, we became Frucor Suntory. §Frucor Suntory offers people an energetic, achievement-focused workplace with plenty of action and a fantastic values based culture. We're passionate and innovative, and we are always on the lookout for ways to do things better – how we make our drinks, look after our people and reduce our environmental footprint. §We are “Hungry to make drinks better” and looking to expand our team…§Based in Manukau, the L&D Consultant role reports to the Capability Manager and the primary purpose will be to lead, develop and deploy learning initiatives which help bring our people strategy to life. You will also provide facilitation for learning programmes and lead key learning initiatives as identified by Capability Manager. §This role is a regionally focussed position where you will operate across Frucor Suntory.§Your primary duties include leading the learning solutions to upskill our People Leaders in ‘operational people skills’, leading the design and development of our Manager’s basics suite of learning programmes, supporting the OD Consultant with the activation of the engagement survey approach and helping support and build leadership & capability development across the organisation. While focused on learning, this is also a varied role where at any one time you may be working on projects across our strategic choices – Growing our People, Culture, Better People Experiences, providing awesome experiences and moments that matter for our people. § §Where do you fit in?§Here at Frucor Suntory, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and like to have fun but we don’t shy away from a challenge, and neither should you. A lot of what we look for is how you would align with our values ‘Together’, ‘Go For It‘ and ‘Make a Difference’. §To enable you to hit the ground running, we’re looking for someone who:§Has proven experience in L&D, facilitation and instructional design§Online and digital learning experience is a bonus§Has strong relationship building and stakeholder management experience§Is proactive and a self-starter§Has the ability to work with ambiguity and translate training needs into practical learning outcomes§Has a tertiary qualification in organisational development, psychology, HR or business would be desirable§Brings experienced in facilitation and feedback provision to the table would be a nice to have§Has a generalist HR and/or consulting background would be useful§Has HDBI accreditation would be a great bonus§What’s it in for you?§We offer a competitive base salary, a day off on your birthday, flexible working hours, study leave and the opportunity to earn an incentive. Working at Frucor Suntory isn't a job, it's a career. We support our people to be their best, and our learning and development opportunities are hard to beat. We share ideas, knowledge and expertise wherever we can to ensure our employees can flourish. §This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a great team and use their skills to influence our staff and customers. You will receive a high level of support to learn new skills and enhance your personal development. §How do I apply?§If you’re passionate about your career and seek a high growth environment, a strong team culture, career advancement and the opportunity to make a real difference to the company’s on-going success, then this is the role for you! §Keen to join our team? Click apply to submit your CV & cover letter before §end of day Sunday 25 October§. §Attention Recruitment Agencies: Frucor Suntory has a Direct Sourcing model and at this point in time we will not require any recruitment agency support for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50719797.txt	§Manager - People§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager - People§§Advertiser: §QJumpers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Generation Homes is one of New Zealand’s most well-known and respected home builders. Operating in nine regions throughout New Zealand we have been making building easy for over 22 years.  We are a dedicated team who pride ourselves on working together to ensure that we are meeting our common goal – to make building easy.  We roll up our sleeves and pitch in to ensure that we get the job done - and we like to have fun whilst we are doing it§An exciting opportunity now exists for an experienced People Manager to join our team based at our Head Office in Tauranga for approximately 30 hours per week.  As an integral part of our team, this newly created role is a great opportunity for someone who is wanting to make a difference in an organisation and really add value. §Your primary focus will be to develop the capabilities of our team within the Generation Homes group of companies, ensuring that our people are well trained and feeling confident in their role.  When you work with people the landscape is forever changing, so naturally the activities that you are involved in will to! This generalist role will see you responsible for working with our Joint Venture Partners to ensure top level execution of staff recruitment staff inductions, training and development, succession planning, management and leadership development, HR management support, policies and procedures, and much more! §Who are we looking for?§Combining your passion for both people and HR, this role requires a people focused HR professional who is motivated, innovative and who has a real desire to see our team thrive in their role as a result of excellent training and a supportive culture.  §To be successful in this role you will need the following:§  §A true passion for people and the ability to build on team and individual capabilities§  §An innovative leading edge approach to people development§  §Previous experience in a people leadership role§  §A wider business understanding with possibly past experience as part of a business management team§  §Outstanding communication skills§  §A sound understanding of New Zealand employment legislation and HR processes§  §The ability to work in an agile manner. §If you are confident that you can make a positive contribution to our team – we want to hear from you!  Please apply with Cover Letter and CV today letting us know why you are the right fit for the role!§§§§

Most employees are tertiary qualified, highly self-motivated and they possess a genuine desire to add value to their clients. You can also look forward to outstanding IT support and tools to help you stay mobile and a wonderful culture when you are in the office, including free fruit, a great coffee machine, social events (if you’re keen to participate in them) and a steady stream of cake (because they like to celebrate birthdays and work anniversaries).§ § §About the Role§ The Head of People and Culture/Capability reports to the CEO IANZ and also works closely with the CEO of the subsidiary company, Telarc. They are also an integral part of the IANZ Senior Management Team. The role has responsibility for delivering the people-based strategies including developing the capability of individuals, as well as building high performance teams. This is a broad position encompassing all the Human Resource functions. It is envisaged that the role be part time (25+ hours per week) and the organisation is flexible as to how those hours are delivered e.g. three full days or reduced hours over 5 days.§  § §About You§ §We seek a tertiary qualified people leader with broad experience in HR gained from senior leadership positions. You will enjoy creating HR frameworks, strategies and communicating with a wide range of people. Most employees are tertiary qualified, highly self-motivated and they possess a genuine desire to add value to their clients. You can also look forward to outstanding IT support and tools to help you stay mobile and a wonderful culture when you are in the office, including free fruit, a great coffee machine, social events (if you’re keen to participate in them) and a steady stream of cake (because they like to celebrate birthdays and work anniversaries).§ § §About the Role§ The Head of People and Culture/Capability reports to the CEO IANZ and also works closely with the CEO of the subsidiary company, Telarc. They are also an integral part of the IANZ Senior Management Team. The role has responsibility for delivering the people-based strategies including developing the capability of individuals, as well as building high performance teams. This is a broad position encompassing all the Human Resource functions. It is envisaged that the role be part time (25+ hours per week) and the organisation is flexible as to how those hours are delivered e.g. three full days or reduced hours over 5 days.§  § §About You§ §We seek a tertiary qualified people leader with broad experience in HR gained from senior leadership positions. jobTitle: HR Officer | Wanaka Based Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50719883.txt	§HR Officer | Wanaka Based§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Officer | Wanaka Based§§Advertiser: §Fluid Recruitment New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The Company:§ §A unique opportunity working for a fantastic organisation based in Wanaka at a key time of their business lifecycle as they take a major step forward entering into a number of overseas export markets.§ §Privately owned with significant financial backing, they are well set to cope with existing market conditions and have the security of multiple product/service lines. Having already achieved excellent success to date the addition of this role with a focus on driving their processes online and adopting an innovative and forward thinking approach to HR and H&S management is another example of their progressive mindset and desire to be leaders within their industry sector.§ §The Role:§ §Joining a small, high performing team this is a newly created position that will best suit an HR professional who is keen to play a key role in an organisations' long term success and understands the value and importance of developing robust policies and frameworks. It represents an excellent opportunity for someone wishing to step up in their career and take on greater responsibility or alternatively someone already at this level who can really make the role their own and still further their own professional development ambitions.§ §The nature of our clients' industry sector means a heavy reliance on the need for Casual staff on a cyclical basis throughout the year. The challenges that this can entail are significant especially in terms of time invested to ensure the right team is in place. We are looking for someone who can manage all the related HR administrative duties, including all H&S and compliance issues associated with sourcing, screening, on-boarding and training as well as maintaining necessary personnel records and overview of the payroll function. This role is predominately office based but there may be occasion for some field work. § §You will need to have proven experience with HR procedures and able manage multiple administrative tasks effortlessly. Responsibilities will include:§ § §Prepare HR documents, office policies, employment contracts and manage employee on-boarding.§ §Support and manage logistical issues around accommodation, travel and wellbeing to improve the recruitment and retention of Casual staff. § §Drive engagement of, and compliance with, all company health and safety policies, procedures and systems including running H&S meetings§ §Provide guidance and coaching to individuals to foster collective ownership of a safety culture.§ §Champion a continuous improvement culture and instil best practice, for example introducing H&S video inductions, standardising on-boarding approach, feedback surveys and moving to a paperless HR function.§ §Furthermore a key selling point of this role is the breath and potential it offers. The business is determined to be leading not following, they want someone who is equally as passionate about wanting to be innovative and progressive, constantly looking to identify opportunities for improvement and assessing company performance to date and where changes can be made.§ §To be Considered:§ §You need to be someone who likes a challenge, enjoys working in a fast-paced dynamic environment, have excellent attention to detail, strong problem-solving abilities and excellent relationship management skills. You will also ideally have strong software management skills and be digitally-savvy, although comprehensive training will be provided.§ §The client is looking to move quickly with this appointment. If you are serious about the Wanaka location and wish to be considered please apply accordingly at your earliest opportunity. For more information you can call Peter on 021 278 8653 or you can email §peter@fluidrecruitment.com§ to arrange a confidential discussion.§§§§

jobTitle: HR Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50719686.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §Graham Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §HR Manager §      §        §          §Successful New Zealand business§          §Talented leadership with clear vision§          §Excellent Christchurch based career move§        §        § §        §The Hagley Building Product Group has steadily grown from its beginnings in 1983 to become one of the regions most respected supplier of building materials. The Group’s purpose-built, brand-new factory is situated in Waterloo Park and features greatest manufacturing capability of its kind in the South Island. We now require someone with the passion and energy to add to the development of our people to ensure the journey is successful.§        § §        §This HR Managemental appointment offers the opportunity to join a superb business on the move and add significant value at both at a senior and hands on level.§        § §        §We are looking to speak with experienced HR leaders who can demonstrate proven experience in:§        §          §Identifying and introducing talent at all operational levels§          §Training, developing and upskilling Managers in HR responsibilities and expectations§          §Developing culture and workplace experiences§          §Implementing training frameworks and ensuring positive learning outcomes§          §Managing HR issues pragmatically while appreciating the risk§        §        § §        §Providing support and expertise to the South Island business leaders this role will take responsibility for:§        §          §Developing and implementing policy, procedure and process improvement initiatives§          §Ensuring legal compliance and alignment with global and regional frameworks§          §Facilitating talent management, employee engagement, succession planning, recruitment and retention§          §Implementing learning and development solutions to build people management capability§          §Supporting major change initiatives, utilising change management strategies to maximise performance and mitigate risk§          §Supporting company transformation initiatives; values, capabilities, performance, engagement communication etc§          §Developing, managing and monitoring HR key performance initiatives§        §        § §        §Ideally, we are looking for a professional and experienced Human Resources Manager with the following traits:§        §          §Situational Leadership, beginning with the ability to demonstrate Humility.§          §Excellent communication skills with all levels of the workforce§          §Ability to appreciate diversity in the workplace§        §        § §        §Would you like to know more? jobTitle: Learning and Development Designer  Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50719773.txt	§Learning and Development Designer §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning and Development Designer §§Advertiser: §Reserve Bank of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Contribute to the Bank’s L&D capability and learning culture §Varied and influential role - instructional design, visual design, needs analysis, talent management §Use your initiative to redesign and create a broad range of training§Flexible working opportunities available §Te tūranga – The role§The Reserve Bank has a new and growing Learning and Development Team. As the L&D Designer, you’ll work closely with the wider Culture & Capability team to design, develop and build learning solutions that enable our people.  With an instructional design focus, you will redesign and create blended learning solutions that are accessible, engaging, relevant and impactful for a diverse workforce. This is a highly influential role where you can play a lead role on big projects, including a needs analysis project to ascertain skills and knowledge across the bank, and design learning and development to align with these gaps.§You’ll be working with cross functional teams to establish learning needs and co-design those solutions with key stakeholders. You’ll enjoy providing specialist learning advice, have ownership of the Learning Management System, and design and deliver learning solutions and experiences.§Ō pūkenga – About you§To be successful in this role you will bring:§Knowledge of adult education, instructional design and learning methodology§Proven experience redesigning, creating and developing training materials for internal courses and induction programmes§Working knowledge of SCORM would be an advantage§Willingness and versatility to work flexibly within an organisation who works collaboratively§Effective performance in a similar role, with demonstrated experience in learning design, development and delivery, and an awareness of how it contributes to an organisation achieving its outcomes§Strong problem solving, including the ability to manage or mitigate risks and implement innovative solutions that align with strategic direction§Excellent presentation and communication skills both verbally and written with the ability to communicate to wide ranging audiences at all levels§Proven ability to develop good relationships with all stakeholders§Keen interest in emerging technology trends influencing the training industry§Ability to come up to speed with online tools and systems quickly§A passion for learning with a resilient and adaptable approach§ §Ngā painga – What we offer§We offer an inclusive and flexible working environment to enable our people to bring their whole selves to work and embrace each other’s uniqueness. Our benefits include flexi-leave, wellness package, working from home subsidy, generous parental leave provisions, a range of learning and development opportunities, and access to numerous social, networking and sporting activities.§Ko wai matou - Who we are§ All New Zealanders have dreams, hopes, plans and goals. To achieve them we need a stable economy and safe banking system built on integrity, innovation and inclusion. And that's exactly what we at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand - Te Pūtea Matua enable. A trusted system that gives Kiwis the confidence to make the spending and savings decisions that matter most to them.§We have a clear goal: to improve the economic wellbeing and living standards of all New Zealanders so that we, and the generations to come, continue to enjoy this great country.§We are hugely passionate about what we do and the impact it has on Kiwi businesses, communities and whānau. Enabling New Zealand’s financial system takes expertise, determination and a strong commitment to working collaboratively with our partners. We carry this responsibility with great pride and encourage you to apply if this resonates with you.§To find out more please review the position description, and for specific queries contact Shona Raemaki, Team Leader L&D, People & Culture at §04 471 3942§.§Please submit your application online by Sunday 25 October 2020.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50719716.txt	§Operational Safety Lead - Hastings§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operational Safety Lead - Hastings§§Advertiser: §T&G Global§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§A bit about us§Come and grow your world with T&G! We are fresh food lovers who constantly strive to grow our world by maintaining year-round freshness and provide a healthier lifestyle for everyone we share the planet with.§As one of New Zealand's largest vertically integrated growing, packing, shipping and marketing companies, we have the people, structure and brands to further support the global communities which we operate and provide a return for all stakeholders.§About the position§T&G is committed to providing and maintaining a safe and healthy working environment with all those involved with its activities including workers, contractors, suppliers and all other people working or visiting our place of work.§As the Operational Safety Lead you will be responsible for planning, implementing and evaluating health and safety strategic activities and programmes. This will be achieved through a facilitation and collaboration approach to build ownership and capability in safety leadership in our NZ Operations business. This will involve:§Utilising safety data to identify emerging trends and working with the Operational Managers to complete a gap analysis§Leading, facilitation and design of a fit for purpose solutions and monitoring the implementation§Monitoring the T&G Global risk management process and working with Operational Managers on areas for improvement.§What we are looking for§The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:§3 plus years of experience in a Health & Safety environment ideally across multiple sites§Proven experience in implementation of health and safety initiatives and change management§Good understanding and knowledge of H&S principles - especially in the area of risk management§Strong influencing skills and the ability to build relationships at all levels§Able to drive engagement with strong communication skills§Exceptional time management and organisational skills; and§Be solutions focused and self-motivated§Our mindsets are: Grounded, Resilient, Open & Winning. We are looking for someone who can embody these mindsets, someone who is passionate about taking ownership of their role and wanting to make a difference at T&G.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50721020.txt	§Instructional Designer- (12 month fixed term) Briscoe Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Instructional Designer- (12 month fixed term) Briscoe Group§§Advertiser: §Briscoe Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Instructional Designer- (12 month fixed term, parental leave cover) Briscoe Group, Auckland§ § We can offer you:§- The chance to develop and design engaging and innovative learning / e-learning solutions§- The opportunity to join a team of dedicated HR professionals partnering with the business to deliver positive change§- A role where you can contribute to the ongoing success of the business and develop your skills as a learning and development professional§ §Based at our support office in Morningside we are seeking an Instructional Designer, who is ready to take the next step in their career and join us in the dynamic world of retail. This is a great opportunity to show us what you can do and leverage your first rate design and implementation ability. Our brands are household names throughout New Zealand: Briscoes Homeware, Rebel Sport and Living & Giving. With 86 stores throughout New Zealand, our focus is on bringing great products and value to our customers. With a strong culture that recognises contributions and rewards performance, we take pride in the development of our people to become excellent retailers.§ §The Instructional Designer is responsible for:§- Helping key stakeholders to identify learning objectives and recommend the most suitable methods for§- Identifying and communicating content of learning activities§- Delivering training and learning within our current suite of approaches across our business§- Assessment of competency against the expected learning outcomes§- Designing and developing learning and e-learning content that has impact, is interesting and engaging§- Facilitation of e-learning and classroom based lessons§- Assisting the HR team to grow capability across the business§- Provide reporting on the performance of learning initiatives§- Provision of advice and guidance on all e-learning related matters§ §To be successful in this role you will need:§- Superior written and verbal communication skills§- Strong stakeholder and relationship management skills§- Knowledge of instructional design theory and adult learning principles§- Expertise in educational design software, Articulate, Camtasia, and Axonify experience an advantage§- A high level of proactivity and initiative, adaptability and resilience§- A tertiary qualification in Human Resources or a related field, or significant experience in a similar Learning and Development role§- An appreciation for and commitment to Health and Safety in the workplace§- Eligibility to work in New Zealand or hold New Zealand Permanent Residency or Citizenship§ § § §Please note: This role will commence in January 2021§ § § §Position closes: 18 September 2020§ §If you have any questions please contact Rebecca Fisher- Talent and Recruitment Manager on §rebecca.fisher@briscoegroup.co.nz§Briscoe Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and a proud supporter of Cure Kids.§All applications will be treated with strictest confidentiality.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50719997.txt	§Senior Human Resources Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Human Resources Advisor§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$86,308 - $106,616 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§What you will do§As a Senior HR Advisor you will be responsible for supporting, coaching and advising NZDF leaders to enable them to make strategic people decisions and manage operational matters as they arise. You will work collaboratively with the team and the wider People Capability Portfolio to drive innovative solutions that meet the needs of our customers.§What we need § §We are seeking the talent and skills of a knowledgeable and experienced HR practitioner to join our Trentham HR Advisory team who deliver broad HR services to the NZDF. Reporting to the HR Site Lead you will be joining a professional, cohesive and supportive team.§There aren't many roles where HR practitioners can make a difference to the country they live in, and in this role you will be offered that rare opportunity. The position is unique as you will be managing portfolios that have a mix of both military and civilian staff, working with our Commanders and Managers on all people-related matters. This is a busy and varied role where no two days are the same, and your ability to influence and build trust will help you establish and maintain strong working relationships.§You may already be a Senior HR Advisor or an HR Advisor ready for the next step in your career.§You will bring to this role a strong foundation in generalist HR comprising of:§A good practical base of New Zealand employment law;§Employment relations;§Remuneration;§Change management;§Risk management; and§General day-to-day HR advice and policy interpretation.§You will be pragmatic, resilient and equipped with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are able to engage with a diverse mix of people at all levels and are comfortable influencing without authority. You also possess a strong service delivery focus and can quickly come to grips with new systems, policies and procedures.§ §Who we are§HR Advisory Services (HRAS) provides accurate, responsive, fit for purpose solutions and advice on all people matters aligned to the strategic direction of NZDF. The team provides leadership and support across all facets of human resources, both strategic and operational, and is a key enabler to the success of our leaders.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§Great benefits for you and your family§; §Full time ongoing work;§Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;§5 weeks annual leave per year;§Onsite carparking.§How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Lisa Kennedy on §(04) 527 5042§.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Monday 26 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50720951.txt	§Health and Safety/HR Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety/HR Officer§§Advertiser: §Affco NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§AFFCO New Zealand is involved in manufacturing predominantly beef, sheep and leather products from 12 processing plants in New Zealand servicing global markets. We are currently seeking an Health and Safety/HR Officer to provide support and advice to our Castlecliff site leadership team.§AFFCO Castlecliff are seeking a talented, detail-oriented and highly organised Health and Safety/HR Officer to join our team based at our Castlecliff site in Whanganui.§The primary function of the role is to support, inform and engage people leaders so their teams remain healthy and go home safe every day. This role champions the reporting of near-misses, incidents and accidents onsite; coaching and assisting people leaders to investigate, review and design new controls as necessary. In addition to this, you will work alongside our Head Office HR and plant management teams to provide best practice HR advice and support in areas such as recruitment, induction, training and employee relations.§Health and Safety key responsibilities include the following:§Partner with site leadership to effectively identify, eliminate, minimise or control risks to an acceptable level§Ensure site compliance with health and safety standards, procedures and systems§Manage the incident and injury investigation and reporting process onsite§Track, analyse and report on health and safety patterns and trends§Drive employee engagement and participation in the management of occupational health and safety§Provide guidance and coaching to individuals on site to foster collective ownership of a safety culture§Champion a continuous improvement culture and instil best practice across all aspects of the health and safety function§Human Resourcing key responsibilities include the following:§Maintaining robust employee records§Recruitment, on boarding and off boarding processes§Performance management, disciplinary processes and investigations§The ideal candidate will have the following experience, qualifications and skills:§Prior experience working in a high-risk environment§A formal qualification in a related field, or commensurate experience§Sound knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 and its application in the workplace§Strong relationship building, influencing and problem resolution skills§Ability to prioritise tasks through good time management and organisation skills§Professional, proactive attitude with excellent interpersonal skills§We are looking for a person that can juggle multiple complex priorities and deadlines. Previous exposure to recruiting, injury management, risk assessment, incident investigation, report writing and the implementation of 'best practice' Health and Safety and HR procedures would be advantageous.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50720045.txt	§Film and TV Extras/Talent Booker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Film and TV Extras/Talent Booker§§Advertiser: §BGT Actors, Models and Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§Welcome to BGT Actors Models and Talent!§ § §BGT Actors Models and Talent, next to Auckland Film Studios, is the most trusted and successful talent agency in New Zealand.§ §Supplying talent Nationwide to the NZ film and television industry, we've recently been involved in such productions as Mission Impossible Fallout, The Shannara Chronicles, The Meg, and Ash vs Evil Dead, with shows like Shortland Street, Westside, and Brokenwood Mysteries lending a constant stream of work.§ § § §We're on the hunt for an exceptional person to join our small, highly motivated team as a full-time Talent Booker.§ § § § §Are you our new Talent Booker dynamo?§ § §Our ideal candidate would be an experienced talent booker with 2 years talent booking under your belt.§ §BUT..... If you don't already have experience then you will be a self-starter, be able to prioritise work at lighting speed, highly organised with outstanding time management skills. You will liaise with talent, casting directors and film companies producing New Zealand's top TV series and feature films, so you'll need exceptional communication skills, utilising prompt and professional email and phone correspondence.§ §You will manage a wide range of Actors, Models & Talent in a supremely professional manner and will promote our image to the public and to the entertainment industry at large.§ §This is a busy and high-pressure environment, so you must be confident to work both independently as well as part of our team. Although your main office hours will be 9am to 5.30pm Monday to Friday, you will be on-call and available to work weekends and after-hours whenever necessary.§ §Ideally, you should have experience in recruitment or have a sales background. You should also have a basic understanding of the film industry, including the intense, long hours that productions involve. On the technical side of things, you should be a fast typist, proficient with Office software, and be comfortable using all Apple products (Imac, Ipad, Iphones as that's what we use all the time).§ §You must have a valid work visa or NZ residency to work for us. We offer a competitive salary and staff training.§ §If this sounds like you, please email §sarah@bgt.nz§ with a cover letter telling us why you're the ideal candidate with your CV.§ §We'll be in touch once we've short-listed our applications.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Company phone.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Excellent written and communication skills are a must.§ §Must be able to prioritise and handle multiple TV shows and Movies a long with all the talent involved.§ §Must have an excellent work ethic and good moral compass.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50745788.txt	§HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Salary + benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§We’re one of the largest beverage companies in New Zealand and partner of choice for some of the world’s leading brands. Our huge portfolio includes much-loved brands such as Coca-Cola, Sprite, Pump, Keri Juice, Jim Beam, Canadian Club, Barista Brothers, and many more! As one of two §HR Advisors§, this is an opportunity to provide efficient and proactive HR and ER support to a business of over 1100 employees. Be part of a team that works to create outstanding employee experiences!§ §The Role§In this busy §HR Advisor§ role you’re the first point of call for all HR related queries, building the businesses understanding of policies and procedures, and guiding them on people-related matters. You’ll work closely with the HR Consulting team with a number of activities including:§ § § §End to end HR support for Performance Plans, disciplinaries, and first line ER cases§ §Supporting the talent process by managing terminations, approving vacancies, and proofing contracts when required§ §Managing employee requests for extended sick leave, parental leave, career breaks§ §Managing the employee exit process, including exit interviews and reporting§ §Management of the centralised HR Inbox and respond to queries from first line managers§ §Support for cyclical process such as performance reviews, remuneration review, and policy updates.        § § §This role will support the operational side of our business (Supply Chain) as well as our core Corporate fucntions. This is a permanent position reporting into the Head of HR Business Partnering and joins a high-performing HR team of 20+. You’ll support a team of three HR Business Partners across the business.§ §About You:§In this fast-paced environment, your energy and urgency will ensure you are a success! You have incredible communication and relationship skills that will allow you to build rapport and trust with managers and employees.§ §You will need at least 4 years’ experience in generalist HR, with a strong understanding of HR systems ad processes - work in an operational or technical environment is highly sought after. Experience in running and leading ER cases such as PIP's, disciplinaries, and health cases is essential. Exposure to Employment Law will put you a step above the rest, and some union understanding is an advantage. § §What’s in it for you?§Alongside a fantastic salary and Kiwisaver, you’ll get access to our company share plan, AMP Super, insurance, gym subsidies, and staff discounts. Based at our Mount Wellington Oasis, we also offer free carparking and plenty of complimentary product – it doesn’t get much better than that! Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in. Who knows where your Amatil NZ career path will take you! § §About Us:§Coca-Cola Amatil NZ is exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ's Best Employers for now 5 years in a row!  If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll say our people, our brands, and our culture. We have an inclusive work environment, and actively embrace the diversity of people, our ideas, their talents, and experiences. Our vision and values are at the heart of all that we do, with a team truly committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees - just as we are for our customers and our consumers.§ §Ready for a job that makes a real impact? Join a dynamic culture where hard work is recognised and appreciated! We’re an innovative business full of real possibilities – join us and find the #realyou.§ §Hit the APPLY button now and take the first step towards a rewarding HR career! Applications close 29th October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50753693.txt	§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§Advertiser: §Kono NZ LP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term §    §    §    §      §        §          §Based in Nelson, Wakatū Incorporation is a Māori-family owned organisation with approximately 4,000 shareholders who descend from the traditional Māori land owners of the Nelson, Tasman and Golden Bay regions.§          §A business of land and sea, Wakatū has four parts: Manaaki, people and culture; Whenua, land and water space; Kono, an award-winning food and drinks producer and exporter, and Auora a consumer-focused, health-solutions business.§          §Guided by Te Pae Tawhiti, our long-term intergenerational vision, and deeply held values of rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, whanaungatanga, kaitiakitanga, hihiritanga and pono, Wakatū manages its assets in a way that will build on its legacy for the generations to come. We are passionate about employing our whānau and encourage our Owners to consider if this role could be a good fit for them.§          §We are looking for an HR Advisor to join our team. You'll champion good information management practices within the people group.§About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§An ongoing continuous improvement mindset and drive to make our people content, information and processes more seamless and simpler for our people.§HR related background would be advantageous, but not essential§Knowledge of graphic, process or user experience design§Design thinking or related experience§Understanding of information management principles§Experience leading or collaborating in project work§Ability to think critically about processes and content§§We are looking for people who have strong attention to detail and are customer service oriented. You will be compassionate and empathic and able to put employees at the centre of your work.§Applications close | Rā Katinga: Tuesday the 27th of October 2020§For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). jobText: TXT/50730774.txt	§Human Resources Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Manager§§Advertiser: §Clutha District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§We are looking for a leadership professional ready to manage and guide our most important resource - our people!§  §We are Clutha District Council.§ We are a team passionate about our region, protecting our natural environment and supporting our wider community. Are you ready to be a part of our team?§  §We're looking for a Human Resources Manager to provide strategic and general human resources services and advice to our management team and staff.§  §With a headcount around 130 and 100 FTE's, we're a diverse team that includes new hires, long standing stalwarts and many in between. We're also a growing workforce with a number of new positions that, along with a turnover of 10%, is driving our current positive recruitment situation.§  §You'll need a strong working knowledge of employment legislation, best practice and corporate requirements and be able to help Council's payroll function by providing employment and pay information and advice.§  §You will need to have:§ § §An appropriate tertiary qualification eg HR or Business Management combined with significant (at least 5 years) HR/Administrative experience at a senior level, or 10-15 years relevant Human Resources experience at a senior level.§ §Knowledge and application of major HR legislation and processes.§ §Awareness of local government legislation such as LGA, LGOIMA.§ §Staff management experience.§ §Project/event management experience.§ §In return we can offer you a management role right at the living heart of our organisation, in touch with our people. Because we're a small team there is hands-on stuff as well and every day will be different.§  §You'll be part of a friendly workplace culture and supportive team that does varied and meaningful work that makes a difference to our communities. If this is what you're looking for, we'd love to hear from you.§  §For confidential enquiries please contact§  §Steve Hill ph §03 419 0271§  §To apply for this job go to: cluthadc.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Current-Vacancies & enter ref code: 5244284. Applications close 09 November 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50728023.txt	§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Are you looking for a new opportunity that offers much more than the average Payroll Manager role?§Wellington City Council (WCC) have an opportunity for an experienced Payroll, Remuneration and HRIS Manager to join the team reporting to the Manager HR Services. As a leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities".§The Payroll and HRIS team contribute to this vision by providing accurate and timely payroll services for WCC, Wellington Water and some Council Controlled Organisations including the Zoo, Zealandia and part time staff for Wellington Venues. In addition the team deliver HRIS system development to improve our customer's experience, implement a fit for purpose remuneration and benefits strategy and framework that supports our employee value proposition and develop robust and HR analytics and reporting systems that enable our leaders to make informed people related decisions.§This role requires a customer centric, delivery focussed person who is comfortable working and providing services in a complex and diverse organisation. You will be innovative in your thinking, champion continuous improvement and be flexible in your approach to meet customer needs.§Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for§?§A broad range of experience with HRIS systems, preferably with TechnologyOne§Experience managing and improving HRIS systems and tools to meet both customer needs and legislative requirements.§Experience developing and implementing remuneration and reward strategies, systems and process across multiple employment contract types.§The ability to build robust HR metrics, trend data and analysis for the business to support better decision making.§A high level of Payroll expertise (technical, functional and operational) and experience in managing and improving Payroll processes.§A good working knowledge of the relevant employment legislation that relates to the payroll particularly the Holidays Act.§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment.§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including: He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do Whakapai ake - We're always improving Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§For further information please checkout the position description or contact §Sarah.Kirkland@wcc.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday 18 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50743395.txt	§Health and Safety Coordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Coordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$60,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§ §Brand new role – loads of scope to make your mark and take ownership§ §Intermediate level – suit someone with 3-5 years H & S experience§ §Stable, family-owned global company in growth mode§ §Manage EVERY aspect of H & S for two separate businesses in the Group§ §Vestner NZ Ltd is a German-owned New Zealand company encompassing Advantage Doors and Vestner, a leading designer and manufacturer of lifts and elevators. This exciting new role is based in Auckland but you will support both operations across 3 different locations, including a branch in Christchurch.§ §We are on the hunt for a quick-thinking and competent H & S Coordinator looking to step up and manage all H & S aspects for a small team of around 40 staff. Due to growth and the need to increase the focus on H & S best practice and compliance, Vestner are committed to a full time, dedicated H & S person. Being a new role, you will have full autonomy to review, assess and make recommendations to senior management. It will then be your job to implement and manage these recommendations to ensure total safety of Vestner’s staff, customers and sites.§ §In a nutshell, you will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure full compliance with all legislative and regulatory provisions through planning and managing training, conducting audits, monitoring processes, reviewing and reporting on data, undertaking investigations and actively facilitating H & S meetings.§ §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:§ § §Review and audit all current H & S practices and activities to ensure they meet industry standards and compliance§ §Prepare data and reports for management, customers and the appropriate authorities§ §Work closely alongside an external H & S Consultant and undertake all identified tasks§ §Plan and conduct comprehensive induction programmes for new staff§ §Oversee site inspections to ensure compliance, train employees and maintain documentation of all activities§ §Work with management to ensure that all H & S guidelines are implemented and enforced§ §All administration tasks associated with a busy and ever-changing work environment§ §To be successful, you must have:§ § §A background of 3+ years in a similar H & S role within the industrial equipment or construction/building sector, or at least have a strong understanding of what regulations are relevant to the industry§ §Experience drafting and implementing H & S processes, systems and procedures, as well as preparing detailed reports§ §High-level interpersonal skills with a confident and professional client-centric approach§ §A sound working knowledge of New Zealand Health and Safety legislation and regulations§ §The ability to work quickly and methodically under pressure without supervision§ §Naturally technically-minded with appropriate IT skills§ §Highly organised work practices with excellent attention to detail§ §A confident approach to implement and embed new processes and systems, as well as being diplomatic and forceful when necessary§ §Relevant H & S qualifications and training is highly desirable§ §A full driver's license is essential as you may need to visit clients’ sites all over the country, in addition to Vestner’s various sites in both Auckland and Christchurch§ §NZ Residency or a Valid NZ Work permit is essential§ §So if you know you have the right mix of skills and want to be part of a well-established and trusted company, we would love to hear from you.  Please send your CV and cover letter today.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50740468.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor - Waitoa UHT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor - Waitoa UHT§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§ §Work on uplifting Fonterra’s health and safety capabilities§ §Showcase your technical health and safety expertise§ §Join New Zealand’s largest business in a role with real variety, autonomy and impact§ §The opportunity§                                                                  §This is truly not your standard H&S Advisor role! If you are looking for a role with plenty of autonomy and variety then this might be the next opportunity for you.§ §In this role as Health and Safety Advisor you will be supporting our diverse Waitoa UHT site in the Waikato. You will work towards the uplift of our health and safety capability. while guiding and coaching our staff, to own health and safety responsibilities and follow regulatory compliance. Working closely with the National Health and Safety Manager you will directly liaise with staff and guide on best practice health and safety. Key focus of your role will be to support the pro-active management of risks, emergency response plans, and upskilling the business in health and safety.§ §What you’ll bring and develop§You will not only have strong technical health and safety knowledge but will also know how to guide and influence staff across best possible health and safety practices. We are after someone collaborative and happy to be hands-on and visible to the business. Ideally coming from a manufacturing background, will help you get up to speed in this role and establish trust.§To make an impact in this role you will have:§• Technical health and safety expertise ideally in plant operations§• Ability to instil trust across a diverse workforce and establish meaningful relationships with stakeholders§ §• Hold a relevant Health and Safety certificate or diploma (NEBOSH or equivalent)§• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment § §• Excellent time management and communication skills§ § §Our story§ §Proudly New Zealand owned and operated, we are a dairy nutrition co-operative made up of farming families. Collaboration, innovation and passion were the cornerstone of our creation and continue to drive all of us at Fonterra.§ §Our dairy know-how and innovation capability mean we can do amazing things with our milk to enhance people’s lives, creating goodness from our farms to over 140 countries around the world. We are purpose lead, empowering people to create goodness for generations.§ §Sustainable farming is at the heart of our strategy. We are committed to farming in a way that regenerates our farms and the environment.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50656732.txt	§Privacy Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Privacy Officer§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Law Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Privacy Officer§ §New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Tu§re o Aotearoa, Wellington§ §About the Law Society§The New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa is the professional body for barristers and solicitors in New Zealand. The Law Society regulates all lawyers practising in New Zealand and is the membership organisation for practising lawyers. With 13 branch offices throughout the country, the Law Society is the Kaitiaki (guardian) of the practise of law in Aotearoa New Zealand and the consumers of legal services.§ §About the role§We are seeking an outstanding candidate to join our People & Culture team to work as a trusted advisor across the entire business and we will provide you with great exposure that will challenge and grow your development.§ §As Privacy Officer you will partner with the business to champion privacy awareness ensuring the Law Society develops and maintains robust privacy frameworks that satisfy legal requirements.§This is a part time role working 20 hours per week. It is important that the Law Society can attract, support, and retain quality staff, one of the ways we achieve this is by offering employees the flexibility to manage their work/life balance.  At the Law Society we provide the choice to work a combination of days and/or hours in the office and at home as part of our flexible working arrangements policy§ §The ideal applicant will:§ § §Ensure the Law Society develops and maintains a robust privacy framework that satisfies relevant legal requirements and standards§ §Champions privacy awareness and understanding across the business§ §Identified, develops, and maintains appropriate privacy policies, procedures, training, systems, and tools to achieve and evidence compliance§ §Providing advice on privacy issues, impact assessments, incidents, breaches, and complaint handling (including requests for access and/or correction)§ §Assisting the business as required to address complaints about possible breaches of privacy§ §Delivers timely, relevant, and insightful reporting to leadership teams and appropriate forums§ § § §The Law Society is committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion and is keen to ensure that appointments reflect New Zealand’s multicultural society. Applications from a diverse range of backgrounds are encouraged.§ § §For a confidential discussion, additional information please contact our People & Culture team (§human.resources@lawsociety.org.nz§).§ § §For the §position description§ please visit the vacancy listing on our website (https://www.lawsociety.org.nz/professional-practice/legal-jobs/privacy-officer-wellington/)§ § § §If you would like to apply, please complete the §application form§ (found on our website link above) and submit this together with your §cover letter §and§ CV §to §recruitment@lawsociety.org.nz§.§ § § §Applications close 5pm Wednesday 28 October 2020§ § § §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50745618.txt	§Health and Safety Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Consultant§§Advertiser: §Canterbury Employers' Chamber of Commerce§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§The Canterbury Employers’ Chamber of Commerce (The Chamber) empowers people in business. We have over 2,600 member organisations who are at the heart of everything we do and are continually evolving our services to better support them in a rapidly changing environment. §We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Health and Safety Consultant to join our team. The successful candidate will be an expert in their field; well-versed in health and safety legislation and across upcoming policy and market changes, and understand the impact of these on businesses, their directors, owners, managers and staff.§You will be confident consulting with senior managers and executives of large organisations through to the owners and managers of smaller businesses across a range of industry sectors. You will also have strong verbal communication skills and be confident presenting seminars and workshops, with the proven ability to develop comprehensive training materials. §Business development will be a key component of this role, so you will have experience in identifying and securing new business development opportunities and meeting budget targets, creating and maintaining strong relationships, and proactively adding value to businesses. §To be a good fit for this role, you will be self-directed and open to and excited about change, enjoy collaborating with others and have a passion for supporting and growing local business. You will also thrive on variety, be an effective multi-tasker and perform well under pressure without compromising on detail.§Working alongside our Business Development Manager, you will:§Deliver H&S advice, training and consultancy services, including workplace inspections, and the development and implementation of H&S management systems and auditing§Proactively secure new business opportunities for H&S training and consultancy§Develop and deliver public and in-house H&S training, both in-person and online§Develop new resources and services in response to and in anticipation of market requirements §Build and maintain relationships with external agencies to assist in providing professional and timely advice and services §Advocate on the behalf of the local business community on health and safety issues at a local and national level§Achieve increased efficiency, strong financial outcomes and impact for our H&S services§Provide internal H&S support for The Chamber§Ensure The Chamber is well-represented in industry, and seen as a H&S expert in Waitaha Canterbury and Aotearoa New Zealand.§The right person will have the following skills and experience:§Minimum of five years’ experience in a health and safety role §High level of health and safety knowledge, including relevant legislation§Ability to understand business requirements and tailor services to meet business needs§Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills§Demonstrated ability to network and build and maintain effective client relationships§Financial acumen, with experience in business development and meeting sales targets§Experience in delivering high level customer service both internally and externally §General understanding of and interest in business and the Waitaha Canterbury economy§Relevant vocational or tertiary qualification.§It is an exciting time to be joining The Chamber as we are actively engaged in a period of strategic transformation. The successful candidate will be offered an attractive remuneration package which will be made up of a base retainer and commission. We also offer a flexible work environment for the right candidate. §If you enjoy working in a progressive and dynamic organisation, please request the position description from Rachel McCann email: rachelm@cecc.org.nz [link removed] before applying with your CV and a covering letter before 5pm, Friday 30 October 2020. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§
