jobTitle: Health & Safety Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50730103.txt	§Health & Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §Emergent & Co Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health & Safety Advisor §      §Health and Safety Advisor role working with a great team in a fast-paced environment.  You will be an experienced Health and Safety Advisor with the ability to work alongside the business and drive culture change to create best practice safe working environments.  Working in a high-profile high-risk business this is a great role in the next step in your career.  § §  § Key experience and deliverables will include§ • Deliver a range of Health and Safety services in order to support and empower managers and staff§ • Drive best practice initiatives, creating a continuous improvement environment§ • Develop a proactive safety culture through ownership and accountability by all§ • Develop and implement an annual, regional health and safety plan to support the national strategy§ • Support the Health & Safety Manager in the development and delivery of the health, safety, and wellness strategy§ • Provide input into training plans§ § You will be an experienced Health and Safety Advisor looking for the next step in your career.  You will be joining a team with a great culture and will continue to develop and coach staff around good Health & Safety practices. You will be hands-on and work with stakeholders to implement a best practice approach. §   § For more information please contact Nick Logan at Emergent & Co Ltd on §09 359 9033§ during office hours. § It is a requirement that you must already hold a NZ Passport or valid working Visa to apply for this role.  § For more information on Emergent & Co Ltd please visit www.emergent.co.nz §      §Nick logan§021748544§ §    §  §§§Health and Safety Advisor role working with a great team in a fast-paced environment.  You will be an experienced Health and Safety Advisor with the ability to work alongside the business and drive culture change to create best practice safe working environments.  Working in a high-profile high-risk business this is a great role in the next step in your career.  § §  § Key experience and deliverables will include§ • Deliver a range of Health and Safety services in order to support and empower managers and staff§ • Drive best practice initiatives, creating a continuous improvement environment§ • Develop a proactive safety culture through ownership and accountability by all§ • Develop and implement an annual, regional health and safety plan to support the national strategy§ • Support the Health & Safety Manager in the development and delivery of the health, safety, and wellness strategy§ • Provide input into training plans§ § You will be an experienced Health and Safety Advisor looking for the next step in your career.  You will be joining a team with a great culture and will continue to develop and coach staff around good Health & Safety practices. You will be hands-on and work with stakeholders to implement a best practice approach. §   § For more information please contact Nick Logan at Emergent & Co Ltd on §09 359 9033§ during office hours. § It is a requirement that you must already hold a NZ Passport or valid working Visa to apply for this role.  § For more information on Emergent & Co Ltd please visit www.emergent.co.nz§§§§

If you would like to join our team, please APPLY now.§        § To learn more about working with Programmed, we encourage you to visit our website.§      §      §      §    §    §programmed.co.nz§  §§§We are currently looking for an Account Manager to join our recruitment team!§ § The role of Account Manager provides high quality service outcomes to our valued customers through the successful, safe and smooth delivery of customer service activities.§ § The position offers the following:§Full Time hours§Monday to Friday§Based in Auckland City§Working along side a fun team§Great pay rate§In order to be successful in this position, you will possess the following:§Proven experience in fast paced recruiting§Good at compliance§Team guidance§Strong in Client KPI's§Negotiation and Contact compliance§Organic growth focused§Customer relationship management and Customer Service§Business development§Operational Management§Health and Safety compliant§Proven ability to multi task, plan and organise§Negotiate outcomes and manage conflict§Data management, administration and reporting§Reliability and Trustworthiness§Reliable transport§Outstanding attitude, and a willingness to learn and develop§You will also be required to complete a Drug and Alcohol screen and Ministry of Justice check. Applicants must have verifiable work rights and eligibility to work in New Zealand.§ § If you want to work for a great company who values their employees and offers on going work, then apply today.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50726237.txt	§Health & Safety Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Safety Consultant§§Advertiser: §RCR Infrastructure Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About the business§ § §RCR Infrastructure Limited is 100% Kiwi owned and operated, with a lineage that dates to 1954. Returned to Kiwi ownership in early 2019,  the RCR business is a nimble and fast-paced business determined to be the first-choice and national provider of planned maintenance, reactive service, minor and major project, along with IQP building compliance services. We currently work in the HVAC, refrigeration and electrical industries with branches in Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga, Wellington, Christchurch and a well-established network of subcontractors across regional New Zealand. § § § §We pride ourselves on delivering great outcomes for our customers by continuous improvement. Our difference is based around §People our Taonga §- treasure, our §Process - w§e strive for learning and development, our §Technology -§ investing in making our workforce 100% digital and mobile. And lastly, our §Approach -§ open and honest communication with a positive culture, as we build trust and strong relationships with our customers. § § §About the role§ § §RCR Infrastructure Limited is looking for a full-time Health and Safety Consultant to join our team on fixed-term 6 months contract, with a possibility of becoming a permanent position. The role is responsible for managing all aspects of Health & Safety, implementing processes & protocol measures and providing advice to mainly RCR but also to Stonewood Group commercial and Stonewood Homes residential development.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §In RCR, we offer an active office environment, and excellent remuneration. The ability for personal growth and shaping the way systems are delivered means every individual can bring their own expertise to the team.§ §If this sounds like you then don't wait, register your expression of interest today. Please copy and paste the below link to your browser and APPLY now!§ §https://stonewoodgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=340§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Key responsibilities§ §To review the health and safety policies and system § §Governance and compliance of Health and Safety§Health and Safety training§Audit, Risk and Incident management§Health and Safety management system§Reporting and Performance measures§ §To review the below H&S under Stonewood Group and Stonewood Homes§ §Audit check Main Contractor health and safety on site§Review the health and safety policies and systems§Provide health and safety improvement§Advisory to Stonewood Homes Franchisor§ §Skills and experience§ §A relevant health & safety qualification§At least 2-5 years experience in a Health & Safety management role§Experience in the construction industry preferred§Knowledge and experience in the ongoing development of H&S Systems and projects, legislation and developing and presenting reporting in New Zealand§A high level of computer literacy, competent with MS Office Suite and Safety related software§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§Adaptable, able to work in a diverse and fast-paced work environment§Able to build good working relationship across the business§ § § §§§§

Fundamental to the role will be your ability to work with and within our staff and sub-contractor teams, understand our business and provide a practical and solutions focused approach to our drive for constant improvement.§ §Reporting to our Regional HSE Manager, you will assist our site teams with both project and resource needs. jobText: TXT/50733999.txt	§Recruitment Consultant - Legal (Non-Professional)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant - Legal (Non-Professional)§§Advertiser: §Rice Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Consultant - Legal (Non-Professional) §      §      §This established agency has been operating in the Auckland market for over 10 years, recently they have undergone a management buy out. This means that they have total control on operations, full autonomy on direction and are agile enough to make decisions that benefit their consultants. The first strategic improvement to business concerns the legal team. They want to establish themselves as a separate specialist firm, leading the charge is one of Auckland's star legal recruiters who has already gathered critical acclaim. The position would be underneath this leader in the non-professional support sector; legal secretaries, legal executives, office managers, trust accountants, HR advisors all within the legal vertical. It's a fast paced and well connected industry that requires a commercially savvy consultant that's able to connect dots quickly; understand the different businesses areas practice areas. A consultants that can identify a requirement once a candidate has moved to a new role. You will need to be direct but also personable with a history of successfully managing and developing relationships. The role requires a team player who wants to join an exciting and vibrant team on the aim to be the #1 specialist legal agency in Auckland. Experience in legal recruitment is preferred however as there are similarities between office support and professional services desks these consultants will be considered, applicants with no agency experience will not be. With a solid client base, a new office and great leadership they are ready to take 2021 by storm. The desk remained profitable even during the worst of the inactivity in the market with previous years hitting $400K+ so it's a fantastic opportunity for a consultant to earn a greater amount of their placement in a comm scheme that is geared towards the consultant. They promote flexibility and encourage a work from home day at least once a week and with and although the legal team is small the wider agency has 11 consultants who are supportive and collaborative. Feel free to flick me a message on LinkedIn if you would like to find out more. §      §Scott Burnett§+64 21 293 4913§scott@rice.co.nz§ §    §    §  §§§This established agency has been operating in the Auckland market for over 10 years, recently they have undergone a management buy out. This means that they have total control on operations, full autonomy on direction and are agile enough to make decisions that benefit their consultants. The first strategic improvement to business concerns the legal team. They want to establish themselves as a separate specialist firm, leading the charge is one of Auckland's star legal recruiters who has already gathered critical acclaim. The position would be underneath this leader in the non-professional support sector; legal secretaries, legal executives, office managers, trust accountants, HR advisors all within the legal vertical. It's a fast paced and well connected industry that requires a commercially savvy consultant that's able to connect dots quickly; understand the different businesses areas practice areas. A consultants that can identify a requirement once a candidate has moved to a new role. You will need to be direct but also personable with a history of successfully managing and developing relationships. The role requires a team player who wants to join an exciting and vibrant team on the aim to be the #1 specialist legal agency in Auckland. Experience in legal recruitment is preferred however as there are similarities between office support and professional services desks these consultants will be considered, applicants with no agency experience will not be. With a solid client base, a new office and great leadership they are ready to take 2021 by storm. The desk remained profitable even during the worst of the inactivity in the market with previous years hitting $400K+ so it's a fantastic opportunity for a consultant to earn a greater amount of their placement in a comm scheme that is geared towards the consultant. jobText: TXT/50728310.txt	§Senior Health and Safety Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Health and Safety Analyst§§Advertiser: §GFS Risk Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§GFS is an award-winning risk management company that specialises in security, safety, and medical risks for film, TV  and digital productions around the world. We are seeking a Senior Health and Safety Analyst to join our expanding team.§ §GFS is headquartered in Queenstown and operates globally with large network of consultants.  We apply international, best practices standards to assessing risk, formulating risk management strategies, and identifying appropriate solutions for implementing plans and protecting productions on set or location.§ §We are led by an Emmy Award-winning producer and our team comes from government, military, legal services, and healthcare backgrounds, with experience working in law enforcement and medical services, and in some of the world’s most complex trouble spots.  Our clients are the major global industry-leaders in screen production.§ §Our vacancy is for a highly motivated, skilled, and experienced senior health and safety analyst.  The role requires the analysis of health and safety elements pertaining to and associated with risk for screen productions and other sectors.  The role be responsible for overseeing health and safety assessments, and consultants on location world wide, and will manage other team members. § §Applicants must have a minimum of a Bachelor First-Class Honours or Masters qualification, proven experience in meeting deadlines for report writing, and at least five years professional experience (ideally in the risk management sector with international context). The successful candidate will also have:§ §Up-to-date knowledge of workplace health and safety, especially Covid-19 and other current issues affecting the safety of workplaces.§Health and Safety qualifications for example NEBOSH or similar§An interest in screen production and geo-politics.§Excellent communication and presentation skills.§ §In exchange, we offer a dynamic and exciting full-time position in a highly motivated team. If you’re seeking a new challenge in Queenstown, we look forward to hearing from you.§ §We are also currently seeking a Senior Security Analyst. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50732032.txt	§Head of Health, Safety, Security & Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Health, Safety, Security & Environment§§Advertiser: §Xero§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. § § § §At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.§ § § §At Xero, we value the physical health, safety and security of our Xeros as well as reducing the impact our offices and people have on the environment. As part of our holistic approach you will partner with the Wellbeing team to deliver on our commitment to support our Xeros and therefore our customers and partners to flourish and grow.§ § § §This newly created role is an exciting opportunity to join the Workplace Experience (WX) team at Xero to create a ‘centre of excellence’ for health & safety, physical security and environmental sustainability. You will spearhead the successful implementation of strategies that allows Xero to mature and excel within these important areas.   § § § § § §What you'll do§ §The Head of Health, Safety, Security & Environment (HSSE) is responsible for developing, implementing and managing innovative systems, programs and education strategies to ensure that Xero creates a safe and beautiful workplace experience in line with Xero’s values and purpose.  You will achieve this through….  § § § §- Engaging with senior leaders across the business to build their capability to role model and prioritise safety, security and environmental good practice as part of day to day life at Xero.§ §- Designing and implementing a framework for improving our management of health and safety.§ §- Work closely with the Head of Wellbeing to ensure that our approach to physical health & safety is complementary to their work on wellbeing.§ §- Be the Workplace Experience lead for delivering and improving upon the physical & environmental objectives of Xero’s ISO27001 management system.§ §- Measure, monitor and report on carbon footprint contributing activities and drive reduction initiatives as part of our Net Zero @ Xero program.§ §- Designing and managing a dashboard of metrics to demonstrate the impact of HSSE strategies which will form part of the regular reporting structure.§ §- Compile and present regular communications and insights to the Workplace Experience Leadership Team, Xero Leadership Team, Board and other key stakeholders.§ § § §What You’ll Bring § §You will have proven experience developing and leading health, safety, security and environmental programs in a similar leadership role.  Alongside the ability to think strategically and creatively to deliver ongoing improvement within these areas, you will also bring with you… § § § §- Authentic leadership, a demonstrated ability to be highly collaborative and work in a team environment while influencing across multiple teams.§ §- Demonstrated project and program management experience working with a variety of stakeholders preferably on a global scale.§ §- Proven ability to build strong and beneficial working relationships with senior managers, business leaders and key stakeholders.Experience of implementing one or more of the following frameworks; OHSAS18001, ISO45001, ISO14001, ISO14067, ISO14064, ISO27001. Or other similar or related standard.§ §- Strong commercial acumen and the ability to leverage and communicate data and metrics to ensure effective implementation and measurement.§ §- A passion for helping people fulfill their potential.§ §- Thought leadership, analysis and presentation of trends in the areas of health, safety, security and environment as well as staying abreast of best practices and benchmark leading companies.§ § § § § §Why Xero?§ §At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package including shares plus a range of leave options to suit your well-being. Our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development and you’ll get to work with the latest technology.  § §Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a member of Pride in Diversity, in recognition of our inclusive workplace. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You will be responsible for building and embedding our H&S culture both internally and with our broad range of sub-contractors.§ §Ensuring regulatory compliance, you will keep up to date with changes in current legislation and implement such changes and provide advice where relevant.§ §Knowledge of Hazard identification & Risk Management is key, developing and implementing risk controls.§ § § §Reporting to the Managing Director, this key role is part of our Senior Management team. You will provide Health, Safety & Wellbeing specialist support and assist in driving the pragmatic delivery of a wide range of H&S advice and services, including systems and planning, legislative compliance, injury management and prevention, incident investigations, risk assessments, training and communication.§  §Reporting to the Health & Safety Manager and part of the People & Culture team, this role will provide you with a supportive environment where you will have the opportunity to develop your knowledge and exposure to a huge range of H&S matters.§  §We are looking for someone who will coach and influence managers and employees on health safety and wellbeing, whilst modelling and driving the Health & Safety culture within our organisation.§  §Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:§  §Coaching and assisting stakeholders to exercise their Health, Safety & wellbeing responsibilities and driving the Health & Safety culture§ § §Assist the H&S Manager in the development, implementation and Worker engagement of H&S ‘belts & braces’ activity, including audits, reporting, investigation, policy and documentation.§ §Ensure data is effectively analysed and the loop closed with business stakeholders, providing key insight to managers, Workers and partnering PCBUs, and driving engagement and participation across all groups§ §Working with key external providers, regulatory bodies, facilitate rehabilitation and return to work.§ § §About You§  §To be successful in this role, you will possess the following skills and experience:§ § §Post-graduate qualification in Health & Safety or equivalency in knowledge and work experience from having performed a similar role§ §2 + years Health and Safety professional experience with working knowledge of relevant NZ legislation§ §Experience developing and applying H&S related policies, procedures, guidelines, and tools§ §Proven track record in driving a culture that supports Safety, Health & Wellbeing§ §Experience in facilitating meetings, plans, reviews and delivering H&S training§ §Good attention to detail and business writing skills and strong Excel skill§ §Ability to flex your style to influence and achieve positive outcomes and actions.§ §How to Apply:§  §Please submit your application online, including a C.V. and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role§  §This role is based in Penrose with travel to Auckland and Northland sites§  §All applications will be responded to electronically§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Despite the challenges that 2020 has presented to the economy, they have more than weathered the storm and continue to progress a number of exciting people related initiatives and to manage transformation related to regulatory changes in the financial services sector.§          §So what stands this opportunity apart from other Senior Advisor roles in the market?§          §Firstly, you will own your portfolio, which predominantly supports the senior leadership team and their direct reports. This means providing gold class service in the form of:§          §            §HR Advice & Line Manager Coaching on all things HR§            §Remuneration and Rewards Support§            §Change Management Support§            §Culture and Engagement Initiatives§            §Talent Management§            §Performance Management and Employment Relations Support§            §Health and Safety Support§            §HR Reporting§            §Recruitment Support and Induction§          §          §Whilst you’ll have both global and local support for remuneration and benefits, you will need to have more than a passing understanding of job sizing, rem banding and the rem review process as you will lead the way for the rest of the team in this area. §          §An added advantage of this role over other Senior Advisor positions is the opportunity to take the position of subject matter expert/coach to other Advisors in the HR team.  You will be the first port of call on operational questions, to critique a particular piece of work or to review an intended course of action, when a sounding board is required.    §          §To ensure your success in this role, you’ll need:§          §            §A minimum of five years generalist HR experience at Advisor level or above in a corporate environment, preferably within the Financial Services sector.§            §Dedicated remuneration and benefits experience as part of your previous roles§            §An outstanding service ethic, with a very strong customer and team focus§            §A fun personality – you actually get the ‘human’ part of your job and can a laugh with your colleagues§            §The resilience to work in a fast paced and at times demanding sales environment§            §A passion for hands on support of your customers – you are a doer, with strong initiative and problem solving capability.§          §          §This role reports to a very commercially minded HR Director who is extremely approachable, customer focused and genuinely concerned with providing development opportunities for the team.  §          §As a seasoned HR professional myself, this is one of those opportunities that jobText: TXT/50723509.txt	§Recruitment Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Partner§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §Recruitment Partner §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35240§        §          §Come and join us to help New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent. Manaaki Tangata, Manaaki Whānau.§          §Wellington location§          §Salary: Up to $91,000.00§        §        §Nau mai Haere mai ki te Manatū Whakahiato Ora§        §Ko te tūmanako kia whakatūturu ai he kaupapa Māori i roto i o mātou mahi o te Manatū§        §About our Team:§        §Our team of eight Recruitment Partners are responsible for providing good practice recruitment advice and support to MSD leadership. We are a diverse and energetic team who thrive on providing excellent customer service and getting the job done! §        §About the Role:§        §As a seasoned recruiter, you will bring innovation to attract high quality candidates using bespoke, fit-for-purpose sourcing strategies. Your commercial acumen will complement the insights you provide to customers to determine a suitable sourcing strategy. §        §In this fast-paced and varied role, you will utilise your creative skills and use a range of marketing tools to attract New Zealand’s top talent. You will work with your external network to gather key market intelligence and trends to inform conversations with your stakeholders. §        §Collaborating with hiring managers to understand their often-unique recruitment needs, you will confidently deliver high quality advice. You will establish yourself as a trusted and respected business partner through close relationships across our People teams and the wider Ministry.§        §On a typical day you will:    §        §          §Partner with hiring managers to develop recruitment strategies.§          §Help to build manager capability through delivering of recruitment training/workshops.§          §Develop advertising campaigns and candidate engagement strategies.§          §Manage the end-to-end recruitment for your assigned portfolios.§          §Support continuous improvement efforts.§          §Play a key role in recruitment related projects.§          §Meet with your external network to gather key information to inform and guide your customers and your recruitment approach.  §        §        §Skills and experience:§        § To be considered for this role you will: §        §          §Have a proven track-record in end-to-end recruitment.§          §Offer proven experience in recruiting a variety of roles, including highly specialised and executive appointments across the private and/or public sectors.§          §Have a strong understanding of recruitment systems (ideally SAP Success Factors).§          §Be driven by integrity and the values of MSD and the Ministry’s purpose.§        §        §Our environment is dynamic, occasionally challenging, frequently rewarding, yet endlessly fun! We offer you the opportunity to be part of it and make a visible and valued impact.§        §How to apply:§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any questions, please contact Nik La Haye - Recruitment Manager on §Nik.LaHaye001@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close: 19 October 2020§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/organisational-solutions/hr/hr-shared-services/recruitment/recruitment-partner-feb20.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35240§ § §Come and join us to help New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent. Manaaki Tangata, Manaaki Whānau.§ §Wellington location§ §Salary: Up to $91,000.00§ §Nau mai Haere mai ki te Manatū Whakahiato Ora§ §Ko te tūmanako kia whakatūturu ai he kaupapa Māori i roto i o mātou mahi o te Manatū§ §About our Team:§ §Our team of eight Recruitment Partners are responsible for providing good practice recruitment advice and support to MSD leadership. jobText: TXT/50748151.txt	§Employee Relations Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employee Relations Specialist§§Advertiser: §Provincial Education Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$70,000 - $84,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§Provincial Education operates nationwide employing over 1100 teachers and staff.  We own over 60+ centres throughout the country offering tailored services to parents by creating happy sustainable and fun learning environments for children.§  §We are on the lookout for an HR practitioner with exceptional ER experience.  You will have successfully managed a large number of cases, have up to date employment law knowledge and be able to demonstrate outstanding mediation skills.§  §In this part time role (approx. 15 - 20 hours per week) you will take ownership of ER cases from end to end, helping to coach managers on policy and procedures and assisting them to work through these situations.  You will undertake investigations and conduct disciplinary meetings for a range of outcomes as well as providing advice and support in relation to performance management. You will be a source of guidance and information relating to ER matters to managers across the business.  You may also be required at times to become involved in adhoc project work within the HR team.§What are we looking for§?§ § §Proven ER experience advocating in ER at all levels within an organisation§ §3 + years ER experience, with an in-depth knowledge of current employment law§ §Outstanding mediation skills§ §You will be an exceptional communicator, with the ability to develop cross functional relationships with a diverse range of people§ §An ability to be calm and exercise sound judgement when under pressure§ §Highly organised with well-developed problem-solving ability§ §Benefits:§ § §Flexible working hours§ §Competitive remuneration package.§ §A fabulous location right next to Orewa beach!§ §Free parking§ §An awesome innovative and supportive team to work alongside§ §This role demands flexibility, the ability to self-manage, and the willingness to be a team player.   If you want to work with great people in a supportive culture apply today with your CV and cover letter!§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years' experience do you have in employee relations?§§§

jobText: TXT/50728138.txt	§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in§The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§About the Role§Reporting to the People & Culture Business Partner, the People & Culture Advisor (PA) will work with the business to provide support and consultation primarily to the broader market / Executive Group team. The PA is also responsible for overseeing/assisting in the day-to-day delivery of People projects, programs, and strategies (communication, on-boarding, integration, talent management etc.).§This is a 12m Fixed-Term role.§What you'll bring§2+ years general HR experience§Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment§Exposure to ER would be highly beneficial§Experience or a good understanding of change management principles§Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment§Flexible with fantastic communication skills and huge amounts of drive§The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"§Solutions focus and comfortable working in an environment which demands strong deliverables§Ability to identify problems and drive appropriate solutions§Strong internal and external customer service focus§Responsibilities§As a People & Culture Advisor you will build trusted advisor relationships across your assigned client groups. You work closely with client business units to apply HR management principles and knowledge to establish rapport, trust, confidence and credibility with management and employees. You will ideally have some experience in change management principles.  The successful candidate will also have a "hands on," "roll up your sleeves" mentality and a strong internal and external customer service focus. There will always be a bias for action, strong work ethic, and a desire to achieve excellent results. You will need the ability to connect and positively interface at all organisational levels, a passion for inventing solutions and process improvement. §Why you want to join us§At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We've maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise' and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50753656.txt	§Recruitment Coordinator/Resourcer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Coordinator/Resourcer§§Advertiser: §Parker Bridge – Global Recruiter Winners 2018 – Best Marketing Campaign§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§The Parker Bridge team have an opening for a superstar Administrator/Resourcer to join our high-performing recruitment team in Wellington. In this energetic culture, you will be at the center of the action, liaising with a team of driven and highly motivated recruitment professionals. Customer service is paramount in this position as success will be based on your support to the consultants and candidates while also ensuring the office is run smoothly and efficiently.§ §The role§ §This role is forever changing and requires someone who is confident in their ability, big on personality, and comfortable supporting others in their pursuit of excellence – in return we offer you a fast-paced, exciting, sometimes hilarious, sometimes manic environment where no two days are the same.§ §This is an opportunity to work for an award-winning company, learn from some of the best recruitment professionals in the market, and leverage state-of-the-art technology. In short, this role needs someone with the drive and ambition to forge a long-lasting career in recruitment, starting from the ground up.§ §Duties§ §The first point of contact for candidates and clients§ §General administration duties such as providing resource solutions for the team and giving insight to relevant consultants on candidate and position matches§ §Ensuring all temporary employee timesheets are received in a timely manner§ §Taking both verbal and written references§ §Updating daily KPI's with weekly summaries§ §Preparing documents for the team§ §Providing marketing administration and coordination§ §Sourcing and screening candidates for consultants§ §Posting and updating jobs on various job boards§ §Maintaining the Parker Bridge external brand§ §As the ideal candidate, you will bring previous administration experience to the team, be extremely adept at managing your time effectively, and have the ability to juggle numerous tasks at once. This would be a great stepping-stone to move into a Recruitment Consultant role in the future.§ §We're a tight-knit team that works hard but also knows how to have fun, so personality fit is very important for us. There's music playing in the office, a casual Friday dress code, drinks together on a Friday and everyone gets a paid day off on their birthday!§ §If you've got what it takes then send us a cover letter outlining why you are the right person for this job as well as your resume in Microsoft Word format. § §At Parker Bridge we make every effort to respond to all applications, however, sometimes the volume we receive is so large it is not possible. If you do not receive a response from us, please don't take it personally as we really value the effort you made to apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

This includes ensuring generalist advice and practices appropriately reflect people strategies, policies and frameworks aligned to the culture and support successful achievement of business objectives, commitments, and the organisation’s vision and values.§  § The role will be based in Christchurch and will also require travel from time-to-time to ensure relationships are pro-actively nurtured and commercial momentum maintained nationally.  The successful applicant will preferably be accredited to deliver psychometrics and will have a proven track record of high-level HR delivery and will possess the superior technical, interpersonal and influencing skills necessary to help continue the development of an evolving and exciting culture. We're already the established leader in Australasia and revolutionizing the way people do business travel in the USA and Europe - and we're growing!§While the world of business travel is changing, we're preparing companies for this with intelligent technology that helps them ensure the continued safety and wellbeing of their travelers - allowing for complex approvals where needed, giving real-time information about precautions taken by transport and accommodation suppliers, tracking and restricting travel around the globe, increasing the flexibility of bookings, giving true visibility and control over costs - and we're not stopping there. We're backed by the likes of Booking.com and there is an exciting road ahead of us at a time where travel needs real, impactful change.§We're hiring people from different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to help us build a world-class team and product.§Requirements§We're looking for an immediately available Talent Acquisition Coordinator to join on a 3 month fixed term contract, with the potential to go permanent in the new year.§Your job is to enable our managers to do what they do brilliantly, by providing them with the talent acquisition support they need.  We're growing fast and the coming months in particular will see a heavy focus on talent acquisition. This is a role your sleeves up and get stuck into it position, requiring a person with strong coordination skills, high attention to detail and a love for fast paced environments.§If you've worked in the tech industry that's a bonus, but most important is that you can be trusted to get on with it and support our managers to do what they do best.§  Our culture is upbeat, energetic and fun - you will likely be the same.  You will also have personal integrity without question, and be adaptable and courageous with what you're doing.  The pace of change is extreme - so you'll want to be up for the ride.§Benefits§Serko's people are rewarded for their efforts with a great salary, competitive benefits, flexible remote working, and awesome offices with games, exceptional coffee, fresh fruit and snacks, and a great social atmosphere. Our environment is upbeat, energetic and fun - and we look for people to add to our culture, not just fit our culture. We value people who have personal integrity, are adaptable, and are courageous with what they do. The pace is energetic, and Serko's people work collaboratively with energy and enthusiasm - so you'll want to be up for the ride. If you're up for a challenge at its most crucial time in history and are excited about joining our team in Auckland, we'd love to hear from you.§To find out more about working at Serko go to http://www.serko.com/about-serko/§Serko is a NZ Immigration Accredited Employer.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50723681.txt	§Senior Recruitment Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Recruitment Adviser§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Recruitment Adviser §      §        §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) sends skilled Kiwis to the Pacific and beyond to share their experience and knowledge directly with local people and communities. Working together with our regional neighbours, our volunteers create new opportunities for people that will continue to ripple across communities for generations to come.§        §A fantastic opportunity for an experienced senior recruiter to join VSA’s Volunteer Recruitment team with this salaried position. This is not your average recruitment role, as you’ll be responsible for recruiting volunteers across a huge range of skills and sectors for your assigned country portfolio within the Pacific. You will work with our in-country programme managers to understand the needs and challenges of your assigned countries, and will then source suitable Kiwi volunteers to undertake VSA assignments overseas that meet the needs of our partner organisations.§        §No two roles you recruit will be the same – one day you might be recruiting a Doctor and the next an Engineer... or a Beekeeper or a Hip Hop Dance Tutor or a Landscaping Adviser... So we are looking for someone who is quick to understand different roles, is proactive at networking, and can adapt to recruiting in varied environments.§        §You will utilise your relationship management skills and your researching skills, as well as ensuring prospective VSA volunteers receive an awesome candidate experience. As a key member of our Volunteer Recruitment team you’ll work as part of a highly skilled and committed organisation that is making a difference in the Pacific.§        §What you’ll be doing:   §        §Your responsibilities will include:§        §          §Proactively managing all end-to-end recruitment activities for a portfolio of countries§          §Sourcing candidates and proactively building talent pools, utilising social media, professional groups, search engines and Boolean searching§          §Screening, interviewing, assessing and making recommendations on potential volunteers§          §Developing and posting online advertising for vacancies§          §Providing expert recruitment advice to other areas of the organisation§          §Actively contributing to process improvements both within the volunteer recruitment team and wider organisation§          §Provide guidance and mentoring to less experienced team members§        §        §Our ideal candidate will have: §        §          §At least 5 years experience as a recruitment professional, preferably including some internal (in-house) recruitment experience§          §Demonstrated expertise in creating, implementing and executing proactive sourcing of talent pools§          §Experience and high proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ideally JobAdder)§          §Incredible organisational skills with the ability to multi-task and work to competing deadlines§          §Experience in designing and implementing improvements to recruitment processes and systems to achieve gains in effectiveness, efficiency and candidate experience§          §A high level of computer literacy, including proficiency with MS Office Suite and social media§          §An inclusive and approachable working style§        §        §Early applications are encouraged as all applications will be screened as they are received. If a highly suitable candidate is identified early on then this job may be filled before the application deadline of Thursday 22nd October 2020. §To download the position description and full details of how to apply for this role, please visit our website https://vsa.org.nz/about-vsa/employment-vacancies/.§        §NOTE:  Only people with a current passport confirming New Zealand citizenship, or New Zealand permanent residency with a multiple re-entry permit, will be considered.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) sends skilled Kiwis to the Pacific and beyond to share their experience and knowledge directly with local people and communities. Working together with our regional neighbours, our volunteers create new opportunities for people that will continue to ripple across communities for generations to come.§ §A fantastic opportunity for an experienced senior recruiter to join VSA’s Volunteer Recruitment team with this salaried position. This is not your average recruitment role, as you’ll be responsible for recruiting volunteers across a huge range of skills and sectors for your assigned country portfolio within the Pacific. You will work with our in-country programme managers to understand the needs and challenges of your assigned countries, and will then source suitable Kiwi volunteers to undertake VSA assignments overseas that meet the needs of our partner organisations.§ §No two roles you recruit will be the same – one day you might be recruiting a Doctor and the next an Engineer... or a Beekeeper or a Hip Hop Dance Tutor or a Landscaping Adviser... So we are looking for someone who is quick to understand different roles, is proactive at networking, and can adapt to recruiting in varied environments.§ §You will utilise your relationship management skills and your researching skills, as well as ensuring prospective VSA volunteers receive an awesome candidate experience. As a key member of our Volunteer Recruitment team you’ll work as part of a highly skilled and committed organisation that is making a difference in the Pacific.§ §What you’ll be doing:   § §Your responsibilities will include:§ § §Proactively managing all end-to-end recruitment activities for a portfolio of countries§ §Sourcing candidates and proactively building talent pools, utilising social media, professional groups, search engines and Boolean searching§ §Screening, interviewing, assessing and making recommendations on potential volunteers§ §Developing and posting online advertising for vacancies§ §Providing expert recruitment advice to other areas of the organisation§ §Actively contributing to process improvements both within the volunteer recruitment team and wider organisation§ §Provide guidance and mentoring to less experienced team members§ §Our ideal candidate will have: § § §At least 5 years experience as a recruitment professional, preferably including some internal (in-house) recruitment experience§ §Demonstrated expertise in creating, implementing and executing proactive sourcing of talent pools§ §Experience and high proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ideally JobAdder)§ §Incredible organisational skills with the ability to multi-task and work to competing deadlines§ §Experience in designing and implementing improvements to recruitment processes and systems to achieve gains in effectiveness, efficiency and candidate experience§ §A high level of computer literacy, including proficiency with MS Office Suite and social media§ §An inclusive and approachable working style§ §Early applications are encouraged as all applications will be screened as they are received. If a highly suitable candidate is identified early on then this job may be filled before the application deadline of Thursday 22nd October 2020. §To download the position description and full details of how to apply for this role, please visit our website https://vsa.org.nz/about-vsa/employment-vacancies/.§ §NOTE:  Only people with a current passport confirming New Zealand citizenship, or New Zealand permanent residency with a multiple re-entry permit, will be considered.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50736554.txt	§Talent Business Partner - 12 month fixed term contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Business Partner - 12 month fixed term contract§§Advertiser: §Meridian§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§ §  §Company Description§  §At Meridian, sustainability is in our DNA.§  §We generate electricity from 100% renewable sources – wind, water and sun. That’s really important to us, because we believe it’s the only way forward for the future of our planet.§  §We also retail electricity to homes, farms and businesses across the country.   We’re committed to being good for the environment, and good to people. We’re proud Principal Partners of KidsCan, helping give Kiwi kids a decent start in life. And we support the DOC Kākāpō Recovery Programme, which aims to get this taonga species off the endangered list and back to their former natural range.                                 §  §Our purpose – our why – is ‘clean energy for a fairer and healthier world’. It’s at the heart of our business, how we operate, and how we treat each other.   §  § §  §Job Description§  §Working as part of our dynamic People Team, you’ll be providing an end to end internal recruitment services, enhancing and promoting our employment brand to the external market. We’re looking for someone who can slot in and hit the ground with operational BAU recruitment as some of our team focus on delivering some exciting in-flight initiatives.§  §Every day is busy as you manage campaigns from recruiting leaders, engineers, traders, front line staff through to corporate services roles. Your self-motivation, professionalism and customer orientation will see you help build on our well recognised brand in the market, utilising your experience with social and professional channels. §  §If you’re passionate about giving hiring managers and candidates an awesome and rewarding recruitment experience, then you will love this job.§  § §  §Qualifications§ § §A solid track record in providing end to end recruitment services in a fast-paced environment where you’ve looked after multiple roles at once.  You may have experience in running bulk recruitment campaigns.§ §Strong administration and coordination skills including experience in organising interviews, coordinating testing, diary management, and keeping stakeholders in the loop.§ §An ability to use recruitment tools such as Application Tracking Systems and Job boards as well as experience building talent pools and utilising candidate sourcing channels such as LinkedIn, social, industry user groups.§ §Awesome relationship management skills and a commitment to providing high-quality service.§ § §  §Additional Information§  §We have an epic culture where hard work and having a good time are equally valued. We live by three ‘How to Be’s’: be gutsy, be a good human, and be in the waka.                             §  §Meridian is truly flexible, diverse and inclusive: in our workplace, you can feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. Our flexible work options make things easier for you and your whānau. §  §All in all, we pride ourselves on being a great place to work.  If you think you’re an awesome fit not only for this role but for Meridian, apply today and tell us why!  §  §Advertising closes on October 27th §(please note this is subject to change)§§§§

jobText: TXT/50751333.txt	§Union Organiser - Auckland - 1.0 FTE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Union Organiser - Auckland - 1.0 FTE§§Advertiser: §NZ Nurses Organisation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Union Organiser - Auckland - 1.0 FTE §      §        §Use your experience to advocate for nurses, midwives, students,§kaimahi hauora & health workers.§        §          §Competitive remuneration§          §Make a real difference to the lives of nurses in Aotearoa / New Zealand§        §        §New Zealand Nurses Organisation (NZNO) is the lead professional nursing organisation and union for nurses. NZNO represents more than 50,000 nurses, midwives, students, kaimahi hauora and health workers of which 3,600 are Māori members in Aotearoa/New Zealand. We represent the interests of nurses on professional and employment related matters. NZNO is a progressive organisation which works to improve the health status of all people of Aotearoa/New Zealand through participation in health and social policy development.§        §NZNO now seeks applications for the role of Organiser (1.0 FTE - 40 hours per week). Collaborating with a diverse range of stakeholders based in Wellington (ideally) and possibly any other NZ location of your choice; an opportunity has arisen for a people and culture leader within the employment relationship arena.§ §In this position you will provide strategic and project support and advice regarding employment relationship matters to Leadership Teams, Managers, and the broader HR team.  Providing thought leadership and continuous improvement thinking to strengthen the ER Strategy is a key component.  You will also be a lead advocate role in collective negotiations.§ §The exciting opportunity provides flexibility, an intellectually stimulating and enjoyable work environment within a supportive and collaborative team.§ §Ideally, you will demonstrate:§ § §Expertise in the Employment lifecycle, and broader Human Resources.§ §Outstanding relationship building capabilities, including honed listening skills and articulate communication with the ability to gain credibility quickly§ §The ability to influence others thinking using and creating best practice People and ER tools and frameworks§ §The ability to deliver strategic and pragmatic people solutions to a variety of Employment Relationship related projects.§ §Please send your resume and interest to Jacquie Duffin at Worklife. §jacquie@worklife.co.nz§ §Or for further exploration please call Jacquie on §04 472 9903§.§ §Interest closes at 5pm on Tuesday the 27th of October.§ §It’s essential that you are a permanent resident to have your application accepted.§§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant Job in Canterbury - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50740289.txt	§Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Adecco Office§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Consultant §      §        §About the Adecco Group:§        §The Adecco Group is the world's leading provider of HR solutions. We deliver recruitment and career services to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§        §About the opportunity:§        §This is an amazing opportunity for a motivated and energetic people-oriented sales or recruitment professional to join our Adecco Christchurch team based in our office on Wrights Road! No two days are ever the same - so if you’re looking for a challenge, keep on reading!§        § As a Recruitment Consultant, you will enjoy the challenge of running a 360-degree desk in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for servicing clients and candidates and ensuring all parts of the recruitment equation are considered at every turn. Driving your desk for success will be vital, and whilst taking on an established client base from day one, it’s critical that the successful candidate is someone who enjoys and gets a kick out of hunting for new business, whilst having the skill to be able to convert new clients into longstanding established partners of Adecco.§        § While recruitment is not a 9 to 5 role, it is certainly a way of life. Your passion for meeting people from all walks will be high on your priority list, and being driven to learn about industry will be front and centre for you. You may be a seasoned recruiter or an industry specialist in the logistics and manufacturing fields. Either way, a fascination in seeing how NZ’s economy ticks over will stand you in great stead.§        § Being passionate to help others and focused on driving long term mutually beneficial relationships will help you in the role too. The role also requires a strong focus on business development, candidate development, placement and of course post-placement care.§        § §We’re looking for someone who can:§        §          §Own the end to end recruitment process§          §Demonstrate a strong empathy for all walks within the recruitment life cycle§          §Seek, establish and maintain effective client relationships through personal visits and core client cycles§          §Conduct effective job briefings and needs analysis with clients to match them with the best possible talent for their requirements§          §Ensure that candidates receive outstanding care at all times§          §Demonstrate strong commercial acumen and analysis of finances§        §        § If you are an ambitious sales and service-orientated person, this is the role for you! This is a position where your energy and drive, along with passion for the industry will be highly valued. We are a global leader in recruitment and will provide you with the opportunity to drive your career and make it your own. §        §What’s in it for you?§        §          §Competitive Salary + lucrative bonus potential§          §Work for a Global ‘Fortune 500’ company with ongoing benefits§          §Great L&D opportunities and a career pathway tailored to you§        §        §If you’re ready to take yourself to new levels of success, come and join us! Apply now online with your updated CV.§        §All applicants must be valid to work in NZ and hold a full class 1 drivers licence.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Adecco Group:§The Adecco Group is the world's leading provider of HR solutions. We deliver recruitment and career services to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§About the opportunity:§This is an amazing opportunity for a motivated and energetic people-oriented sales or recruitment professional to join our Adecco Christchurch team based in our office on Wrights Road! No two days are ever the same - so if you’re looking for a challenge, keep on reading!§ As a Recruitment Consultant, you will enjoy the challenge of running a 360-degree desk in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for servicing clients and candidates and ensuring all parts of the recruitment equation are considered at every turn. Driving your desk for success will be vital, and whilst taking on an established client base from day one, it’s critical that the successful candidate is someone who enjoys and gets a kick out of hunting for new business, whilst having the skill to be able to convert new clients into longstanding established partners of Adecco.§ While recruitment is not a 9 to 5 role, it is certainly a way of life. Your passion for meeting people from all walks will be high on your priority list, and being driven to learn about industry will be front and centre for you. You may be a seasoned recruiter or an industry specialist in the logistics and manufacturing fields. Either way, a fascination in seeing how NZ’s economy ticks over will stand you in great stead.§ Being passionate to help others and focused on driving long term mutually beneficial relationships will help you in the role too. The role also requires a strong focus on business development, candidate development, placement and of course post-placement care.§ §We’re looking for someone who can:§Own the end to end recruitment process§Demonstrate a strong empathy for all walks within the recruitment life cycle§Seek, establish and maintain effective client relationships through personal visits and core client cycles§Conduct effective job briefings and needs analysis with clients to match them with the best possible talent for their requirements§Ensure that candidates receive outstanding care at all times§Demonstrate strong commercial acumen and analysis of finances§ If you are an ambitious sales and service-orientated person, this is the role for you! This is a position where your energy and drive, along with passion for the industry will be highly valued. jobText: TXT/50753677.txt	§HRIS Systems Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HRIS Systems Administrator§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§NZD30 - NZD40 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced HRIS Administrator to hit the ground running with our client based in the CBD.§§Fulltime, 6 month ++ temporary opportunity§Supportive, collaborative team environment§ASAP start§§You will be comfortable working with a large volume of data and be able to maintain a high level of confidentiality.§Duties will include:§§Loading new starter information into SAP§Updating the database with structural changes (i.e. salary, promotions, etc.)§Managing the data imports for Success Factors§Creating surveys and reports via Qualtrics§Creating new on-boarding guides§Liaising with the IT team and external providers to fix system issues and escalations§Supporting hiring manager with the on-boarding system, tracking and monitoring of tasks completed§Data analysis and reporting on cost centres, leave trends, health & safety, etc.§Requirements:§Previous experience working in a similar role (HRIS)§Previous experience using SAP (for HR) §Experience working with LMS§Strong MS Excel skills§Excellent customer service and communication skills§In return, you will be part of a professional yet rewarding environment with great opportunities to add value. §If you think you are right for this role and have current eligibility to work in New Zealand full time, we want to hear from you.  Please email your resume to §sam.rajkumar@madison.co.nz§ quoting reference 89311.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Payroll & HRIS Manager - Wellington based Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50744321.txt	§Payroll & HRIS Manager - Wellington based§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll & HRIS Manager - Wellington based§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Are you looking for a new opportunity that offers much more than the average Payroll Manager role?§Wellington City Council (WCC) have an opportunity for an experienced Payroll, Remuneration and HRIS Manager to join the team reporting to the Manager HR Services. As a leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities".§The Payroll and HRIS team contribute to this vision by providing accurate and timely payroll services for WCC, Wellington Water and some Council Controlled Organisations including the Zoo, Zealandia and part time staff for Wellington Venues. In addition the team deliver HRIS system development to improve our customer's experience, implement a fit for purpose remuneration and benefits strategy and framework that supports our employee value proposition and develop robust and HR analytics and reporting systems that enable our leaders to make informed people related decisions.§This role requires a customer centric, delivery focussed person who is comfortable working and providing services in a complex and diverse organisation. You will be innovative in your thinking, champion continuous improvement and be flexible in your approach to meet customer needs.§Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for§?§A broad range of experience with HRIS systems, preferably with TechnologyOne§Experience managing and improving HRIS systems and tools to meet both customer needs and legislative requirements.§Experience developing and implementing remuneration and reward strategies, systems and process across multiple employment contract types.§The ability to build robust HR metrics, trend data and analysis for the business to support better decision making.§A high level of Payroll expertise (technical, functional and operational) and experience in managing and improving Payroll processes.§A good working knowledge of the relevant employment legislation that relates to the payroll particularly the Holidays Act.§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment.§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including: He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do Whakapai ake - We're always improving Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§For further information please checkout the position description or contact §Sarah.Kirkland@wcc.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday 18 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
