jobText: TXT/50758971.txt	§HR Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Mott MacDonald Australia and New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §HR Business Partner §      §        §Mott MacDonald New Zealand is a dynamic and innovative engineering, management and development consultancy working with high profile clients across New Zealand. We are a wholly independent, employee-owned business with strong local leadership and autonomy. §We established our Auckland business just over 9 years ago, starting with a team of 2 and growing to over 180 staff across our Water, Built Environment, Transport and Advisory, and Digital markets. Our market presence continues in Auckland and we are expanding in Wellington. Our successes over the past years has seen us take significant roles on a range of NZ landmark and country shaping projects including Auckland Airport Terminal Development Plan, Auckland City Rail Link, Auckland Safeswim programme, and the NZ Expo 2020 venue in Dubai.§Our team consists of great engineers, project managers, leaders, digital designers, corporate services and advisors who want to shape the communities in which we live while opening opportunities for connected thinking with our clients and our people. Our HR Business Partner, NZ is taking on an exciting internal relocation, creating a unique opportunity for someone to lead our HR strategy in New Zealand.§As part of our Regional HR and NZ leadership teams, you will partner with business leaders to deliver HR operations, influence business decisions and drive high performance aligned with global, regional and local initiatives. In this role you will:§• Be a key contributor, influencer and implementor of HR annual activities and key strategies that deliver tangible outcomes§• Role model and actively contribute to our equality, diversity, inclusion and wellbeing initiatives§• Foster collaboration in and across our international offices§• Support and contribute into local and regional initiatives for continual improvement to our employee experience§• Analyse country HR trends and metrics and develop solutions, programmes and policies in consideration of local, regional and Group initiatives§• Be responsible for industrial relations and compensation governance and compliance§• Facilitate and delivery workshops and/or learning outcomes as they related to employee engagement, development and succession planning. §Candidate specifications:§• Demonstrated experience leading an HR function, either independently; managing a team; or someone looking to take the next step into a Business Partnership role§• A degree or diploma in Human Resources or related field§• A willingness to deliver both hands on and strategic HR support§• Experience in a professional services environment, ideally working as part of our regional and/or global team§• Solid understanding of compensation structures and NZ industrial relations§• Most of all, someone who enjoys what they do and being part of a diverse and fun team!§The success of our growth has been through local recruitment and the internal mobility of our international workforce. A working knowledge of global mobility as it relates to NZ legislation and immigration will be highly regarded. §We offer you all of the benefits that come from working in a global consultancy, including a market aligned salary, ongoing professional support, career development and a great opportunity to work on key projects. We are committed to fostering a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork and embraces sustainability.§We welcome applications from suitably qualified candidates who are looking to join a growing consultancy. If you would like to know more about this unique opportunity, please contact our recruitment team, or apply below online to register your interest. §There’s no time like present to make a change.§      §      §      §      §        §      §    §    §  §§§Mott MacDonald New Zealand is a dynamic and innovative engineering, management and development consultancy working with high profile clients across New Zealand. We are a wholly independent, employee-owned business with strong local leadership and autonomy. §We established our Auckland business just over 9 years ago, starting with a team of 2 and growing to over 180 staff across our Water, Built Environment, Transport and Advisory, and Digital markets. Our market presence continues in Auckland and we are expanding in Wellington. Our successes over the past years has seen us take significant roles on a range of NZ landmark and country shaping projects including Auckland Airport Terminal Development Plan, Auckland City Rail Link, Auckland Safeswim programme, and the NZ Expo 2020 venue in Dubai.§Our team consists of great engineers, project managers, leaders, digital designers, corporate services and advisors who want to shape the communities in which we live while opening opportunities for connected thinking with our clients and our people. Our HR Business Partner, NZ is taking on an exciting internal relocation, creating a unique opportunity for someone to lead our HR strategy in New Zealand.§As part of our Regional HR and NZ leadership teams, you will partner with business leaders to deliver HR operations, influence business decisions and drive high performance aligned with global, regional and local initiatives. In this role you will:§• Be a key contributor, influencer and implementor of HR annual activities and key strategies that deliver tangible outcomes§• Role model and actively contribute to our equality, diversity, inclusion and wellbeing initiatives§• Foster collaboration in and across our international offices§• Support and contribute into local and regional initiatives for continual improvement to our employee experience§• Analyse country HR trends and metrics and develop solutions, programmes and policies in consideration of local, regional and Group initiatives§• Be responsible for industrial relations and compensation governance and compliance§• Facilitate and delivery workshops and/or learning outcomes as they related to employee engagement, development and succession planning. §Candidate specifications:§• Demonstrated experience leading an HR function, either independently; managing a team; or someone looking to take the next step into a Business Partnership role§• A degree or diploma in Human Resources or related field§• A willingness to deliver both hands on and strategic HR support§• Experience in a professional services environment, ideally working as part of our regional and/or global team§• Solid understanding of compensation structures and NZ industrial relations§• Most of all, someone who enjoys what they do and being part of a diverse and fun team!§The success of our growth has been through local recruitment and the internal mobility of our international workforce. A working knowledge of global mobility as it relates to NZ legislation and immigration will be highly regarded. §We offer you all of the benefits that come from working in a global consultancy, including a market aligned salary, ongoing professional support, career development and a great opportunity to work on key projects. We are committed to fostering a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork and embraces sustainability.§We welcome applications from suitably qualified candidates who are looking to join a growing consultancy. If you would like to know more about this unique opportunity, please contact our recruitment team, or apply below online to register your interest. §There’s no time like present to make a change.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50763802.txt	§Recruitment Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Coordinator§§Advertiser: §VisionWest Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§If you love meeting new people, conducting interviews, and are precise with detail, this is the job for you! §VisionWest is seeking a permanent Recruitment Coordinator to join the Human Resources Team in the Hamilton Office. Our ideal team member is someone with a positive and enthusiastic attitude, who enjoys supporting the team, has a strong work ethic and thrives in a fast-paced work environment. §This role will be recruiting for our Support Worker workforce. To be successful in obtaining this role, you will need to have the appropriate experience and the drive to succeed when challenges arise. You will also need to have a good understanding of VisionWest’s mission and values and be a great fit for our Human Resources Team.§Key responsibilities of the role include:§  §Telephone and face to face interviews§  §Liaising with candidates and staff§  §Ensuring recruitment requests are actioned in a timely manner§  §Ensuring documentation is completed correctly§  §Providing administration support when required§Other skills and attributes we are looking for are:§  §Previous recruitment and generalist HR experience preferred§  §Competent in administration and Microsoft Word and Excel§  §Excellent communication skills - spoken, written and a great phone manner§  §Sound understanding of employment related legislation an advantage§  §The ability to manage confidential information appropriately§  §The ability to efficiently coordinate high volume recruitment§  §A warm, welcoming and professional manner with the ability to engage easily with a wide range of people§  §A full, clean driver licence as there will be some travel required between offices.  §A commitment to the mission and values of VisionWest Community Trust is essential for this position, see www.VisionWest.org.nz.§If this role appeals to you, then please apply now!§  §§§§

jobTitle: Health and Safety Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50753927.txt	§Health and Safety Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Coordinator§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Health and Safety Coordinator §        §          §Our client’s business is growing, and they are looking for a passionate Health and Safety Coordinator to join their high performing and dynamic team!§          § §          §In this role, you will be responsible for building, administering and maintaining a comprehensive health and safety program.§          § §          §This is an opportunity for someone who is resilient, adaptable to change and enjoys problem solving. If this sounds like you, then please apply today!§          § §          §Some of the key duties of this role include:§          § §          §· Promoting excellence in health and safety management§          §· Participating in investigations of near-miss, accidents and injuries§          §· Monitoring health and safety performance through auditing and reporting§          §· Maintaining the Health, Safety and Environment Management System§          §· Assessing risks in the work place and implementing appropriate protocols§          §· Reviewing Health, Safety and Environment related documents (policies, procedures and processes)§          §· Developing, improving and maintaining existing safety practices§          §· Assisting the business in achieving ISO 14001 : ISO 45001 : ISO 9001§          § §          §To be considered for this role, you must obtain the following attributes:§          § §          §· Relevant Health & Safety qualifications or a willingness to work towards one§          §· 2 years' or more experience in a similar role§          §· Experience with a Health, Safety and Environment System§          §· Sound knowledge of NZ Health and Safety legislation§          §· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal§          §· Ability to coordinate and manage activities§          §· Strong team player and interpersonal skills§          §· ‘Can do’ attitude, and ability to instil positivity in the workplace§          §· Highly organised with meticulous attention to detail§          § §          §Please apply only if you are eligible to work in New Zealand (New Zealand Citizen or Permanent Resident). Our client may not be able to support a visa application for this role.§          §To apply for this position, please visit our Hot TXT at www.h2r.co.nz and refer to reference number 26273. For further information, please contact Janine Petersen on §04 4999 471§.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Our client’s business is growing, and they are looking for a passionate Health and Safety Coordinator to join their high performing and dynamic team!§ § § §In this role, you will be responsible for building, administering and maintaining a comprehensive health and safety program.§ § § §This is an opportunity for someone who is resilient, adaptable to change and enjoys problem solving. If this sounds like you, then please apply today!§ § § §Some of the key duties of this role include:§ § § §· Promoting excellence in health and safety management§ §· Participating in investigations of near-miss, accidents and injuries§ §· Monitoring health and safety performance through auditing and reporting§ §· Maintaining the Health, Safety and Environment Management System§ §· Assessing risks in the work place and implementing appropriate protocols§ §· Reviewing Health, Safety and Environment related documents (policies, procedures and processes)§ §· Developing, improving and maintaining existing safety practices§ §· Assisting the business in achieving ISO 14001 : ISO 45001 : ISO 9001§ § § §To be considered for this role, you must obtain the following attributes:§ § § §· Relevant Health & Safety qualifications or a willingness to work towards one§ §· 2 years' or more experience in a similar role§ §· Experience with a Health, Safety and Environment System§ §· Sound knowledge of NZ Health and Safety legislation§ §· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal§ §· Ability to coordinate and manage activities§ §· Strong team player and interpersonal skills§ §· ‘Can do’ attitude, and ability to instil positivity in the workplace§ §· Highly organised with meticulous attention to detail§ § § §Please apply only if you are eligible to work in New Zealand (New Zealand Citizen or Permanent Resident). Our client may not be able to support a visa application for this role.§ §To apply for this position, please visit our Hot TXT at www.h2r.co.nz and refer to reference number 26273. For further information, please contact Janine Petersen on §04 4999 471§.§§§§

more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments.  We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion.  We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.§        §Our People Assist team handle all things related to looking after New Zealand Post's people, by supporting our leaders through a range of important HR functions and offering expert guidance and support.  We have an exciting permanent opportunity for a Team Leader - People Assist Support to lead our talented and enthusiastic HR Administrators who are based both in NZ and offshore. §        §About the role§        §Along with the leading our People Assist Support function, you'll play a pivotal role in owning core processes, management system, and you will need to ensure this is all completed with excellent standards of accuracy and a strong customer focus.    §        §About you§        §We are proud of the service and solutions our People Assist team provides, so you will need to have generalist HR experience, have led a team within an HR function, experience in recruitment, a strong record of continuous improvement with core processes, and a customer focus that is second-to-none.  We're keen to hear about your success in leading a high performing team that deliver value add customer service and solutions, and your stakeholder engagement abilities that allow you to network within our business and champion the important work this team does.§        §With a team in both NZ and Manila, this role will appeal to you if you have, or are looking for, outsourcing experience.§        §Interested?§        §People Assist are a hard-working team who understand the importance of having fun and working together to provide the best solutions possible for our people.  If we've described you and you're ready to accept the challenges and rewards this role will bring, we invite you to apply now.  We are only accepting applications via §www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz§ where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter.  For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email Toi Tangata (People & Culture)§§Advertiser: §Ngāi Tahu Holdings Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Kia hiwa rā!§ §People are our greatest taonga - it is through our people that the tribal legacy lives.§ §We're seeking an experienced leader to join our Toi Tangata - People and Culture team as Organisation Development (OD) Manager.§ §This is no ordinary role and no ordinary challenge.  Our organisation is on a journey to high performance, delivering excellent results for our shareholders and optimal benefits for Ngāi Tahu.  Operational excellence and transformed organisational culture are key people challenges to achieving this ambition.§ §The OD Manager will support Toi Tangata to embed an effective and standardised shared service approach of HR infrastructure and OD interventions across our diverse business portfolio.  The team will implement OD initiatives from the People and Culture Strategic Plan which supports us to recruit, engage, develop, and retain a talented and motivated workforce.  § §The ideal candidate will have§:§ § §A relevant tertiary-level degree majoring in Human Resources, Business or Organisational Psychology§ §Significant experience in Organisational Development as a senior consultant or in-house practitioner in several industries and occupational environments§ §Experience as a generalist HR practitioner ideally having worked with multiple operational HR processes and policies§ §Experience in large organisations with corporate disciplines and professional HR and OD infrastructure§ §An awareness of and affinity for the values and aspirations of Ngāi Tahu whānui and an openness to embrace and learn te reo and tikanga Māori§ §Demonstrated success in creating culture change within an organisation, with a strong understanding of how to introduce levers to produce change.§ §Sound decision-making and problem-solving ability.§ §Advanced relationship management, influencing and coaching skills.§ §Familiarity with the Treaty of Waitangi and its application to the work of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu.§ §A strong service ethic and achievement orientation.§ §Proven ability to develop trust and credibility at all levels.§ §Management experience is desirable.§ §In return, you will be part of a dedicated, supportive and high performing team who take pride in excellent service delivery to our internal customers within Te Rūnanga group, ultimately helping to progress outcomes for Ngāi Tahu whānau.§ §Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu is a highly reputable, thriving organisation, striving towards enriching the lives of current and future generations. Guided by our vision, Ngāi Tahu whānau are at the heart of everything we do "'mō tātou, ā, mō kā uri ā muri ake nei'" (for us and our children after us).§ §Apply now or for confidential enquiries, please contact Anteisha O'Connell on anteisha.oconnell@ngaitahu.iwi.nz. § §If this sounds like the role for you, maraka mai! Please do not hesitate to apply!§ §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§§§§

This role will play a key role helping us to bring this ATS to life and will support our team and the wider organisation to ensure that data is accurately sourced, processed and stored throughout our onboarding process.§On a day-to-day basis, you will be:§documenting processes§sourcing/requesting data§acting as a subject matter expert for our onboarding process§liaising with the HR Systems team as well as Payroll§accurately entering data between systems§providing overflow recruitment coordination support to the wider recruitment team.§This is a fixed-term position for 12 months and will be based in Wellington.§About you - Mōu§We are looking for candidates that are interested in gaining experience withing recruitment and HR systems.§If you demonstrate the following attributes and skills, we'd love to receive an application from you:§Adaptable to change and motivation to learn§A good eye for detail - it's not often you get it wrong§Awesome communication skills tailored for your audience§Organisational skills with the ability to multi-task, and work to tight and competing deadlines - you've got a 'can-do' attitude§You get satisfaction from delivering a job well done at pace§If you have experience working with SAP SuccessFactors and/or SnapHire, that would be an added bonus.§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. jobText: TXT/50757179.txt	§Associate and Senior Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate and Senior Associate§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§ §Senior Associate and Associate opportunities§ §Leadership and Specialist Focus§ §Great People focused on making a measurable difference.§ §Here at §IN§SIDE Recruitment we believe that everyone deserves to be treated like a person, not part of a process. With this in mind, we have taken the opportunity to change the way the industry operates by truly adding a refreshingly personal touch to it and connect people and organisations with purpose.§ §By taking the time to understand our people needs,  we have been able to create a significant presence in both the Auckland and Wellington markets, as the market leader for Leadership, Specialist and Executive Contracting needs. § §With an eye on 2021 we are looking to grow our team, support our clients more and develop our business into areas we think opportunity exists.  So with this in mind we have created two new positions supporting and working with our Associate Directors.§ §As a Senior Associate you will be responsible for relationship management, assignment delivery including all aspects involved with end to end recruitment process. In addition to this you will manage on and off assignment care for candidates and clients. Whilst majority of your work will be come through already established client relationships you will be expected to create more of your own opportunities through your own networks and referrals that the business supports you with.  § §As an Associate you will support the delivery of an end to end recruitment process, including interviewing, assisting with searching, shortlist presentations and reference checks. You will be responsible for managing on and off assignment care for contractors. As you will be early on in your career all your opportunities will be provided for you.§ §We are looking for people who have recruitment experience or exposure to recruitment and are passionate about delivering an exceptional candidate and client experience and share these personality traits:§ § §Driven§ §Professional§ §Successful§ §Fresh§ §Down to earth§ §Quality focused§ §If you are looking to join an environment that puts people at the heart of their organisation, please apply now. For more information, contact Troy Turner on §04 913 6941§ or §troy@insiderecruitment.co.nz§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50765718.txt	§Human Resources Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Advisor§§Advertiser: §Northland Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Human Resources Advisor §        §          §Fixed-term, 12 months§          §We are the carers for Northland's environment and community. Are you one of us?§          §A few things you should know about Northland Regional Council... we aren't about parking tickets, roading, building consents or any of that stuff! Our work is ultimately about working together to care for our region's incredible environment and many communities, matching our skills and resources with the vision and aspirations of our people.§          §Toitū te whenua, toitū to moana, toitū te tangata. If the land is well, if the sea is well, the people will thrive.§          §The opportunity awaits:§          §Our current HR Advisor will be going on maternity leave for 6-7 months, but 2021 is going to be a busy year so we are looking for someone to be with us for approximately 12 months starting January 2021. Aside from business as usual work the organisation has a number of projects on the go which tends to mean more recruitment, we are introducing a HRIS system and we will be making improvements in our training programme - these are just a few of the things coming up.§          §Do you have what it takes?§          §We are looking for someone who can bring the following to our diverse talent pool:§          §            §A degree qualification in relevant discipline (e.g. Business Management, Human Resources, Law or similar)§            §A minimum of 3 years' in an HR Advisor role§            §A good understanding of relevant HR legislation, practices and procedures§            §Experience developing and providing training§            §Negotiation and conflict resolution skills§          §          §We don't just want someone that §CAN §do the job, we want someone who has the §DRIVE §to do a §GREAT§ job and has a passion for what our organisation and values stand for. That's why at NRC, we understand that sometimes the right person doesn't ‘tick all the boxes'. If you don't fit the mould exactly, but truly believe you can help provide advice and support our managers and staff in people management and development§,§ then tell us. We'll consider it.§          §What's in it for you?§          §We'll pay you to do a job you love, and we also care about our staff. Our team has grown a lot over the years, but our small organisation culture is still here. We celebrate our efforts, share wedding/baby pictures, host many shared morning teas, enjoy outings, annual fishing competitions and brunches, and have a lot of fun together. We have an active social club that comes up with great ideas.§          §We also walk the talk when it comes to flexible working. We have remote workers, home workers, part time workers, condensed weeks and more. We support our staff during the good and hard times, but if you're also interested in the tangible stuff, we have that too - check out our benefits here.§          §What's next?§          §Want to chat with us first or just need more information? If so, contact our Human Resources Manager today.§          §The work we do really makes a difference and if you are someone who is motivated to contribute to the management of Northland's environment, check out the position description and apply today.§          §Applications close on 28 October 2020 and must be submitted online.§          § §          §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency/citizenship or a valid NZ work visa.§          §To apply for this job go to: www.nrc.govt.nz/jobs§        §        §        §        §To find out more about this position visit www.nrc.govt.nz/jobs.§          §          §          §        §      §      §    §  §§§Fixed-term, 12 months§ §We are the carers for Northland's environment and community. Our work is ultimately about working together to care for our region's incredible environment and many communities, matching our skills and resources with the vision and aspirations of our people.§  §Toitū te whenua, toitū to moana, toitū te tangata. If the land is well, if the sea is well, the people will thrive.§  §The opportunity awaits:§  §Our current HR Advisor will be going on maternity leave for 6-7 months, but 2021 is going to be a busy year so we are looking for someone to be with us for approximately 12 months starting January 2021. Aside from business as usual work the organisation has a number of projects on the go which tends to mean more recruitment, we are introducing a HRIS system and we will be making improvements in our training programme - these are just a few of the things coming up.§  §Do you have what it takes?§  §We are looking for someone who can bring the following to our diverse talent pool:§ § §A degree qualification in relevant discipline (e.g. Business Management, Human Resources, Law or similar)§ §A minimum of 3 years' in an HR Advisor role§ §A good understanding of relevant HR legislation, practices and procedures§ §Experience developing and providing training§ §Negotiation and conflict resolution skills§ §We don't just want someone that §CAN §do the job, we want someone who has the §DRIVE §to do a §GREAT§ job and has a passion for what our organisation and values stand for. That's why at NRC, we understand that sometimes the right person doesn't ‘tick all the boxes'. If you don't fit the mould exactly, but truly believe you can help provide advice and support our managers and staff in people management and development§,§ then tell us. We'll consider it.§  §What's in it for you?§  §We'll pay you to do a job you love, and we also care about our staff. Our team has grown a lot over the years, but our small organisation culture is still here. We celebrate our efforts, share wedding/baby pictures, host many shared morning teas, enjoy outings, annual fishing competitions and brunches, and have a lot of fun together. We have an active social club that comes up with great ideas.§  §We also walk the talk when it comes to flexible working. We have remote workers, home workers, part time workers, condensed weeks and more. We support our staff during the good and hard times, but if you're also interested in the tangible stuff, we have that too - check out our benefits here.§  §What's next?§  §Want to chat with us first or just need more information? jobText: TXT/50769740.txt	§HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §MyHR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§MyHR has been growing rapidly for some time now. Add to this the unprecedented impacts of Covid and it’s not surprising we need some additional HR legends to join our team.§ §The core function of this role is to provide support to our new clients during their implementation phase. This is the proactive, value-add, business advisory side of HR. A great way to develop those generalist HR skills and truly partner with a variety of businesses.§ §You will be responsible for making sure new clients are welcomed with open arms and set-up for success. The role involves:§ § §Reviewing existing employment documents; agreements, policies, JD’s etc. then helping organisations implement best-practice, legally up to date replacements.§ §Discovering the strategic drivers of the organisation and helping them develop meaningful, modern performance reviews geared for success.§ §Overseeing the configuration of the MyHR software, ensuring clients maximise the many benefits of our world-class HRIS.§ §Helping them get the most out of the MyHR service.§ §Providing training via Zoom covering: § §HR best-practice§ §Employment law and process§ §MyHR awesome software features§ § § §MyHR is dynamic work environment, opportunities to further develop your career will be available including generalist HR advisory, business partnering, consulting and future team management options, if you’re keen.§ §Being able to operate in a structured and organised manner is critical, as some days it will feel like you’re herding cats!§ §You’ll be joining a high-performing team, which has consistently scored 10/10 on Net Promoter Score feedback. We therefore need somebody with an impeccable customer service ethic.§ §Knowledge of NZ employment law is critical.§ §4+ years of hands-on HR and ER experience will be required to allow you to really deliver in this role.§ §You must be able to quickly build credibility with clients across multiple industries by tailoring your advice and support to deliver pragmatic outcomes for their contexts.§ §A flair for language, careful attention to detail and good time management skills will ensure you thrive in our fast-paced environment, as will a genuine commitment to team success.§ §A relevant tertiary qualification is helpful but not required.§ §MyHR is no-longer a start-up, we are an established, high-growth, successful service in the NZ and Aus Markets. It’s all about growth from here! This is an exciting time to join us.§ §We’re close-knit and have a vibe that’s all our own. While we are diligent in our employment law delivery, there is a sense of irreverence and fun that helps keep us all well-balanced. We work hard, we support each other, we have fun along the way.§ §Apply through SEEK with your CV or LinkedIn profile.§ §A long-winded cover letter isn’t necessary, but please do flick us some compelling words about what interests you about this particular role and our business.§ §Applications close on Friday 6th November 2020.§ §You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources adviser?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§How many years' experience do you have in generalist HR?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50765581.txt	§Principal Partner - People & Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Partner - People & Culture§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Housing and Urban Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§We have an exciting opportunity at Housing and Urban Development (HUD) in our People and Culture team.§In a short space of time HUD has grown significantly, built relationships and capability and are enabling system wide transformative programmes of reform and delivery in the housing and urban development system. There is still so much to do - if this inspires you, this role may be for you.§This is a newly created role working alongside the Head of People and Culture (P&C) to support the development and implementation of the HUD community and people programme - Te Whāriki which aims to promote a thriving community that embraces Te Ao Māori. §About us | Mō mātou§§People & Culture (P&C)§ form part of the §System and Organisational Performance group§ that helps shape and support the delivery of HUD's purpose and strategic direction. The group includes functions that ensure HUD is delivering on our cross-system leadership role (connecting across the sector and delivering on our purpose and outcomes), help build and support our organisation through supporting and enabling our people, and that support effective communications and engagement with the public and our stakeholders.§About the role | Mō te tūnga§We have an ambitious work programme ahead of us, supporting the delivery of HUD prioritises through our people and shaping our culture, focused on creating a thriving HUD community. You will help lead the development and implementation of key foundational people strategies, ensuring they are responsive to the needs of the organisation.§In this senior position you will provide guidance for the P&C team, supporting the scope and delivery of people programme initiatives across the organisation. Key to your success will be your ability to ensure the pitch and level of engagement across the business is responsive to business outcomes, Tangata Whenua and Tangata Tiriti.§About you | Mōu§You will bring a multi-disciplinary approach to the role and draw on your knowledge and expertise of delivering a wide range of HR and people initiatives.  With a proven track record of success in a similar type role, you will inspire and influence others to drive successful people and business outcomes.§Self-directed, you'll motivate and influence others within the P&C team, taking them on the journey with you to ensure the successful delivery of P&C work programmes across the Ministry.§What you'll need to bring to the role: §§A sound understanding and strong desire to embrace Te Ao Māori (Te Reo, tikanga, te Tiriti o Waitangi)§Comprehensive programme/project management methodology and skills§Proven experience working collaboratively across an organisation and within a team to deliver on shared goals and vision§Experienced making quality decisions using analytically sound, well-rounded, informed and inclusive approaches§A proven track record of being able to influence at all levels of an organisation  §The ability to be adaptable, agile and flexible within a fast-moving environment§Strong ability to synthesise complex information and ideas and articulate to wide audiences in a simple, compelling way§Well-developed understanding of the machinery of government with demonstrated business savvy§§Pre-requisites§§Must have the right to live and work in New Zealand§Must be able to obtain relevant checks and clearances as/if required (e.g. security clearance)§Relevant tertiary qualification is desirable§§How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §Please specify which location and level of position you would like to be considered for in your covering letter.§ §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§§For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§§Applications closes 2 November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50772852.txt	§HR Business Partner - Northern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Business Partner - Northern§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§+ vehicle, tools of trade and free parking §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Business Partner - Northern §      §        §§        §Downer's HR team is as diverse as it is technically strong and in the role HR Business Partner, you will have the opportunity to use your broad range of HR generalist skills within a truly collaborative, forward thinking and successful organisation.§You’ll be an integral member of both our Northern regional business (covering greater Auckland and Whangarei) as well as Transport Technology business, covering Auckland to Bluff and some key sites in between.  This is a broad role and area to cover and requires regular travel between sites. §As part of the Northern Leadership and Transport Technology teams, as well as the wider HR team, you’ll have a strong working relationship with the Operational GM’s, whilst reporting through to the GM People & Culture (three pretty awesome people to work with and not just saying that cause one of them is my boss).§Working across a broad workforce spanning between 400 - 500 employees, you’ll be responsible for providing generalist and operational support across a variety of business units where you’ll partner with managers and advise on all aspects of HR including: performance management, employment relations, and change management.§You’ll be integral in supporting and embedding HR initiatives such as diversity, workforce planning, employee engagement and talent pipeline coordination.  You’ll drive positive change throughout all levels of the business by ensuring that HR strategies are aligned with the business objectives of the company.§At Downer we are proud to be learning organisation. jobText: TXT/50765500.txt	§Talent Acquisition Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Acquisition Lead§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§Interested in the variety and the complexity of local government?§Develop and lead our talent acquisition strategy§Help us build a sustainable workforce§We are looking for a passionate people leader to join us as our next Talent Acquisition Lead.§Our People and Culture group work in partnership across Council to create a high performing, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling our people to deliver great services to our communities.§We are embarking on a journey where we practice with kindness and are committed to being insightful, unattached, focussed, connected and authentic in our approach to best partner with our customers. As a group we are committed to collaboration and continuous improvement, it is an awesome journey to be part of and you will thrive here if you enjoy challenging yourself and will embrace a changing environment.§Our Talent Acquisition team is a relatively new team that works in partnership with leaders across Council to provide specialist recruitment advice and coaching for a seamless experience for our managers and a positive candidate experience. The team has a busy and exciting year ahead and you will be coming in at the right time where you will be responsible for developing the Talent Acquisition Strategy, building the WCC employer brand, lifting our recruitment team profile across the organisation and identifying process & system improvements. You will own and execute the vision for the evolution of our talent acquisition team to be at the 'top of their game' in delivering exceptional recruitment services that will enable WCC to fulfil its strategic people objectives!§We think this opportunity would suit someone dynamic in their leadership style with a strong recruitment experience across a range of roles including senior leadership and high-volume operational roles. Our ideal person will have proven in-house experience in delivering talent strategies including attraction & sourcing and familiarity with a range of selection methods.§Our environment is very dynamic, occasionally challenging and fast paced so we are looking for someone who is resilient, versatile and pragmatic in their approach. You will be someone who can build and maintain collaborative relationships with people across all levels and actively seek internal customer feedback to ensure their often-unique recruitment needs are met.§What's in it for you?§You will be part of a high performing, collaborative and supportive team of HR professionals, there will be plenty of opportunities for you to stretch and grow where no two days will be the same working for an organisation as diverse as the Council.§Hit apply now to make an application online and/or to view the position description. For more information or for a confidential chat you are welcome to get in touch with Aleena Antony, Talent Acquisition Partner at §Aleena.antony@wcc.govt.nz§.§Applications close §08 November 2020.§ All applications must be submitted online.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50766189.txt	§LMS Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LMS Specialist§§Advertiser: §Blue Sky Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §LMS Specialist §      §This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS (Totara) that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation. §      §      §    §    §www.blueskyrecruitment.nz §  §§§This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS (Totara) that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50773236.txt	§Manager Volunteer Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Volunteer Recruitment§§Advertiser: §McLaren Associates Ltd - Winner SEEK Small Recruitment Agency of the Year 2019§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Manager Volunteer Recruitment §      §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) sends skilled Kiwis to the Pacific and beyond to share their experience and knowledge directly with local people and communities. Working together with our regional neighbours, our volunteers create new opportunities for people that will continue to ripple across communities for generations to come.§ § § § Ask anyone at VSA what they like most about working here, and they’ll unanimously say it’s the people. Our recruitment roles are people-centric; you’ll be working collaboratively with other teams across the organisation and you’ll have the opportunity to interact with some really inspiring people from a diverse range of professions who apply for volunteer assignments with VSA.§   § As the Manager Volunteer Recruitment, you will help achieve VSA’s goals by managing the volunteer recruitment function to ensure we recruit quality New Zealand volunteers. These volunteers will work alongside people in the wider Pacific to help them build their own capability and sustainability, and enable better futures for them and their communities.§   § You will lead a small team of recruiters and together you’ll have responsibility for the attraction, recruitment and selection of approximately 100* volunteers annually (* pre-COVID figure). Due to pandemic-related international border closures, VSA is currently supporting its Pacific partner organisations by recruiting e-volunteers who can work remotely from New Zealand, as well as recruiting to build up a talent pool of future volunteers ready to deploy overseas once borders reopen.§   § This position is a combination of hands-on recruitment (that is, you will manage a country portfolio) and recruitment leadership, and is a great opportunity for an experienced recruitment leader looking to do meaningful and varied work.§   § §Person Profile§:§        §          §Significant experience in leading the provision of end-to-end recruitment services, and design and management of recruitment strategies and policies, preferably in an in-house context§          §Knowledge of best practice recruitment and selection methods and processes, and current trends and practices, and the ability to apply that knowledge to enhance how VSA recruits its volunteers§          §Leadership skills, with demonstrated experience in managing a small team§          §An appreciation of the issues and challenges relating to international volunteering and cross-cultural placements§          §A natural organiser with the ability to prioritise work without compromising quality§          §Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building capabilities§          §Articulate communicator in both written and oral form§          §Calm and professional in your approach, with lots of initiative§          §Experience using an applicant tracking system (VSA uses JobAdder)§          §Commitment to, and understanding of, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and multi-culturalism§        §   § §Applications close: §5pm Tuesday 3 November 2020§ §Applications to:§ Kirsty McLaren via mclaren.co.nz§ §Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§   § §P:§ §04 499 1069§ §W:§ www.mclaren.co.nz§      §    §    §  §§§Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) sends skilled Kiwis to the Pacific and beyond to share their experience and knowledge directly with local people and communities. Working together with our regional neighbours, our volunteers create new opportunities for people that will continue to ripple across communities for generations to come.§ § § § Ask anyone at VSA what they like most about working here, and they’ll unanimously say it’s the people. Our recruitment roles are people-centric; you’ll be working collaboratively with other teams across the organisation and you’ll have the opportunity to interact with some really inspiring people from a diverse range of professions who apply for volunteer assignments with VSA.§   § As the Manager Volunteer Recruitment, you will help achieve VSA’s goals by managing the volunteer recruitment function to ensure we recruit quality New Zealand volunteers. These volunteers will work alongside people in the wider Pacific to help them build their own capability and sustainability, and enable better futures for them and their communities.§   § You will lead a small team of recruiters and together you’ll have responsibility for the attraction, recruitment and selection of approximately 100* volunteers annually (* pre-COVID figure). Due to pandemic-related international border closures, VSA is currently supporting its Pacific partner organisations by recruiting e-volunteers who can work remotely from New Zealand, as well as recruiting to build up a talent pool of future volunteers ready to deploy overseas once borders reopen.§   § This position is a combination of hands-on recruitment (that is, you will manage a country portfolio) and recruitment leadership, and is a great opportunity for an experienced recruitment leader looking to do meaningful and varied work.§   § §Person Profile§:§ § §Significant experience in leading the provision of end-to-end recruitment services, and design and management of recruitment strategies and policies, preferably in an in-house context§ §Knowledge of best practice recruitment and selection methods and processes, and current trends and practices, and the ability to apply that knowledge to enhance how VSA recruits its volunteers§ §Leadership skills, with demonstrated experience in managing a small team§ §An appreciation of the issues and challenges relating to international volunteering and cross-cultural placements§ §A natural organiser with the ability to prioritise work without compromising quality§ §Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building capabilities§ §Articulate communicator in both written and oral form§ §Calm and professional in your approach, with lots of initiative§ §Experience using an applicant tracking system (VSA uses JobAdder)§ §Commitment to, and understanding of, the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and multi-culturalism§ §   § §Applications close: §5pm Tuesday 3 November 2020§ §Applications to:§ Kirsty McLaren via mclaren.co.nz§ §Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§   § §P:§ §04 499 1069§ §W:§ www.mclaren.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Growth Manager, HR & Office Administrations Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50766580.txt	§Growth Manager, HR & Office Administrations§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Growth Manager, HR & Office Administrations§§Advertiser: §Kenzzi§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§Growth Manager is a broad and varied role where you will get to help our small team grow. Like at many start-ups, you will work across a wide variety of disciplines, from recruiting to HR to office administration . Your mission, if you accept it, is simple - to empower our sales, marketing, product development and management team's efforts as we scale our company from recruiting more team members to general office administrations.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Recruiting, interview scheduling, headcount planning.§ §HR management, helping with on-boarding, policies and process development.§ §Event management, office excursions, off-sites.§ §Coordination of office planning as additional staff are added.§ §Office administrative work, report preparation and scheduling meetings.§ §Qualifications§ § §5+ yrs experience working at a small, fast growing company, preferably HR and Admin functions.§ §Strong project management, execution and clear communication skills is a must.§ §Detail-oriented and must be able to work autonomously.§ §Aptitude and willingness to learn.§ §Ability to multitask and prioritize task.§ §Thrive in metrics-driven and data-informed environment.§ §Interest in direct to consumer companies and loves a fast pace and agile environment.§ §About KENZZI§KENZZI is a Kiwi company that has our horizons set across the globe. We have the number one at-home IPL hair removal handset and we are one of the world's fastest-growing beauty tech companies. The KENZZI IPL Handset will produce visible results in just a few treatments and is easy to use and gentle on your skin. The KENZZI is perfect for treating any body part and is backed by our 90 day 100% money-back guarantee.  §As a company we are proud of what we have achieved and wish to continue the growth with our dynamic, passionate and results driven team.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50767552.txt	§HR Operations - Process Support Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Operations - Process Support Lead§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§ §Join our HR Operations advisory team, bringing HR and payroll solutions to life!§ §Broad role supporting People, Process and Policy§ §Work across improvement initiatives across the HR operations teams§ §Your Purpose:§ §As the Process & Support Lead, you will be part of the HR Operations Payroll leadership team.  Working with a talented, fun, and collaborative team of operational HR professionals, you will provide accurate and efficient HR policy, process and payroll support to our HR Operations team. This will include supporting a high-volume case work-load across a broad spectrum, such as employment agreements, Fonterra policy, legislation, time and attendance and much more.  § §The role will also have a focus on continuous improvement to deliver consistent and professional service and enhance the customer experience, which you will get involved in.§ §A few key responsibilities will include:§ § §Proactively review HR Operations processes, collateral, systems and activities to help evaluate accuracy and consistency of completed tasks.§ §Providing hands-on support and guidance to the HR Operations team with BAU or project-related tasks.§ §What you will bring:§ §You will have excellent communication skills and bring a solutions-focused and customer-centric approach to this Process support role.  Not only will you have the ability to build trust and influence with ease, you will also be able to help guide and support the wider HR team.  You will be able to work efficiently and strive to meet service level agreements, while balancing the requirement to provide quality advice. § §If you have previous experience in HR coordination, policy and process advisory roles or payroll support, this could be the role you have been looking for.  Working in a shared services environment is highly advantageous, but not essential.  What is key, is your ability to find viable, effective solutions efficiently.§ §For the right candidate, we are open for you to be based in Auckland or Hamilton, with trips to either location when required, and we also offer flexible working opportunities.§ §About Us:§ §The HR Operations Services Team is a centralised advisory team, with the primary purpose of providing front-line HR support and advice to managers and employees relating to operational HR policy and process, payroll and systems. The team is part of the HR Operations team within Global Service Operations and operates virtually from Auckland and Hamilton, supporting primarily New Zealand and Australia based employees.§ §We are a Co-operative of farming families, who through our strategy, values, and purpose create a philosophy of good together as the way we operate. We are passionate about creating goodness for generations, empowering others, and leaving things in a better way than how we found them. You, me us together Tᾱtou tᾱtou.§§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Coordinator - Oranga Tamariki Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50766095.txt	§Recruitment Coordinator - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Coordinator - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Recruitment Coordinator - Oranga Tamariki §Permanent, Wellington based§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi. We aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe§ Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa §We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§If you do practice the same values as we do, we would like to hear from you!§About the role - Mō te tūnga§We at Oranga Tamariki currently have an excellent opportunity for a Recruitment Coordinator to join our National Office based in Wellington - a high performing team who is creative and innovative with relationships built on mutual trust and respect.§This role will suit someone with strong administration skills who is interested in a career in recruitment. You'll be someone who has a well-developed problem-solving technique, to have critical thinking and to be able to demonstrate resilience. You will also display a caring, friendly demeanour and be a real team player with an open-minded approach. You will also need to have a real passion and dedication to build positive relationships with our stakeholders.§Being a member of the People and Leadership function you will be part of a team that delivers on our people strategy by providing targeted advice, support and guidance to managers on people-related queries and help deliver an exceptional employee experience.§About you - Mōu§We are looking for someone who:§thrives on delivering a job well done§enjoys learning in an environment where change is frequent Is process driven and has a high level of attention to detail§is an awesome communicator§is comfortable working with multiple systems§works well within a team, but across the wider business§can keep their perspective when it all gets a little crazy!§You will have at least one year experience in recruitment coordination, ideally in the public sector§About us - Mō mātou§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children is a ministry dedicated to supporting any child in New Zealand whose wellbeing is at significant risk of harm now, or in the future.§Our vision is that New Zealand values the wellbeing of tamariki above all else. We believe that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can, and should flourish.§What's in it for you - Nōu te rourou§We offer a vibrant and supportive team, flexible work options and a genuine commitment to wellbeing. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way. This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of Tamariki and Rangatahi. Come join us - Tūhono mai§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about role, please contact §kate.scott@OT.govt.nz§Applications close on Monday, 26 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50773346.txt	§HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §HR Advisor §        §          §Our client is looking for a mid-senior level HR generalist to come on board and support their managers remotely in the West Coast and Canterbury region. This role will be supporting two HR Business Partners who are supportive and work at pace. We work with our clients and candidates to build great relationships so we can match the right person for the right role.  § §Here's our latest opportunity!§ § §The Company§ The South Waikato Achievement trust located in the heart of Tokoroa was founded by the local community in 1977. The aim was to give people with disabilities the opportunity to live independent, fulfilling lives. Little did they know how much the trust would grow, now supporting over 95 Clients from not only the Tokoroa area, but further afield as well. The trust provides residential services to their clients as well as the opportunity to work in the world of recycling to help them build professional skills and knowledge.§  § §The Role§ As the trust grows, the team find themselves on the hunt for a Human Resource and Health and Safety Manager to really get stuck into the nuts and bolts of the operation. This role is newly created, so there is the opportunity to really make it your own. An initial audit of the Trust’s processes will be first and foremost followed by the general day to day duties to ensure the residents and clients are kept safe at work. As the Human Resource and Health Safety Manager it will be your responsibility to develop and improve all SOP’s and ensure that everyone is following the necessary processes.§  § §The Person§ If you’re looking for a full on but fun place to work, then this is the role for you! The ideal candidate will have 4-5 years’ experience in Human Resources and Health and safety as well as the ability to keep things rolling within the organization. The trust is really searching for an empathetic individual who finds fulfillment in helping others, the team find the biggest reward is supporting their clients to lead independent lives. jobText: TXT/50773785.txt	§NZSki Human Resources Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§NZSki Human Resources Manager§§Advertiser: §NZSki Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §NZSki Human Resources Manager§      §        §Can’t wait to start shredding in South Island’s most stunning mountain landscapes? Are you fueled by a passion for the mountains and Snowsports coupled with experience and knowledge in human resources, people leadership and culture?§        §Joining the NZSki team is more than working at a skifield - it’s joining a family. A whanau that has been growing since 1947 and continues to strive to create the best experience for our people, locals and guests alike. We offer three diverse alpine playgrounds in Queenstown and Canterbury to get your vertical metres in.§        §Through our crew, each mountain has its own personality. Their success is due not only to our awesome customer service, first-class facilities, majestic scenery and awesome terrain but also due to each ski area connecting to Our Shared Purpose. We have chosen a snowflake to visually represent Our Shared Purpose because snow is the sole reason we're here; it's a gift from nature that's so simple, so elegant but an expression of a powerful elemental force. It takes many snowflakes to cover the mountains and each snowflake is unique. That's just like our team. It takes many unique individuals who share a purpose to form the NZSki team. §        §Our vision is to “Love It, Live It, Share It” and we achieve this by having a strong desire to lend a hand wherever we can; provide awesome customer service; have a proactive attitude to keep it safe; aspire to unleash our potential and enjoy the ride; respect our environment; and become part of our community. §        §About the role §        §Managing the end to end employee life-cycle journey for NZSki, owner and operator of three ski areas in the South Island: Coronet Peak, The Remarkables and Mt Hutt.
