jobText: TXT/50773620.txt	§HSE Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HSE Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Hunter Campbell Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HSE Coordinator §      §The Company§   § §This is an excellent opportunity to join a well-known global equipment manufacturer of Material Handling Equipment. The New Zealand operation has a reputation of providing the markets premium product range and backs this up with a premium service ethic. The Head Office is based in East Auckland with major branch locations throughout the country of which this position sits at their Head Office. This organisation provides MHE equipment, fleet management and warehouse solutions to a large range of some of New Zealand’s most recognised businesses from the top of the North Island to the bottom of the South.   § §The Opportunity§   § §This position will have the responsibility for maintaining the coordination and administration of branch compliance. Alongside maintaining the integrity of the HSE management systems.  § §The Key Responsibilities of this position will be to:§        §          §Maintain records in line with company and legislative requirements.§          §Maintain risk and hazardous substance registers.§          §Liaise with ACC around any incidents/accidents.§          §Liaise with the internal APAC team for any other incidents.§          §Coordinate Zero Harm programmes across the branches.§          §Monitor ongoing tasks highlighted from inspections and toolbox meetings. §          §Complete monthly HSE reports for Senior Management and an internal monthly newsletter.§        § Successful applicants will demonstrate;§        §          §A working understanding of HSE legislation and regulations relating to an operational environment.§          §Experience maintaining HSE systems and processes.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§          §A positive "can-do" attitude.§        § If this opportunity is of interest please apply following the link below. Alternatively, email §johnb@huntercampbell.co.nz§ or call John on 021 73 75 76.§      §    §    §jobs@huntercampbell.co.nz§  §§§The Company§   § §This is an excellent opportunity to join a well-known global equipment manufacturer of Material Handling Equipment. The New Zealand operation has a reputation of providing the markets premium product range and backs this up with a premium service ethic. The Head Office is based in East Auckland with major branch locations throughout the country of which this position sits at their Head Office. This organisation provides MHE equipment, fleet management and warehouse solutions to a large range of some of New Zealand’s most recognised businesses from the top of the North Island to the bottom of the South.   § §The Opportunity§   § §This position will have the responsibility for maintaining the coordination and administration of branch compliance. Alongside maintaining the integrity of the HSE management systems.  § §The Key Responsibilities of this position will be to:§ § §Maintain records in line with company and legislative requirements.§ §Maintain risk and hazardous substance registers.§ §Liaise with ACC around any incidents/accidents.§ §Liaise with the internal APAC team for any other incidents.§ §Coordinate Zero Harm programmes across the branches.§ §Monitor ongoing tasks highlighted from inspections and toolbox meetings. § §Complete monthly HSE reports for Senior Management and an internal monthly newsletter.§ § Successful applicants will demonstrate;§ § §A working understanding of HSE legislation and regulations relating to an operational environment.§ §Experience maintaining HSE systems and processes.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §A positive "can-do" attitude.§ § If this opportunity is of interest please apply following the link below. Alternatively, email §johnb@huntercampbell.co.nz§ or call John on 021 73 75 76.§§§§

jobTitle: On Shore Supply Chain H&S Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50775261.txt	§On Shore Supply Chain H&S Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§On Shore Supply Chain H&S Manager§§Advertiser: §Ballance Agri-Nutrients§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Company description:§Ballance Agri-Nutrients is a New Zealand farmer-owned co-operative that helps its customers to farm more productively, proﬁtably and sustainably.§Job description:§There are those who make and sell fertiliser and feed - and then there's Ballance Agri-Nutrients.§We're real people making a real difference to kiwi farmers and sustainable food production, we work hard to help our farmers get results and we strive to keep our people safe and well along the way. With 40 Service Centres and Hub Stores located across New Zealand, the role of the On Shore Supply Chain Health & Safety Manager is building H&S leaders within the business and help embed ownership for safety at every level. §This position provides leadership, advice and guidance to our regional leaders and our frontline supply chain teams across all aspects of H&S, continually moving our culture from compliance to care. §You will be responsible for:§•    Continuous improvement of our H&S Systems§•    Supporting the management of incidents, near misses, risk reporting and prioritising areas of focus§•    Identify areas for improvement in key H&S areas§•    Leadership/support for our regional leaders and teams§•    Project management and oversight for key H&S initiatives §•    H&S based training development for the end users§For your success, you will have:§•    Recognised higher tertiary studies and demonstrated previous experience in a similar role.§•    Previous leadership & change leadership experience§•    Highly capable skills of planning, coordinating and implementing projects.§•    Advanced communication skills that inspire change and create trust at all levels within the company§•    Excellent written skills able to produce well-structured / easy-to-read written processes and reports - for multiple audiences§•    Experience using MS Word, MS Powerpoint and MS Excel§•    Knowledge of New Zealand Health, Safety and Environmental legislation and good practice. §•    Eligibility to work in New Zealand§If you meet the criteria above, we would love to hear from you!§Applications close 1 November 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Learning Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50778160.txt	§Senior Learning Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Learning Designer§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Post Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Learning Designer §      §      §      §        §          §Auckland based opportunity§          §Permanent position§        §        §We are currently looking for an Auckland-based, experienced and capable §Senior Learning Designer§ to join our team of highly committed, fun and collaborative L&D professionals on a 12 month fixed term basis to assist with a number of project initatives.§        §The role:§        §Our Senior Learning Designers lead the effort to create innovative learning solutions using sound instructional design methodologies, current technologies and effective project management to meet organizational development goals based on best practices from the field. §        §You'll be looked upon as a leader in the team, providing coaching and mentoring to your colleagues, while also engaging with our senior stakeholders to ensure that what we are designing, and the development of content meets their business needs.§        §What you'll bring to the table:§        §Key to your success in this role will be your ability to pull together meaningful learning in a short period of time. You'll be able to demonstrate your experience in instructional design, across a wide range of learning solutions.§        §This is a strategic role, where your confidence, resilience, and skills in stakeholder engagement will be highly valued. You'll be well versed at facilitating and enabling change through learning initiatives, and have the ability to make critical, big picture decisions so that our solutions are future-proofed, flexible and aligned to our wider business goals. §        §You'll have a deep understanding of how adults learn, including the importance of informal and social learning, and your solutions will be innovative, pragmatic and achieve business results. You will bring your customer focus, creative flair, interpersonal savvy, curiosity and great skills at planning and organising to get work done. §        §This role offers variety and challenge, in a truly collaborative team environment. You'll benefit from the support of your colleagues, and the relationships you'll build with one of New Zealand's largest employers.§        §Interested? We'd love to hear from you. Applications close on 28th October 2020.§        §Have a read of the JD attached here, apply using the link below, or for further information please contact Gemma Corbett (Talent Sourcing Specialist) on 027 372 4705.§      §      §      §      §jobs.nzpost.co.nz§    §    §  §§§§Auckland based opportunity§§Permanent position§§We are currently looking for an Auckland-based, experienced and capable §Senior Learning Designer§ to join our team of highly committed, fun and collaborative L&D professionals on a 12 month fixed term basis to assist with a number of project initatives.§The role:§Our Senior Learning Designers lead the effort to create innovative learning solutions using sound instructional design methodologies, current technologies and effective project management to meet organizational development goals based on best practices from the field. §You'll be looked upon as a leader in the team, providing coaching and mentoring to your colleagues, while also engaging with our senior stakeholders to ensure that what we are designing, and the development of content meets their business needs.§What you'll bring to the table:§Key to your success in this role will be your ability to pull together meaningful learning in a short period of time. You'll be able to demonstrate your experience in instructional design, across a wide range of learning solutions.§This is a strategic role, where your confidence, resilience, and skills in stakeholder engagement will be highly valued. You'll be well versed at facilitating and enabling change through learning initiatives, and have the ability to make critical, big picture decisions so that our solutions are future-proofed, flexible and aligned to our wider business goals. §You'll have a deep understanding of how adults learn, including the importance of informal and social learning, and your solutions will be innovative, pragmatic and achieve business results. You will bring your customer focus, creative flair, interpersonal savvy, curiosity and great skills at planning and organising to get work done. §This role offers variety and challenge, in a truly collaborative team environment. You'll benefit from the support of your colleagues, and the relationships you'll build with one of New Zealand's largest employers.§Interested? We'd love to hear from you. Applications close on 28th October 2020.§Have a read of the JD attached here, apply using the link below, or for further information please contact Gemma Corbett (Talent Sourcing Specialist) on 027 372 4705.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50774225.txt	§Recruitment Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Advisor§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Permanent, full-time, Wellington§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, our goal is to establish a multiagency approach to protecting and caring for New Zealand's tamariki and rangatahi. We aim to demonstrate these values:§We put §Tamariki§ first§We believe §Aroha§ is vital§We respect the §Mana§ of people§We are §Tika§ and §Pono§We value §Whakapapa§We recognise that §Oranga§ is a journey§If you do practice the same values as we do, we would like to hear from you!§About the role - Mō te tūnga§Oranga Tamariki currently have an excellent opportunity for a Recruitment Advisor to join our People and Leadership team based in Wellington - a high performing team who are creative and innovative with relationships built on mutual trust and respect.§Oranga Tamariki are undergoing a period of transformation and are looking for a passionate Recruitment Advisor. As a vital team member you will form key partnerships across a business unit to provide expert advice and policy for best practice and recruitment standards. You will have the opportunity to influence and coach leaders to improve capability and effectiveness of recruitment processes by looking for continual improvements.§As a member of the People and Leadership team you will contribute to deliver on our people strategy by providing targeted advice, support and guidance to managers on people-related queries and help deliver an exceptional employee experience.§About you - Mōu§We are looking for someone who has the following:§Previous recruitment advisory experience, preferably with an understanding of public service conduct framework§Well-developed communication skills, ability to convey information clearly and to a broad audience§Ability to coach and mentor Hiring Managers and ensure best practice is followed§Confident using technology to enable recruitment processes§General HR knowledge and ability to evaluate potential risks§Excellent written skills and proficiency in job writing§A passion for embracing and uplifting team culture and values§An agile mindsight where you continuously look for improvements§If you have previous end to end recruitment advisory or consultant experience and enjoy the creativity and solution-focused needs of an advisory position, apply today!§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children is a Ministry dedicated to supporting any child in New Zealand whose wellbeing is at significant risk of harm now, or in the future.§Our vision is that New Zealand values the wellbeing of tamariki above all else. We believe that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can, and should flourish.§What's in it for you - Nōu te rourou§We offer a vibrant and supportive team, flexible work options and a genuine commitment to wellbeing. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way. This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of Tamariki and Rangatahi. Come join us - Tūhono mai§How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you have any questions about role, please contact §kate.scott@ot.govt.nz§Applications close on Tuesday, 3 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Learning and Development Coordinator Job in Manawatu - SEEK
experience: Ideally a qualification in Training and Development or at least five (5) years
jobText: TXT/50774843.txt	§Learning and Development Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning and Development Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Electra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Due to the retirement of a much-loved member of our People and Culture team, we currently have a unique opportunity for an experienced and talented Learning & Development Coordinator to join us on a permanent, part-time basis.  We envisage the role being between 16 – 20 hours per week, working from our head office in Levin.§ §As Learning & Development Coordinator, you will be a proactive influencer with a passion for the organisational learning and development of employees to build their capability and improve the overall teams’ performance. You will be instrumental in developing initiatives that ensures Electra is fostering a culture that values diversity and inclusion and is reflected in our approach during on-boarding and continued learning and development throughout an employee’s career.§ §About the Electra Group§ §We are a dynamic, forward-thinking and innovative local business, part of a vibrant community in the Horowhenua and Kapiti regions of New Zealand. We have been servicing our customers and the community for more than 90 years and believe the key to our success is our people, the community support we receive, our product innovation and diversification into new industries. The Electra Group consists of Electra Ltd, Electra Generation, and Electra Services (trading as Securely). § §Electra is committed to living our values of Safety, Respect, Professional, Accountability and Integrity. We continually strive for excellence in everything that we do.  § §The Opportunity§ §Reporting to the GM, People and Culture, you will be responsible for the timely and accurate coordination of training programs, HR inductions and the development of employees within the Electra group, as you:§ § §Design and develop robust learning and development plans and organisation development initiatives, to address specific divisional or individual needs§ §Drive operational excellence in training processes, facilitating and coordinating training programs, working with partner training providers to assess the success of the training provided, it’s delivery and the evaluation across different training programs§ §Work with the GM, People and Culture and the Group HR Manager to manage and facilitate training content for people leaders to build their capability across talent management practices such as: Talent Acquisition, Employee Engagement, Performance Management, Recognition, Development and Succession Planning § §Evaluate effectiveness of training and review training programs to ensure they achieve training objectives and drive business performance. Ensure the ROI is measurable, and the training has a positive impact on the business§ §Build new e-learning modules to take as much of our internal learning digital, as possible§ §The boxes you'll tick § § §Ideally a qualification in Training and Development or at least five (5) years of comparable commercial experience§ §Experience in a company with both corporate and field-based training needs would be highly advantageous§ §Professional competencies in Adult Education Methodologies§ §Highly competent with IT systems and the MS office suite§ §Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal§ §The ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels and deliver feedback in a targeted and constructive manner§ §Prioritisation skills coupled with a calm demeanour§ §Excellent multi-tasking skills§ §A passion to see people grow and succeed in their chosen career path§ §Knowledge of e-learning methodologies, systems and techniques, to assist with the adoption of digital and self-paced learning would be highly regarded§ §You are well organised, and with excellent planning skills, you can pre-empt any possible hurdles you must overcome, to keep people on the learning and development journey.  You can meet multiple deadlines and use your extensive administrative skills, to keep to task.  Your time management skills ensure our learning and development calendar is relevant, up-to-date and maximises all learning opportunities across the business.§ §The benefits§ § §Part-time flexible work arrangements to suit the business and you personally§ §A generous salary§ §Fantastic company benefits including health insurance and an envious well-being program§ §The chance to work with a fantastic, close knit People and Culture team§§§§

jobText: TXT/50774436.txt	§Manager Recruitment and Sourcing§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Recruitment and Sourcing§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Manager Recruitment and Sourcing §        §          § §          §            §Opportunity to join us on our journey as we embark on new ways of working§            §Mix of operational management, strategic leadership and stakeholder relations§            §Large Multi-Layered Team - passionate about growing MPI talent§          §          § §          §People may be surprised where MPI's work takes our people - we operate across the country in a range of environments from paddocks, orchards, forest and oceans to airports, ports, transitional facilities and corporate offices.  Whether working over water, protecting our borders or traversing our country's regions, the days are never dull.§          § §          §The Recruitment & Sourcing team is a specialised function within Human Resources and the Corporate Services branch who are focused on the delivery of an integrated customer centric end-to-end recruitment service across MPI. Managing this high energy delivery focussed team can be a demanding and busy role, but we promise the work will be incredibly interesting, diverse and rewarding. §          §Join MPI as the Manager Recruitment and Sourcing and relish the opportunity to work collaboratively with the wider Human Resources team to deliver services that enable the achievement of MPI's strategic and operational goals by sourcing and hiring the best talent possible§          § §          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click§ §here§          § §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §You will lead a recruitment and on-boarding service that provides MPI with a high quality, business focused service. This role is a true mix of operational hands on ‘roll up your sleeves' delivery and strategic execution, and an energetic leader is now required to take this team to the next level.§          § §          §Key focus areas include:§          §            §process improvement with a focus on the team operating model and best practice delivery§            §creation of advanced candidate sourcing strategies for hard to fill roles§            §providing insightful and business-related advice for the development and delivery of solutions to meet business needs, oversight and coordination of early onboarding processes in collaboration with the pay team§            §reporting that provides rich information in current and forecast recruitment activity & trends§            §continued development of a high performing team who deliver consistency and solution focused results§            §supporting the HR Director as an active and constructive contributor to the business plan and work programme of HR and support of the HR Leadership team§ §          §          § §          §Mōu - About You§          §With significant operational recruitment experience in a similar environment, you will be a strong practitioner who passionately believes in excellence in delivery and building a strong and positive team culture who is eager to develop and lead this team into its next phase of delivery.§          §With exceptional stakeholder engagement and business partnering skills, you will be a natural at gaining buy in and taking others on a journey to achieve results.  With expert communication, you will be comfortable engaging with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders and demonstrate a consultative and collaborative working style.§          §This role is also about leading a multi-layered recruitment team with a Team Leader, Senior Recruitment Advisers, Recruitment Advisers, Administrators and a Lead Recruitment Adviser Māori and Pacifica. You will also be a member of several leadership teams within the Corporate Services Branch and key stakeholder groups across MPI.§          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§          §            §Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§            §Benefit from flexible working arrangements§            §Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§            §Wellness benefit for employees§            §Workstation assessment§            §Free annual flu vaccination§            §Bi-annual MPI-paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames§          §          §  §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role please click "APPLY FOR THIS JOB" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers' portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          § §          §The closing date is midnight on 3rd November 2020§          § §          §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Meredith Edwards for a confidential discussion at §meredith.edwards@mpi.govt.nz§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Opportunity to join us on our journey as we embark on new ways of working§Mix of operational management, strategic leadership and stakeholder relations§Large Multi-Layered Team - passionate about growing MPI talent§§ §People may be surprised where MPI's work takes our people - we operate across the country in a range of environments from paddocks, orchards, forest and oceans to airports, ports, transitional facilities and corporate offices.  Whether working over water, protecting our borders or traversing our country's regions, the days are never dull.§ §The Recruitment & Sourcing team is a specialised function within Human Resources and the Corporate Services branch who are focused on the delivery of an integrated customer centric end-to-end recruitment service across MPI. Managing this high energy delivery focussed team can be a demanding and busy role, but we promise the work will be incredibly interesting, diverse and rewarding. §Join MPI as the Manager Recruitment and Sourcing and relish the opportunity to work collaboratively with the wider Human Resources team to deliver services that enable the achievement of MPI's strategic and operational goals by sourcing and hiring the best talent possible§ §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click§ §here§§ §§Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§You will lead a recruitment and on-boarding service that provides MPI with a high quality, business focused service. This role is a true mix of operational hands on ‘roll up your sleeves' delivery and strategic execution, and an energetic leader is now required to take this team to the next level.§ §§Key focus areas include:§§process improvement with a focus on the team operating model and best practice delivery§creation of advanced candidate sourcing strategies for hard to fill roles§providing insightful and business-related advice for the development and delivery of solutions to meet business needs, oversight and coordination of early onboarding processes in collaboration with the pay team§reporting that provides rich information in current and forecast recruitment activity & trends§continued development of a high performing team who deliver consistency and solution focused results§supporting the HR Director as an active and constructive contributor to the business plan and work programme of HR and support of the HR Leadership team§ §§ §§Mōu - About You§With significant operational recruitment experience in a similar environment, you will be a strong practitioner who passionately believes in excellence in delivery and building a strong and positive team culture who is eager to develop and lead this team into its next phase of delivery.§With exceptional stakeholder engagement and business partnering skills, you will be a natural at gaining buy in and taking others on a journey to achieve results.  With expert communication, you will be comfortable engaging with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders and demonstrate a consultative and collaborative working style.§This role is also about leading a multi-layered recruitment team with a Team Leader, Senior Recruitment Advisers, Recruitment Advisers, Administrators and a Lead Recruitment Adviser Māori and Pacifica. You will also be a member of several leadership teams within the Corporate Services Branch and key stakeholder groups across MPI.§ §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§Benefit from flexible working arrangements§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§Wellness benefit for employees§Workstation assessment§Free annual flu vaccination§Bi-annual MPI-paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames§§  §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply§To view the position description and/or apply for the role please click "APPLY FOR THIS JOB" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers' portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§ §The closing date is midnight on 3rd November 2020§§ §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Meredith Edwards for a confidential discussion at §meredith.edwards@mpi.govt.nz§ §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. jobTitle: Occupational Health Practitioner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50776452.txt	§Occupational Health Practitioner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Occupational Health Practitioner§§Advertiser: §Ghella Abergeldie JV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§The Central Interceptor is a wastewater tunnel that will run between the Māngere Wastewater Treatment Plant and Grey Lynn. The main tunnel will run underground for 14.7 kilometres and will be at a depth of between 15 and 110 metres. It will cross the Manukau Harbour at about 15 metres below the seabed. Along the route it will connect to the existing wastewater network, which will divert flows and overflows into the tunnel to reduce overflows.§ §As part of the tight-knit Health, Safety and Well-being team, the Well-being Practitioner will implement occupational health and well-being initiatives for the workforce (employees and subcontractors on site) to support the overall health and well-being strategy for the Central Interceptor project.§ §What will you be getting involved in?§ § §Provide advice and training on work-related health risks to increase workforce awareness§ §Manage the pre-employment medical assessment process§ §Undertake drug and alcohol testing§ §Manage the annual health monitoring programme and post incident health monitoring§ §Assist in developing and supporting the workplace well-being programme§ §Immunisations and vaccinations§ §Ergonomic assessments § §Assist with injury management and return to work programme§ §First response for incidents / injuries§ §Support and contribute to the Occupational Health and Well-being Management system§ § §You will have:§ § §Current Registered Nurse practicing certificate with the NZ Nursing Council§ §Previous experience of working in an occupational health role would be ideal § §A post-graduate occupational health qualification is desirable§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills§ §Current NZ Class 1 drivers’ license§ §Good Microsoft office skills§ §Ideally, you will also have a current Ministry of Health-approved Vaccinator Certificate, First Aid certificate, and NZQA US 25458 & US25511 Drug & Alcohol screening – however, we can easily get you certified if needed.§ §This role will suit a self-starter, who is highly motivated and can work autonomously. You will be fully supported by the wider health and well-being team and be provided with all the tools to successfully deliver your role, including a company vehicle to get you to and from our many works sites!§ §If you are looking to make a positive impact, be part of a legacy project that has wide-reaching benefits for Auckland and the community then we want to hear from you. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50773879.txt	§Senior Advisor Learning and Development §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor Learning and Development §§Advertiser: §Office of the Ombudsman§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Advisor Learning and Development §      §        §§        §          §Bring your knowledge of adult learning and learning methodology§          §Be part of a collaborative, passionate team§          §Permanent role in Wellington CBD location§        §        §Mō te Tari o te Kaitiaki Mana Tangata - About the Ombudsman§        §My purpose as Chief Ombudsman is to investigate, review and inspect the administrative conduct of public sector agencies and provide advice and guidance to ensure people are being treated fairly. I also carry out a range of roles that go toward protecting the public's rights, such as monitoring places of detention, and the implementation of the United Nations Disabilities Convention.§        §Mō tō mātou tira - About our team§        §The People and Capability Team play a pivotal role in shaping the potential of the Ombudsman's staff and ensuring they have the capability to carry out their important work. Led by the Manager People and Capability, the team are responsible for the development and delivery of a broad range of human resource management strategies and plans which support my strategic objectives.§        §Mō te tūranga - About the role§        §The Senior Advisor Learning and Development is a new role, created to focus on the design, implementation and evaluation of learning and development programmes to build the organisation capabilities required to deliver the Ombudsman's strategic objectives.  In this role you will use your extensive knowledge of adult learning programmes and principles to ensure that the learning design is "sticky", cost-effective and positively impacts on organisation performance. You will also act as Business Owner for the implementation and ongoing operation of the Learning Management System (LMS). Key priorities include leadership development, Māori cultural capability, and E-learning.§        §He kōrero mōu - About you§        §To be successful in this role you will have these essential qualifications and experience: §        §          §A tertiary qualification in Human Resources or related discipline such as Educational Psychology§          §At least 5 years working in the design and delivery or adult learning programmes§          §Demonstrable knowledge of learning principles including AGES, Kirkpatrick, and Blooms Taxonomy§          §Proven experience of successfully working with a Learning Management System (LMS)§          §Awareness and understanding of basic Te Reo Māori and Tikanga§        §        §It would also be beneficial to have the following: §        §          §Qualifications or experience in coaching/mentoring§          §Post-graduate qualifications in adult learning, OD, or neuroscience§          §Experience in the design and development of E-learning on SCORM compliant software§        §        §Me pēhea e tono - How to apply§        §To apply, click on the ‘Apply Now' button where you will need to register through our online career centre, complete our application form and upload your CV and cover letter. For further information about this vacancy please email §recruitment@ombudsman.parliament.nz§.§        §All applicants will have a legal entitlement to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a criminal convictions check and may be required to achieve and maintain a NZ Government (NZSIS) security clearance.§        §Depending on skills and experience the salary is expected to be $109,000 to $127,000.§        §Applications close Monday, 2 November 2020.§        § §      §    §  §§§§Bring your knowledge of adult learning and learning methodology§Be part of a collaborative, passionate team§Permanent role in Wellington CBD location§§Mō te Tari o te Kaitiaki Mana Tangata - About the Ombudsman§My purpose as Chief Ombudsman is to investigate, review and inspect the administrative conduct of public sector agencies and provide advice and guidance to ensure people are being treated fairly. I also carry out a range of roles that go toward protecting the public's rights, such as monitoring places of detention, and the implementation of the United Nations Disabilities Convention.§Mō tō mātou tira - About our team§The People and Capability Team play a pivotal role in shaping the potential of the Ombudsman's staff and ensuring they have the capability to carry out their important work. Led by the Manager People and Capability, the team are responsible for the development and delivery of a broad range of human resource management strategies and plans which support my strategic objectives.§Mō te tūranga - About the role§The Senior Advisor Learning and Development is a new role, created to focus on the design, implementation and evaluation of learning and development programmes to build the organisation capabilities required to deliver the Ombudsman's strategic objectives.  In this role you will use your extensive knowledge of adult learning programmes and principles to ensure that the learning design is "sticky", cost-effective and positively impacts on organisation performance. You will also act as Business Owner for the implementation and ongoing operation of the Learning Management System (LMS). Key priorities include leadership development, Māori cultural capability, and E-learning.§He kōrero mōu - About you§To be successful in this role you will have these essential qualifications and experience: §§A tertiary qualification in Human Resources or related discipline such as Educational Psychology§At least 5 years working in the design and delivery or adult learning programmes§Demonstrable knowledge of learning principles including AGES, Kirkpatrick, and Blooms Taxonomy§Proven experience of successfully working with a Learning Management System (LMS)§Awareness and understanding of basic Te Reo Māori and Tikanga§§It would also be beneficial to have the following: §§Qualifications or experience in coaching/mentoring§Post-graduate qualifications in adult learning, OD, or neuroscience§Experience in the design and development of E-learning on SCORM compliant software§§Me pēhea e tono - How to apply§To apply, click on the ‘Apply Now' button where you will need to register through our online career centre, complete our application form and upload your CV and cover letter. For further information about this vacancy please email §recruitment@ombudsman.parliament.nz§.§All applicants will have a legal entitlement to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a criminal convictions check and may be required to achieve and maintain a NZ Government (NZSIS) security clearance.§Depending on skills and experience the salary is expected to be $109,000 to $127,000.§Applications close Monday, 2 November 2020.§ §§§§

Due to increased investment in HSW at TCC, we are seeking two Business Partners to join our existing team.§        §Reporting to the Team Leader: Health, Safety & Wellbeing, as a Health, Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner (HSWP), your role is to work with our people leaders, building their capability and knowledge so they can deliver best practice health and safety in their areas. You'll also be involved in contributing to key projects that enhance our health and safety management system.§        §Working with key people leaders, in our most diverse and interesting business units (Infrastructure and Corporate Services), you will have the opportunity to take the next step in your career working across a variety of our highest risk areas: City Waters, Transportation, Sustainability and Waste, Marine Precinct, Airport and Project Delivery.§        §You'll be an experienced health and safety professional with the ability to quickly establish rapport with experienced and senior leaders, and you will thrive on ensuring they understand the business drivers for health and safety and advising them how they can engage their teams.§        §As a preferred candidate partnering with people leaders in a HSBP or Advisor role and achieving some significant improvements in culture and engagement§          §relevant health and safety work experience in infrastructure/heavy manufacturing or regulatory business environment§          §experience of health and safety technology and systems and the ability to use and interpret data to help people leaders with understanding their business' health and safety performance.§        §        §This is a career changing opportunity for an exceptional practitioner where you will be able to make a real jobText: TXT/50791230.txt	§Human Resource Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resource Manager§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Steel§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Human Resource Manager §      §        §About the role§        §We are looking for an HR professional with strong ER/IR experience to join our team as an HR Manager for a 6-month fixed term contract to cover parental leave. Based at our Steel Mill in Glenbrook and reporting to the General Manager People, you will be responsible for driving the implementation of key people strategies and initiatives that support the achievement of New Zealand Steel’s commercial success to the Primary Operations and Mining & Services divisions. §        §This role is not for the faint hearted and will ideally suit someone who has a strong background in heavily unionised environments and change management. You will have well-rounded knowledge and experience as an HR professional and is well practised with workplace investigations, performance management, providing specialist advice, recruitment and supporting business leaders on people related matters as well as leadership coaching and development. Experience working in large organisations in the areas of manufacturing, construction, heavy industry is desirable. Experience in a unionised workforce is essential.§        §Role responsibilities will include but are not limited to:§        §          §Leading the Primary Operations and Mining & Services leadership teams through change projects §          §Supporting the Primary Operations and Mining & Services businesses Leadership Team with succession planning and talent development§          §Support the implementation of an Employment Relations Plan that promotes positive workplace relations with our people and their representative unions§          §Seek business improvement opportunities and create project plans to achieve the required performance change §          §Drive/execute a project plan for sustainable leadership development for the Primary Operations and Mining & Services business Units§          §Build employee and organisational capability across the Primary Operations and Mining & Services businesses, identifying and supporting the creation of appropriate development opportunities as well as opportunities to attract key talent where appropriate.§          §Support the Primary Operations and Mining & Services Leadership Teams in the annual performance and salary review and STI process§        §        § §        §Full time 6-month fixed term role§        §Role Location:   §Steel Mill - Glenbrook, with flexibility to cover Waikato North Head mine site at Otaua (approx 20mins from Glenbrook site)§        §Hours:   §Monday – Friday 40 hours per week§        § §        §What you will bring§        §You will need to be someone who enjoys a challenge and have a proven track record of developing trusted cross functional relationships at all levels. Structured in your approach but able to handle multiple and competing priorities, your proven natural commercial acumen to deliver business results will be some of the keys to your success in this role. In addition, we are looking for people who can demonstrate the following: §        §Required:§        §          §Bachelor’s Degree in HR or other relevant tertiary qualification§          §5+ Years HR generalist advisory experience §          §3 Years IR experience§          §A strong communicator both written and verbal, with a passion for helping our business leaders achieve their business objectives§          §High initiative and tenacity§          §Pragmatic approach to problem solving and strong analytical skills§          §Stakeholder relationship engagement and management§          §Able to negotiate and implement contractual agreements §          §Strong influencing and interpersonal communication skills§          §Can solve problems of moderate complexity requiring changes to existing procedures for their solution§        §        § §        §We embrace all aspects of diversity and inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace that reflects our people and community. Connect with us today if you want to join a strong People team and an innovative and progressive business.§        § §        §What we can offer§        §We have opportunities for learning and development, unique work location, remote working options, onsite medical centre, free parking, an excellent remuneration package and a supportive team environment.§        § §        §About us§        §New Zealand Steel, a wholly owned subsidiary of BlueScope, manufactures and markets a range of flat rolled steel products for the building, construction, manufacturing and agricultural sectors.  You may know us for our flagship COLORSTEEL® brand. Being part of the BlueScope brand makes us a strong and successful global company offering connections throughout the world, and providing access to resources and tools from the wider business. We believe our people are our strength, and embrace diversity and inclusion as we aim to have the right people in the right roles to move us into the future. If you enjoy working with people who are practical, put your safety first, and care about the communities in which they work, then New Zealand Steel is the place for you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the role§We are looking for an HR professional with strong ER/IR experience to join our team as an HR Manager for a 6-month fixed term contract to cover parental leave. If you enjoy working with people who are practical, put your safety first, and care about the communities in which they work, then New Zealand Steel is the place for you.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50786150.txt	§Human Resources Manager (Relocate to Ayers Rock Resort, NT)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Manager (Relocate to Ayers Rock Resort, NT)§§Advertiser: §Voyages Indigenous Tourism Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§About the role§ §We are looking for a competent and proactive HR Manager to join the Voyages Ayers Rock Resort leadership team.§ §Reporting directly to the Senior HR Manager you will be collaborating with our key business leaders and internal & external stakeholders throughout the business.§ §If you thrive on building strong relationships, developing innovative solutions and providing quality strategic HR advice you will find this role highly rewarding. This is a true generalist role and with a hands on approach you will have the opportunity to guide, lead & manage the broad range of HR activities and projects.§ §No two days are alike when working in hospitality and each day presents new opportunities to learn and grow and develop your HR talent.§ §This position is based at Ayers Rock Resort which is located in the Northern Territory.§ § § §About you§ § §You will be an experienced and confident HR practitioner who enjoys operating in a fast-paced environment.§ §We are looking for someone who is inquisitive and has a desire for continuous improvement with the ability to apply their business acumen to develop clear, actionable business solutions.§ §You will have a demonstrated ability to build effective relationships with key stakeholders across all levels of the organisation and we expect you to have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and a keen eye for detail.§ §You have proven experience dealing with an array of HR and ER/IR matters and will be confident in mitigating risk and ensuring procedural fairness.§ §To fit with our team culturally you will have a strong work ethic and be keen to help others out when needed. Our team is collaborative - we support each other to succeed and to find the best solutions for our stakeholders. Importantly, we like to have a bit of fun along the way!§ §Most of all we're looking for someone with a positive mindset, who wants to work in a team where collaboration and a customer focus are key to success.§ § § §About Us:§ §Voyages Indigenous Tourism Australia is a unique Australian travel company wholly owned by the Indigenous Land & Sea Corporation (ILSC) offering experience-based holidays in spectacular wilderness locations including Ayers Rock Resort in the iconic Red Centre and tourism facilities at Mossman Gorge in Tropical North Queensland.§ §Voyages vision is to change lives through cultural tourism. We offer our visitors a genuine Indigenous experience while making a real difference, through building culturally respectful relationships and partnerships with communities in the NPY region and developing sustainable, meaningful employment for Indigenous Australians in tourism and hospitality.§ § § §What we offer§ In addition to a competitive salary, we offer you subsidised accommodation, resort discounts, meals on duty, relocation and vacation bonuses. Within Yulara we have dedicated staff facilities including pool, gym, and resident’s club to enjoy at your leisure time.§ §If this sounds like the perfect opportunity to escape to the desert, then please apply now. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.§ §A Criminal History Check is a mandatory step of the recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § § § §Job Description§ §We have a newly created and exciting opportunity for a Health & Safety Advisor to join our Corporate Solutions team in §either our Wellington or Auckland office§.§ §This role is responsible for all aspects of health and safety in the facilities, asset, and property management services of our Corporate Solutions division.§ §Our Corporate Solutions team provides property and facilities services to clients who either occupy property or hold property as a supporting asset to their core business or operations. We work in partnership with our clients to ensure that their property portfolio dovetails with their wider business model.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Support the development, monitoring and implementation of supplier health, safety and performance outcomes and KPIs§ §Provide technical support and training and develop engagement across health and safety practices§ §Undertake incident investigation when required§ §Assist with the development, improvement and implementation of policies, procedures, frameworks and tools§ §Undertake site inspections including assessing work, worksite, hazards, and controls,  including Permit issuing in accordance with client and Colliers requirements§ §Audit and ensure suppliers are compliant, including reviewing JSA/SWMS/HITRA§ §Implement and monitor maintenance programmes and standards§ §Inform and educate suppliers on Permit to Work system requirements§ §Liaise with stakeholders for site specific works§ §Assist the effective management of service providers and suppliers§ §Provide a high level of personalised and professional service to clients§ §Support the strategic direction of the client property, lease and portfolio management programmes and standards§ §Assist with the preparation of documentation, including reports, approvals, and reviews§ §Maintain database records§ §Assist with projects to drive innovation§ § § §Qualifications§ § §A working understanding of relevant NZ legislation, industry standards and external frameworks (e.g. NZAS 4801, ISO 45001)§ §Proven experience in a similar role or Level 4 NZQA Safety qualification or equivalent§ §Excellent customer service§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §The ability to make sound decisions and solve problems§ §The ability to work with different stakeholders and build strong working relationships with all styles§ §Proficient with computer systems and database management§ §Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy§ §Strong organisation and time management skills§ §Proactive team player§ §The ability to travel and a current full driver’s license§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50791145.txt	§Principal Adviser Health and Safety§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Adviser Health and Safety§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Principal Adviser Health and Safety §        §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi §          §With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper§          § §          §Mō te Tiakitanga Putaiao Aotearoa§          §Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. We have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy. §          §Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to protect New Zealand while supporting strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain world.  §As a result, we have several new positions in Biosecurity New Zealand§, §including a Principal Health and Safety Adviser Biosecurity.§          §Mō tō mātou rōpū (About our team):§          §At Biosecurity New Zealand, our focus is on stopping unwanted pests and diseases at the border, before they get to New Zealand, and eradicating or managing the impact of those already here. With the help of New Zealanders, we ensure our unique environments and the value of our primary industries are maintained.§          §Te whainga poto o tēnei tūranga (What is the purpose of this position?):§          §The §Principal Health and Safety Adviser Biosecurity§ is a key position in the group to advice, lead and manage all activities and work that shape Biosecurity NZ's approach to improving the overall health and safety programme of work.§          §To achieve this, the Principal Health and Safety Adviser will focus on promoting leadership in health and safety domain, working collaboratively with BNZ leadership team, wider MPI staff as well as relevant external parties to ensure  that a consistent and aligned approach to health and safety is adopted and applied  across the Biosecurity NZ.§          §Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako (Skills & Experience):§          §The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate experience of at least 10 years in occupational health and safety and/or relevant professional role within a large operational organisation, coupled§          §A previous track record of successful strategic leadership, with high level strategic capability and ability to maintain a clear focus on long term goals will enable you to succeed.§          §You will need an in-depth understanding of occupational health and safety including legislation and regulations, standards and codes of compliance, along with experience that involves the provision of advice. Analysis and engagement with decision makers at an executive level.  An ability to build and maintain stakeholder relationships is essential.§          §A key to success will be your ability to see the ‘big picture' and have flexibility to adapt and find solutions to challenges and pressures whilst maintaining an evidence-based approach.§          §If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application. §          §Ahurea - (Culture):§          §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.§          § §          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):§          §            §Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§            §Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§            §Wellness benefit for employees§          §          §Further information around the benefits of working for MPI can be watched§ here§          §Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.§          §The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visit §http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearance§ for more information.§          §For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email §jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nz§  §          § §          §Applications close 4 October 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§          § §          § §        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi §§With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper§§ §§Mō te Tiakitanga Putaiao Aotearoa§Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. We have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy. §Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to protect New Zealand while supporting strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain world.  §As a result, we have several new positions in Biosecurity New Zealand§, §including a Principal Health and Safety Adviser Biosecurity.§§Mō tō mātou rōpū (About our team):§At Biosecurity New Zealand, our focus is on stopping unwanted pests and diseases at the border, before they get to New Zealand, and eradicating or managing the impact of those already here. With the help of New Zealanders, we ensure our unique environments and the value of our primary industries are maintained.§Te whainga poto o tēnei tūranga (What is the purpose of this position?):§The §Principal Health and Safety Adviser Biosecurity§ is a key position in the group to advice, lead and manage all activities and work that shape Biosecurity NZ's approach to improving the overall health and safety programme of work.§To achieve this, the Principal Health and Safety Adviser will focus on promoting leadership in health and safety domain, working collaboratively with BNZ leadership team, wider MPI staff as well as relevant external parties to ensure  that a consistent and aligned approach to health and safety is adopted and applied  across the Biosecurity NZ.§Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako (Skills & Experience):§The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate experience of at least 10 years in occupational health and safety and/or relevant professional role within a large operational organisation, coupled§A previous track record of successful strategic leadership, with high level strategic capability and ability to maintain a clear focus on long term goals will enable you to succeed.§You will need an in-depth understanding of occupational health and safety including legislation and regulations, standards and codes of compliance, along with experience that involves the provision of advice. Analysis and engagement with decision makers at an executive level.  An ability to build and maintain stakeholder relationships is essential.§A key to success will be your ability to see the ‘big picture' and have flexibility to adapt and find solutions to challenges and pressures whilst maintaining an evidence-based approach.§If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application. §Ahurea - (Culture):§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.§ §§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§§ §§Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):§§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§§Wellness benefit for employees§§Further information around the benefits of working for MPI can be watched§ here§§Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.§The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visit §http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearance§ for more information.§For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email §jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nz§  § §Applications close 4 October 2020§ §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity.
