jobText: TXT/50788548.txt	§Talent Acquisition Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Acquisition Manager§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Deloitte New Zealand is a Member Firm of the Deloitte global network, a 150 year old Partnership that spans 150 countries and employs more than 300,000 professionals worldwide.  Here in New Zealand we make up 1,400 of the global network, operating across 7 regions in New Zealand to provide specialised services to private and public sector organisations.§  § §  §About the team§  §Our award winning talent team partners with the business to provide a robust workforce that helps to change the future of New Zealand as we know it today, consistently working towards our local, regional and global strategic initiatives. This commitment and focus has helped us to being the largest and most recognised professional services practice in New Zealand and an employer of choice for professionals and graduates alike, and we have no intentions of slowing down.§  § §  §In the Talent team, we’re a close bunch that focuses on making an impact that matters for our people, candidates and community through our values – Arataki, Mahi pono, Manaaki, Hapai tangata and Mahitahi. We’re a multicultural and diverse group in the People & Performance team, and thrive on challenges, complex problem solving and being the best human beings that we can be. Most importantly, we have the freedom to bring our whole selves to work every single day.§  § §  §What might your day look like with us?§ § §Establish and build upon an existing culture of inclusion, integrity, respect and support of the team. This includes setting the direction and purpose of our Talent Acquisition team based on our local and global firm wide strategy.§ §Collaborating with other Managers in the People & Performance team to lead, coach and inspire a team of recruitment advisors to provide opportunities for new experiences to grow future skills.§ §Own and evolve the experienced and graduate recruitment candidate experience across the full recruitment lifecycle, putting together policies and processes in respect to our initiatives such as diversity & inclusion, mobility, digital adoption and best practice solutions.§ §Play an active role in relationship management internally and externally, with vendors and service providers. This includes connecting and teaming with peers from other Deloitte member firms to build internal capabilities and innovation.§ §Provide innovation, perspective and market leading employment branding and attraction strategies that focus on maximising local talent pools and flexible enough for offshore talent attraction too. We’ve won awards in this space.§ §Own end to end project management lifecycle for policies, processes, technology and other talent related initiatives from strategy through to realisation. This includes systems administration and configuration in Lever (ATS).§ §Provide regular reporting across team performance, firm positioning in respect to D&I and other commitments in respect of talent at Deloitte.§ § §  §Enough about us, let’s talk about you§ § §Demonstrable leadership skills as a Talent Acquisition Manager or lead within a large New Zealand or global firm, professional services or similar environment is useful. People management experience is a must.§ §Strong financial and commercial acumen with business partnering skills within a Talent Acquisition function. You need to be an open and credible communicator and networker with the ability to quickly to establish rapport with people at all levels.§ §A Curious leader. You like to keep your finger on the pulse in terms of what’s trending in talent acquisition. Understands the full recruitment value chain, including digital marketing and social media strategy, employer branding, graduate recruitment campaigns and experienced recruitment processes. You’re always looking for opportunities to learn, innovate and adapt to position ourselves as market leaders.§ §Ability to demonstrate Deloitte values and engrain strategic initiatives into the everyday culture of the team, building on an already high performing team that’s made us the employer of choice in New Zealand.§ §Excellent written and spoken English language skills. Knowledge of any other secondary languages are a bonus!§ §Excellent presentation, organisation and administrative skills. Ability to think creatively to solve complex problems and executing solutions in line with scope, time, budgetary and resourcing is key. Project management experience highly advantageous.§ § §  §Have we got your attention?§  §If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, including our ability to provide flexible working arrangements, please contact Carey Wong from the Talent Acquisition team on §09 952 4202§. Otherwise, we’d love to hear from you.§  §Due to the current border restrictions in New Zealand, we are only able to support local applications or applicants who already possess citizenship or existing working rights for New Zealand. §  § §  §Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process. §§§§§

jobTitle: HR Operations - Process and Systems Owner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50791237.txt	§HR Operations - Process and Systems Owner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Operations - Process and Systems Owner§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§ §Be part of a team with a true global focus, enhancing HR systems§ §Dynamic & fast paced role with plenty of variety§ §12 month fixed term contract§ §Your Purpose:§As our HR Process Owner - Payroll, you will play an integral role in shaping our Fonterra payroll journey.  You will provide insight into process design and identify areas for improvement to determine the appropriate technology solutions to support our strategic and business direction and keeping our customer experience at the forefront.§ §Your ability to build relationships, translate technical needs into business and process outcomes and drive our long-term road map will be key success factors of the role.  Not only will you own payroll systems, you will also be involved in various projects that will streamline the way we utilise HR systems in the future.§ §A few key responsibilities will include: § § §Work with stakeholders and vendors to drive a change process in system performance§ §Manage ongoing system upgrades, design test plans, co-ordinate and participate in regression testing§ §Be the first point of call for all process and system related queries and issues for the business§ §About you§Your ability to prioritise and balance competing demands with ease is what will set you apart from the rest.  You’ll ideally have a background in Payroll and HR system analysis and be tech savvy, understanding what is required from technical stand point, but being able to work with business needs.§ §However, first and foremost, is your ability to build and own internal and external relationships, working alongside various teams to ensure our system architecture and road map is clear, while having a passion for continuous improvement.§ §A few key skills are:§ § §A background in HR process design, mapping and alignment to technology solutions§ §Ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements for HRIS – payroll and time and attendance§ §A continuous improvement mindset to drive efficient process and provide a positive customer experience§ §Ability to work collaboratively with our key stakeholders§ §Strong background in HR and Payroll legislation§ §While this role can be based in Hamilton or Auckland, there will be travel required to each location.  This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to a key Fonterra business unit. If you are keen to use your knowledge and expertise to really make a difference to our HR systems– apply now!§ §About us§ §We are a Co-operative of farming families, who through our strategy, values, and purpose create a philosophy of good together as the way we operate. We are passionate about creating goodness for generations, empowering others, and leaving things in a better way than how we found them. You, me us together Tᾱtou tᾱtou.§§§§

jobTitle: LMS Administrator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50785665.txt	§LMS Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LMS Administrator§§Advertiser: §AIA New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§We have an exciting admin opportunity to join our fun and collaborative Learning & Organisational Development team to assist in the development, design and configuration of a new Learning Management System, which will deliver external learning and development initiatives for advisers and intermediaries.§This is a fixed term opportunity for 12 months.§§Key responsibilities:§Develop and coordinate the mapping of learning activities within the LMS, (events, webinars e-learning) including creation of learning activities, learning plans and learning paths, allocation of CPD’s.  §Migration of existing learning records from historical systems into the new LMS§Managing the governance of learning persona’s and learning groups§Scheduling, promotion, registration, resource preparation, room set up, managing stakeholder expectations, etc.§Establish and maintain compliance reporting (e.g. Accreditation and CPD status), to meet our third party Business Statement obligations, regulators, and manage and mitigate potential risk. Reconcile data where required and upload data to the relevant systems§Support and promote other External Learning initiatives using the LMS as required, e.g. Adviser roadshows, educational conferences§Manage the external LMS solution to continually improve and enhance the learning experience and outcomes for our Advisers§Continuously improve documentation, processes and reporting.§Perform other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by supervisor in order to meet reasonable operational and/or other requirements.§§Key skills/experience required:§Customer service experience§Activity planning and co-ordination§Ability to manage a large, varied and complex workload§Stakeholder management and relationship building§Able to work independently as well as collaboratively within and outside the team§Working knowledge of AIA’s systems and processes is a bonus§Proficient Salesforce capability§Proficient (preferably intermediate to advanced) in Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel§Working knowledge and experience with Learning Management Systems§Attention to detail§Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50786261.txt	§Organisational Development Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Organisational Development Advisor§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Want to be part of a team shaping the culture here at WCC?§Experience in working in a busy Organisational Development team?§Our organisation value you and the community we serve§Join a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace§Our Culture and Capability team is looking for a proactive, smart and experienced Organisational Development Advisor to join our team.§Our People and Culture group work in partnership across Council to create a high performing, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling our people to deliver great services to our communities. We are embarking on a journey where we practice with kindness and are committed to being insightful, unattached, focussed, connected and authentic in our approach to best partner with our customers. As a group we are committed to collaboration and continuous improvement so it is an exciting journey to be part of and you will thrive here if you enjoy challenging yourself and will embrace a changing environment.§The OD Advisor role plays an integral part in supporting the Culture and Capability Business Unit to successfully deliver on our programme of work. They will do this by leading our recognition and award programme, annual performance, career and development process and the development and implementation of resources to support career progression as well as supporting other work programme initiatives that support WCC to be a high performing organisation.§We are looking for someone with a tertiary qualification with a minimum of three years' experience working in a busy HR team on complex OD initiatives. You will have excellent customer service, influencing and organisational skills. You will be a confident communicator who is flexible and approachable and able deliver high quality work.§We will reward you with plenty of learning and development opportunities; you will be part of a high performing, collaborative and supportive team of HR professionals who you can learn from. We enjoy what we do, work smart and hard, have fun and laugh out loud and are motivated to be at the top of our game. This role will offer you a lot of variety and exposure and no two days will be the same working for an organisation as diverse as Council.§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including: He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do Whakapai ake - We're always improving Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§Believe you can add value? Hit apply now to make an application online and/or to view the position description. If you have any questions or need further information, please get in touch with Sarah Dick, Principal OD Advisor at §sarah.dick@wcc.govt.nz§.§Applications close §Wednesday the 4th of November 2020§. All applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this role ideally you should currently be in New Zealand with valid work rights.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50785276.txt	§People and Safety Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Safety Manager§§Advertiser: §Brannigans Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§SOUTH CANTERBURY BASED§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §People and Safety Manager §      §        §Oceania Dairy Limited (ODL) §is a wholly owned subsidiary of Inner Mongolia Yili Industrial Group, China’s largest dairy producer, listed on the Shanghai stock exchange. Employing over 380 team members, the $650 million state of the art Glenavy processing plant has been designed for the production of nutritional milk powder and liquid milk for export markets. For more information visit §www.oceaniadairy.co.nz§. Located in South Canterbury, Glenavy is 20 minutes’ scenic drive from Oamaru and 40 minutes from Timaru and offers an unparalleled lifestyle with great outdoor activities and attractions. For more information on the region visit § www.southcanterbury.org.nz§ or § www.waitaki.govt.nz§ §        § §        §The Role§        §Reporting to the General Manager, this Glenavy based role will lead the People and Safety functions including the development and implementation of Human Resource, Organisational Development and Safety strategies, policies and practices that support the delivery of key business outcomes.§        §As a senior leader you will champion HR systems, policies and procedures ensuring the effective development and implementation of operational human resources including overseeing the recruitment, engagement and learning and developmental programmes while fostering a collaborative and enabling culture. In addition, you will provide effective leadership to a team of seven including a H&S Manager.§        § §        §Skills and Experience§        §This role requires an experienced leader with substantial human resource and commercial experience at an operational and strategic level. You will possess excellent interpersonal skills, build relationships effectively and be able to influence in a consultative manner. You will have extensive experience collecting and analysing data, and utilising technology to empower the HR function. You will be professional and a goal orientated problem solver, acting as a trusted advisor, fostering an inclusive service driven and safety led culture. A relevant qualification and experience in a similar role are essential.§        §A Position Description for the role is available for download § here.§        § §        §To Apply§        §Please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate ‘Apply’ button. Initial phone enquiries can be made to Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8757§ or Nick Carter on §03 345 8764§.§        §Applications for this role close Monday 9th November 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Oceania Dairy Limited (ODL) §is a wholly owned subsidiary of Inner Mongolia Yili Industrial Group, China’s largest dairy producer, listed on the Shanghai stock exchange. For more information on the region visit § www.southcanterbury.org.nz§ or § www.waitaki.govt.nz§ § § § §The Role§ §Reporting to the General Manager, this Glenavy based role will lead the People and Safety functions including the development and implementation of Human Resource, Organisational Development and Safety strategies, policies and practices that support the delivery of key business outcomes.§ §As a senior leader you will champion HR systems, policies and procedures ensuring the effective development and implementation of operational human resources including overseeing the recruitment, engagement and learning and developmental programmes while fostering a collaborative and enabling culture. In addition, you will provide effective leadership to a team of seven including a H&S Manager.§ § § §Skills and Experience§ §This role requires an experienced leader with substantial human resource and commercial experience at an operational and strategic level. A relevant qualification and experience in a similar role are essential.§ §A Position Description for the role is available for download § here.§ § § §To Apply§ §Please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate ‘Apply’ button. jobText: TXT/50786043.txt	§Recruitment Manager (Relocate to Ayers Rock Resort, NT)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Manager (Relocate to Ayers Rock Resort, NT)§§Advertiser: §Voyages Indigenous Tourism Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§About the role§ §We are looking for a proactive Recruitment Manager to join the Voyages Ayers Rock Resort team.§ §Reporting directly to the Senior Human Resources Manager you will be responsible for delivering recruitment support and specialist advice to manage and deliver a complete lifecycle solution for the recruitment of key hires – including specialist, professional and leadership roles.§ §This is a hands on approach role that requires to build and sustain collaborative working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders ensuring service effectiveness to deliver workforce planning advice and delivery across requisition, selection, appointment and on boarding activities.§ §This position is based at Ayers Rock Resort which is located in the Northern Territory.§ § § §About you§ § §You will be an experienced senior recruitment advisor with a background in volume recruitment in customer service/ hospitality§ §We are looking for someone ethical in approach, capable of supporting a number of key stakeholders with the upmost customer service and deliver on best practice recruitment methods.§ §You will have proven expertise in managing competing deliverables with shine through whilst also being a key person in the team to drive a culture of inclusiveness and support. § §You will have demonstrated ability to develop and deliver resourcing plan for allocated roles in partnership with hiring managers and business unit leaders§ §Maintain a strong knowledge base of industry and connect with relevant talent to ensure Voyages remain competitive in the candidate market, whilst actively building and engaging with an ongoing pipeline to fill current and future vacancies§ §To fit with our team culturally you will champion the organisation’s vision, values and brand through example setting in operational excellence, quality assurance and professional behaviour ensuring effective team mentoring.§ § § §About Us:§ §Voyages Indigenous Tourism Australia is a unique Australian travel company wholly owned by the Indigenous Land & Sea Corporation (ILSC) offering experience-based holidays in spectacular wilderness locations including Ayers Rock Resort in the iconic Red Centre and tourism facilities at Mossman Gorge in Tropical North Queensland.§ §Voyages vision is to change lives through cultural tourism. We offer our visitors a genuine Indigenous experience while making a real difference, through building culturally respectful relationships and partnerships with communities in the NPY region and developing sustainable, meaningful employment for Indigenous Australians in tourism and hospitality.§ § § §What we offer§ In addition to a competitive salary, we offer you subsidised accommodation, resort discounts, meals on duty, relocation and vacation bonuses. Within Yulara we have dedicated staff facilities including pool, gym, and resident’s club to enjoy at your leisure time.§ §If this sounds like the perfect opportunity to escape to the desert, then please apply now. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.§ §A Criminal History Check is a mandatory step of the recruitment process.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50783937.txt	§OD Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§OD Consultant§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Post Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §OD Consultant §      §      §      §        §          § Rewarding work with a committed and talented team§          § Help us do the right things for our people§          § Partner with the business to provide amazing OD solutions§        §        §New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments.  We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion.  We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.§        §Our people are our secret to success, and our People Team are passionate about helping to ensure we have the right people, doing the right things, that our people are safe and focused, and that we have a strong roadmap for the future of our people.  We're creative, practical and we bring our best and help each other and NZ Post succeed.  We're now looking for two superstar OD Consultants to join our great team.§        §About the role§        §As one of our OD Consultants you will thrive on partnering with our business leaders and our People team to identify, analyse, implement and evaluate OD solutions that improve business performance, employee capability, talent management and engagement.  We have high aspirations to enable a great experience for our people and unlocking our future success and you will work towards these goals by linking people development and performance solutions to business strategy, and by bringing our cultural aspirations, leadership principles, behaviours and organisational values to life by providing great OD solutions.  You'll have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, with  various people from across the People team and alongside a wide range of stakeholders.§        §About you§        §You'll have a couple of years' L&D or OD experience behind you and you'll be ready to grow and develop your OD career.  Customer focus is key to this role so we'll want to hear about how you build and manage client relationships and partner with your stakeholders to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes that support our success.  You'll need a bit of change management and project management experience to successfully deliver solutions in collaboration with key stakeholders.  To be successful in this role you'll also need to bring your facilitation and coaching skills and be highly-organised and have sound prioritisation skills.§        §Interested?§        §If you have the right skills and experience and want to grow and develop your OD career alongside a People team who are passionate about enabling our people's success, we invite you to apply now.  We are only accepting applications via §www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz§ where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter.  For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to §Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz§        §Applications close 30 October 2020.  §        §All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check and may be required to undertake a drug test.§      §      §      §      §jobs.nzpost.co.nz§    §    §  §§§ Rewarding work with a committed and talented team§ Help us do the right things for our people§ Partner with the business to provide amazing OD solutions§§New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments.  We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion.  We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.§Our people are our secret to success, and our People Team are passionate about helping to ensure we have the right people, doing the right things, that our people are safe and focused, and that we have a strong roadmap for the future of our people.  We're creative, practical and we bring our best and help each other and NZ Post succeed.  We're now looking for two superstar OD Consultants to join our great team.§About the role§As one of our OD Consultants you will thrive on partnering with our business leaders and our People team to identify, analyse, implement and evaluate OD solutions that improve business performance, employee capability, talent management and engagement.  We have high aspirations to enable a great experience for our people and unlocking our future success and you will work towards these goals by linking people development and performance solutions to business strategy, and by bringing our cultural aspirations, leadership principles, behaviours and organisational values to life by providing great OD solutions.  You'll have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, with  various people from across the People team and alongside a wide range of stakeholders.§About you§You'll have a couple of years' L&D or OD experience behind you and you'll be ready to grow and develop your OD career.  Customer focus is key to this role so we'll want to hear about how you build and manage client relationships and partner with your stakeholders to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes that support our success.  You'll need a bit of change management and project management experience to successfully deliver solutions in collaboration with key stakeholders.  To be successful in this role you'll also need to bring your facilitation and coaching skills and be highly-organised and have sound prioritisation skills.§Interested?§If you have the right skills and experience and want to grow and develop your OD career alongside a People team who are passionate about enabling our people's success, we invite you to apply now.  We are only accepting applications via §www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz§ where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter.  For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to §Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz§Applications close 30 October 2020.  §§All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check and may be required to undertake a drug test.§§§§

jobTitle: Learning and Organisational Development Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50786525.txt	§Learning and Organisational Development Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning and Organisational Development Specialist§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$93,746 - $115,803 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §Learning and Organisational Development Specialist §    §      §        §What you will do §        §This is an exciting opportunity for a learning & organisational development specialist to embed, manage and continue to evolve various initiatives that are being implemented within the Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO). This includes a Competency Framework, Learning Solutions Framework, Talent Management System, Position Descriptions and the DEMO Workforce Strategy.§You will maintain and coordinate the DEMO induction programme and assist competency subject matter experts in designing, developing and delivering discrete equipment management learning solutions to workforce members.§To do this, you will use your specialist expertise and excellent relationship management skills to facilitate DEMO’s ongoing workforce development. §        §As a sole-charge position, you’ll be relied upon to demonstrate initiative, prioritise requirements, work with the DEMO Senior Leadership Team, broader management, subject matter experts and staff, to achieve the desired organisational and learning outcomes.  §        §Please note: §The official title for this role within NZDF is Equipment Management Capability Development Lead. §        §What we need §        §An experienced, successful practitioner in learning & organisational development, preferably with some expertise in delivering professional and technology focussed capability development solutions. You will be an effective planner, articulate communicator and most importantly, a commited team player, who is able to positively contribute to the development journey DEMO is undertaking to become an ISO55000-aligned, world class equipment management organisation. §        §The ideal candidate will:§        §          §Be experienced in the development, management and implementation of learning and organisational  development solutions;§          §Possess excellent planning, communication, facilitation, and stakeholder relationship skills;§          §Be a leader in their field.§        §        §Who we are §        §The Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO) is responsible for providing proactive, responsive and effective strategic in-service equipment fleet management and full life-cycle integrated logistic support (ILS) advice to support delivery of the NZDF’s outputs.  Our focus is on equipment and related commodities and consumables, and ensuring they are available at the right time and standard to enable the Army, Air Force and Navy to achieve the right effect. §        §The NZDF is charged with the defence of the nation, the security of its interests, and the protection of its fundamental values and institutions. The NZDF comprises 14,000 military and civilian staff across the armed services of Navy, Army and Air Force, operating as ‘Three Services – One Force.’ §        §Why Us §        §NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances. §        §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year;§          §Free onsite parking and great nearby amenities;§          §Flexible working environment and positive culture;§          §Variety, challenge and a chance to influence. §        §        §How to Apply §        §To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our § Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Garry Brosnan on §(04) 560 6837§.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit. §        §Applications close on §Wednesday 4 November 2020§. §        §Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows: §        §Low level Security Clearance§        §          §most preferably a NZ citizen, who §has resided in this country continuously§ for at least the last §five years§, OR§          §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §five years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do § §This is an exciting opportunity for a learning & organisational development specialist to embed, manage and continue to evolve various initiatives that are being implemented within the Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO). This includes a Competency Framework, Learning Solutions Framework, Talent Management System, Position Descriptions and the DEMO Workforce Strategy.§You will maintain and coordinate the DEMO induction programme and assist competency subject matter experts in designing, developing and delivering discrete equipment management learning solutions to workforce members.§To do this, you will use your specialist expertise and excellent relationship management skills to facilitate DEMO’s ongoing workforce development. § §As a sole-charge position, you’ll be relied upon to demonstrate initiative, prioritise requirements, work with the DEMO Senior Leadership Team, broader management, subject matter experts and staff, to achieve the desired organisational and learning outcomes.  § §Please note: §The official title for this role within NZDF is Equipment Management Capability Development Lead. § §What we need § §An experienced, successful practitioner in learning & organisational development, preferably with some expertise in delivering professional and technology focussed capability development solutions. You will be an effective planner, articulate communicator and most importantly, a commited team player, who is able to positively contribute to the development journey DEMO is undertaking to become an ISO55000-aligned, world class equipment management organisation. § §The ideal candidate will:§ § §Be experienced in the development, management and implementation of learning and organisational  development solutions;§ §Possess excellent planning, communication, facilitation, and stakeholder relationship skills;§ §Be a leader in their field.§ §Who we are § §The Defence Equipment Management Organisation (DEMO) is responsible for providing proactive, responsive and effective strategic in-service equipment fleet management and full life-cycle integrated logistic support (ILS) advice to support delivery of the NZDF’s outputs.  Our focus is on equipment and related commodities and consumables, and ensuring they are available at the right time and standard to enable the Army, Air Force and Navy to achieve the right effect. § §The NZDF is charged with the defence of the nation, the security of its interests, and the protection of its fundamental values and institutions. The NZDF comprises 14,000 military and civilian staff across the armed services of Navy, Army and Air Force, operating as ‘Three Services – One Force.’ § §Why Us § §NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances. § §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§ § §Great benefits for you and your family§;§ §5 weeks annual leave per year;§ §Free onsite parking and great nearby amenities;§ §Flexible working environment and positive culture;§ §Variety, challenge and a chance to influence. § §How to Apply § §To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our § Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Garry Brosnan on §(04) 560 6837§.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit. § §Applications close on §Wednesday 4 November 2020§. § §Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows: § §Low level Security Clearance§ § §most preferably a NZ citizen, who §has resided in this country continuously§ for at least the last §five years§, OR§ §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §five years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.§ §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§

jobTitle: Learning Systems and Governance Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50782900.txt	§Learning Systems and Governance Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning Systems and Governance Advisor§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Salary§§Salary + Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Learning Systems and Governance Advisor§ §Westpac on Takutai Square, Auckland§ §Full Time, Permanent – 37.5 hours a week§ §Human Resources§ §How will I help?§ §A unique opportunity to join the Learning, Talent and Culture team as the Learning Systems and Governance Advisor. In this role you will work closely with the Manager, Learning Governance and Systems to provide our employees with the tools and resources for their continuous development and learning as well as ensuring that the right learning is targeted to the right people at the right time through your management of the Learning Management Systems (LMS). § §An important part of this role involves working with our Business Unit stakeholders to support compliance with all legislative, regulatory, and related Risk Controls through effective learning governance. This includes, but isn’t limited to, supporting implementation of governance procedures, ongoing maintenance of targeting and learning pathways and providing governance progress reports. § §Your ability to analyse complex information, project management skills, strong consulting skills and ability to build strong relationships will see you strive and be a role model for self-directed learning. § § § §What is in it for me?§ §Being part of a company where you are valued as an individual, able to put you mark into our customer experiences. With financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth, and insurance offers), you will also be able to develop so your career can grow as you do. § §You will join a team where you can work across boundaries as One Team to lead the market through service excellence and anticipating customer needs. § § § §What do I need?§ §Experience working with Learning Management Systems (both using it and configuring it)§ §Experience in identifying methods to deploy a learning programme using the LMS and other technology   § §Experience working with general HR systems§ §Background in Human Resources is a bonus§ §Ability to manage stakeholders and make smart recommendations based on business requirements§ §Understanding of the importance of governance procedures § §Ability to evaluate existing processes and to implement process improvements§ § § §What is it like to work there?§ §We are passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we will invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your ongoing learning and development.  As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you'll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme and fantastic staff banking package.  § § § §Next Steps§ §Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter through the link on this page. § §For more information, please get in touch with §Tasha.patel@westpac.co.nz§ §Please note: we are happy to answer your questions but we do not accept applications by email.§ §We appreciate your interest in a future career with Westpac, however, due to current border restrictions brought about by Covid19 and uncertainty around when this will change,  we are unable to support visas for offshore applicants at this time.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Principal Advisor - Engagement - 18 months fixed term Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50787621.txt	§Principal Advisor - Engagement - 18 months fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Engagement - 18 months fixed term§§Advertiser: §Ministry for the Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Advisor - Engagement - 18 months fixed term §      §        §Principal Engagement Advisor - Transformation§        §Here at the Ministry for the Environment (MfE) we value our people and we love to do things differently.  Our people are from diverse backgrounds and work in flexible ways, but are all committed to our responsibility as primary advisors to the Government on the environment.§        §We tackle the hottest issues that impact on the environment, supporting New Zealand's prosperity - economic, social and cultural, without compromising our environment for future generations.§        §The Ministry's goal to make Aotearoa New Zealand the most liveable place in the world is a considerable responsibility and one we take seriously. §        § §        § §What you will do: §        §Engagement sits at the heart of system leadership and is therefore a critical underpinning capability for the Ministry for the Environment as the environmental system leader for Aotearoa New Zealand.§        §Our external relationships sit at the heart of our engagement. A critical shift we need to make is in the way in which we build and maintain relationships. We want to revolutionise how we communicate and engage with a core focus of embedding engagement excellence into our DNA. Fundamentally, this role is about leading the transformation of the Ministry's organisational engagement culture and practice.§        §Critical to embedding engagement excellence within our organisation is the implementation of our new engagement framework. The framework describes how engagement will be stitched into the lining of our planning, policy development and delivery. At a practical level this requires:§        §          §implementing clear standards for what good engagement looks like§          §integrating practices, systems and processes to ensure quality standards are met and continuous improvement becomes§          §working across the Ministry and continuing to foster a culture of quality engagement§          §growing engagement capability as a critical applied skill§        §        §To help us achieve our engagement aspirations we need a highly-experienced operator who understands the importance of investing in the right systems, processes and capability and can get results by working through others. You'll be an influential leader that can work collaboratively to foster and leverage key working relationships at all levels in the Ministry. Additionally, you'll have an established track record of leading transformational change across organisations.§        § §        §What you will bring:§        §You are dynamic and passionate with a reputation for excellence and delivery together with strong political nous. You will have:§        §          §Proven experience in leading change management/transformation at an organisation level, ideally with an engagement and/or capability building focus§          §Proven experience developing and implementing engagement strategies for organisations§          §Exceptionally solution-focused with the ability to present ideas and propositions§          §A talent for issues management and problem solving§          §Deep knowledge and expertise of engagement best practice in working with Treaty partners§          §A strong understanding of Te Ao Māori§        §        §We embrace diversity and inclusion and are committed to equal opportunities. What's important to us is ‘he rau kotahi tangata' - embracing our multiple talents - by harnessing our diversity and being inclusive.  We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds.  MfE is also well regarded for its commitment to flexible working.§        § §        § §Benefits:§        §As well as being part of an innovative organisation with an important purpose of making Aotearoa, New Zealand, the most liveable place in the world, we offer you:§        §          §A flexible by default approach to support your work-life balance§          §Agile working, allowing you variety and challenges across the organisation as we work as ‘One MfE'§          §Generous leave entitlements§          §Te Reo Maori language courses (and te Reo Maori competency allowance)§          §An active social club and  employee networks§          §Opportunities for development and education§        §        § You will foster innovation, value diversity, and deliver on the collective leadership goals we set for ourselves. This includes using MfE's Edge Behaviours as the foundation of how you lead and our teams operate.§        §The salary range for the role is from 148,206 to 186,317§        §To apply, please complete the online questionnaire and attach your CV and cover letter.  PD is attached to the MfE Careers site. for more information about the position please contact John Robertson on §john.robertson@mfe.govt.nz§        § §        §§      §      §      §    §    §www.mfe.govt.nz§  §§§Principal Engagement Advisor - Transformation§Here at the Ministry for the Environment (MfE) we value our people and we love to do things differently.  Our people are from diverse backgrounds and work in flexible ways, but are all committed to our responsibility as primary advisors to the Government on the environment.§We tackle the hottest issues that impact on the environment, supporting New Zealand's prosperity - economic, social and cultural, without compromising our environment for future generations.§The Ministry's goal to make Aotearoa New Zealand the most liveable place in the world is a considerable responsibility and one we take seriously. § § §What you will do: §Engagement sits at the heart of system leadership and is therefore a critical underpinning capability for the Ministry for the Environment as the environmental system leader for Aotearoa New Zealand.§Our external relationships sit at the heart of our engagement. A critical shift we need to make is in the way in which we build and maintain relationships. We want to revolutionise how we communicate and engage with a core focus of embedding engagement excellence into our DNA. Fundamentally, this role is about leading the transformation of the Ministry's organisational engagement culture and practice.§Critical to embedding engagement excellence within our organisation is the implementation of our new engagement framework. The framework describes how engagement will be stitched into the lining of our planning, policy development and delivery. At a practical level this requires:§§implementing clear standards for what good engagement looks like§integrating practices, systems and processes to ensure quality standards are met and continuous improvement becomes§working across the Ministry and continuing to foster a culture of quality engagement§growing engagement capability as a critical applied skill§§To help us achieve our engagement aspirations we need a highly-experienced operator who understands the importance of investing in the right systems, processes and capability and can get results by working through others. You'll be an influential leader that can work collaboratively to foster and leverage key working relationships at all levels in the Ministry. Additionally, you'll have an established track record of leading transformational change across organisations.§ §What you will bring:§You are dynamic and passionate with a reputation for excellence and delivery together with strong political nous. You will have:§§Proven experience in leading change management/transformation at an organisation level, ideally with an engagement and/or capability building focus§Proven experience developing and implementing engagement strategies for organisations§Exceptionally solution-focused with the ability to present ideas and propositions§A talent for issues management and problem solving§Deep knowledge and expertise of engagement best practice in working with Treaty partners§A strong understanding of Te Ao Māori§§We embrace diversity and inclusion and are committed to equal opportunities. What's important to us is ‘he rau kotahi tangata' - embracing our multiple talents - by harnessing our diversity and being inclusive.  We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds.  MfE is also well regarded for its commitment to flexible working.§ §§ §Benefits:§§As well as being part of an innovative organisation with an important purpose of making Aotearoa, New Zealand, the most liveable place in the world, we offer you:§§A flexible by default approach to support your work-life balance§Agile working, allowing you variety and challenges across the organisation as we work as ‘One MfE'§Generous leave entitlements§Te Reo Maori language courses (and te Reo Maori competency allowance)§An active social club and  employee networks§Opportunities for development and education§§ You will foster innovation, value diversity, and deliver on the collective leadership goals we set for ourselves. This includes using MfE's Edge Behaviours as the foundation of how you lead and our teams operate.§The salary range for the role is from 148,206 to 186,317§To apply, please complete the online questionnaire and attach your CV and cover letter.  PD is attached to the MfE Careers site. for more information about the position please contact John Robertson on §john.robertson@mfe.govt.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Health & Safety Coordinator / Advisor Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50784137.txt	§Health & Safety Coordinator / Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Safety Coordinator / Advisor§§Advertiser: §Fluid Recruitment New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Salary§§$50k - $65k p.a.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Working in the Agriculture industry, this role will suit someone who is looking to build their career within this sector and who understands the importance of a strong H&S function and how having the right frameworks and processes in place can be invaluable. The nature of the industry that my client operates in means there can be heavy demand for casual and seasonal workers throughout the year. Ensuring the right training and support is provided is essential both for employee safety and wellbeing as well ensuring compliance for the business. §This role will be supporting the leadership team in delivering best practice and making sure processes are in place for the onboarding and training of new employees as well as ensuring the existing team and individual managers equally understand their own responsibilities in taking ownership for Health & Safety within the organisation.§In addition this role provides the opportunity for someone to take on a wider range of duties across the HR spectrum, running the recruitment process, sourcing, screening and selection and managing personnel documentation. You will be completing necessary compliance checks, writing various SOP's and policy documents, ensuring personnel documentation is completed and all necessary training courses have been delivered. Furthermore you will help on various project based assignments and general administration associated with the busines as it continues to grow and expand. § § §To Note:§ § This role is based in §Wanaka§ and will be a mixture of office based with some field work. Given the cyclical nature of the industry you will need to be available on a full-time basis during their busy periods.§ The client is looking to move quickly with this appointment. If you are interested to learn more please call Peter on 021 278 8653 alternatively apply now via the relevant link.§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50784611.txt	§Learning and Development Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning and Development Specialist§§Advertiser: §Infinitas Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§We are looking for a dynamic and talented Learning and Development Specialist to lead the Learning and Development (L&D) function for this rapidly growing and successful New Zealand-owned company in the healthcare sector.§  § We are searching for someone that has implementation and systems training experience and that can develop the function to be the best in class for the company.§  § The role is both strategic and operational and encompasses some of the below responsibilities:§ § §Create and organise the delivery of company-wide learning and development programmes and team building activities§ §Lead the implementation of the Learning Management System. Ensure the system delivers efficient workflows, is relevant, and user-friendly.§ §Maximise the use of digital and repeatable content and systems§ §Identify, select, and manage external training providers§ §Develop methodologies to obtain quantitative and qualitative feedback on the impact of training and development activities.§ § It is essential that you are strong operationally and able to roll up your sleeves, and be in the detail to achieve outcomes.  Crucially, you will be a strong relationship builder with excellent stakeholder management skills and be able to adapt to the ever-changing healthcare landscape. You will be managing a field trainer who is the subject matter expert and helping them develop their skills.§  § The company is at the beginning stage of a positive transformation project that allows for significant improvements to be made across the business, and this role is seen as critical to the continued success of the organisation. We are looking for someone to make improvements and work with the highly talented and capable business unit leaders across the company to continue driving a high performing culture.§  § The role reports into the head of HR for the company who is supportive but is looking for this role to be autonomous, and thus we are looking for someone that can drive and implement their own strategy. This role would suit candidates who are ambitious and wanting to do great work.§  § Opportunities like this are rare so please apply to the role as soon as possible or if you have any questions please call Jason on §09 218 6127§  § For more information about Infinitas Talent please click on this link: http://infinitas-talent.co.nz/§§§§

Our focus is on delivering The Heritage Experience (T.H.E) which promises an exceptional and personalised experience every time a guest stays with us. Our H.O.P.E. values of Honesty, Ownership, Passion and Empathy define us as an organisation. We measure ourselves by these values, and are attributes we look for in all of our employees.§          §The Role:§          §The Heritage Hotel Christchurch is seeking an experienced Administration superstar to join our team. You will take ownership of the HR function, provide general administration support to the Hotel Manager and team, and assist in operations on an ad-hoc basis. As we are a small tight-knit team this is a hands on role where you get involved in everything – you must enjoy variety and be willing to roll your sleeves up and pitch in!§          §You will report directly to the Hotel Manager and in addition be part of the wider group human resources team with a dotted line reporting to the Group Human Resources Manager.§          §Handling the day-to-day human resources functions such as recruitment, implementation of our HR policies and processes, supporting all people-related issues and ensuring compliance with employment legislation will be your core focus. You will also be updating and delivering training to ensure our key asset – our staff – can deliver The Heritage Experience, as well as owning health & safety for the hotel including training and reporting. Along with this, you’ll provide general administrative support such as producing documents and reports, managing our uniform supply, and responding to guest correspondence.§          §About You:§          §To be our preferred candidate you’ll bring:§          §            §Great administration skills, preferably from a hospitality or tourism environment§            §Strong IT skills in MS office, and Zambion (our HR/Payroll system) would be ideal§            §Excellent communication skills and the ability to relate to people from all walks of life.§            §HR experience and knowledge, particularly in recruitment and training§            §Good time management as you will be handling multiple tasks and changing priorities§            §Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion§            §Flexibility with your time and tasks§            §Outstanding attention to detail§            §Ideally some hotel experience but this is not essential§            §A clean NZ driver’s license, as you will need to assist with valet parking when the team is busy§          §          §In return we offer a competitive salary, flexible working hours, free and discounted hotel stays, a friendly team environment and the chance to grow your skills as we support professional development.§          §You must be legally entitled to work on New Zealand to be considered for this role.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Heritage Hotel Management operate Heritage, CityLife and Heritage Collection Hotels within New Zealand. We measure ourselves by these values, and are attributes we look for in all of our employees.§ §The Role:§ §The Heritage Hotel Christchurch is seeking an experienced Administration superstar to join our team. You will take ownership of the HR function, provide general administration support to the Hotel Manager and team, and assist in operations on an ad-hoc basis. As we are a small tight-knit team this is a hands on role where you get involved in everything – you must enjoy variety and be willing to roll your sleeves up and pitch in!§ §You will report directly to the Hotel Manager and in addition be part of the wider group human resources team with a dotted line reporting to the Group Human Resources Manager.§ §Handling the day-to-day human resources functions such as recruitment, implementation of our HR policies and processes, supporting all people-related issues and ensuring compliance with employment legislation will be your core focus. You will also be updating and delivering training to ensure our key asset – our staff – can deliver The Heritage Experience, as well as owning health & safety for the hotel including training and reporting. Along with this, you’ll provide general administrative support such as producing documents and reports, managing our uniform supply, and responding to guest correspondence.§ §About You:§ §To be our preferred candidate you’ll bring:§ § §Great administration skills, preferably from a hospitality or tourism environment§ §Strong IT skills in MS office, and Zambion (our HR/Payroll system) would be ideal§ §Excellent communication skills and the ability to relate to people from all walks of life.§ §HR experience and knowledge, particularly in recruitment and training§ §Good time management as you will be handling multiple tasks and changing priorities§ §Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion§ §Flexibility with your time and tasks§ §Outstanding attention to detail§ §Ideally some hotel experience but this is not essential§ §A clean NZ driver’s license, as you will need to assist with valet parking when the team is busy§ §In return we offer a competitive salary, flexible working hours, free and discounted hotel stays, a friendly team environment and the chance to grow your skills as we support professional development.§ §You must be legally entitled to work on New Zealand to be considered for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources administrator?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50803946.txt	§People & Performance Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Performance Team Leader§§Advertiser: §UP Education Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§People & Performance -Team Leader  § §At UP Education, we believe learning should be defined by the exceptional. Over the past twenty years we have built an innovative, student-centred learning community that provides outstanding education opportunities for students seeking a tertiary study experience in New Zealand or Australia.§ §Known for our agility, our responsiveness to the changing world and our ability to continually deliver excellence; the pivotal role of People & Performance Team Leader requires charismatic influence to empower and support our amazing leaders and staff.   §Does this sound like you?§ §What sets us apart? §As a company, we thrive on breaking the typical education provider mould.  Commercially savvy, operationally nimble and digitally enabled; we harness the collective skills of our broader group with a sharpened focus on our student well-being, the educational experiences of students and the achievement of exceptional educational outcomes.   §Does this sound like your kind of company?§ §What’s the role?§ Based in Auckland, you are an integral member of the People & Performance Team.  The key purpose of this generalist position is the oversight of the people operations function, and to provide team leadership to our People Coordinators & Advisor.§ §This role will also provide you with the opportunity to develop your HR generalist skillset as you will be advising on ER cases and/or other generalist People & Performance initiatives.§ §What boxes do you need to tick? § § §Tertiary qualification in Human Resources or other related area,§ §HR Generalist experience, with a focus on people operations and some experience in dealing with ER cases§ §A strong willingness to learn, to get stuck in, and to jump straight in to whatever new and exciting initiative comes our way§ §A proven people connector,§ §A proven partnering style of walking alongside the business and our leaders, § §Great communication skills and excellent customer service mindset§ §Immaculate attention to detail and organisational skills§ §Continuously on a process improvement mind-set journey§ §Tick those boxed? Click apply for this job!§ We would love to hear from you!§ §Want to learn more? jobText: TXT/50803484.txt	§HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §Genesis§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§About Genesis:§We are New Zealand's largest electricity and gas retailer, supplying energy through our two retail brands - Genesis and Energy Online - to more than 650,000 customer connections across New Zealand.§About the role:§A critical role part of our HR Operations team, reporting to Group Manager P&C. This'll be a fast paced, varied role where you'll be front and centre for HR enquires; providing HR service and support to People Leaders and Genesis employees.§Acting as the first point of HR contact to provide initial guidance and advice on all employment related matters, performance management, change process and pay matters. The purpose of the role is to be the go-to person on policies, process, legislative matters and support our HR Consultants and Group Managers.§Key responsibilities:§Provide first level HR support service to People Leaders and Genesis employees which may be in person or via the HR Inbox.§To effectively manage the HR inbox, and provide where possible a first time response and resolution or appropriately escalate to relevant HR Consultants or P&C Group Managers.§Assist with the timely and accurate resolution of HR queries as directed from the Group Manager(s) P&C. Including Employment Relations queries.§Manage the production and publishing of HR documents.§Contribute to the implementation of any new HR processes and procedures as determined by the Group Manager P&C.§Assist in the continuous improvement process to develop and amend templates and guides to enable people leaders to 'self-serve'.§Lead or assist with HR projects to automate or address process or system improvements.§Co-ordinate cyclical HR activities as directed by Group Manager P&C such as performance reviews, remuneration reviews, etc.§Support the talent process including the process of terminations, setting up approvals to recruit and reviewing IEAs, letters of offer and letters of addendums as required.§To manage the employee exit process, including the coordination of exit interviews and reporting.§Administer and support relevant HR/Payroll processes with Success Factors to ensure all employees are paid accurately, on time and in alignment with the employment agreement terms and conditions or legislative requirements.§About you:§At least 2-4 years' experience in a varied operational human resource-based role.§Solid experience in HR first line resolution.§Sound understanding of critical processes such as PIPs, disciplinaries and wellbeing matters.§Proven experience engaging with stakeholders at all levels and managing service expectations.§A strong understanding of HR systems and processes.§Sound working knowledge of all employment and work safe legislation which possibly some experience in planning and running ER cases.§Understanding of technology and its linkages to HR, and value to end users.§Team work and collaboration will be key to the success of this role; you'll work very closely with the HR Consultants and P&C Managers/Group Managers to deliver seamless HR service to the business. The People and Culture team are looking to deliver process improvements so there is huge scope to grow and make a difference in this role.§Our culture:§Genesis is proud to be an inclusive workplace; we celebrate difference and diversity and aim to empower our employees. We're a business built on innovation and optimism; a place where we value our people and provide opportunities for them to build outstanding careers and a better New Zealand.§Create your world of tomorrow, at Genesis.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We are one of the largest suppliers of essential services in the region, and are proud to provide the expertise to keep infrastructure working for our communities. No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.§        § §        §Ventia’s facilities management solutions enables our clients across a broad range of sectors to focus on their core business.  We provide facility management services including; building and open space maintenance, operations, asset management, project management and delivery services. §        § §        §As a leading services provider, we are expanding our business in the Manawatu region (can be based in Whanganui or Palmerston North) and are looking for a SHEQ Manager to provide WHS, Environment and Quality expertise to our Facilities Management Contract team and client.§        § §        §Your duties will include, but are not limited to:§        §          §Ensuring the provision of current and §Relevant SHEQ qualification§          §Internal auditor qualifications (ISO 9001, 14001, 45001)§          §ICAM investigation methodology or equivalent§          §Knowledge of all current and pending Health, Safety and Environment legislation§          §Industry experience in a similar WHS, environmental and/or quality role, preferably in Facilities Management, services or construction§ work environment where you matter. §        §          §We take our people’s careers seriously, helping them to learn and grow.§          §There’s nothing more important to us than keeping our people and the public safe.§          §We look after each other and foster our people’s wellbeing. § §        §        § §        §Diversity§        §No matter who you are, we encourage you to apply for the job that’s right for you.§        §We are actively increasing diversity across our business so our workforce reflects the diverse communities in which we work. With a clear strategy to manage future city growth and development, staff across Tauranga City Council (TCC) are working hard to deliver high quality services and outcomes for our community.§        §About the role§        §We're looking for an experienced senior health and safety leader who can combine their cultural change experience and proven strategic leadership to develop and champion Health Safety and Wellbeing strategy and business planning across Tauranga City Council.§        §This is a new, fixed-term role and will lead a team of Health and Safety experts who support a complex and growing organisation including ambitious infrastructure capital works programmes and projects across Tauranga City.§        §Reporting to the General Manager - People and Engagement, the role is responsible for leading and influencing transformational change to our Health Safety and Wellbeing service, organisational approach and culture. You will be able to demonstrate competence and expertise in designing and implementing safety management systems, programmes and strategies. This role is about leading and engaging people, so you will be an exceptional communicator with proven leadership experience in influencing, developing and coaching others at all levels across the business.§        §You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account. A key focus of the role is to build the health and safety leadership capability of senior leaders and their teams across our business.§About you§To be successful in this role, you will have significant experience (5-10 years) in a senior strategic leadership role along with a relevant tertiary qualification in business change management or Health Safety and Wellbeing. You will be able to demonstrate competence and expertise in designing and implementing safety management systems, programmes and strategies. This role is about leading and engaging people, so you will be an exceptional communicator with proven leadership experience in influencing, developing and coaching others at all levels across the business.§You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account.
