jobText: TXT/50802332.txt	§Health & Safety Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Safety Manager§§Advertiser: §Foleys§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About the Company§Servicing our communities since 1934, Foleys is a well-established plumbing, drainage, gas fitting, electrical, and mechanical business with 220 staff across our eleven NZ locations. §You can find out all about us and our values on our website but at Foleys you will be part of a close knit, family-orientated team where good pay, career development, and support are available to you.§About the Role and You§We are looking for our next awesome H&S Manager to continue improving our health, safety, and wellbeing focus across our eleven branches.§You will be pragmatic, encouraging, and easy-going when engaging with our staff to champion regulatory compliance and best practice.  At Foleys, it is critical that you are down-to-earth, resilient, and enjoy a good laugh!§Working with senior/branch/project managers, trade staff, and administrators-  relationship building is key to being successful in this role. While you have no direct reports you will be assisted by our network of a dozen fantastic branch administrators and also backed by our task-oriented & supportive general manager. You will be trusted to lead this function and bring some fresh thinking to the role.§This is an opportunity for an experienced H&S Manager with great people skills, or a keen & motivated Senior H&S Advisor ready to step up into a bigger role. §You do need to be physically able to get around construction sites and be comfortable speaking in front of groups of tradies, and leading meetings. §While based in our Dunedin head office, you will be able to get out and about travelling around our branches in Balclutha, Alexandra, Queenstown, Wanaka, Ranfurly, Twizel, Timaru, Oamaru, Christchurch, & Palmerston North. BBC Technologies designs, develops, manufactures and installs all their own end-to-end turnkey lines, which include traceability and analytics software. We are a NZ based international company that has made the most of our Kiwi ingenuity to develop innovative products specifically designed for small, delicate fruit including blueberries, cherries and cherry tomatoes.§ §BBC Technologies is a member of the TOMRA Group that was founded on innovation in 1972 that began with design, manufacture, and sale of reverse vending machines for automated collection of used beverage containers. Today TOMRA provides technology-led solutions that enable the circular economy with advanced collection and sorting systems that optimize resource recovery and minimize waste in the food, recycling, and mining industries.   § §The Role§ §We are looking for an enthusiastic Global HR Coordinator to join our collaborative team on a maternity cover contract through to the end of July 2021. This is an ideal role for a new graduate looking to gain some industry experience.§ §This is an exciting role where you’ll be involved in a variety of different tasks. Day to day you’ll be responsible for all aspects of the recruitment and onboarding processes, maintaining accurate personnel records both electronic and in the HR system, responding to internal and external HR enquiries and providing assistance, as well as supporting new initiatives for our continued journey of growth.§ §This role is also responsible for overseeing the day to day running and coordination of our health and safety system which includes investigating incidents, leading monthly committee meetings, maintain company vehicles, and a number of other administrative tasks.§ §If you’re looking for looking for diversity in your day to day tasks and the opportunity to learn something new this could be the role for you!§ §Person Specifications § §To enable you to hit the ground running, we’re looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:§ § §Previous HR experience and/or a relevant degree.§ §Experience in recruitment - preferred but not essential.§ §Strong organisation and time management skills.§ §Excellent communication and phone manner.§ §Graduates are encouraged to apply!§ §Why work for us?§  § §This is a fantastic opportunity to join a well-known New Zealand company, with an established global presence.§ §If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Click to apply now with an up to date CV and cover letter outlining why you would be great for this role. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources coordinator?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Our key objective is to ensure we have world class learning and enable our people and leaders to be the best they can be,§        §motivated and high performing.§        §  §        §As the Training Advisor you’ll play a key role in contributing to the Foodies Learning teams success to deliver the best in class learning initiatives. You will:§ § §Be responsible for scheduling and co-ordinating the smooth running of a selection of our programmes and courses through our Learning Management Systems (LMS) and online delivery tools.§ §Raise PO’s in SAP and ensure they are processed within required timeframes.§ §Be the first point of contact for participants and vendors, providing high-quality service to these key stakeholders.§ §Be a proactive partner and Trusted Advisor to Foodies and Owner Operators across all areas of the business, assisting to anticipate and deliver excellence in our learning offerings.§ § § §About you§ § § §You’ll bring your best every day, have great banter and be easy to deal with.  With impeccable attention to detail and high organisational skills you’ll;§ § § § §Have proven experience as a Training Administrator, Training Advisor, HR Assistant or similar role.§ §Experience in SAP Financial Management and working knowledge of databases, Learning Management Systems (LMS), and web delivery tools is essential.§ §A reliable problem-solver and with strong project management skills.§ §A high standard of interpersonal and communication skills, and an ability to effectively communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §  § §About us§ § § §Foodies is a team of 25,000 New Zealanders in a growing network of 340 + stores. jobText: TXT/50800787.txt	§Learning Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Watercare Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Come join our L&OD team as our Learning Business Partner! If you have a sense of humour, like to laugh out loud, a lot - then you'll want to join this vibrant team. The team is ready to welcome another new member with a huge amount of curiosity that will challenge the norm and build fantastic stakeholder relations. This role is full time and based in Newmarket. Which is a hub for all things entertainment. You will love being based here however your bank account may not agree!§In this role you will help develop human centred design learning solutions that incorporate best practice instructional design and foster and embed a True learning culture. You will provide variation of learning, learning technology and learning design support and services that are practical, innovative and enhance capability building.§What you'll get involved in:§Conduct needs analysis to determine programme objectives;§Produce engaging and effective learning solutions via robust needs analysis;§Define storyboards, outline curriculum or programme;§Articulate and present creative ideas to others;§Create end user guides, instructions, specifications;§Conduct needs analysis to determine programme objectives;§Research and analyse alternative / emerging digital learning methodologies, technologies;§Align learning governance within content and other learning collateral.§Learning & Organisation development strategy planning and deployment§What you'll bring to the role:§Experience in the successful development of learning materials;§Ability to manage multiple projects;§Experience in Financial business areas (preferred)§Experience in working with AGILE Hybrid methodology and design thinking;§Up to date knowledge of industry trends and educational resources;§Ability to evaluate the effectiveness of learning material;§Experience Docebo (preferred) or other Learning Management Systems (LMS);§Understanding and/or use of eLearning and digital learning solution technology and tools.§Experience in conducting, testing and trialling new design solutions, technologies and equipment - preferred;§Ability to quickly learn new technologies and understand the implications of such technologies;§Exposure/ capability to co-ordinate LMS administrative tasks.§Watercare offers a competitive salary and a staff benefits package including:§Training and development opportunities§Flexible working hours§Life and income protection insurance plans§Generous parental leave§Employee discounts at a range of large retailer§If you are looking for an exciting career opportunity with lots of potential for development then APPLY NOW!§§§§

We are extremely passionate about the work we do – making a real difference for our clients – and value everyone in our team as we really are one big family. Our culture is about being courageous, finding the fun and delivering great outcomes with our clients, and driving change that sticks. We pride ourselves on making the complex clear and simple and providing engaging solutions for clients that help their business succeed and make them great places to work.§ §The Role§In this role, you will create, manage and grow current and new client relationships, deliver high quality consulting services, and be part of our small but rapidly growing Auckland team. As a Senior Consultant you will have an opportunity to:  §Join a high-quality OD Consulting business at a time of growth, expansion and excitement§Deliver a breadth of OD services (Assessment, Development (individuals & teams), Coaching, Career management incl Transition, Wellbeing), although particularly Career Transition and Wellbeing. Overtime you will have the opportunity to grow and develop skills across all services areas§Provide end-to-end delivery experiences so you see the outcomes of the work you deliver§Manage client accounts to become their trusted advisor§Help grow and develop the business§Be part of a culture that continuously strives to have a balance between fun and high performance§§You Will§Have had significant experience in the delivery of career transition and/or wellbeing services,§Have real experience in or the desire to learn business development§Have had sound experience in account management and supporting the ongoing needs of clients§Be an excellent facilitator of group workshops§Possess coaching or highly developed interpersonal skills§Enjoy a balance between working in a team environment and working autonomously§We would expect that you would have a relevant tertiary qualifications in the area of Organisational Psychology /HR or similar. §§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment team leader Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50791824.txt	§Recruitment team leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment team leader§§Advertiser: §Education Personnel§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§Recruitment with a purpose § §At ep.education, our mission is to bring the best people in education together. Every team member is passionate about their role and understands the important part they are playing in the placement process. While we are focused on growth, we are about quality placements and great client and teacher relationships, not bums on seats.  § §By working as a recruiter/team leader in the education sector, you will certainly feel there is a real purpose to your work.   § § § §The ep.education Team § §Our family friendly environment sets us apart and enables our staff to enjoy a good work-life balance. We ensure that all of our staff gets the support they need to reach their full potential, through continuous training and on-going coaching. Our team members work very hard but they make sure they are having fun along the way. Our culture is very important to us.  § § § §The role§ § §The team you would lead is responsible for recruiting primary school/ECE teachers in temporary/relief roles. The role involves 3 early morning starts a week to fill in same day and advanced bookings in both ECE and schools sector. Your aim will be to support your team so our relief pool of candidates and client base continues growing. There will be a strong emphasis on Business Development and you will have your own portfolio of clients. You will be self-motivated and able to build strong relationships to make the most of an expanding and dynamic education sector in the greater Wellington region.  § § § §Ideal candidate § §If you are a driven individual who enjoys a fast pace working environment and team work, then we’d love to hear from you. Our ideal candidate will be adaptable, have great communication skills, strong interpersonal and organisational skills. You must have prior recruitment as well as leadership/mentorship experience. Our schools, centres and teachers are very important to us so you must have a customer focused approach and a can-do attitude. You must have the right to enter and work in New Zealand to apply.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§
